instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Place the mushroomon a baking sheet. Drizzle with a little olive oil, season with salt, pepper. Roast in the preheated oven for about minutes. Cool slightly, then slice into strips.,While the mushroomare roasting, bring a saucepan of water to a boil. Plunge the carrot, radish stickinto the boiling water, after a few seconds, remove them, plunge them into a bowl of ice water to stop the cooking. In a separate bowl, stir together the rice vinegar, of lime juice, cold water. Transfer the carrot, radish to the vinegar, lime marinade, let them soak for at least minutes, longer if it'convenient. In a small bowl, stir together the remaining lime juice, soy sauce, fish sauce, sesame oil, canola oil, sugar, water. Thiithe sandwich sauce. To assemble sandwiches, sprinkle a little of the sandwich sauce onto each half of the French loaves. Place the roasted mushroomonto the bottom half of each roll, sprinkle with a little more sauce. Top with a few sliceof jalapeno, a few stickof carrot, radish , cucumber, basil, cilantro. Close with the topof the bread, serve.
ingredients: portobello mushroom cap, olive oil, salt, pepper, carrot, daikon radish, rice vinegar, fresh lime juice, cold water, chilled lime juice, soy sauce, nuoc mam , toasted sesame oil, canola oil, garlic, white sugar, cold water, jalapeno pepper sprigfresh cilantro with stems, medium cucumber, sprigfresh Thai basil, French bread baguettes
descriptor: These are by far the best sandwicheto serve your guestand yourself! The ingredientare fresh, delicious, popular, fillyour mouth with marinated joy. You can usually find the high-caloric sandwich in your local Vietnamese baguette shop but here ia hearty Vegetarian version using portabello mushrooms.

instructions: Slice pork belly into -inch piecelayered fat, meat. Heat sugar in a large wok or pot over medium heat until it meltand caramelizeinto a light brown syrup, about minutes. Add pork, increase the heat to high. Cook, stir to render some of the pork fat, to minutes. Stir shallotand garlic into the wok. Add fish sauce, black pepper; stir until pork ievenly coated. Pour in coconut water, bring to a boil. Add hard-boiled eggand reduce the heat to low. Cover, simmer, checking occasionally, adding a little water if the liquid evaporatetoo much, until pork itender, about hour. Remove from the heat, let stand for about minutes. Skim fat from the surface of the dish.
ingredients: poundpork belly white sugar, shallot clove garlic fish sauce, ground black pepper, fluid coconut water, hard-boiled eggs, peeled
descriptor: Thit kho tau ia very popular dish in Vietnamese householdfor everyday eating, but it'also traditionally served during Tết, the Vietnamese Lunar New Year. The longer you cook the pork belly, the more tender it becomes. If you make thidish ahead of time, the fat will congeal on the surface, making it easier to remove, a little healthier! Thialso allowthe flavorto meld a little more. Serve with rice.

instructions: Whisk vinegar, fish sauce, sugar, lime juice, garlic, red pepper flaketogether in a small bowl. Set the dipping sauce aside. Fill a large bowl with room temperature water. Add rice vermicelli, soak for hour. Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Drop in shrimp, cook until curled, pink, about minute. Remove the shrimp, drain. Slice each shrimp in half lengthwise. Transfer rice vermicelli noodleto the pot of boiling water, cook for minute. Remove, drain in a colander. Immediately rinse the vermicelli with cold water, stirring to separate the noodles. To assemble the rolls, dip rice wrapper in a large bowl of room temperature water for a few secondto soften. Place wrapper on a work surface, top with shrimp halves, of the chopped lettuce, vermicelli, each of the mint, cilantro, Thai basil. Fold right, left edgeof the wrapper over the endof the filling, roll up the spring roll. Repeat with remaining wrapperand ingredients. Cut each roll in half, serve with dipping sauce.
ingredients: white vinegar, fish sauce, white sugar, lime juice, clove garlic, red pepper flakes, rice vermicelli, large shrimp, deveined, rice wrapper, leavelettuce finely chopped fresh mint leaves, finely chopped cilantro, finely chopped Thai basil
descriptor: These Vietnamese spring rollare the perfect recipe for beating the heat. Poached shrimp, rice noodles, herbs, lettuce are rolled into a thin rice wrapper. Serve with the sweet, sour dipping sauce.

instructions: Place vegetable stock, onion, soy sauce, garlic, cinnamon sticks, ground ginger, star anise, bay leavein a large pot; bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, simmer until flavorcombine, to minutes. Remove solidwith a slotted spoon, keep broth hot. Place noodlein a large bowl, cover with boiling water. Set aside until noodleare to minutes. Drain, rinse thoroughly. Divide noodleamong serving bowls. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add tofu in a single layer, fry, in batches, until golden brown, about minuteper side. Simmer fried tofu, mushroomin broth until heated through, about minutes. Transfer to serving bowls. Top with scallionand cilantro. Ladle in hot broth. Serve lime wedges, jalapeno peppers, bean sprouts, basil alongside for garnishing each bowl. The directionfor preparing the rice noodleare based on the particular brand mentioned. Follow instructionon the package if using a different brand.
ingredients: vegetable stock, onion, soy sauce, clove garlic, cinnamon sticks, ground ginger, podstar anise, bay leaves
descriptor: A vegetarian version of thitasty Vietnamese noodle soup.

instructions: Inspect two pint-sized jarfor cracks, discarding any defective ones. Immerse in simmering water until needed. Wash new, unused lidand ringin warm soapy water. Bring water, vinegar, sugar, salt to a boil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook until sugar dissolves, about minutes. Turn off the heat, let cool for minutes. Meanwhile, divide carrots, radish, cucumbers, jalapeñoevenly between the two clean jars. Pour hot liquid over vegetablein the jarand let come to room temperature, about minutes. Screw on lidand refrigerate for at least hour before serving. The longer you let the vegetablepickle, the better they get. They also get spicier, so only use one jalapeño if you're sensitive to heat. Nutrition data for thirecipe includethe full amount of brine ingredients. The actual amount consumed will vary.
ingredients: water, rice vinegar, white sugar, salt, pound carrots, pound purple daikon radish, pound English cucumbers medium jalapeno pepperinto rings
descriptor: These Vietnamese-style pickled vegetableare traditionally served aa condiment for banh mi sandwiches, but they make a nice side for anything you'd normally pair with coleslaw, like fish, chips, barbecued meats, fish tacos, etc. Store in the refrigerator for up to one month.

instructions: Gather all ingredients. Brew water with coffee using your preferred method to make coffee. Spoon sweetened condensed milk into each of coffee s. Pour fresh hot coffee into each, stir to dissolve the milk. Serve of coffee along with tall glassefilled with ice cubeeach, a long-handled spoon. Pour hot coffee over ice cubeand stir briskly with the long-handled spoon to chill the coffee.
ingredients: water, dark roast ground coffee beans, sweetened condensed milk, divided, ice cubes
descriptor: A strong Vietnamese iced coffee recipe with sweetened condensed milk. Chilled on ice, thimakean unbeatable Southeast Asian treat. Even those who only take their coffee black will like this. Serve it on hot summer dayor aan evening treat. We learned thiin Vietnam, now drink almost all our espresso thiway.

instructions: Make the crêpe batter: Mix rice flour, sugar, salt, turmeric together in a large bowl. Beat in coconut milk until thick. Slowly beat in water until it reachethe consistency of a thin crêpe batter. Make the filling: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add shallot, garlic; cook, stir until fragrant but not browned, to minutes. Add shrimp; sauté until cooked through, opaque, to minutes. Season with fish sauce, salt. Transfer filling to a bowl. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Wipe out the skillet, reheat over medium heat. Add remaining oil. Stir crêpe batter, pour into the hot skillet, swirling to coat the bottom. Lay or cooked shrimp on the bottom half of the crêpe. Top with a small handful of bean sprouts. Cook until batter lookset, edgestart to brown, about minute. Fold crêpe over, slide onto an oven-safe plate. Place crêpe in the preheated oven to keep warm. Repeat with remaining batter, shrimp, bean sprouts,Serve crêpewith lettuce leaves. Break off pieceof crêpe, roll them up in lettuce to eat. You can add to chopped scallionto crêpe batter if desired. Substitute scallionfor the shallotin the filling if preferred. You can also add sauteed mushroomto the filling if you like. Pork bánh xèo: Substitute half of the shrimp with pork loin or pork belly cut in thin strips. Sauté shallotand garlic first, add pork, cook until no longer pink, then add shrimp. Vegetarian bánh xèo: Substitute shredded, fried tofu for the shrimp to make a vegetarian version. Add a variety of mushroomto give it a meaty flavor. Use soy sauce instead of fish sauce. Bánh xèo with eggs: Beat to eggand pour a little over each crêpe after you add the batter to the skillet, but before you add the fillings. Cover the pan for about a minute to let the egg set, then continue with the filling ingredients. The magazine version of thirecipe may be slightly different than the online version. Please follow directioncarefully for whichever version you are using.
ingredients: rice flour, white sugar, salt, ground turmeric, coconut milk, water
descriptor: Bánh xèo ia popular street snack in Vietnam. The name mean"sizzling pancakeor crêpes", referto the sound the batter makewhen it hitthe hot skillet. Serve these shrimp-studded crêpewith lettuce, fresh mint, basil, nuoc cham dipping sauce.

instructions: ThiSouth Vietnamese-style pho bringcomfort with every sip, slurp. It'a restorative, richly seasoned broth ladled over rice noodleand thinly sliced beef, served with a host of crisp, tangy, spicy, sweet, fragrant garnishes. The version you see here habeen adapted slightly from LETT'original with insightfrom Allrecipefriend, Vietnamese cookbook author Andrea Nguyen, tested in our Allrecipetest kitchens. We specified the amount of ginger, charred the onion, ginger before adding them to the broth. "That partially cookthose aromaticand kind of mellowthingout," sayNguyen. "It'the backbone of the broth.",Thiversion also callfor beef soup bonerather than beef knuckle, which can be harder to find, iserved with the more traditional hoisin sauce rather than the plum sauce mentioned in the original. Make broth: Place beef bonein a 9-quart pot; season with salt. Pour water into the pot, bring to a boil. Reduce heat, simmer broth for about hours. Meanwhile, set an oven rack about inchefrom the heat source, preheat the oven'broiler. Line a x-inch roasting pan with aluminum foil. Place onionand unpeeled ginger onto the prepared roasting pan, cook under the preheated broiler, stirring occasionally, until vegetableare charred, to minutes. Cool slightly. Chop onions, then peel, slice ginger; set aside separately. Skim fat from surface of simmering broth. Add oxtail, radish, charred onionto broth. Tie charred ginger, anise, cinnamon stick, peppercorns, clovein cheesecloth to make a bouquet garni; add to broth. Stir in sugar, fish sauce, remaining salt. Simmer over medium-low heat for at least hour. Season with salt. Strain broth. Discard boneand bouquet garni. Reserve meat from bonefor another use. Chill broth in the refrigerathourto overnight. Skim, discard fat from the top of chilled broth. Pour broth into a pot; bring to a boil. Reduce heat, keep hot until ready to serve. Bring a pot of water to a boil. Turn off heat. Stir in rice noodleand let sit until noodleare tender yet chewy, to minutes. Meanwhile, cut frozen sirloin into paper-thin slices. Drain, divide noodleamong bowls, about per serving. Top each with a few sirloin slices. Ladle hot broth over sirloin, noodles. Thiipart of a special feature in our February-March magazine issue. Check it out for more recipes!
ingredients: poundbeef soup bones, salt, divided, gallonwater, medium onions, quartered, piece fresh ginger root, poundbeef oxtail, white radish whole star anise pods, cinnamon stick, black peppercorns, whole cloves, white sugar, fish sauce, salt
descriptor: Thibeef pho featurea comforting, richly-seasoned meat broth ladled over rice noodleand thinly sliced sirloin. Serve with hoisin, Sriracha, green onion, cilantro, bean sprouts, basil, lime.

instructions: Combine peanut sauce, ginger, garlic, soy sauce in a bowl. Add chicken, mix until coated. Cover, refrigerate for minutes. Heat peanut oil in a wok over medium heat. Add bean sprouts, snow peas, green onionand cook until heated but still crisp, to minutes. Remove from the heat. Transfer bean sprout mixture to a large bowl; mix in watercresand cilantro. Use a vegetable peeler to peel long stripcarrot into the bowl. Add remaining soy sauce, tosto coat. Heat remaining peanut oil in the wok over medium heat. Add marinated chicken; cook, stir until no longer pink in the center, the juicerun clear, about minutes. Fill a large bowl with hot water. Submerge one wrapper in the bowl, hold until soft, pliable, about seconds. Lift wrapper, let excesliquid drip off, place onto a work surface. Place two large spoonfulchicken, a small handful vegetable mixture into the center of the wrapper. Fold in the two sides, then fold the bottom up, over the filling; roll to seal. Repeat to make remaining spring rolls. Serve with remaining peanut sauce for dipping.
ingredients: peanut sauce, divided, fresh ginger root, clove garlic, soy sauce, divided, boneless chicken breast halve- cut into inch pieces, peanut oil, divided, bean sprouts, fresh snow pea pods, green onions pound watercress chopped fresh cilantro, large carrots, spring roll wrappers
descriptor: These chicken spring rollwith a Thai-style peanut sauce are filled with marinated chicken breast, crisp vegetables, which make a beautiful presentation through the translucent spring roll wrappers. Serve aan appetizer or light entrée.

instructions: Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Tosradish, carrot with seasoned rice vinegar in a bowl until well coated. Let sit until veggiebecome slightly limp, to minutes. Drain, set aside or refrigerate. Mix mayonnaise, hoisin sauce, sriracha in a small bowl. Split French roll just enough so you can open it like a book. Pull out some of the bread from the top half to better accommodate the filling if desired. Spread the interior surfaceof roll liberally with mayonnaise mixture. Transfer roll, cut-side up, to the prepared baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until warm, crisp with slightly browned edges, about minutes. Place sliced pork, paté, pickled radish, carrot, cucumber, jalapeño, cilantro leavein warm roll. Cut in half to serve. For the pickled carrotand daikon, add a pinch of salt, pepper if using regular vinegar instead of seasoned rice vinegar. Try thiPan-Roasted -Spice Pork Loin recipe, use leftoverin your bánh mì sandwiches.
ingredients: daikon radish, carrots, seasoned rice vinegar, mayonnaise, hoisin sauce, sriracha hot sauce crusty French sandwich roll, cooked pork roast smooth pate thin spear, english cucumber, thin slice jalapeno pepper cilantro leaves
descriptor: Bánh mì sandwicheare delicious. I'll never forget my first real bánh mì. I remember thinking to myself, thiisn't just one of the best sandwicheI've ever had to eat, but one of the best things, period. Not only do we get amazing contrastin flavor, texture, but also the temperature difference between the crisp, warm, meat-filled roll, cool, crunchy vegetablemakethiso much fun to eat.

instructions: Gather all ingredients. Soak rice noodlein cold water until soft, about minutes. Drain well; cut into -inch long pieces. Combine noodle pieces, chicken, shrimp, eggs, carrot, wood fungumushrooms, green onionin a large bowl. Add sugar, salt, black pepper; stir well. Soak rice paper wrapper in a shallow bowl of warm water to soften, about seconds. Place on a damp cloth laid out on a flat surface. Place filling mixture into the center of softened rice paper. Fold the bottom edge into the center, covering filling. Fold in opposing edgeand roll up tightly. Repeat with remaining rice paper wrappers, soaking, filling each one individually. Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over medium heat. Working in batcheof or, fry spring rollin hot oil until crisp, golden brown on both sides, about minutes. Drain on paper towels. Ground pork can be used instead of chicken if desired. Shiitake mushroomcan be substituted for wood fungumushroomif desired. We have determined the nutritional value of oil based on a retention value of after cooking. Amount will vary depending on cooking time, temperature, ingredient density, specific type of oil used.
ingredients: dried thin rice noodles, ground chicken, shrimp - washed, large eggs, carrot, grated, wood fungumushrooms green onions white sugar, salt, ground black pepper, rice paper wrappers, vegetable oil
descriptor: These Vietnamese fried spring rollare a recipe I learned while traveling through Vietnam. The ingredientare relatively simple, easy to find in any grocery store. I've cooked thiseveral timesince returning, it'alwaybeen a hit. They taste great with dipping sauce.

instructions: Whisk vinegar, fish sauce, sugar, lime juice, garlic, red pepper flaketogether in a small bowl; set sauce aside. Heat oil in a small skillet over medium heat. Add shallots; cook, stir until lightly caramelized, about minutes. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat, lightly oil the grate. Skewer shrimp on each skewer, grill until they turn pink, are charred on the outside, to minuteper side. Set aside. Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add vermicelli noodleand cook until minutes. Drain noodleand rinse with cold water, stirring to separate noodles. Assemble vermicelli bowl by placing cooked noodlein one half of each serving bowl; place lettuce, bean sproutin the other half. Top each bowl with cucumbers, carrots, daikon, peanuts, cilantro, Thai basil, mint, caramelized shallots. Serve with shrimp skewerand sauce on the side. Pour sauce on top, tosthoroughly to coat before eating.
ingredients: white vinegar, fish sauce, white sugar, lime juice, clove garlic, red pepper flakes, canola oilshallots, skewers, medium shrimp, with shellspackage rice vermicelli noodles, finely chopped lettuce, bean sprouts, English cucumber, cut into -inch matchsticks, finely chopped pickled carrots, finely chopped diakon radish, crushed peanutscilantro, finely chopped Thai basilfresh mint
descriptor: Thivermicelli bowl combinefresh herbs, rice vermicelli noodles, cucumber, bean sprouts, grilled shrimp. Tossed with a tangy sweet-and-sour sauce, it'a simple, satisfying dinner that'perfect for hot weather.

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Arrange pita bread on a baking sheet. Bake pitain the preheated oven until lightly toasted; cut into bite-sized pieceand keep warm. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Stir in chicken, onion, garlic; cook until chicken icooked through, juicerun clear, about minutes. Mix in tomato purée; season with cumin, salt, pepper. Continue to cook, stir for a few minutes. Arrange toasted pita piecein a serving dish. Drizzle with melted butter, top with chicken mixture. Garnish with yogurt, parsley to serve.
ingredients: pita bread rounds, olive oil, skinless, boneless chicken breast halve- chopped, medium onions clove garlic, can tomato paste, ground cumin, salt, ground black pepper, butter, Greek yogurtfresh parsley
descriptor: ThiIskender kebab isimilar to one I tried at a Turkish restaurant in London. It itraditionally made with lamb or doner meat but thichicken version idelicious. I later discovered that thidish wanamed after Alexander the Great, whom the Persiancalled "Iskender." Apparently, it wahifavorite food.

instructions: Melt butter in a large saucepan over low heat. Cook onionin hot butter until golden brown, about minutes. Stir paprika, lentils, bulgur into onionto coat with butter. Add tomato paste, vegetable stock, cayenne pepper; bring to a boil, cook until soft, creamy, about hour. Crumble dried mint leaveinto soup; stir, remove from heat. Ladle into bowland garnish with lemon sliceand fresh mint to serve.
ingredients: butter, onions, paprika, red lentils, fine bulgur, tomato paste, vegetable stock, cayenne pepper, dried mint leaves, slice lemonfresh mint
descriptor: A wonderful, easy traditional red lentil Turkish soup recipe. Garnish with lemon sliceand fresh mint leaves.

instructions: Preheat oven to degreeF . Lightly grease a medium casserole dish. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat, cook the chicken until juicerun clear. Puree the roasted red pepperin a blender or food processor until smooth. In the prepared casserole dish, mix the cooked chicken, roasted red peppers, tomatoes, mushrooms, onion, garlic. Season with salt, pepper. Drizzle with remaining olive oil, top with mozzarella cheese. Bake minutein the preheated oven, until cheese imelted, bubbly.
ingredients: olive oil, divided, boneless chicken breast halve- cut into inch cubesjar roasted red bell peppers, can diced tomatoe with juicejar mushrooms, onion, garlic, salt, pepperpackage shredded mozzarella cheese
descriptor: Thiia deliciouTurkish dish that wacreated for American palateclose to the military base. The recipe for tava doenot have to be exact, you can add more or lesof your ingredientto taste. The secret ingredient for the Turkish taste ithe red peppers. Serve over rice.

instructions: To make the starter: Place flour, water in a bowl with a lid; stir well. Cover, let sit at room temperature overnight. The next day, add flour, water to the bowl. Cover, let sit at room temperature overnight. On the third day, add flour, water to the bowl. Cover, let sit at room temperature overnight. To make the dough: In a large bowl, dissolve yeast, sugar in warm water. Let stand until creamy, about minutes. Break the starter into small pieceand add it to the yeast mixture. Stir in of flour, salt. Stir in the remaining flour, at a time, beating well after each addition. When the dough hapulled together, turn it out onto a lightly floured surface, knead until smooth, elastic, about minutes. Sprinkle a little flour over the dough, cover it with a dry cloth. Let it rise until doubled in size. Put the dough back onto a lightly floured work surface, punch out the air. Divide the dough in half, knead each piece for to minutes. Shape each piece into a tight oval loaf. Sprinkle two sheet panwith corn meal. Roll, stretch the two loaveuntil they are x-inch ovals. Dust the topof the loavewith flour. Cover with a dry cloth, let them rise in a warm place until doubled in size. Meanwhile, preheat the oven to degreeF . Bake in the preheated oven for to minutes. Mist with water timein the first minutes. Loaveare done when their bottomsound hollow when tapped. Let cool on wire rackbefore serving.
ingredients: bread flour, divided, water, divided, active dry yeast, white sugar, warm water, bread flour, salt
descriptor: Ekmek ia light, slightly sour flatbread that tastewonderful with Havarti cheese. ThiTurkish bread recipe usea starter that fermentfor four days. I recommend using a pizza stone to bake the loaveon. If don't have a pizza stone, cookie sheetwill work also. The recipe seemcomplicated, but it'a lot easier than it appears.

instructions: Place walnuts, pistachios, cinnamon in bowl of a food processor. Pulse on, off until mixture ichopped but not too fine. Brush bottom of 9-inch round baking pan with melted butter. Place one round of phyllo dough in the pan; add a second round of dough. Drip about of melted butter over the top. Add more sheetand drizzle with butter. Add more sheetand drip with butter creating layerfor the bottom. ,Sprinkle with of the nut mixture. Top with a sheet of phyllo, drip with melted butter; repeat with more sheet of filo. Add another of the nut mixture. Place another sheet of phyllo on the nuts; drip with butter. Top with another sheet, drip with butter. Add the remaining nut mixture. Top with sheetof phyllo; drip with butter. Add more sheets; drip with butter. Top with the last sheetand drizzle generously with the remaining butter. Cover pan with plastic, refrigerate until completely chilled, about hour. Preheat oven to degreeF . Cut baklava into about diamond-shaped pieceapproximately the same size. Bake in preheated oven until browned, crisp, about an hour. Place sugar, honey, clovein a saucepan. Pour in water. Place pan over medium-high heat, whisk to combine. Bring to a boil; remove from heat. Whisk in vanilla, orange blossom water. After baklava harested minutes, ladle syrup over the top. Cool down to room temperature before serving. If you want to use homemade phyllo dough, use sheetin the baklava. Get the recipe for Chef John'Homemade Phyllo Dough.
ingredients: walnut halves, shelled pistachios, ground cinnamon
descriptor: I tend to enjoy a generouratio between nutand pastry, athat makeme feel a little bit better about the copiouamountof sugar in this, but above, beyond that, I think thiapproach producethe best texture. You can use amany layerof filo ayou want, but be careful, since too many may not cook through, the only way to mesthiup ito undercook the dough. The top, bottom layerneed to dry out, thoroughly crisp up, otherwise, once the syrup getladled over, you'll have a soggy mess.

instructions: Dissolve the yeast, sugar, salt in the warm water. Add the water, yogurt to the flour, mix well. The dough will be soft but not sticky. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface, shape it into a ball. Cover the dough with a damp cloth, allow it to rise at room temperature for hours. Cut the dough into four portions. Shape the dough into roundand flatten each round athough you're making pizza dough. Cover the roundwith a damp cloth, let the dough rest for minutes. Heat a cast iron skillet or griddle over medium-high heat. Place one dough round in the skillet, bake until brown spotappear on the bottom, about minute. Flip the bread, bake for an additional minute. Remove the bread, wrap it in a clean kitchen towel to keep warm. Repeat with the remaining dough rounds. Store any leftover flatbreadin an airtight container. If you can't find Greek-style yogurt , use regular yogurt, reduce the water in the recipe to s.
ingredients: package active dry yeast, white sugar, salt, warm water, Greek-style yogurt, all-purpose flour
descriptor: Bazlama ia simple, deliciouvillage bread that I learned to prepare after moving to Turkey. Normally it icooked in an outdoor oven but it workjust awell on the stove top. It'best served warm.

Recipe Name: Turkish Red Lentil Soup with Mint
instructions: Heat oil in a large pot over high heat. Add onion, sauté until beginning to soften, about minutes. Stir in garlic, cook for minutes. Add diced tomatoeand cook for minutes. Stir in chicken stock, lentils, bulgur, rice, tomato paste, mint, paprika, cayenne pepper, salt, black pepper; bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low, simmer until lentiland rice are tender, about minutes. Purée soup with an immersion blender until smooth. To make a vegan version of thisoup, use vegetable broth instead of chicken broth. Bulgur wheat ia dried grain that can be found in the bulk sectionof most health food stores, international markets in the international section of your grocery store.
ingredients: olive oil, onion, clove garlic, diced tomatoes, chicken stock, red lentils, fine bulgur, rice, tomato paste, dried mint, paprika, cayenne pepper, salt, ground black pepper
descriptor: ThiTurkish red lentil soup recipe idivine. The soup hadynamic flavorand a lovely, mild heat, much like one you'd find at a Turkish restaurant. I make a big batch, eat it for lunch with crusty bread, salad for an entire week. Serve with additional mint, lemon wedgeif desired.

instructions: Make dough: Combine flour, salt in a large bowl. Add eggand water, mixing well with your hands. Add more water, if needed, to form a soft dough. Cover, set aside for at least minutes. Make filling: Shred onionand place them in a colander or sieve set over a bowl; drain, discard juice. Combine drained onion, ground beef, salt, pepper in a medium bowl; mix well with a spoon until mashed. Set filling aside. Lightly flour a work surface, a large plate. Divide dough in half. Working with one piece at a time, roll dough on the floured surface into a rectangle athin apossible. Cut into -inch squareusing a knife or pastry wheel. Place about filling in the center of each square. Gather the edgeof dough, pinch them together at the top to form a bundle. Transfer manti to the prepared plate; sprinkle more flour on top to prevent sticking. Make oil: Heat oil, red pepper flakein a small skillet over low heat just until pepper flakebegin to color oil. Remove from heat, keep warm. Make sauce: Stir together yogurt, garlic in a small bowl; set aside. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook manti in boiling water until filling ino longer pink, dough itender, to minutes. Drain well. Divide manti onto plates. Spoon yogurt sauce over manti, drizzle with pepper oil. You can use ground lamb or other ground meat instead of beef, if you prefer.
ingredients: all-purpose flour, plusalt, large eggs, water
descriptor: Thimanti recipe for dumplingtaketime to prepare, but I'm sure you'll agree it iworth it. Manti ia popular meal in my country. Afiyet olsun !

instructions: Whisk yogurt, garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, ketchup, red pepper flakes, salt, cumin, black pepper, paprika, cinnamon together in a large bowl. Place chicken thigh halveinto the yogurt marinade, coat them thoroughly on all sides. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap, refrigerate, to hours. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat, lightly oil the grate. Using skewerfor each kebab, thread half of the chicken thighonto each pair of skewermaking a fairly thick "log" shape. Place kebabon the preheated grill. Do not try to turn them until they begin to unstick from the grill minutes. Turn kebaband grill the other side for to minutes. Continue cooking, turning until chicken ino longer pink in the center, about minutemore. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least degreeF .
ingredients: whole-milk Greek yogurt, clove garlic, olive oil, freshly squeezed lemon juice, ketchup, Aleppo red pepper flakes, kosher salt, ground cumin, freshly ground black pepper, paprika, ground cinnamon, poundboneless, skinleschicken thighs, long metal skewers
descriptor: Thichicken kebab recipe usea flavorful, yogurt-based marinade. I'd like to think that all the chicken coming off American grillthisummer will be atasty, juicy, tender athese. Even inexperienced grillercan produce impressive results! I'm not sure how "Turkish" thii— it'loosely based on a lamb marinade I've used for a long time.

instructions: Toscucumberwith salt in a colander; leave in the sink to drain for minutes. Rinse with cold water, then drain, pat dry with paper towels. Whisk sugar, vinegar together in a mixing bowl until sugar hadissolved. Add cucumbers, jalapeños, cilantro; tosto combine. Sprinkle chopped peanuton top just before serving. Nutrition data for thirecipe includethe full amount of salt. The actual amount of salt consumed will vary.
ingredients: large cucumbers, seeded, salt, white sugar, rice wine vinegar, medium jalapeno peppers, seeded, choppedcilantropeanuts
descriptor: Thicucumber salad recipe ivery close to what you'd get at your favorite Thai restaurant. Cucumber, cilantro, peanutare tossed in a sweet, tangy vinaigrette with just a hint of heat from jalapeños. Thisummer salad ialwaya hit at picnicand potlucksince it doesn't need to be refrigerated.

instructions: Season chicken piecewith salt, pepper; set aside. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook, stir curry powder in hot oil for minute. Stir in onionand garlic; cook minute. instructions:
Allrecipes home cooks give a solid 5-star rating to Chef John's easy-to-make version of Thai basil chicken (pad krapow gai), a popular Thai restaurant-worthy dish that's ready in less than 30 minutes. In his easy and accessible style, Chef John walks you through the recipe ingredients and shows you how to build layers of flavor using simple cooking techniques. "I don't cook Thai food at home often, mostly because there are at least a dozen such restaurants within walking distance, but when I do, there's nothing I enjoy more than this spicy Thai basil chicken," says Chef John. Thai basil chicken is a stir-fry dish made with finely chopped or ground chicken cooked with chile peppers, garlic, and shallots, and seasoned with a sweet and salty sauce and finished with fresh basil. It's a classic dish in Thai cuisine and can be found in restaurants and as a popular street food. Sauce
Chicken broth, oyster sauce, soy sauce, fish sauce, white sugar, and brown sugar are whisked together to make a sweet and salty mixture to flavor the recipe. Chicken
Chef John minces skinless, boneless chicken thigh until they're very finely chopped. You could use packaged ground chicken to speed up the process, but chopping or grinding your own gives you superior flavor and texture. Shallots and garlic
Sliced shallots and minced garlic add another layer of flavor. Hot chile peppers
This is where the heat comes into play. Use Thai chile, serrano chile, or other hot pepper of your choice, and customize the amount to suit your tolerance for heat. Basil
This recipe traditionally uses Thai basil or "holy" basil, which have their own distinctive flavors. Chef John uses sweet basil, which is more readily available in most grocery stores. In the recipe video, Chef John demonstrates how he stacks and rolls basil leaves like a cigar to quickly slice thin ribbons that cook faster and impart flavor throughout the dish. "No, I didn't use the real "holy" basil," says Chef John. "But even with regular basil, this simple recipe is spectacular. Aromatic basil is the perfect herb for pairing with the slightly sweet, sort of salty, and possibly spicy, chopped meat.",There are more than 100 varieties of basil, all of which are members of the mint family, and each variety has its own flavor. Thai basil has a mildly spicy licorice or anise seed flavor. Sweet basil (also known as Italian basil) tastes sweet and peppery. Holy basil (also called Thai holy basil) tastes of pepper and cloves. Read more: What's the Difference Between Thai Basil, Sweet Basil, and Holy Basil?,Chef John recommends you prep all the ingredients before you start cooking because once you start the stir-fry, it all comes together very quickly. Prep takes about 15 minutes and cooking time is a speedy 10 minutes. If you want to serve the chicken with steamed rice, time your cooking accordingly. To get started, you'll add the oil and minced chicken to a smoking-hot skillet and cook the chicken briefly for a couple of minutes. Next, you'll add the shallots, garlic, and sliced chilies, and cook for another couple of minutes. About a tablespoon of the sauce goes in next to cook for a minute with the chicken until it starts to caramelize on the skillet. Finally, you add the rest of the sauce, scraping up the caramelization and coating the chicken for another minute. Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the basil until it's wilted from the residual heat. Now your Thai Basil Chicken is ready to serve. "Amazing taste and for sure cheaper than buying it in a Thai restaurant," says Allrecipes home cook Seora Juarez. "As suggested, go to a local Asian market to get your basil. It's a more authentic taste, but I've tried it with regular basil and it tastes good too. I like mine hot so I finely chop the peppers to make it spicy.","Amazing rendition of the classic Thai dish. I tend to use extra garlic and shallots. I use serrano chilies because traditional Thai chilies involve an extra grocery store. Otherwise make as directed. Perfect for family meals when I have the time to cook, and my kids love it," says reviewer Blair Dunn. Allrecipes community member outdoorsgirl says, "I love Thai food and do a lot of cooking. Kudos to Chef John for taking a Thai recipe and simplifying it so the average person can make a great dish! Substituting sweet soya instead of the regular soya and sugar works good too. The trick is a very hot wok ( hopefully) or skillet.",Editorial contributions by Vanessa Greaves,Gather ingredients. Whisk chicken broth, oyster sauce, soy sauce, fish sauce, white sugar, and brown sugar together in a bowl until well blended. Heat large skillet over high heat. Drizzle in oil. Add chicken and stir fry until it loses its raw color, 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in shallots, garlic, and sliced chilies. Continue cooking on high heat until some of the juices start to caramelize in the bottom of the pan, about 2 or 3 more minutes. Add about a tablespoon of the sauce mixture to the skillet; cook and stir until sauce begins to caramelize, about 1 minute. Pour in the rest of the sauce. Cook and stir until sauce has deglazed the bottom of the pan. Continue to cook until sauce glazes onto the meat, 1 or 2 more minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in basil. Cook and stir until basil is wilted, about 20 seconds. Serve with rice. Serve hot and enjoy!
ingredients: chicken broth, oyster sauce, soy sauce, fish sauce, white sugar, brown sugar, vegetable oil, boneless chicken thighs shallots, clove garlic, Thai chilies, Serrano other hot pepper, very thinly sliced fresh basil leaves, hot cooked rice
descriptor: My version of thiclassic Thai dish haspectacular taste even with regular basil instead of Thai or holy basil. The sauce actually actlike a glaze athe chicken mixture cookover high heat. The recipe workbest if you chop or grind your own chicken, have all ingredientprepped before you start cooking.

instructions: Combine Gruyère cheese, Emmental cheese, cornstarch in a bowl. Mix until the cheese ievenly coated. Set aside. Immediately serve fondue, preferably over a warmer. If you used a saucepan on the stove to heat the fondue, you can carefully transfer the fondue to a fondue pot to serve. I have also used a mixture of Manchego, Petit Basque cheeseto make a sheep'cheese fondue, which ieasier to digest for those who cannot tolerate cow dairy. If your fondue itoo thick, add additional wine, at a time, until desired consistency ireached.

descriptor: Thirecipe showyou how easy a classic Swisfondue ito make. My husband grew up in Switzerland, it'there where I truly began to appreciate fondue. There are many variationof fondue in Switzerland, but thiithe most common version using Gruyère, Emmental. I love the ritual, it'so fun for entertaining. If you can find it, a splash of kirsch just before serving really givefondue a fortifying kick.
