instructions: Whisk the eggin a large bowl. Blend in sugar, beat until mixture ithick, pale, about minutes. Mix in the melted butter, salt. Gradually fold in the flour, lemon zest. Cover, refrigerate for at least one hour preferably, overnight. Preheat oven to degreeF . Lightly grease cookie sheet. On a floured surface, roll out dough to inch thickness. Cut into desired shapeusing cookie cutters. Place cookieon prepared cookie sheet. Brush with beaten egg yolkand decorate with sprinkles. Bake in preheated oven until golden at the edges, to minutes. Cool cookieon racks.
ingredients: eggs, white sugar, butter, cooled to lukewarm, pinch salt, all purpose flour, grated lemon zest, egg yolks, seasonal colored sprinkles
descriptor: These are sweet Swiscookies. We usually make them for Weihnachten , top them with sprinklebut they are appropriate year-round.

instructions: Butter a inch square metal pan. Place a sheet of parchment paper in the bottom. Butter the parchment, flour the whole pan. Position the rack of the oven to the lowest level, preheat the broiler. In a large bowl, cream the butter or margarine until light, fluffy. Add in the almond paste in small chunks; beat until smooth. Add the confectioners' sugar, cornstarch, vanilla, salt. Beat in the yolkone at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat until smooth. In another bowl, beat the egg whiteto soft peaks. Add in the sugar slowly while continuing to beat the meringue to stiff, glossy peaks. Fold the meringue into the yolk mixture. Sift the flour over this, fold in. Spoon a small amount of batter onto the parchment in the baking pan. With a pastry brush, paint the batter on. You want to cover the paper completely, but have a thin layer. Place under the broiler, cook until light brown; thishould take about to minutes. Brush another layer of the batter over the cake, place under the broiler. Continue on in thiway until all of the batter iused. Cool completely. Turn the cake out of the pan, trim the edgeclean. In a double boiler, combine the chocolate, the oil. Heat until the chocolate ismooth. With a pastry brush, brush one side of the trimmed cake with some chocolate. Don't make it too thick. Allow thito harden. Turn the cake over, brush the other side. Allow the cake to set. Cut the cake into narrow strips, each about -inchewide. Brush the sideand top with the glaze, allow to set. Store in the refrigeratbut serve at room temperature.
ingredients: unsalted butter, sifted confectioners' sugar, cornstarch, almond paste, vanilla extract, pinch salt, egg yolks, egg whites, white sugar, all-purpose flour, squaresemisweet chocolate, vegetable oil
descriptor: A true SwisBaumkuchen ialmost impossible to make at home. It requirea rotating spit, almost a gallon of batter, loadof time. Thiia smaller version, although it too taketime. The resulttaste a little like a Kit-Kat bar. The many layerwill remind you of the famouDobostorte.

instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add potatoeand cook until tender but still firm, about minutes. Drain, let cool. Once cool, peel, grate potatoes. Melt of butter in large nonstick skillet. Add a layer of potatoeand a layer of cheese, then sprinkle with salt, pepper. Repeat layers. Dot each layer with remaining butter. Sprinkle hot water over the top layer, cover, cook over low to medium heat until bottom layer browns. Turn potato cake with spatula, brown other side.
ingredients: large potatoes, butter, Swischeese, grated, salt, ground black pepper, hot water
descriptor: ThideliciouSwisrösti recipe featurelayerof potato, cheese. The recipe comefrom Basel, Switzerland. Enjoy!

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil, place a baking rack on top. Spray the baking rack with cooking spray. Combine bread crumband milk in a large bowl. Allow bread crumbto soak up the milk for about minutes. Mix in ground beef, ground pork, onion, parsley, celery, egg, garlic, sugar, salt, pepper until combined; mixture will be fairly wet. Shape into meatballwith a - cookie scoop. Place meatballon the prepared baking rack. Bake in the preheated oven until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of a meatball read degreeF , about minutes. While the meatballare baking, melt butter for sauce in a large saucepan over medium-low heat. Whisk in flour, cook, stirring constantly, for minutes. Gradually whisk in beef broth, Worcestershire sauce until smooth. Cook, stirring often, until slightly thickened, about minutes. Remove meatballfrom the oven, add to the sauce mixture. Simmer for minutes. Stir in sour cream, dill, lemon zest. Season with salt, pepper, serve immediately.
ingredients: cooking spray, fresh bread crumbs, milk, pound lean ground beef, pound lean ground pork, finely chopped onion, finely chopped fresh parsley, finely chopped celery, large egg, lightly garlic, white sugar, salt, freshly ground black pepper
descriptor: There are many versionof Swedish meatballs, thiithe way we like ours. They're juicy, tender, flavorful in a creamy, rich sauce. We enjoy them over mashed potatoeor buttered noodleand served with lingonberry sauce or cranberry sauce.

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Heat olive oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Saute onion in the hot oil until transparent, to minutes. Remove from heat, let cool. Combine ground sirloin, ground pork, bread crumbs, onion, egg, milk, garlic powder, salt, pepper, dasheWorcestershire sauce in a bowl. Form into -inch meatballs. Place onto a baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the centers, about minutes. Pour beef broth, soy sauce, rosemary, remaining Worcestershire sauce into a large skillet. Bring to a simmer. Pour remaining beef broth into a measuring, whisk in cornstarch. Pour mixture into the sauce, stir until thickened. Add meatballto the sauce, stir in Greek yogurt. Top with parsley, serve.
ingredients: olive oil, sweet onion, grated, pound ground sirloin, pound ground pork, seasoned panko bread crumbs, egg, milk, garlic powder, salt, freshly ground black pepper, dasheWorcestershire sauce, divided, reduced-sodium beef broth, divided, reduced-sodium soy sauce, finely chopped fresh rosemary, cornstarch, Greek yogurtfresh parsley
descriptor: Thirecipe ia healthier take on a classic Swedish meatballdish without sacrificing the elegance or taste. No one will ever know from tasting thidish that it ia lighter, healthier version.

instructions: Preheat oven to degreeF . In a large bowl, whisk together the egg, the milk. Add the beef, cream of wheat, onion, mix well. Shape into inch balls. Place ballon a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at degreeF for about minutes. Drain meatballon paper towels, if needed. Then place meatballin a lightly greased quart casserole dish. In a separate medium bowl, combine the soupwith the evaporated milk, stirring until smooth. Pour over the meatballs. Bake uncovered at degreeF for another minutes. Sprinkle with parsley before serving.
ingredients: egg, milk, pound ground beef, dry cream of wheat cereal, onion, can condensed cream of chicken soup, can condensed cream of mushroom soup, can evaporated milkfresh parsley
descriptor: Thiione of my husband'favorites. I created it using several other Swedish meatball recipethat didn't quite make the grade.

instructions: Heat a pan over medium heat, add oats. Tosand shake until fragrant, lightly toasted, to minutes. Combine sugar, cocoa powder, salt, cayenne, butter, coconut oil, vanilla extract, coffee in a bowl. Add the oatand mix until thoroughly combined. Portion dough into ballusing a sorbet scoop. Roll ballin grated coconut, transfer to a parchment-lined baking pan. Let them firm up in the fridge for to minutes. Both regular coffee, espresso work here. The sugar will add some grittinesto the overall texture. For something smoother, cream the sugar with butter first or just use powdered sugar. You can keep these in the fridge, let them sit out a bit before eating so they're not completely firm.
ingredients: quick-cooking rolled oats, white sugar, cocoa powder, pinch kosher salt, pinch cayenne pepper, unsalted butter, coconut oil, at room temperature, vanilla extract, strong brewed coffee, unsweetened grated coconut
descriptor: They say that these Swedish chocolate balls, known achokladbollar, are the first thing a Swedish child learnto make, for good reason; they're easy to do, there'no baking required, mixing the "dough" together makefor a fun activity. They sure beat snacking on a candy bar during the afternoon slump, athe fatand whole grain keep you satisfied much longer, while the coffee, cocoa provide the perfect pick-me-up.

instructions: Preheat oven to degreeF . Lightly grease an -inch pie plate. Sift together the flour, cocoa powder, salt; set aside. Stir the egginto the sugar until smooth. Add the flour mixture, stir just until combined. Pour in the vanilla extract, butter; stir until well combined. Pour into prepared pie plate. Bake on the lower rack of the preheated oven for minutes until the center haslightly set. Allow cake to cool for hour in the pie plate. Serve warm refrigerate overnight, serve cold.
ingredients: all-purpose flour, unsweetened cocoa powder, pinch salt, eggs, white sugar, vanilla extract, butter,
descriptor: Thiia Swedish recipe for Kladdkaka , a rich, gooey chocolate cake. It should serve but at our house it often serveonly ...

instructions: Gently simmer the red wine, port wine, cinnamon sticks, whole cloves, orange peel in a large pot set over medium-low heat. Stir in the sugar, rum, brandy. Continue simmering minutestirring to completely dissolve the sugar, the mixture isteaming but not boiling. Mix the raisinand almondtogether in a bowl. To serve, ladle into coffee or Swedish-style small glasor ceramic mugs. Garnish each with a spoonful of the raisin, almond mixture.
ingredients: bottlefruity red wine, such aBeaujolais, bottle port wine, cinnamon sticks, whole clovesange, peel cut, white sugar, rum, brandy, raisins, slivered almonds
descriptor: Glogg iwarm served during the Christmaholidayin Sweden, other Scandinavian countries, ait isweet, spicy, warming. Thiithe adult version of the drink, so don't serve it to the kids! Garnish drinkwith raisinand slivered almonds. Serve warm with gingerbread cookies.

instructions: Mix the oats, sugar, cocoa together in a bowl. Add the butter, use your handto mix the ingredienttogether to make a thick dough. Mix in the coffee, vanilla, chocolate until thoroughly blended. Place the coconut flakein a small bowl. Pinch off small amountof dough, roll between your handto make small balls, about -inchein diameter. Roll the ballin the coconut flakes. Ballare ready to eat may be refrigerated hourto become firmer. These chocolate ballare also often flavored with Swedish 'Punsch' liqueur or arrak extract, which givethem their name a'Arrak Balls.' They can also be rolled in chocolate sprinkleor chopped toasted almonds. Place the ballin small paper candy for serving at holiday parties.
ingredients: regular rolled oat, white sugar, unsweetened cocoa powder, butter or margarine, strong coffee, vanilla extractsquareunsweetened baking chocolate, coconut flakes
descriptor: Thiia classic Swedish recipe, beloved by every Swede. It ione of the first thingchildren learn to make, it'enjoyed greatly by all ages. The ballcan either be bite-sized or giant, whichever seemmore appealing. Or make one big ball, many small ones. Additional cocoa powder or chocolate can be added to intensify the flavor.

instructions: Make meatballs: Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook, stir onion, salt in hot butter until onion turntranslucent, about minutes. Transfer onion mixture to a large bowl. Stir in eggs, bread crumbs, milk, black pepper, nutmeg, allspice, cayenne. Mix in ground beef, pork until well combined. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap, refrigerate for hour. Make gravy: Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat; whisk in flour, cook until golden brown, to minutes. Slowly whisk in beef broth. Increase heat to medium-high, whisk in cream, bring to a simmer. Stir in sugar, Worcestershire. Simmer until slightly thickened, to minutes. Season with salt, black pepper. Remove from heat, set aside. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil, lightly coat with cooking spray. Roll to meatball mixture into a ball using wet hands; repeat with remaining meatball mixture. Place meatballon the prepared baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until browned, cooked through, about minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least degreeF . Transfer meatballto gravy, cook over medium-low heat until warmed through, about minutes.
ingredients: butter, yellow onion, fine salt, large eggs, plain bread crumbs, milk, freshly ground black pepper, ground nutmeg, ground allspice, pinch cayenne pepper, pound ground beef chuck, pound ground pork
descriptor: Swedish meatballs, traditionally served with boiled potatoeand lingonberry preserves, are a hearty meal the whole family will love!

instructions:
This pepparkakor recipe produces irresistibly crisp cookies that are full of warm, spicy, and cozy flavor. Pepparkakor (or "pepper cookies") are Swedish cookies. Similar to gingersnaps, pepparkakor are thin, crisp, and spicy. They're commonly baked and sold in Scandinavian countries during the holiday season. These are the ingredients you'll need to make this traditional pepparkakor recipe:,· Flour: This pepparkakor recipe starts with all-purpose flour, which gives the cookies structure.
· Baking soda: Baking soda acts as a leavener, which means it helps the cookies rise.
· Spices: These cozy pepparkakor cookies are spiced with cinnamon, cloves, ginger, and cardamom.
· Butter: Two sticks of butter add moisture and richness.
· Sugar: A blend of white and brown sugars gives these cookies a perfectly balanced sweet flavor.
· Egg: A beaten egg adds moisture and acts as a binder, which means it helps hold the dough together.
· Corn syrup: Dark corn syrup adds even more moisture and sweetness. If you'd like a lighter flavor, opt for light corn syrup. You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here's a brief overview of what you can expect when you make pepparkakor cookies at home:,1. Make the dough: Sift the dry ingredients together. Beat the butter and sugars, then add the remaining ingredients. Add the dry mix to the wet mix, then chill the dough.
2. Roll and cut the dough: Roll the chilled dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Cut the dough into shapes using cookie cutters.
3. Bake the cookies: Bake the cookies in a preheated oven until they're set. Transfer the cookies to a wire rack to cool. Allow the cookies to cool completely, then transfer them to an airtight container. Store at room temperature for up to one week. Unbaked pepparkakor dough will freeze well for up to three months. Wrap the dough ball in a layer of storage wrap then a layer of aluminum foil. When you're ready to bake, allow the dough to thaw overnight in the refrigerator, then roll, cut, and bake as directed. Baked pepparkakor can be frozen for up to three months. Place the completely cooled cookies in a zip-top freezer bag. Thaw in the fridge overnight. Editorial contributions by Corey Williams,Sift flour, baking soda, cinnamon, cloves, ginger, and cardamom into a large bowl. Beat butter, white sugar, and brown sugar together in a separate bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed until light and fluffy. Beat in egg and corn syrup until smooth. Gradually stir in flour mixture until evenly blended. Divide dough into four equal portions and wrap tightly in plastic wrap; refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or overnight. When ready to bake, preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease baking sheets. Working with one disk at a time, and leaving the remaining disks in the refrigerator, unwrap chilled dough and place onto a lightly floured surface. Roll dough with a floured rolling pin to a thickness of 1/8 inch. Cut dough into desired shapes with cookie cutters, dipping the cutters into flour as needed so they don't stick to the dough. Place cookies 1 inch apart on prepared baking sheets. Bake in the preheated oven until set, about 5 minutes. Transfer cookies to wire racks to cool. Repeat rolling, cutting, and baking the remaining cookies.
ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking soda, cinnamon, ground cloves, ground ginger, ground cardamom, unsalted butter, white sugar, brown sugar, packed, large egg, dark corn syrup
descriptor: Pepparkakor are thin, crispy, gingerbread cookiethat are a Christmatradition in Sweden. They're usually cut into heart, flower star shapes. Store cooled cookiein airtight containers.

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Peel potatoeand place in a bowl of cold water to prevent browning. One at a time, dry potatoeand place in a large wooden or metal serving spoon. Using a sharp knife, slice potato crosswise at /-inch intervals, cutting until the knife touchethe spoon, being careful not to cut all the way through so the potato stayintact. Arrange potatoecut-side up in a shallow baking dish or small roasting pan. Drizzle with of the melted butter, then season with salt, pepper. Bake in the preheated oven for to minutes; drizzle with remaining butter, sprinkle Romano cheese, bread crumbon top. Season with a little more salt, pepper, bake until nicely browned, about minutes.
ingredients: baking potatoes, butter, salt, pepper, finely grated fresh Romano cheese, seasoned dry bread crumbs
descriptor: ThiHasselback potatoerecipe makeseasoned potatoecrisp on the outside, tender on the inside. ThiSwedish dish takeitname from Hasselbacken, the Stockholm restaurant where it wafirst served.

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Place bread crumbinto a small bowl; mix in cream. Allow to stand until crumbabsorb cream, about minutes. Meanwhile, melt butter in a skillet over medium heat; cook, stir onion until light brown, about minutes. Transfer onion to a mixing bowl. Mix ground beef, ground pork, egg, brown sugar, salt, black pepper, nutmeg, allspice, ginger with onion in the mixing bowl. Lightly mix in bread crumband cream. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Pinch off about meat mixture per meatball; form into balls. Place meatballinto the skillet, cook, turning often, until browned, about minutes. Insideof meatballwill still be pink. Place browned meatballinto a baking dish, pour in chicken broth, cover with foil. Bake in the preheated oven until meatballare tender, about minutes. Remove meatballto a serving dish. Pour pan drippinginto a saucepan over medium heat. Whisk flour into drippinguntil smooth. Gradually whisk in enough beef broth to total about liquid. Bring gravy to a simmer, whisking constantly, until thickened, about minutes. Just before serving, whisk in sour cream. Season with salt, black pepper. Serve gravy with meatballs.
ingredients: sliceday-old white bread, crumbled, heavy cream, butter, small onion, pound ground beef, pound finely ground pork, egg, brown sugar, salt, ground black pepper, ground nutmeg, ground allspice, ground ginger, butter, chicken broth, all-purpose flour, beef broth, sour cream
descriptor: ThiSwedish meatball recipe iour family'Christmatradition. We frequently double the recipe, keep it warm in a slow cooker. Worth the effort, the meatballare even better the next day! Reserve brown gravy, add sour cream to it the day you serve the leftovers.

instructions: Combine potatoes, olive oil, salt in a large cold skillet. Heat on low, cook until potatoeare to minutes. Increase heat to high, fry until golden, to minutes. Drain on paper towels. Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stir onion with salt in the hot oil until onion ha to minutes. Add garlic, chile, smoked paprika; simmer for to minutes. Stir in tomatoeand return to a simmer. Transfer tomato mixture to a blender, cover, puree until tomato sauce ismooth. Serve patatabravawith tomato puree, and mayonnaise for dipping. The nutrition data for thirecipe includethe full amount of olive oil. We have determined the nutritional value of oil based on a retention value of after cooking. The exact amount will vary depending on cooking time, temperature, ingredient density, the specific type of oil used.
ingredients: russet potatoes, cut into -inch cubes, olive oil, salt, olive oil, onion, salt, clove garlic, red chile, smoked paprika, whole peeled tomatoes, mayonnaise
descriptor: Spanish tapaare tasty small platethat when combined can create a light supper or serve aa great appetizer. PatataBravaare tasty fried potato cubeserved with a smoky, spicy dipping sauce.

instructions: Combine white wine, peach vodka, lemonade concentrate, sugar in a large pitcher; stir until sugar idissolved. Add sliced peaches, red grapes, green grapes. Refrigerate sangria until well chilled, flavorhave blended, at least hourto overnight. Serve over ice, use a slotted spoon to include sliced peacheand grapewith each serving. I use a dry white wine such aSauvignon Blanc. You can use frozen peach sliceif you prefer.
ingredients: bottle dry white wine, peach flavored vodka, frozen lemonade concentrate, white sugar, pound white peaches, pitted, seedless red grapes, seedless green grapes
descriptor: Thirefreshing white peach sangria recipe ieasy to make, alwaya hit at parties!

instructions: Heat oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Add potatoeand season lightly with salt, pepper; cook, stirring occasionally, until golden brown, crisp, to minutes. Add onions; cook, stir until soft, beginning to brown, to minutes. Whisk eggin a bowl; season with salt, pepper. Pour egginto the skillet, stir gently to combine with potatoeand onion. Reduce the heat to low, cook until eggbegin to brown on the bottom, to minutes. Loosen omelet with a spatula. Invert a large plate over the pan, carefully flip omelet out onto the plate. Slide omelet, uncooked-side down, back into the pan. Cook until eggare set, to minutes. Serve warm, garnished with tomato, green onion.
ingredients: olive oil, pound potatoes, salt, pepper, large onion large eggs, medium tomato, green onions
descriptor: ThiSpanish-style egg, potato omelet may not be fancy, but it'certainly a hearty meal that everyone will enjoy. Crispy fried potatoeand onionare cooked with eggs, then garnished with tomatoeand green onionfor color, flavor.

instructions: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water, bring to a rolling boil. Cook fettuccine at a boil until almost tender, about minutes. While the pasta icooking, heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion, cook until starting to soften, about minutes. Add garlic, cook until fragrant, about minute. Pour in sardineand tomato sauce, stir to combine, cook until heated through, about minutes. Reduce the heat to low, keep at a simmer. Drain pasta, add to sauce, stir to combine. Cover, turn off the heat, let stand for minutes. Squeeze lemon over top, divide onto four serving plates. Garnish with Parmesan, red pepper flakes.
ingredients: dry fettuccine pasta, olive oil, medium yellow onion clove garlic, medium lemon, juiced, can sardinein tomato sauce, Parmesan cheese, pinch red pepper flakes
descriptor: Pasta de sardine ia great dish for anyone who likeseafood with their pasta. Thidish inot only fast, easy to prepare, but it ialso delicious. It'of regional Spanish-Italian authenticity, goewell with either red wine or beer.

instructions: Soak salted codfish in about quartof water, changing the water three timeover the course of hours. Drain, then cut codfish into bite-sized pieces. Layer of each ingredient in a pot in the following order: potatoes, codfish, onions, hard-boiled eggs, capers, garlic, olives, roasted red peppers, raisins. Place bay leaf on raisins, then pour of the tomato sauce, of the olive oil over top. Repeat layerin the same order, skipping bay leaf. Pour water, white wine over top; do not stir. Cover, bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce the heat to medium-low, simmer until potatoeare tender, about minutes. In Puerto Rico, thistew inormally served with a side of white rice, boiled root vegetablelike yucca, yautía, ñame boiled green bananas. After plating, drizzle extra-virgin olive oil over everything, add a slice of avocado on the side. Another option ito serve with a side of funche .
ingredients: pound salted cod fish, medium potatoethick, medium onion large hard-boiled egg capers, large clove garlic, pitted green olivesjar roasted red bell peppers, golden raisins, large bay leafcan tomato sauce, extra virgin olive oil, water, white wine
descriptor: Bacalao starin thiSpanish-style fish stew from the Basque region of Spain. Thitraditional dish ipopular in all Spanish-speaking countries; in fact, each country'version islightly different. In Mexico, it'usually made for Christmas, New Year'Eve, Lent. In Puerto Rico, it'enjoyed during Lent but also year-round. Thiione of the Puerto Rican versions.

instructions: Gather all ingredients. Make the dough: Stir flour, salt together in a medium bowl. Cut in shortening using a pastry blender until the mixture resemblecoarse crumbs. Use a fork to stir in water, a few at a time, until the mixture cometogether. Pat into a ball, flatten slightly. Wrap in plastic wrap, refrigerate for hour. Make the filling while dough ichilling: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion, cook until tender, about minutes. Add beef, paprika, cumin, pepper, salt; cook, stir until beef ibrowned, crumbly, to minutes. Drain excesgrease, then stir in the raisinand vinegar. Cover, refrigerate until chilled, about hour. Remove dough, filling from the refrigerator. Form dough into twenty-four -inch balls. Stir hard-cooked egginto filling. Heat oil in a deep-fryer to degreeF . While the oil iheating, roll one ball dough on a floured surface into a thin circle. Spoon some filling onto the center, fold dough into a half-moon shape, presthe edgewith your fingerto seal. Repeat to fill, form remaining empanadas. Working in batches, fry to empanadaat a time in hot oil until browned, about minuteper side. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot. We have determined the nutritional value of oil based on a retention value of after cooking. The exact amount may vary depending on cook time, temperature, ingredient density, the specific type of oil used.
ingredients: all-purpose flour, salt, shortening, water
descriptor: Try thieasy empanada recipe for the best fried empanadamade with homemade dough. The ground beef, raisin, hard-cooked egg filling makethirecipe extra delicious.

instructions: Heat a paella pan over medium-high heat, coat with olive oil. Add chicken, rabbit, garlic; cook, stir until nicely browned. Move the browned meat to the sideof the pan, add tomato, butter beans, peas, green beans. Season with paprika, mix well. Fill the paella pan almost to the top with water, measuring the water ayou add it so you can determine the amount of rice to add later. Bring to a boil. Simmer for about hour to make a nice broth. Season with a generouamount of salt, just enough saffron for a yellow colthyme, rosemary. Stir in half amuch rice athe amount of water added to the pan. Cover, reduce heat to low, simmer until all of the liquid habeen absorbed, about minutes. Rabbit can be very hard to find so you can just use a whole chicken instead. It also may be easier to use boneless chicken but then you don't get any fun extras, like heartand livers. If you do use the heartand livers, don't put them in until later athey cook very fast. They will however add a nice flavor to the rest of the dish. To account for personal preferences, the seasoningare intended to be added. Add just enough saffron to make a nice yellow color. Season with thyme, rosemary if desired. The goal ito make a rich-tasting broth that will soak into the rice to make it delicious. Since paella pancome in different sizes, water, rice measurementare left open for modificationawell. I like to use bomba, Valencia arboria rice.
ingredients: olive oil, whole chicken, rabbit, cleaned, head garlic, cloves, medium tomato, can butter beans, package frozen green peas, package frozen green beans, mild paprika, water, salt, pinch saffron threads, pinch dried thyme, pinch dried rosemary, short-grain white rice
descriptor: A traditional paella Valenciana. I lived in Spain for two yearwhere I wataught the art of making paella which originated in Valencia. I haven't found anything on here which ieven close to authentic, so I thought I would add thirecipe for those who would like to try a taste of Spain. First, foremost you will need a special paella pan called a paellera or just a paella. Trust me after you taste thiyou'll be glad you bought the special pan.

instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Add of the potato slices, cook, stirring occasionally, until just tender, to minutes. Transfer potatoeto a large bowl, leaving oil in the skillet. Add remaining potatoeto the skillet; cook, stirring occasionally, until just tender, to minutes. Transfer potatoeto the bowl, reserving oil in the skillet. Season potatoewith salt, pepper. Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a separate skillet over medium heat. Stir in onion rings, gently cook until soft, golden brown, about minutes. Spoon oniononto a plate, allow to cool. Whisk eggin a large bowl until smooth. Stir in cooled onions, roasted peppers, serrano ham. Gently fold in cooked potatoes. Heat the large skillet with reserved oil over low heat. Pour in egg mixture, gently cook until the sidehave started to set, the bottom haturned golden brown, to minutes. Loosen tortilla with a spatula if needed, then carefully slide onto a large plate. Turn the skillet upside down, place onto the uncooked side of tortilla. Turn the skillet right-side-up, remove the plate. Return the skillet to the stove, continue cooking until tortilla haset in the center, about minutes. Slide the tortilla onto a serving plate, allow to cool to room temperature. Cut into six wedgeand sprinkle with parsley to serve.
ingredients: olive oil, potatoes, salt, pepper, olive oil, onioninto rings, large eggs, roasted red pepper, drained, cut into strips, Spanish serrano ham chopped fresh Italian parsley
descriptor: Tortilla española ia potato, onion omelet. It'a classic tapadish, prepared all over Spain. Thiversion also includeroasted red pepperand Spanish Serrano ham. Unlike most omelets, a Spanish tortilla iserved at room temperature.

instructions: Make dipping sauce: Combine garlic, smoked paprika, salt in a mortar, pestle or food processor; procesuntil smooth. Mix in mayonnaise, sherry vinegar, tomato paste, chipotle chile powder, cayenne pepper until combined. Cover, refrigerate sauce. Make spice blend: Mix together salt, black pepper, paprika, chipotle chile powder in a small bowl. Set aside. Make potatoes: Pour water into a large saucepan. Stir salt, smoked paprika, cumin, bay leaveinto water. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover; simmer for minutes. Stir potatoeinto seasoned water, bring to a boil, simmer until potatoeare tender but not fully cooked, to minutes. The tip of a paring knife should easily insert into the center of a potato cube. Drain potatoeand transfer to a wire rack to cool completely, about minutes. Heat vegetable oil in a large cast iron skillet or Dutch oven to degreeF . Add cooled potato cubeand cook, stirring frequently, until golden brown, to minutes. Transfer potatoeto a baking sheet lined with paper towelto cool slightly. Tosin a bowl with spice blend, serve with dipping sauce. The nutrition data for thirecipe includethe full amount of the salt used in the cooking liquid, spice mix. The actual amount of the salt consumed will vary.
ingredients: clove garlic, smoked paprika, pinch salt, mayonnaise, sherry vinegar tomato paste, ground chipotle peppers, pinch cayenne pepper more
descriptor: Patatabravaare fried potatoethat are fiercely textured, fiercely flavored, fiercely presented, fiercely enjoyed. How fierce ireally up to you, your inner Spaniard. There are amany patatabravarecipeahomein Spain, thiinothing more than my latest rendition.

instructions: Place onion, garlic, bay leaf, paprika, salt, olive oil into a saucepan. Cook, stir over medium-high heat until onionstart to soften, about minutes. Add white wine to create the braising liquid. Bring to a simmer. Transfer octopuinto braising liquid, turning to coat with the liquid. Cover; reduce heat to low. Simmer minuteand turn octopuover. Continue cooking until octopuitender, another to minutes. Remove from heat; transfer octoputo a large bowl. Pour braising liquid over octopus. Place bowl above a bowl of ice water to cool to room temperature. Cover bowl with plastic wrap when octopuand liquid are cool. Refrigerate until thoroughly chilled, at least houror overnight. Transfer octoputo a work surface, mop off braising juicewith paper towels; remove amuch of the purple skin ayou want. Cut octopuinto or serving-size pieces. Brush with olive oil. Transfer braising liquid to saucepan. Bring to a boil; remove from heat. Strain out solids; transfer liquid to a mixing bowl; let cool about minutes. Stir in lemon juice, extra-virgin olive oil, salt, cayenne pepper to make the serving sauce. Heat a grill pan or outdoor grill to high heat. Transfer octopupieceto grill. Cook until flesh iseared, almost charred minutes. Turn, cook other side until dark brown, caramelized, heated through, another or minutes. Transfer to a platter. Slice octopuinto fairly thick diagonal slices. Place on a serving dish. Spoon braising liquid mixture over the top. Dust with a bit of cayenne pepper, if desired. Freshly chopped Italian parsley inice to add to the serving sauce. I love to serve braised octopuwith crusty roasted potatoes.
ingredients: yellow onion, clove garlic, large bay leaf, smoked Spanish paprika, kosher salt, olive oil, white wine
descriptor: Above, beyond the ingredientin thioctopurecipe, the cooking method should I say methods, couldn't be easier. Along ayou braise it gently on low heat, until just tender, then give it a nice sear before serving, you should be in great shape. Thismoky braised octopuigreat served with crusty roasted potatoes.

instructions: Have orange, lemon, lime, rum, wine, orange juice well chilled. Slice orange, lemon, lime into thin rounds; place in a large glaspitcher. Pour in rum, sugar. Chill in the refrigerator until flavorblend, about hours. Crush fruit lightly with a wooden spoon; stir in wine, orange juice. Adjust sweetnesadesired.
ingredients: orange, lemon, lime, rum, white sugar, bottle dry red wine, orange juice
descriptor: Thiauthentic sangria recipe ia terrific version of the popular wine drink. You can add any fruit that you want, but I find that appleand pearabsorb all the rum. Thione inot diluted with carbonated beverages. I have had much succeswith red Burgundy wine, white rum, though spiced rum inice too.

instructions: Place shrimp in a large bowl, season with paprika, kosher salt; mix well to coat. Slice garlic into thin slices. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat; add garlic, cook until golden, about minutes. Add shrimp, increase heat to high. Tosand turn shrimp with tonguntil starting to curl but still undercooked, about minutes. Pour in sherry. Cook, stirring continuously, until sauce comeup to a boil, shrimp icooked through, about minute more. Remove from heat. Stir in parsley. Unlesyou live in a few choice locations, it'rare to find true fresh shrimp at the market. All they do ithaw some frozen, put it in the case, where it situntil you buy it, which iwhy it really makea lot more sense to purchase frozen. To thaw, run cold water into the bowl of frozen shrimp, let it sit for about minutebefore draining. Repeat once more. Feel free to substitute sherry with white wine plua pinch of sugar.
ingredients: pound frozen large shrimp, deveined, hot smoked paprika, kosher salt, clove garlic, extra-virgin olive oil, dry sherryItalian flat-leaf parsley
descriptor: Gambaal ajillo are on every Spanish restaurant menu — for good reason! It'a dish of shrimp cloaked in garlic-infused olive oil with smoky hintof paprika, a touch of sweetnesfrom sherry. Make sure you have all your ingredienttogether before you head to the stove since, start to finish, thicookin mere minutes. It'great for a tapaparty since you can prep everything ahead of time. Just spoon the shrimp, sauce over toasted bread, sprinkle more cayenne, parsley on top to enjoy.

instructions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat; add bacon, season with salt, pepper. Cook until bacon icrisp, to minutes. Add cabbage, onion, sugar; cook, stir continuously until cabbage, onion are tender, about to minutes.
ingredients: vegetable oil, bacon, cut into thirds, salt, ground black pepper, head cabbage, cored, white onion pinch white sugar
descriptor: Fried cabbage ia favorite at Mammaw'house! Bacon ifried until crispy, then sautéed with cabbage, onion in thisimple, quick side dish. It'terrific with cornbread.

instructions: Every baker needa good buttermilk biscuit recipe in their repertoire. If you don't have a go-to yet, you're in luck! Chef John'take on classic buttermilk biscuitia favorite in the Allrecipecommunity. Best of all, it'easy to make with ingredientyou probably have on hand. Buttermilk iused in biscuit-making for itacid, fat content. Itacidity workwith the leavenerto help the dough rise, producing a taller, fluffier biscuit. Buttermilk also adda subtle tang. Cream biscuitare made with heavy cream. Cream biscuitare beloved because they're incredibly easy-to-make. But, since cream imuch milder than buttermilk, they won't be quite aflavorful . Also, cream biscuitwill likely not rise ahigh abuttermilk biscuits, especially if the recipe doesn't contain enough leavener. Learn more: Here Are the Biscuit TypeEvery Baker Should Know How To Make,You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here'a brief overview of what you can expect when you make these from-scratch buttermilk biscuits:,Whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt in a large bowl. Cut cold butter sliceinto the flour mixture with a pastry blender until the dough resemblecoarse crumbs. Next, make a well in the center of the dough. Pour cold buttermilk into the well, gently stir until combined. Turn the dough out on a floured surface, pat it into a rectangle. Fold the rectangle in thirds, then turn dough a half turn. Gather any crumband flatten back into a rectangle. Repeat the procestwo more times. Roll the dough on the floured surface until it'about -inch thick. Use a round biscuit cutter to cut the biscuits. Re-roll the scrapand continue cutting until the dough igone. Transfer the biscuitto a lined baking sheet. Use your thumb to presan indent into the top of each biscuit. Brush the topwith buttermilk. Bake until the biscuitare golden brown. Not sure what to serve with your buttermilk biscuits? We've got you covered. Check out our collection of Wayto DresUp Your Homemade Biscuits. If you're looking for something a little heartier, biscuitpair well with any of Our Top-Rated SoupGive You Comfort By the Bowlful. You can also use them to make biscuitand gravy, breakfast sandwiches, so much more. Store homemade buttermilk biscuitat room temperature for about two dayor in the fridge for up to a week. Either way, you'll need to make sure they're in an airtight container or wrapped tightly in foil to prevent them from drying out. Yes, you can definitely freeze buttermilk biscuit—, it'a great idea if you won't eat the whole batch within a week. Allow the biscuitto cool completely, then wrap them individually in one layer of storage wrap, one layer of foil. Store in the freezer for up to three months. There'no need to thaw frozen biscuits. Simply transfer them to a baking sheet, bake at degreeF for about - minutes until they're warmed through. "​​Whipped up a double batch of these beautiful buttermilk biscuits," sayBitchnkitchen. "Chef John, you never let me down. I watched the video to make sure I had a handle on the technique. My husband, daughter loved them; my grandfather proclaimed that surely the way to a man'heart ipaved with these biscuits. The only change I made wato instead of cutting roundand handling the dough that much more I used a pizza cutter to slice equal sized squares.","Thirecipe iabsolutely perfect," raveNoah Ribaric. "I have never had scratch biscuitthat turned out so well; thirecipe hafound a home in my cooking hall of fame.","No need to look any further for a perfect biscuit, thiithe only recipe you will ever need," according to Vintage American Male. "Awesome, high-rising, flaky, buttery rich flavor! What more could you want in a biscuit? Follow directionexactly, you won't be disappointed.",Editorial contributionby Corey Williams,Preheat oven to degreeF . Line a baking sheet with a silicone baking mat or parchment paper. Whisk flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt together in a large bowl. Add cold butter sliceand cut into the flour with a pastry blender until the mixture resemblecoarse crumbs. Make a well in the center of the mixture. Pour cold buttermilk into the well, stir gently until just combined. Turn dough onto a floured work surface, pat it together into a rectangle. Fold the rectangle in thirds. Turn dough a half turn, gather any crumbs, flatten back into a rectangle. Repeat twice folding, pressing the dough a total of three times. Roll dough on a floured surface to about inch thick. Use a /-inch round biscuit cutter to cut biscuits. Reroll any scrapto cut more biscuits; you should get total. Transfer biscuitto the prepared baking sheet. Presan indent into the top of each biscuit with your thumb. Brush buttermilk over the tops. Bake in the preheated oven until biscuitare flaky, golden brown, about minutes. Enjoy!,Make sure you use cold butter, cold buttermilk for thirecipe!
ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, unsalted butter, chilled in freezer, cut into thin slices, cold buttermilk, buttermilk for brushing
descriptor: Thideceptively simple buttermilk biscuit recipe can come out a million different waywith some very minor variationon the ingredientand amounts. Thione'my favorite — flaky, but not dry; chewy, but not tough;, crisp in just the right spots. Ice-cold butter, some extra dough folding are key to having lotof flaky layerin each golden brown buttermilk biscuit.

instructions:
This bananas foster recipe is a showstopping dessert that will impress everyone at your table — but it's surprisingly simple to make!,Bananas foster is a dessert consisting of sliced bananas and a rum sauce served over vanilla ice cream. It originated in New Orleans and is often prepared tableside in restaurants as a flambé (a cooking technique in which alcohol is added to a hot pan, creating flames). These are the ingredients you'll need to make this restaurant-worthy bananas foster recipe:,· Butter: This decadent bananas foster recipe starts with butter melted in a skillet.
· Brown sugar: Dark brown sugar gives the dessert a rich and complex sweetness.
· Rum: Use your favorite dark rum for this boozy treat.
· Vanilla: Vanilla extract enhances the overall flavor of this bananas foster recipe.
· Cinnamon: Ground cinnamon lends a warm and cozy flavor.
· Bananas: Of course, you'll need bananas!
· Walnuts: Coarsely chopped walnuts add nutty flavor and welcome crunch.
· Ice cream: Use store-bought or homemade vanilla ice cream. You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here's a brief overview of what you can expect when you make bananas foster at home:,1. Melt the butter in a skillet. Stir in the sugar, rum, vanilla, and cinnamon.
2. Add the bananas and walnuts, then cook until the bananas are soft.
3. Serve over ice cream. While it's best to make bananas foster right before you plan to serve it, you can make the sugary rum sauce the day before. Store it in an airtight container in the refrigerator, then reheat on the stove before finishing the recipe as written. "Just right," according to Bradley Miller. "Delicious and simple. Making sure the sugar is completely dissolved is very important for a great bananas foster.","I have made this for years," says Michelle Embrey Hembree. "It is so delicious! The only thing I do differently is substitute brandy for the rum. It's a favorite at my house. I usually make a double batch and it will all be gone that night or the next day.","Made this on the weekend with pecans and had to omit the vanilla (because I ran out), but it was so good," says LJ Shaw. "Used the remaining little bit on pancakes the next morning and I now have a new favorite pancake topper.",Editorial contributions by Corey Williams,Melt butter in a large, deep skillet over medium heat. Stir in brown sugar, rum, vanilla, and cinnamon; bring to a low boil. Place bananas and walnuts in the pan. Cook until bananas have softened, 1 to 2 minutes. Serve at once over vanilla ice cream.
ingredients: butter, dark brown sugar, rum, vanilla extract, ground cinnamon, bananas, crosswise, coarsely chopped walnuts, pint vanilla ice cream
descriptor: Bananafoster imade by cooking sliced bananaand walnutin a buttery rum sauce, serving it over vanilla ice cream. A Father'Day favorite we all love!

instructions: Southern-style collard greenare savory comfort food with a deliciously zesty kick. Thiclassic, down-home side dish featurefresh chopped collard greencooked with crumbled bacon, chicken broth for a perfectly tender finish. Learn how to make thitantalizingly spicy Southern recipe, bring the meat, three right to your door. Plus, get the best methodfor storing, freezing. Simple pantry ingredientand affordable produce come together to make thitreasured dish. Bacon, garlic, onion create the flavor base, while chicken broth actathe braising liquid. Red pepper flakeadd a fiery element that you can dial up or down based on preference. Since collard greengrow in the ground, you'll want to give them a good wash before you use them. You can wash the greencut or whole, but we suggest washing after cutting for the most thorough clean . Start by pulling or cutting the woody stem away from the leaves. Roughly cut the greeninto two-inch pieceor strips. Culinary producer Nicole McLaughlin recommendrolling or folding the large leaveto make the procesa little quicker, easier. Once the greenare cut, it'time to wash. Submerge the greenin water , allow the grit to fall to the bottom. Drain in a colander, rinse again under running water. Making a tender, flavorful pot of collard greencouldn't be easier. You'll find the full recipe below with step-by-step instructions, but here'what you can expect when you make thitop-rated recipe;,Begin by cooking bacon slicein a skillet until crisp. Remove the bacon from heat, crumble, add back to the pan along with chopped onion, garlic. Next, add fresh cut collard greento the mixture. Cook them gently, just until they begin to wilt, before pouring in broth, seasonings. Reduce heat, let the collard greencook low, slow — about minutewill result in silky, spicy greenthat any Southern grandma would be proud to serve. These classic collard greenpair perfectly with all kindof Southern dishes, from fried chicken to country ham. Nicole suggestserving them with barbecue chicken, cornbread for a down-home meal that'll please everyone at your table. Before cooking, fresh collard greencan be stored in the refrigerator for four to five days. They can also be frozen ahead of time — blanched greencan last for monthin the freezer before cooking. What about leftovers? Southern collard greenare usually cooked in large batches, so freezing the remaining portionia great way to have a deliciouside dish on hand when you're short on time. Freeze cooked collard greenin small plastic bagas-is. They'll last up to months. "I just cooked these greenwith black-eyed peas, cornbread, pork chops, " sharehome cook Shelby. "We're in the South, my husband haeaten A LOT of collards. He'raving right now!","Just the right balance of flavors," sayreviewer Alexis. "The only variationI made were more bacon, onions, a dash of apple cider vinegar. I don't think I'll ever prepare these any other way!","Being from the north, I had no idea what to even do with collard greens, sayLaura. "I used thirecipe, found out that not only are they easy to prepare, I like collard greens!,Editorial contributionby Rai Minceyand Corey Williams,Gather all ingredients. Heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add bacon, cook until crisp, to minutes. Remove bacon from pan, crumble, return to the pan. Add onion to the pan, cook until tender, about minutes. Add garlic, cook until just fragrant. Add collard greens, fry until they start to wilt. Pour in chicken broth, season with salt, pepper, red pepper flakes. Reduce heat to low, cover, simmer until greenare tender, about minutes. Serve hot, enjoy!
ingredients: olive oil, bacon, large onion clove garlic, pound fresh collard greens, chicken broth, salt, pepper, pinch red pepper flakes
descriptor: If you like collard greenyou will love thirecipe. The bacon, oniongive them a wonderful flavor. Add more red pepper for a little more spice.

instructions: Thicolorful southern coleslaw isure to brighten up any table. Here’what you’ll need to make thibright, flavorful southern coleslaw recipe:,You’ll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here’a brief overview of what you can expect when you make southern coleslaw:,Tip from recipe creator Kristina: “To speed thingup, I sometimebuy a bag of shredded cabbage with carrotin it, then chop it a little finer.”,Yes! In fact, since the coleslaw will taste better the longer it sitin the fridge, it might actually make more sense to make it the day before you plan to serve it. Store the southern coleslaw in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to five days. “Excellent,” raveBonnie Henry. “I made no adjustmentand it iperfect. The entire family loved it, we're having it tonight with pulled pork sandwiches.”,“We've been looking for the perfect coleslaw, I think we found it,” according to Ray. “If you're looking for a KFC copycat thiiit!”,“Thirecipe wareally great,” sayNana Tina. “Everyone loved it, I will be making it for our church dinner. Sure it will go over well. I did substitute sour cream, a little water because I did not have buttermilk.”,Editorial contributionby Corey Williams,Mix cabbage, carrots, onion in a large salad bowl. Whisk mayonnaise, sugar, milk, buttermilk, lemon juice, vinegar, salt, black pepper in a separate bowl until smooth, sugar hadissolved. Pour dressing over cabbage mixture, mix thoroughly. Cover bowl, refrigerate slaw at least hour. Mix again before serving. To speed thingup, I sometimebuy a bag of shredded cabbage with carrotin it, then chop it a little finer.
ingredients: head cabbage, finely shredded, carrots, finely chopped onion, mayonnaise, white sugar, milk, buttermilk, lemon juice, distilled white vinegar, salt, ground black pepper
descriptor: ThiSouthern coleslaw recipe habeen passed down the generationand igreat for any occasion. It hathe perfect balance of sweet, tangy. I've even been told it ireminiscent of KFC coleslaw. You be the judge!

instructions:
Pimento cheese is the perfect dish to bring to potlucks, tailgates, and just about any get-together! The easy-to-make Southern staple is a true crowd-pleaser. This Southern pimento cheese recipe will surely become a go-to in your recipe box. Pimento cheese is a popular Southern spread that's traditionally made with shredded Cheddar, mayonnaise, and pimentos. It's commonly served with crackers and vegetables or as a sandwich filling. Pimento cheese is often called the "pâté of the south.",You'll find a detailed ingredient list and step-by-step instructions in the recipe below, but let's go over the basics:,These are the ingredients you'll need to make pimento cheese at home:,· Cheese: This recipe calls for shredded extra-sharp Cheddar cheese. You can use a mix of mild and sharp Cheddar, if you'd like.
· Mayonnaise: Mayonnaise is a key ingredient in traditional pimento cheese.
· Cream cheese: Cream cheese makes this pimento cheese spread extra decadent.
· Pimentos: Of course, you'll need jarred pimentos!
· Jalapeños: A minced jalapeño is optional, but it's great for fans of spicy flavor.
· Spices and seasonings: This pimento cheese is flavored with garlic powder, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper. It couldn't be easier to make homemade pimento cheese: Just mix all the ingredients until they're well-combined. Find the full, step-by-step recipe below. Tip: You can combine the ingredients in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment; beat until smooth and creamy. "Pimento cheese is a Southern staple," says culinary producer Nicole McLaughlin (a.k.a. NicoleMcMom). "If you've never had it, today is the day!" Here are a few of her best pimento cheese tips and tricks:,· Make sure to grate your own cheese from the block. "Do not buy that pre-shredded stuff, it is not going to be the same," warns Nicole.
· Using a stand mixer with the paddle attachment is a great shortcut for making big batches of pimento cheese, according to Nicole. But don't mix until the pimentos are pulverized! Stop when the mixture is well-combined.
· Instead of pre-diced pimentos, Nicole likes to buy jarred and sliced pimentos to dice herself before adding them to the cheese mixture. Store the pimento cheese in a shallow, airtight container in the refrigerator for up to one week. You can freeze pimento cheese for up to three months. Though it will still taste delicious, the flavor might be slightly different after it has been frozen and thawed. "Delicious as-is," according to one Allrecipes community member. "Mix a dollop in with mashed potatoes, scrambled eggs or on top of a burger for a real treat!","This is absolutely AMAZING," raves DPerkins. "I stuck to the recipe, the only difference is that I roasted my jalapeno before adding. The entire family loved it. I will definitely be making this again.","Loved this," says Debbie. "We like spicy and hot, so I added a bit more jalapeño and a splash of Sriracha as well. I served it warmed on an open faced, toasted bagel with a bit more extra shredded Cheddar melted on top.",Editorial contributions by Corey Williams,Gather all ingredients. Place Cheddar cheese, cream cheese, mayonnaise, pimento, minced jalapeño, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, and onion powder in a large bowl. Mix until thoroughly combined. Season to taste with salt and black pepper. Enjoy!
ingredients: shredded extra-sharp Cheddar cheese, cream cheese, mayonnaisejar diced pimento, jalapeno pepper, seeded, garlic powder, ground cayenne pepper, onion powder, salt, black pepper
descriptor: Thiwonderful pimento cheese with jalapeño can be used to spice up grilled cheese sandwiches, aa spread for crackers served alongside your favorite fried green tomatoes.

instructions: Looking for a hearty rice dish with a kick? Thiauthentic Louisiana red beanand rice ia budget-friendly recipe with incredible Cajun flavor. Andouille sausage joingarden-fresh vegetables, zesty spices, long grain rice in thideliciously down-home recipe. Learn all about thiboldly savory dish, including tipon choosing the best beanand what to serve alongside it. Thimultifaceted Louisiana-style red beanand rice recipe imade easier by breaking down the prep into small steps. You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here'a brief overview of what you can expect:,Start by soaking your beanovernight, dicing any vegetablebeforehand. When you're ready to begin, transfer the soaked beanto a large pot with water. Then, saute onions, bell peppers, garlic, celery in an oiled skillet until a bit of color appears. Add the cooked vegetables, bay leaves, Cajun seasoning, other spiceto the beans. Bring the bean mixture to a boil before reducing the heat, allowing the ingredientto simmer for two to two, a half hours. Steam the rice during thitime, set it aside. Add Andouille sausage to the beanand cook for an additional half-hour. After cooking, pour the spicy sausage, beanover rice, enjoy a piping hot bowl of tender, meaty, flavorful perfection. Red beanand kidney beanshare a similar colbut they're actually two different typeof legumes. Red beanare small, rounded, have a faintly nutty taste. Red kidney beanare larger in size, with thicker skin, a slightly richer hue. Both can be used to make an appetizing red beanand rice dish, but dried kidney beanmay have to soak longer before cooking. Using dry beanin thirecipe ensurethat they retain their shape during cooking. Dried beanshould be soaked prior to cooking for easier digestion, faster cook time. There are two commonly used wayto soak beans: overnight or quick soak. The overnight method iincredibly simple — add beanto a large stockpot, cover them with twice their volume in water. Cover, let sit overnight. Quick soaking consistof bringing dried beanand water to a boil before removing them from heat, allowing the beanto sit for one to four hour. Red beanand rice ia versatile recipe that can act aa main or side dish. The big, hearty flavorpair well with foodlike cornbread, collard greens, barbecued meats, fried chicken. Leftover red beanshould be stored separately from rice to discourage mushiness. Place both componentin their own sealed container, refrigerate for up to a week. To freeze your leftovers, place cooled, single servingof rice into freezer bagand top with a commensurate portion of beans. Tightly seal the bags, freeze for up to three months. "I'm a Louisiana boy who grew up eating red beanand rice, sharereviewer jChase. "Thirecipe ithe real deal. It'become a staple in my home, I serve it up twice a month.","I made substitutionbecause I did not want to venture out to the market for ingredientI did not have," sayhome cook Rea. "Thitime, I used chorizo sausage, celery powder, green pepper from my garden. I recommend it as-is with personal adjustments!","All I can say iwow!" raveLesley. "I served half that night for dinner , the rest I froze in individual servingfor a later date. A -star recipe for sure!",Editorial contributionby Rai Mincey,Gather all ingredients. Rinse beans, then soak in a large pot of water overnight. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook onion, bell pepper, celery, garlic in olive oil for to minutes. Rinse beans, transfer to a large pot with water. Stir cooked vegetableinto beans. Season with bay leaves, parsley, thyme, Cajun seasoning, cayenne pepper, sage. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer for hours. Stir sausage into beans, continue to simmer for minutes. Meanwhile, prepare the rice. Bring water, rice to a boil in a saucepan. Reduce heat, cover, simmer for minutes. Serve beanover steamed white rice.
ingredients: pound dry kidney beans, olive oil, large onion green bell pepper stalkcelery garlic, water, bay leaves, dried parsley, dried thyme, Cajun seasoning, cayenne pepper, dried sage, pound andouille sausage water, long grain white rice
descriptor: Authentic Cajun flavor! I grew up in Louisiana, love red beanand rice; these are just like I remember. Serve with hot sauce for a little kick. My family loved to splash a little cider vinegar in each bowl.

instructions:
This jambalaya recipe is savory, spicy, and oh-so satisfying. The Allrecipes community can't get enough of the top-rated jambalaya — it has earned more than 1,000 rave reviews from happy home cooks. Jambalaya is a one-pot dish that's made with rice, meat or seafood, and vegetables. With French and Spanish influences, jambalaya is quite similar to paella. The name "jambalaya" likely comes from the Provençal word "jambalaia," which means mishmash. Like many Cajun and Creole foods, jambalaya starts with the Cajun holy trinity: a flavor base of onion, bell peppers, and celery. Learn more: What's the Difference Between Gumbo and Jambalaya?,These are the ingredients you'll need to make the best jambalaya of your life:,· Oil: Chicken and andouille sausage are sautéed in peanut oil.
· Sausage: Opt for andouille sausage for the most authentic jambalaya.
· Chicken: Cut one pound of boneless, skinless chicken breasts into 1-inch pieces.
· Spices and seasonings: This chicken and sausage jambalaya is flavored with Cajun seasoning, fresh garlic, red pepper flakes, salt, pepper, hot sauce, Worcestershire sauce, and file powder.
· Vegetables: You'll need an onion, green bell peppers, and celery.
· Rice: Opt for plain white rice for this jambalaya recipe.
· Broth: Use store-bought or homemade chicken broth to cook the rice. You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below – but here's a brief overview of what you can expect when you make this tried-and-true chicken and sausage jambalaya:,1. Cook the meat: Season the sausage and chicken pieces with Cajun seasoning. Sauté the sausage until browned, then remove with a slotted spoon and set aside. Sauté chicken until lightly browned on all sides. Remove with a slotted spoon and set aside.
2. Cook the vegetables: In the same pot, sauté the onion, celery, bell pepper, and garlic until tender. Stir in the crushed tomatoes and seasonings. Add the meat and cook for 10 minutes.
3. Add the rice: Stir in the rice and chicken broth. Bring to a boil, reduce the heat, and cook until all the liquid is absorbed. Jambalaya, with its hearty and satisfying ingredients, is a meal all on its own. You don't technically need to serve it with anything. If you want to go the extra mile, though, here are a few mouthwatering ideas:,· Grandmother's Buttermilk Cornbread
· Cajun Corn and Bacon Maque Choux
· Southern-Style Crowder Peas,Explore our entire collection of Cajun Side Dish Recipes. Allow the jambalaya to cool completely, then transfer it to an airtight container. Store in the refrigerator for three to four days. Reheat on the microwave or stove. If you're worried about the jambalaya drying out as it reheats, add a bit of broth to keep it moist. Yes, you can freeze jambalaya for up to three months. Ladle it (in serving-size portions) into zip-top freezer bags. Wrap each bag in foil and freeze flat. "I have made this recipe several times now," says Jamie. "This time I added more vegetables and used fresh tomatoes from my garden! We all love it and will make it over and over again!","Wow," raves one Allrecipes community member. "This was soooooo yummy and easy to prepare. I made it the first time for a small dinner party and it was a hit. The little bit of leftovers the next day heated up nicely and tasted terrific.","Made this tonight and loved it," says Lola Marie. "So easy and so delicious! I'll definitely be making it again.",Editorial contributions by Corey Williams,Gather all ingredients. Heat 1 tablespoon of peanut oil in a large heavy Dutch oven over medium heat. Season the sausage and chicken pieces with Cajun seasoning. Sauté sausage until browned. Remove with slotted spoon, and set aside. Add 1 tablespoon peanut oil, and sauté chicken pieces until lightly browned on all sides. Remove with a slotted spoon, and set aside. In the same pot, saute onion, bell pepper, celery, and garlic until tender. Stir in crushed tomatoes, and season with red pepper, black pepper, salt, hot pepper sauce, Worcestershire sauce, and filé powder. Stir in chicken and sausage. Cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in the rice and chicken broth. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes, or until liquid is absorbed. Serve and enjoy!
ingredients: peanut oil, divided, Cajun seasoning, andouille sausage into rounds, pound bonelesskinleschicken breasts, cut into inch pieces, onion, small green bell pepper, stalkcelery, clove garlic, mincedcan crushed Italian tomatoes, red pepper flakes, ground black pepper, salt, hot pepper sauce, Worcestershire sauce, file powder, uncooked white rice, chicken broth
descriptor: A spicy jambalaya with chicken, andouille sausage, rice, Cajun seasoningthat'easy to make in one pot.

instructions: Southern-style fried green tomatoeare the crisp, tangy, boldly savory appetizer you should be making all year. Thiclassic, down-home dish featuresliced unripe tomatoethat are dredged in flour, cornmeal before being skillet-fried to buttery-brown perfection. Our community of home cooklovethe simple seasoningand wonderful crunch of thiold-fashioned recipe. Learn how to make, store, freeze the tastiest fried green tomatoeever. Green tomatoeare unripe red tomatoe with much firmer flesh, a sharp, tart flavor. Most are intentionally picked before maturing to ensure the crispest, driest fruit possible. Because they have a lower water content, green tomatoeare perfectly suitable for sauteeing, frying. Your fried tomatoewill hold up best if you cut them horizontally in - to -inch thick slices. If you like, you can sprinkle a tiny pinch of sugar on each slice to chase away any lingering bitterness. Before frying, dredge the tomato slicein seasoned flour — or make a thicker breading: dip the slicelightly in flour, then in beaten egg, followed by a substantial coating of breadcrumbs, cornmeal cracker crumbs. For real down-home flavfry them in bacon grease . Whatever kind of fat you use, make sure it'around degreeF for crispy golden-brown results. Half the fun of eating fried green tomatoeidipping them in a creamy, flavorful sauce. Serve thiSouthern dish with zippy remoulade, honey mustard a sweet chili sauce for an incredibly delicioufinish. Whip up your sauce ahead of time so the flavorhave time to meld ayou prepare, cook the fried green tomatoes. Although fried green tomatoeare best enjoyed piping hot, perfectly crisp, you can store them in the refrigerator for one to two days. Keep them in an airtight container, reheat in an oiled skillet, oven air fryer. After being cooked, fried green tomatoeare not great candidatefor freezing. But sliced, battered green tomatoecan be stored safely in the freezer for up to a year. Simply pat tomatoedry, dip them in egg wash, dredge in a flour-cornmeal mixture, then freeze. Use an airtight container or freezer bag to hold the battered tomatoes. You'll have zesty, Southern-style goodnesready to pop into the skillet year-round. Culinary producer Nicole McLaughlin saythese fried green tomatoeare perfectly crunchy on the outside, but tender, juicy on the inside. Here are a few of her best tipand trickfor making these "summer delights:","Just made thiand it wafantastic!" ravehome cook Larry. "I love fried green tomatoeand thione hit the bullseye. Will definitely use thione again. It reminded me of when I wayoung, my mom made it.","Thiia quick summer meal with a salad or cottage cheese out on the patio next to the pool," shareTBIRD. "Thankfor the recipe!","I added garlic powder, used cayenne pepper instead of black pepper because I love the warmth of it," sayreviewer Elana. "I used almond milk instead of cow'milk — just dependon your preference.",Editorial contributionby Carl Hanson, Rai Mincey, Corey Williams,Gather all ingredients. Slice tomatoeinch thick. Discard the ends. Whisk eggand milk together in a medium-sized bowl. Scoop flour onto a plate. Mix cornmeal, bread crumbs, salt, pepper on another plate. Dip tomatoeinto flour to coat. Then dip tomatoeinto milk, egg mixture; dredge in breadcrumbto completely coat. Heat oil in a large deep skillet to degreeF . Place tomatoein hot oil in batcheof or, to prevent them from touching; fry until crisp, golden brown on one side, then flip, fry on other side. Transfer fried tomatoeto a paper towel-lined plate to drain. Repeat with remaining tomatoes. Serve hot, enjoy!,We have determined the nutritional value of oil based on a retention value of after cooking. The exact amount may vary depending on cook time, temperature, ingredient density, the specific type of oil used.
ingredients: large green tomatoes, eggs, milk, all-purpose flour, cornmeal, bread crumbs, coarse kosher salt, ground black pepper, quart vegetable oil
descriptor: Serve these fried green tomatoeoutside with a glasof iced tea one summer night, enjoy the sunset with someone you love. You can also fry up red tomatoe with thirecipe but make sure they are not overripe or they will be mushy.

instructions: Classic peach cobbler ialwaya hit when peacheare at their peak. Thiparticular cobbler haover, five-star ratings, so we're confident you'll be thrilled with the results, too. A warm mixture of sweetened, juicy peacheitopped with a biscuit-like dough, sprinkled in cinnamon sugar. Although it'made from scratch with fresh peaches, thieasy peach cobbler iincredibly simple, cometogether in just one hour. No fresh peaches? See below for tipon using canned or frozen peacheduring the off season. A cobbler — not to be confused with a crisp or crumble — ia deep-dish fruit dessert with a sweetened fruit filling that itopped off with a biscuit-like dough. The dough may cover the entire dish or be dropped by the spoonful, earning it the name "cobbler" for itresemblance to a cobblestone street. It giveyou the same fruit-and-pastry combination apie, but without all the effort. In the case of peach cobbler, fresh, frozen canned peachemay be combined with sugar, spices, lemon juice, cornstarch . Awith all cobblers, it'finished off with a biscuit-like topping, sprinkled with a cinnamon-sugar mixture. Although it'hard to beat a ripe, juicy peach during peak season, canned , frozen peache make a great alternative when fresh inot an option. Reviewersay they had succeswith both canned, frozen peaches:,Picking a perfectly ripe peach can seem tricky, but you can rely on three simple sensory cues: look, touch, smell. A ripe peach will have a golden-hue near the stem, it should give slightly to your grip, it will have a sweet, fragrant smell. If your peachearen't ripe, here'the good news: They will continue to ripen with a little patience. Place unripe peacheon the counter stem-side-down at room temperature until ripe. Most folkchoose to peel their peaches, but you can absolutely leave the skin on. The skin will soften ait bakeand be far lesnoticeable once cooked. If you do choose to peel them you can do so one of two ways:,It just wouldn’t be summer without a homemade peach cobbler, according to culinary developer, test kitchen expert Nicole McLaughlin . Here are a few of her favorite tipand trickfor a perfect cobbler every time:,While it ibest right out of the oven , cobbler will keep covered in the fridge for up to four days. To reheat, microwave to your desired temperature or bake at degreeF for about minutes until warmed through. "Coming from the Peach State, I'm really picky about peach cobbler," sayreviewer AlliePeacock. "Thirecipe ifantastic!","Last summer I also made batcheof the filling, then froze it, had delicioucobbler all winter long," sayreviewer TraviHalling. Editorial contributionby Melanie Fincher, Corey Williams,Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Combine peaches, white sugar, brown sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, lemon juice, cornstarch in a large bowl; tosto coat evenly, pour into a -quart baking dish. Bake in preheated oven for minutes. Meanwhile, combine flour, white sugar, brown sugar, baking powder, salt in a large bowl. Blend in butter with your fingertipor a pastry blender until mixture resemblecoarse meal. Stir in water until just combined. Remove peachefrom oven, drop spoonfulof topping over them. Mix white sugar, cinnamon together in a small bowl; sprinkle over entire cobbler. Bake in the preheated oven until topping igolden, about minutes.
ingredients: fresh peache, pitted into thin wedges, white sugar, brown sugar, ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg, fresh lemon juice, cornstarch, all-purpose flour, white sugar, brown sugar, baking powder, salt, unsalted butter, chilled boiling water, white sugar, ground cinnamon
descriptor: Thipeach cobbler recipe isomething I've perfected over the years. It'loved by all. Use fresh Georgia peaches, of course!

instructions: There'nothing like a freshly baked sweet potato pie to usher in the holiday season. The autumnal dessert just tastelike home, doesn't it? Thitop-rated sweet potato pie recipe, which isubtly spiced with ingredientyou probably already have on hand, habeen beloved by the Allrecipecommunity for decades. Learn how to make, store, freeze, serve the best sweet potato pie of your life with thicommunity favorite recipe. If you have fresh sweet potatoeand a few kitchen staples, you likely have everything you need to make thihomemade sweet potato pie. Sweet potato, pumpkin pieare both autumnal dessertthat are popular during the cooler months, particularly during the holiday season. Pumpkin pie haa milder flavor that'typically flavored with a lot of spices. Sweet potatoeare naturally a bit sweeter, flavorful, so sweet potato pie doesn't usually feature amany spices. Pumpkin pie ialso generally quite dense, while it'sweet potato-based counterpart islightly more airy. It'easier than you think to make a bakery-worthy sweet potato pie. You'll find the full recipe below, but here'a brief overview of what you can expect:,Yes, you can make sweet potato pie ahead of time! It'a great idea if you're prepping for a holiday, want to conserve oven space on the big day. Store sweet potato pie in the fridge, covered tightly in storage wrap or aluminum foil, for three to four days. You should refrigerate the pie asoon ait hacooled to room temperature. You can absolutely freeze sweet potato pie —, you should if you want to get a jump-start on holiday baking. To freeze sweet potato pie, bake it in an aluminum pie plate . Cover the cooled pie in several layerof storage wrap. Top the storage wrap with a layer of aluminum foil. Thaw in the fridge overnight. "Thipie lasted all of about minutein my house," sayCALLMEVAN. "Everybody enjoyed a change from the usual pumpkin pie.","Smellterrific while it'baking, the taste iamazing! We topped ourwith real whipped cream mixed with a little vanilla.","Thiia wonderful recipe," raveGeri. "The first time I followed the directionexactly. It wareally good. The second time I used the blender to mix all of the ingredientand it waeven better.",Editorial contributionby Corey Williams,Place whole sweet potato in pot, cover with water; bring to a boil. Boil until tender when pierced with a fork, to minutes. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Remove sweet potato from the pot, run under cold water. Remove, discard skin. Break sweet potato flesh apart, place in a bowl. Add butter, mix with an electric mixer until well combined. Add sugar, milk, eggs, nutmeg, cinnamon, vanilla; beat on medium speed until mixture ismooth. Pour filling into unbaked pie crust. Bake in the preheated oven until a knife inserted in the center comeout clean, to minutes. Remove from the oven, let cool before serving. Pie will be puffed up like a soufflé when you remove it from the oven, but will deflate ait cools.
ingredients: sweet potato, butter, white sugar, milk, large eggs, ground nutmeg, ground cinnamon, vanilla extract, unbaked pie crust
descriptor: Thisweet potato pie recipe washared with me by a special friend in Atlanta, GA. It halong been a favorite, everyone who tasteit sayit ithe best they've ever had.

instructions: Heat the olive oil over medium heat in a large soup pot; cook, stir the onion in the hot oil until translucent, about minutes. Whisk of vegetable stock, the peanut butter into the onionuntil the mixture ismooth. Beat in remaining vegetable stock, diced tomatoe with their liquid, crushed red pepper flakes; bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium low, cook at a simmer for minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in the cabbage, sweet potato, carrot, turnip; simmer, stirring occasionally, until the vegetableare tender, about more minutes. Stir in the okra, chicken, simmer until the okra itender, about additional minutes.
ingredients: olive oil, onion, vegetable stock, divided, peanut butter, canned diced tomatoes, with juices, crushed red pepper flakes finely chopped cabbagesweet potatocarrotturnipokracooked chicken
descriptor: Thihearty, deliciousoup combinea wonderful variety of vegetablewith peanut butter, a few red pepper flakefor unexpected flavorand just the right amount of kick.

instructions: Preheat oven to degreeF . Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat; add onion, saute until browned, about minutes. Add ground beef to onion, saute until browned, about minutes. Soak bread in milk in a small bowl, mash, add to ground beef mixture; stir in of beaten egg, raisins, vinegar, sugar, turmeric, salt, curry powder, ground black pepper. Transfer beef mixture to glasbaking dish; insert bay leaves. Bake in preheated oven for minutes. Whisk remaining egg, remaining milk together in a small bowl; pour over meat mixture, return to oven for minutes. Serve with chutney. Mutton can be substituted for the ground beef. Lemon juice can be substituted for the vinegar.
ingredients: oil, onion pound ground beef, slice bread, milk, divided, egg, divided, seedlesraisin, white vinegar, white sugar, ground turmeric, salt, curry powder, ground black pepper, bay leaves, chutney
descriptor: A classic South African entree. While not particularly spicy, the dish hacomplex flavorwith the sweetnesof raisincontrasting the curry. Serve with yellow rice.

instructions: Melt butter in a large saucepan or soup pot over medium heat, cook, stir the onion until translucent, about minutes. Pour in the chicken broth, stir in the butternut squash cubesange juice, orange zest. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, simmer until the squash cubeare tender, to minutes. Pour the soup into a blender, filling the pitcher no more than halfway full. Hold down the lid of the blender with a folded kitchen towel, carefully start the blender, using a few quick pulseto get the soup moving before leaving it on to puree. Puree in batcheuntil smooth, pour back into the pot. Alternately, you can use a stick blender, puree the soup right in the cooking pot. Whisk in sour cream until smooth, season with salt, pepper. Heat over medium-low heat until almost simmering, serve hot. The number of servingilargely dependent on the size of your butternut, so it can be a good idea to double the recipe for soup for a group--it'alwaya big hit!,Substitute vegetable stock for chicken broth to make a vegetarian soup.
ingredients: butter, onion, can chicken broth, butternut squash, seeded, cut into -inch cubesange, juicedange, juiced, zested, sour cream, salt, pepper
descriptor: Thiia recipe given to me by my mother before she passed away. Awith anything involving butternut it'a little time intensive but it'well worth it! So creamy, delicious! Garnish with croutonand/or parsley, serve with garlic bread.

instructions: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat; stir in onionand bell peppers. Cook, stir until the onion ha turned translucent, about minutes. Add carrots, tomatoes, green chiles, water, bouillon cube, curry powder, chili powder, salt, pepper. Cook until mixture iwell combined, thickened, to minutes.
