descriptor: Thiia staple food in South Africa awell aother parts.

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Grease a 9-inch square baking dish. Beat sugar, butter, eggwith an electric mixer until smooth, creamy. Mix in pumpkin purée until well combined. Add milk, cake flour, baking powder, mix until smooth. Pour mixture into the prepared baking dish, sprinkle cinnamon over top. Bake in the preheated oven until set in the middle, minuteto hour. You can use margarine instead of butter. If you only have medium eggs, use four.
ingredients: white sugar, unsalted butter, large eggs, pumpkin purée, milk, cake flour, baking powder, pinch ground cinnamon more
descriptor: Thipumpkin soufflé casserole ireminiscent of a sweet pumpkin dish I had in South Africa.

instructions: Preheat oven to degreeF . Grease, flour a 9-inch cake pan. Combine sugar, egg, butter in a large bowl; beat with an electric mixer until creamy. Beat in apricot jam, vinegar, ginger, baking soda. Add milk, flour; beat until batter ismooth. Pour batter into the prepared pan. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comeout clean, about minutes. Combine milk, butter, sugar, water in a saucepan over medium heat minutebefore pudding idone baking. Bring to a boil, stir until smooth. Pour hot sauce over pudding, let it sink into the pudding.
ingredients: white sugar, egg, butter, apricot jam, white vinegar, ground ginger, baking soda, milk, all-purpose flour
descriptor: Thiia unique take on the traditional South African malva pudding. Serve hot with ice cream or whipped cream cold with hot homemade custard.

instructions: Preheat an oven to degreeF . Beat sugar, eggwith an electric mixer in a large bowl until light, fluffy. Stir in the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, vinegar, apricot jam. Pour in of milk, stir until well combined. Spoon the batter into a greased, quart oven-proof baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven for to minutes until a knife inserted into the center comeout clean. Pierce the baked pudding several timewith a skewer or fork. Place sugar, water, milk, butter, vanilla in a saucepan, stir over medium heat. When the mixture cometo a boil remove it from the heat, slowly pour the mixture over the hot pudding. Serve warm.
ingredients: white sugar, eggs, flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, distilled white vinegar, apricot jam, milk
descriptor: A South African favorite! We call it 'Bruinpoeding' in South Africa.

instructions: Preheat oven to degreeF . In a small saucepan over low heat, melt butter or margarine together with vinegar, milk. Remove from heat, set aside. Meanwhile, sift flour, baking soda, salt together into a separate bowl. Beat sugar, eggwith an electric mixer on high speed until fluffy, light colored, about minutes. Gradually mix in the apricot jam. Fold the dry ingredientinto the egg mixture alternately with warmed milk mixture using a spatula. Pour batter into a greased, quart oven-proof baking dish. Bake approximately minutes until a knife inserted into the center comeout clean. Place cream, butter, sugar, water in a saucepan, stir over moderate heat until the butter hamelted, sugar idissolved. Do not allow the mixture to boil. Remove pudding from the oven, pierce several timewith a skewer or fork, pour the hot cream mixture immediately over the pudding. Serve hot or cold.
ingredients: butter, white vinegar, milk, superfine sugar, eggs, apricot jelly, cake flour, baking soda, pinch salt
descriptor: Thirich, South African pudding containno marshmallows, but probably got itname from itspongy texture! Deliciouserved hot or cold with cream.

instructions: Heat oil in a large, heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium-high heat. Dredge lamb in flour; shake off excess. Cook lamb in hot oil until browned all over. Transfer lamb to a plate, reserving drippingin the pan. Cook, stir onion in drippinguntil soft, about minutes. Mix in tomatoes. Return lamb chopto the saucepan; season with bay leaves, bouillon, salt, brown sugar, white peppercorns, black pepper, Worcestershire sauce. Cover, reduce heat, simmer for hour, minutes. Stir occasionally, making sure nothing stickto the bottom of the pan. Stir in potatoes; continue cooking until potatoeare cooked, meat itender, about minutemore.
ingredients: vegetable oil, poundlamb or mutton breast chopsinto portions, cake flour, large onion poundfresh tomatoes white vinegar, bay leaves, cube beef bouillon cube, salt, brown sugar, whole white peppercorns, freshly ground black pepper, dash Worcestershire sauce, medium potatoes, quartered
descriptor: Tomato bredie ia popular South African meal, good winter fare. Bredie ian old Cape name for a dish of meat, vegetablestewed together so that the flavorintermingle. The gravy irich, thick, full-bodied, obtained by using meat with a fair amount of bone, fat, rolling it in flour, browning it before the vegetableare added. The flavor improveif left a day or two before eating. Nice with brown rice.

instructions: Gather all ingredients. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Season fish with salt, fry in the hot skillet until fish ibrowned, flakeeasily with a fork, about minuteper side. Transfer to a plate. Add onionand garlic to the skillet, cook over medium heat until translucent, about minutes. Add chile pepper, bay leaves, peppercorns, allspice berries, then pour in vinegar, water, bring to a boil. Stir in brown sugar until dissolved. Season with curry powder, cumin, coriander, turmeric. Taste, add brown sugar if desired. Arrange layerof fish, pickling mixture in a serving dish. Pour in pickling liquid to cover the top layer. Let cool to room temperature, about minutes. Cover, refrigerate for at least hourbefore serving.
ingredients: vegetable oil, poundcod fillets, cut into to portions, salt, large onions into rings, clove garlic red chile pepper, seeded, large bay leaves, whole black peppercorns, whole allspice berries, red wine vinegar, water, packed brown sugar, curry powder, ground cumin, ground coriander, ground turmeric
descriptor: Thirecipe for pickled fish itraditionally served with hot crosbunor freshly baked bread for Easter in Cape Town, South Africa.

Recipe Name: Old-Time Kentucky Bacon Milk Gravy for Biscuits
instructions: Heat bacon drippingin a skillet over medium heat; whisk flour into drippinguntil smooth. Reduce the heat to low, cook, stirring constantly so it doesn't burn, until roux icaramel brown in colabout minutes. Stir in salt, black pepper. Add milk, at a time, whisking until thoroughly blended after each addition. Bring gravy to a simmer, then whisk constantly until thick, smooth, bubbling.

descriptor: I grew up eating thimilk gravy made with bacon grease. Everyone haheard of sausage gravy, but it doesn't compare to this. After frying your bacon for breakfast, use the bacon drippingto make true Kentucky biscuit gravy. Iit fattening? Oh yeah, you better believe it — but it'worth it! Pour it over biscuitand serve with crispy bacon, scrambled or fried eggs.

instructions: Sprinkle chicken piecewith salt, pepper; place them in a deep-sided baking dish. Whisk buttermilk, hot pepper sauce, cayenne pepper together in a large bowl; pour over chicken, tossing to coat all sides. Place or pieceof chicken at a time into the plastic bag, shake well to coat chicken piecewith seasoned flour. Heat oil in a deep fryer or large saucepan to degreeF . instructions: Remove leavefrom collard, mustard, turnip greens; discard stems. Gently wash leavein warm water to remove all soil, sand. Partially fill a clean sink with warm water; stir in chicken broth, salt. Allow greento soak in chicken broth mixture for minutes. Scoop greeninto a colander, allow to drain; do not rinse. Discard chicken broth mixture down the sink. Pour remaining chicken broth into a large pot; mix in greens. Stir in vegetable oil, bacon bits, sugar, garlic, salt, pepper; bring to a boil. instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Lightly grease a large baking dish. Bring water to a boil in a large saucepan; stir in grits. Reduce the heat, cover, simmer until liquid habeen absorbed, about minutes. Mix in Cheddar cheese, of the butter until melted. Cook sausage in a skillet over medium-high heat until browned, crumbly, to minutes. Drain, add to gritmixture. Whisk eggand milk together in a bowl. Pour into the skillet used to cook the sausage. Lightly scramble eggover medium-low heat, then mix into gritmixture. Pour gritmixture into the prepared baking dish. Dot with remaining butter, sprinkle with remaining Cheddar, season with salt, pepper. Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned, about minutes.

instructions: Whisk together buttermilk, mustard, salt, pepper, cayenne in a bowl. Pour buttermilk marinade into a resealable plastic bag. Add chicken pieces, coat with marinade, squeeze out excesair, seal the bag. Marinate in the refrigerator for to hours. Combine flour, baking powder, garlic powder, onion powder in another resealable plastic bag; shake to mix thoroughly. Working with one piece at a time, transfer marinated chicken to the dry ingredient bag, seal the bag, shake well to coat. After all chicken pieceare coated, repeat the procesby dipping them in buttermilk marinade, shaking in the dry coating again. Then heat oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Place chicken on the pan. Fry chicken in batchein hot oil, turning chicken occasionally, until golden brown, juicerun clear. instructions: Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Season chicken piecewith salt, pepper. Place flour in a shallow dish. Dredge chicken in flour, place in the skillet, brown on all sides. Set chicken aside, drain skillet, reserving about butter. Reduce skillet heat to medium-low, stir in onions, carrots, celery, garlic. Cook until tender, minutes. Stir in flour, cook minutemore. Pour in chicken broth, season with cayenne pepper, remaining salt, pepper. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low. Return chicken to the skillet, cover, continue cooking until chicken juicerun clear, gravy hathickened, about minutes.

descriptor: A favorite smothered chicken recipe. You can't just go to any restaurant, get thicomforting dish like you would if you went down to the urban neighborhoodin Houston. Thimeal of browned chicken in a savory chicken gravy sauce ibest when served over a bed of white rice.

instructions: Gather all ingredients. Inspect three pint-sized jarfor crackand ringfor rust, discarding any defective ones. Immerse in simmering water until brine iready. Wash new, unused lidand ringin warm soapy water. Bring water, vinegar, salt to a rolling boil in a small saucepan. Divide okra evenly between the hot, sterlized jars. Place a dried chile, a of dill into each jar. Pour hot brine over okra, then run a clean knife or thin spatula around the insideof the jarto remove any air bubbles. Wipe the rimwith a moist paper towel to remove any residue. Top with lidand screw ringon tightly. Place a rack in the bottom of a large stockpot, fill halfway with water. Bring to a boil, lower jar incheapart into the boiling water using a holder. Pour in more boiling water to cover jarby at least inch. Bring to a rolling boil, cover, procesfor minutes. Remove the jarfrom the stockpot, let rest, several incheapart, for to hours. Presthe center of each lid with a finger to ensure the lid doenot move up or down. Remove the ringfor storage, store in a cool, dark area.
ingredients: poundfresh okra, dried red chile peppers, dried dill, water, vinegar, salt
descriptor: Grandma Oma alwayused to pickle okra thiway, I still do. Spicy pickled okra ia welcome change on a relish tray. Refrigerate jarafter opening.

instructions: Place cleaned chitterlingin a -quart pot, cover with cold water. Bring to a rolling boil; add onion, season with salt, garlic, red pepper flakes. Simmer until chitterlingare clear to white in color, reach desired tenderness, to hours. Soak chitterlingin cold water throughout the cleaning stage. Each chitterling should be examined, run under cold water, all foreign materialshould be removed, discarded. Chitterlingshould retain some fat, so be careful to leave some on. After each chitterling habeen cleaned, soak in two cold water bathfor a few minutes. The second water bath should be clearer. If not, soak in one more bath. Be sure to wash any surfacewith a bleach-based sanitizer, your handthoroughly with soap to avoid contamination while handling raw chitterlings.
ingredients: poundfrozen chitterlings, cleaned, onion, roughly chopped, salt, garlic, crushed red pepper flakes
descriptor: Chitterlings, made from pigs' intestines, are a favorite among Southern families. Traditionally, they are prepared during the holiday season, but deep freezing makethem available year-round. Deliciouserved with spaghetti or turnip greens. Be certain to pasthe vinegar, hot sauce!

instructions: Place oxtails, onion, garlic, Greek seasoning, salt, pepper, seasoning salt in a large stockpot. Fill with enough water to cover oxtailand place over high heat. Bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat to medium. Cook oxtailuntil tender, to hours. Remove from heat, reserve broth. Warm bacon drippingor shortening in a skillet over medium heat. Add flour; cook, stir for minutes. Stir in reserved broth, browning sauce. Season with salt, pepper, garlic powder. Cook, stirring constantly, until gravy thickens. Place oxtailin the skillet; stir to coat with gravy. Cook, stirring occasionally, over medium-low heat until warmed through, about minutes. The salt content shown in the nutrition information reflectthe large amount of salt added to the cooking liquid, most of which idiscarded.

descriptor: Thioxtail recipe wamy mom's, it'a soul food blast from the past. I adjust spiceto my taste . You can double the gravy if you like. My family lovethidish served with rice.

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Sprinkle of the chopped onionand of the chopped garlic into the bottom of a roasting pan; pour in water, vinegar. Season neck bonewith salt, pepper, place in the roasting pan. Sprinkle remaining onionand garlic over top, cover the roasting pan tightly with aluminum foil. Bake in the preheated oven for hours, basting every minuteand recovering with the foil every time you baste. Remove the foil, continue cooking until neck boneare golden brown, about more minutes.
ingredients: onions, roughly chopped, clove garlic, roughly chopped, water, distilled white vinegar, poundpork neck bones, salt, ground black pepper
descriptor: Pork neck boneare great with greenor cabbage. They can be baked or boiled, thirecipe can be fixed either way. It dependupon how much attention you want to give the dish. I think thiione of those mealthat takeyou back to your mother'kitchen.

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Arrange okra in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil; sprinkle with kosher salt, pepper. Roast in the preheated oven until okra ilightly browned, tender, to minutes.
ingredients: fresh okra podinch thick, olive oil, kosher salt, black pepper
descriptor: Thiroasted okra recipe iso simple, easy. Stewed okra igreat, but we like to roast ourfrom time to time for a little variety. Okra tendto be lesgummy or slimy when roasted. A good Southern gardener needokra recipes. In season, I find myself bringing in okra by the armload nearly every other day. Chopped tomato makea great addition when we have some handy.

instructions:
In need of a little Southern comfort? You're in luck! This fried okra recipe, wonderfully crispy and never slimy, is just the ticket. You can fry okra at home with just a few ingredients you may already have on hand. If not, here's what to add to your grocery list:,Okra
You'll need 10 okra pods sliced into ¼-inch pieces. Buy smooth, bright green pods that feel firm, but not hard. Egg
A beaten egg keeps the okra moist and gives the cornmeal something to stick to during the frying process. Cornmeal
Cornmeal is to thank for this fried okra's pleasant crunch. Seasonings
This fried okra is simply seasoned with salt and pepper. For a hint of heat, add a pinch (or two) of cayenne pepper. Oil
Vegetable oil has a high smoke point, so it's perfect for frying okra to crispy perfection. Restaurant-worthy fried okra is within reach — you just need to follow a series of simple steps. You'll find the full recipe below, but here's a brief overview of what you can expect:,Soak the okra in a beaten egg. Meanwhile, combine the cornmeal and seasonings in a small bowl. Dredge the egg-soaked okra in cornmeal, coating completely. Heat the oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Place the dredged okra in the oil, stirring continuously, and reduce the heat when it starts to brown. Cook until golden and drain on paper towels. Store fried okra in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to five days. Reheat in the oven for the crispiest results. It's best to freeze fried okra before frying. Just dredge the egg-soaked okra in cornmeal and arrange it in a single layer on a baking sheet. Flash freeze until frozen solid, then transfer to a zip-top freezer bag. Wrap the bag in a layer of aluminum foil for extra protection against freezer burn. When you're ready to cook, simply fry the okra from frozen. "I don't live down South anymore, but this recipe brings back the memories of my grandmother's fried okra," raves ROOKIE COOKIE. "Quick and delicious," according to Joy. "It's a go-to recipe when okra from the garden is picked. Light batter lets the flavor of the okra shine through.","Perfect," says hmmrav10. "I will only use this recipe for my okra. Also it works so well on fried green beans! Light and just enough crunch. Editorial contributions by Corey Williams,In a small bowl, soak okra in egg for 5 to 10 minutes. In a medium bowl, combine cornmeal, salt, and pepper. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Dredge okra in the cornmeal mixture, coating evenly. Carefully place okra in hot oil; stir continuously. Reduce heat to medium when okra first starts to brown, and cook until golden. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot and enjoy!
ingredients: podokra in inch pieces, egg, cornmeal, salt, ground black pepper, vegetable oil
descriptor: Fresh okra podare sliced, coated in seasoned cornmeal, then fried until golden, crispy in thisimple Southern classic! Add a pinch of ground cayenne pepper to the cornmeal for a touch of heat, if you like.

instructions: Warm milk in a small saucepan over medium heat until it bubbles, then remove from heat. Let cool until lukewarm. Stir together warm water, yeast in a large bowl. Let stand until yeast softenand beginto form a creamy foam, about minutes. Stir lukewarm milk, sugar, beaten eggs, salt, cardamom into yeast mixture. Beat in flour until combined. Add flour, beat until dough ismooth, elastic. Add melted butter; beat until glossy. Mix in remaining flour until dough istiff. Transfer dough to a floured surface, cover with an inverted mixing bowl, let rest for minutes. Knead dough until smooth, satiny, then place in a lightly greased mixing bowl, turn dough to coat. Cover with a dish towel; let rise in a warm place until doubled, about hour. Punch down dough; let rise again until almost doubled, about hour. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Grease baking sheets. Turn dough out again onto a floured surface, divide into equal pieces. Divide each piece into thirds. Roll each piece into a - to -inch strip. Braid stripinto a loaf to get large, braided loaves. Lift loaveonto the prepared baking sheets. Cover with a dish towel, let rise for minutes. Beat together egg, water in a small bowl. Brush over loaveand sprinkle with sugar. Bake in the preheated oven until the top igolden brown, to minutes. Check occasionally because the bottomof loavecan burn quickly.
ingredients: milk, warm water,package active dry yeast, white sugar, large eggs, salt, ground cardamom, all-purpose flour, butter, large egg, water, white sugar
descriptor: Finnish pulla ia unique bread with a sweet flavor that makea wonderful holiday gift. It takeabout four hourto make, so allow yourself plenty of time.

instructions:
This Danish kringle recipe features a flaky pastry crust braided around a sweet, creamy filling. Believe it or not, this impressive Danish kringle recipe is easy to make with basic ingredients you likely already have on hand. Here's what you'll need:,You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here's a brief overview of what you can expect when you make this traditional Danish kringle:,1. Make the pastry: Cut butter into sifted flour. Stir in sour cream, then cover the dough and chill it overnight.
2. Make the filling: Mix softened butter, brown sugar, and some of the walnuts in a bowl. Set aside.
3. Assemble the kringle: Assemble, fill, and braid the kringle according to the detailed instructions in the recipe.
4. Bake the kringle: Place on a prepared baking sheet and bake until golden brown. Mix the confectioners' sugar and water, then drizzle the glaze over the cooled kringle. To make the pastry crust by hand: Sift flour into a large bowl. Cut in cold butter with 2 knives or a pastry blender until mixture is crumbly. Stir in sour cream and mix well to form a sticky dough. Cover dough tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 8 hours to overnight. Store your homemade Danish kringle in an airtight container at room temperature for up to five days. Yes, you can freeze a kringle (before you ice it). Simply wrap it in at least two layers of storage wrap and at least one layer of aluminum foil. Freeze for up to three months. Thaw in the refrigerator overnight. Add the icing after it is totally thawed. "What a good recipe (and so easy) for any time of year," raves Allrecipes Allstar Jan Mowbray. "Made the dough last night; shaped and baked it this morning. I used cherry pie filling instead of the mixture posted — delicious.","I made this recipe for Christmas Eve and dessert on Christmas Day — family and friends took slices home for the next day's breakfast," says Grace Hill. "Just fabulous and easy.","Super delicious," according to MSelvidio. "After trying a few fillings, I've decided that I like fruit preserves the best. Putting a bit of vanilla extract into the glaze also gives it extra flavor.",Editorial contributions by Corey Williams,To make the pastry: Place flour and salt in a food processor and pulse to combine. Add butter and pulse until pieces are pea-sized. Add sour cream and pulse to form a sticky dough. Cover dough tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 8 hours, or overnight. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper. To make the filling: Place egg yolk in a medium bowl; set egg white aside for egg wash. Add cream cheese, brown sugar, and cinnamon; beat with an electric mixer until smooth. Stir in 1 cup toasted walnuts until well combined. Divide chilled dough in half. Roll each piece of dough into a 10x12-inch rectangle on a lightly floured surface. Working from a short side, spoon 1/2 of the filling along the center four inches of each rectangle. On both sides of the filling, cut the unfilled pastry into eight horizontal strips. Working top to bottom, fold each strip over the filling, alternating sides. Press to seal ends and tuck under; arrange braids on the prepared baking sheet. Beat egg white and 1 tablespoon water together until smooth; brush evenly over each braid. Bake kringles in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 30 to 35 minutes. Cool on the baking sheet for 30 minutes. While pastries are cooling, make glaze: Mix together confectioners' sugar and 2 tablespoons water in a small bowl until smooth and thin enough to drizzle. Spoon or drizzle glaze over cooled pastries; sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup of walnuts. This recipe was tested in our test kitchen in June 2023, and was updated to make two 10-inch long braids (the original recipe made three). We also replaced the butter in the filling with cream cheese to prevent it oozing out as much.
ingredients: all-purpose flour, plumore aneeded, salt, cold butter, cubed, sour cream
descriptor: A Danish kringle ia holiday pastry that ibeautiful, delicious. Thirecipe ifrom my father-in-law'mother, who waborn, raised in Denmark. It looklike a complicated braid but isimply created by crisscrossing stripof dough. You can make the dough at least to dayin advance — it'easy to make, doesn't require yeast.

instructions: Preheat, lightly grease a large skillet or electric griddle. Mix flour, salt, baking soda together in a bowl. Add egg, buttermilk, butter; stir together lightly, but keep it lumpy. The batter should look thick, spongy, puffy. Drop of the batter onto the cooking surface, spreading lightly with the bottom of the . Cook until lightly browned on each side, to minuteper side.
ingredients: flour, salt, baking soda, large egg, buttermilk, butter,
descriptor: These buttermilk pancakeare passed down from my grandmother, who wafully Scandinavian. They are light, fluffy, great with berry syrups. I have made these for yearaa special treat, I hope you enjoy them amuch amy family has.

instructions:
If you've never made krumkake at home, this is your year. This krumkake recipe results in delicious, elegant, and crowd-pleasing cookies every time. Krumkake, which means "curved cake," is a Norwegian waffle cookie that's shaped like a cone. The cookies are traditionally made using a decorative griddle with flour, sugar, eggs, butter, and milk or cream. Norwegian immigrants popularized krumkaker (plural) in New England and the American Midwest. They're often served during the holiday season. You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here's a brief overview of what you can expect when you make krumkake at home:,1. Make the batter: Beat the butter and sugar, then gradually add the eggs. Add the remaining ingredients and blend until smooth.
2. Make the krumkake: Spoon the batter onto a greased krumkake iron. Cook until golden brown, then flip and finish cooking.
3. Roll the krumkake: Roll each krumkake around the handle of a wooden spoon to form a cone. Tip: You may need to experiment with the amount of batter and baking time depending on the iron. You can also use an electric krumkake or pizzelle iron. Serve the krumkake as-is or fill each krumkaker with homemade whipped cream. You can also dip the end of each krumkaker in chocolate for an extra touch of decadence. Store the cooled krumkake in an airtight container at room temperature for up to one week. If you plan to fill the krumkake with whipped cream, do that just before serving. "Great cookie," according to What's for dinner, mom?. "Rolled nicely into cones. I dipped the tops in melted chocolate and then filled with stabilized, sweetened whipped cream and mini chocolate chips.","I doubled the recipe and added 1 teaspoon ground cardamom (no butter flavor added)," says jaythomas62. "We love it. Making it again today for the third week in a row.","Wow," raves Sally. "These were DELICIOUS! My hubby and the kids devoured them. I do not have a Krumkake iron so I used my pizzelle iron.",Editorial contributions by Corey Williams,Beat sugar and butter in a large bowl until combined; add eggs, one at a time, mixing well. Add flour, milk, vanilla, and butter flavoring; blend into the batter until smooth. Heat krumkake iron over a medium burner; lightly grease both sides of the iron with butter or cooking spray. Spoon about one tablespoon of batter onto the center of the preheated iron; close gently until just pressing together. Cook until golden brown on one side, about 30 seconds, then flip and cook on the other side. Remove krumkake from the iron and quickly roll up around the handle of a wooden spoon to form a cone. Repeat with the remaining batter. Cool krumkake completely on a wire rack before storing in an airtight container. Other flavorings can be added in addition to or instead of vanilla. You may need to experiment with the amount of batter and baking time depending on the iron. You can also use an electric krumkake or pizzelle iron.
ingredients: white sugar, unsalted butter, large eggs, all-purpose flour, milk, vanilla extract, butter flavoring
descriptor: Krumkake ia Norwegian crispy wafer-like cookie that'rolled into a cone. Pipe them with whipped cream or dip them in melted chocolate for a delicioutreat. You can even use thirecipe to make your own ice cream cones!

instructions: Gather all ingredients. Beat together eggs, sugar, salt in a large bowl. Add flour, milk, vanilla extract; beat until smooth. Heat oil in a large, deep skillet to degreeF . Place a wire rack over paper towels. Heat the rosette iron in hot oil for minutes. Lift the iron, let excesoil drain. Dip the iron in batter to inch from the top of the iron, then dip the iron immediately into hot oil. Fry rosette in hot oil until golden, about seconds. Lift the iron out; tip upside down to drain. Use a fork to push rosette off the iron onto the prepared wire rack. Reheat the iron in hot oil for minute; cook remaining batter. Sprinkle rosettewith confectioners' sugar. Enjoy!,We have determined the nutritional value of oil based on a retention value of after cooking. The exact amount will vary depending on cooking time, temperature, ingredient density, the specific type of oil used.
ingredients: large eggs, white sugar, salt, sifted all-purpose flour, milk, vanilla extract, vegetable oil, confectioners' sugar
descriptor: Cook rosetteon a rosette iron, then sprinkle with sugar.

instructions: Beat egg whitein a clean glasor metal bowl with an electric mixer on high speed until stiff peakform. Set aside. Mix together buttermilk, flour, egg yolks, butter, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt in a large bowl; beat until smooth. Gently fold in egg whites. Heat an aebleskiver pan over medium heat. Put about vegetable oil in the bottom of each . Pour about batter into each prepared . Asoon abubbleappear around the edges, turn them quickly. Continue cooking, turning the ball to keep it from burning.
ingredients: large egg whites, buttermilk, all-purpose flour, large egg yolks, butter, white sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt, vegetable oil
descriptor: Aebleskiver ia Danish dessert, like doughnut holes, but sweeter, much better. It'traditionally served with glogg during the Advent, cooked in a cast iron pan that resemblean egg poacher. Serve hot with syrup, jam powdered sugar.

instructions:
This warm and cozy glögg recipe will warm you up from the inside out. If you've never celebrated the holiday season with Swedish glögg, it's time to remedy that ASAP!,Glögg is Swedish infused wine. Usually served during the holiday season, it's similar to mulled wine — but it's not quite the same thing (glögg is a bit more involved). Traditionally, the drink is set on fire so the sugar granules completely dissolve. These are the ingredients you'll need to make this traditional Swedish glögg recipe:,· Alcohol: This big batch Swedish glögg recipe is quite boozy. It calls for a combination of port wine (don't throw away the bottles!), bourbon whiskey, and white rum.
· Spices: The glögg gets its warm and cozy flavor from cloves, a cinnamon stick, and cardamom pods. A strip of orange peel lends fruity flavor.
· Sugar: Sweeten things up with ¾ cup white sugar.
· Raisins and almonds: Raisins and almonds lend subtle, yet welcome, flavor. Tip: Use an ordinary port wine for this recipe, because the strong-flavored spices and other ingredients will overwhelm an expensive wine. Making Swedish glögg for the first time can be intimidating, but it's actually not that hard (you just need a great recipe). You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here's a brief overview of what you can expect:,1. Heat the port wine. Add bourbon and rum, making sure the alcohol is warm but not simmering.
2. Secure the spices and orange peel strip in a cheesecloth square tied with twine.
3. Carefully light the alcohol with a long-handled match and let burn for one minute.
4. Place the lid on the pot to extinguish the flames. Let cool for 10 minutes.
5. Add the bundled spices and let cool to room temperature.
6. Strain and serve, garnishing with the reserved raisins and almonds. Pour strained glögg into the reserved port wine bottles, replace the caps, and keep upright in a cool dark place for up to a year. You can also refrigerate the steeped raisins and almonds in a covered bowl or jar for up to a year. "Just like what my grandfather used to make," says Write from the Heart. "Warms the heart and the blue flames make a spectacular show that will break the ice at even the stiffest of gatherings. Sometimes I use rum instead of whiskey. Can adapt this to be non-alcoholic: one liter apple juice, one liter cranberry juice, one lemon sliced.","I grew up in Sweden and still have family there and visit on a regular basis," according to mitoboru. "I have had and made my fair share of glögg, including my grandmother's recipe. This is by far the best one to date.","Growing up with a Swedish family, this was a staple of Christmas," says Erinammo. "The smell is so sweet and wonderful. This is exactly how my father makes it. Be prepared though for the kick and don't expect to drink too much!",Editorial contributions by Corey Williams,Heat port wine in a large stockpot with a lid over medium heat until just below the simmering point. Add bourbon and rum; heat until just below simmering. Save the bottles and their caps for storing leftover glögg. Meanwhile, place cinnamon stick, orange peel, cloves, and cardamom pods in the center of the cheesecloth square. Gather edges of the cheesecloth and tie with kitchen twine to secure; set aside. When wine mixture is very hot but not boiling, carefully light it with a long-handled match. Wearing a heatproof cooking mitt, carefully pour sugar into the flames; let mixture burn for 1 minute. Place the lid on the stockpot to extinguish the flames and turn off the heat. Let mixture cool, covered, about 10 minutes. Add the cheesecloth spice bundle, raisins, and almonds to warm wine mixture; let it cool to room temperature, about 1 hour. Strain cooled glögg and reserve the raisins and almonds. To serve: Pour glögg into a saucepan and warm over medium-low heat until hot but not simmering, about 5 minutes. Ladle 3 ounces of warmed glögg into a small coffee cup or a small Swedish-style glögg mug, and garnish each serving with a few reserved raisins and almonds. Use an ordinary port wine for this recipe, because the strong-flavored spices and other ingredients will overwhelm an expensive wine. Pour strained glögg into the reserved bottles, recap, and keep upright in a cool dark place for up to 1 year. Refrigerate the steeped raisins and almonds in a covered bowl or jar for up to 1 year.
ingredients: bottleport wine, bottle proof bourbon whiskey, bottle white rum, cinnamon stick, strip of orange peel, whole cloves, whole cardamom pods, cracked, square of cheesecloth, white sugarpackage dark raisinspackage blanched slivered almonds
descriptor: Glögg ia Swedish punch made from spiced wine. My grandfather brought thirecipe over from Sweden in 9. We still use it today. "God Jul!"

instructions: Gather all ingredients. Place potatoein a large pot, cover with water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, simmer until tender, about minutes; drain. Run hot potatoethrough a potato ricer into a large bowl. Beat butter, cream, salt, sugar into riced potatoes. Let cool to room temperature. Stir flour into potato mixture to form a soft dough. Pull off pieceof dough, form into walnut-sized balls. Lightly flour a clean cloth, roll out lefse ballto /-inch thick. Heat a griddle over high heat. Cook lefse on the hot griddle until brown blisterform, about minute per side. Place cooked lefse on a damp towel to cool slightly. Repeat with remaining dough, stacking them on top of each other athey're cooked; cover until ready to serve.
ingredients: potatoes, butter, heavy cream, salt, white sugar, all-purpose flour
descriptor: I waraised on lefse aa special treat for the holidays. We still make it every holiday season, thiithe best recipe ever. We eat ourwith butter, sugar. Note: you will need a potato ricer to prepare thirecipe.

instructions: Beat eggin a bowl with an electric mixer until thick, lemon-colored, to minutes. Stir in milk. Sift together flour, sugar, salt in a separate bowl. Add to egg mixture; mix until batter ismooth. Grease a griddle with butter; heat over medium heat. Drop fulof batter on the griddle; spread to make thin pancakes. Cook until light brown on bottom, to minutes. Flip, continue cooking until second side ilight brown, to minutemore. Repeat with remaining batter. Make sure to use real butter, not margarine.
ingredients: eggs, milk, all-purpose flour, white sugar, salt, butter
descriptor: ThiSwedish pancakerecipe wataught to my father by himother, who waborn in Sweden. My father then passed thiauthentic recipe to me. Kidlove them, there are never any leftoverwhen I make them. Spoon melted butter over the pancakeand sprinkle with sugar or serve with lingonberry sauce. The pancakecan be made into larger cakes; however, the yield will be smaller. You can also use the batter to make crepes.

instructions: Shake flour with salt in a large, resealable plastic bag until combined; add beef, shake to coat. Melt butter in a skillet over medium-high heat. Brown beef in the hot butter, about minuteper side. Stir mushrooms, onion, garlic into beef; cook, stir until garlic ifragrant, to minutes. Transfer beef, vegetableto a bowl, leaving drippingin skillet. Melt more butter in skillet over medium heat. Cook, stir flour in the hot butter until smooth; stir tomato paste into flour mixture. Whisk beef stock into mixture, cook, stirring constantly, until sauce ithickened, bubbling, about minutes. Return beef, vegetableto skillet, stir to coat with sauce. Reduce heat to very low, simmer until beef itender, to hours. The longer it cooks, the more tender the meat will be. Just before serving, stir sour cream, white wine into beef mixture, heat through. Do not boil.
ingredients: all-purpose flour, salt, poundbeef sirloin, butter, mushroomsonion, clove garlic, butter, all-purpose flour, tomato paste, chilled beef stock, sour cream, dry white wine
descriptor: Thiia deliciouStroganoff that my Nana made all the time. My husband'favorite meal iStroganoff, before we met he never had homemade Stroganoff sauce. Once my mom made thifor him, he hanever eaten any other! Serve over rice or egg noodles.

instructions: Place milk in a or small bowl. Stir in sugar, sprinkle yeast over the top. Set aside until foamy, about minutes. Pour the remaining milk into a large bowl. Add the melted butter, egg, salt, of flour to the large bowl with the milk. Stir in the yeast mixture. Mix in flour at a time until dough pullaway from the sideof the bowl, doesn't stick to your hands. Cover the bowl loosely, set in a warm place to rise for about hour. Dough should almost triple in size. While you wait for the dough to rise, melt the remaining butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add cabbage, cook, stirring frequently, until cabbage hawilted. Mix in the eggand season with salt, pepper. Continue to cook, stirring occasionally until cabbage itender. Set thiaside for the filling. Place the risen dough onto a floured surface, gently form into a long snake about inchewide. Cut into inch pieceand roll each piece into a ball. Flatten the ballby hand until they are to incheacross. Place a spoonful of the cabbage filling in the center, fold in half to enclose. Pinch the edgetogether to seal in the filling. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Line one or two baking sheetwith aluminum foil. Place the pirozhki onto the baking sheet, leaving room between them for them to grow. Bake for minutein the preheated oven until golden brown.
ingredients: milk, warmed, white sugar, active dry yeast, butter, egg, salt, all-purpose flour, butter, medium head cabbage, hard-cooked eggs salt, pepper
descriptor: I'm Russian, thirecipe habeen handed down from my grandma. They taste delicious, are a great comfort food .

instructions: Place ingredientinto the bread machine in order suggested by the manufacturer. Use the whole wheat, regular crust setting. After the baking cycle ends, remove bread from pan, place on a cake rack, allow to cool for hour before slicing. To make thirecipe in a stand mixer, combine all of the ingredientexcept the softened butter in the mixing bowl. Mix on low speed using the dough hook, scraping the dough down occasionally, for minutes. Add the softened butter, mix for an additional minutes. Transfer the dough to a greased bowl, cover it with plastic wrap, a kitchen towel, allow it to rise until doubled, about hour. Grease two 9x-inch loaf pans. Deflate the dough, turn it out onto a lightly floured surface. Divide the dough in half. Flatten the dough pieceinto rectangles, pressing down with your handto pop any air bubbles. Fold the dough into thirds, rolling it slightly under your palmto form a loaf, pinch the seam to seal. Place the loaveinto the loaf pans, seam-side down, cover with a floured kitchen towel, allow it to rise again until doubled, about minutes. Bake the loavein a preheated degree oven until the crust idark, the bottom of the loaf soundhollow when tapped, to minutes. Remove the bread from the pan, cool on a wire rack.
ingredients: water, cider vinegar, bread flour, rye flour, salt, margarine, dark corn syrup, brown sugar, unsweetened cocoa powder, instant coffee granules, caraway seed, fennel seed, active dry yeast
descriptor: I have been looking for a good Russian Black Bread recipe. Thione ithe closest I have come. The vinegar adda bit of a bite, but believe me, with cheese it imarvelous.

instructions: Combine butter, pepper, garlic powder. On a x inch piece of aluminum foil, spread mixture to about x inches. Place thimixture in the coldest section of your freezer, freeze until firm. Thican be done ahead of time. Remove all fat from the chicken breast. If using whole chicken breasts, cut them in half. Place each chicken breast half between pieceof waxed paper, using a mallet, pound carefully to about inch thicknesor less. When butter mixture ifirm, remove from freezer, cut into equal pieces. Place one piece of butter on each chicken breast. Fold in edgeof chicken, then roll to encase the butter completely. Secure the chicken roll with small skeweror toothpicks. In a mixing bowl, beat eggwith water until fluffy. In a separate bowl, mix together black pepper, garlic powder, dill weed, flour. Coat the chicken well with the seasoned flour. Dip the floured chicken in the egg mixture, then roll in the bread crumbs. Place coated chicken on a shallow tray, chill in refrigerator for minutes. In a medium size deep frying pan, heat vegetable oil to medium-high. Fry chicken for about minutethen turn over, fry for minutelonger or until the chicken igolden brown. To test for doneness, cut into one of the rolled chicken breastto make sure it doesn't have a pink interior. Serve immediately, garnished with a sliced lemon twist, a sprinkling or parsley. We have determined the nutritional value of oil based on a retention value of after cooking. The exact amount may vary depending on cook time, temperature, ingredient density, the specific type of oil used.
ingredients: butter, ground black pepper, garlic powder, boneless chicken breast halves, eggs, water, ground black pepper, garlic powder, dried dill weed, all-purpose flour, dry bread crumbs, vegetable oil, lemon chopped fresh parsley
descriptor: Thifantastic Russian Chicken Kiev recipe habeen my family favorite for the past years. It ireasonably easy to prepare, iworth the time.

instructions: Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Mix in leekand carrots, cook minutes. Pour in broth. Season with dill, salt, pepper, bay leaf. Mix in potatoes, cover, cook minutes until potatoeare tender but firm. Remove, discard the bay leaf. Melt the remaining butter in a skillet over medium heat, saute the mushroom minutes, until lightly browned. Stir into the soup. In a small bowl, mix the half-and-half, flour until smooth. Stir into the soup to thicken. Garnish each bowl of soup with fresh dill to serve.
ingredients: butter, divided, leeks large carrot chicken broth, dried dill weed, salt, ground black pepper, bay leaf, potatoes, pound fresh mushroom half-and-half, all-purpose flour, sprig fresh dill weed
descriptor: I make thisoup every Halloween, ithe 'signal' to the family that the cool weather haarrived. I've been making it for yearnow, out of all the soupI make, it istill everyone'favorite. Enjoy!

instructions: To make the filling: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook, stir ground beef in the hot skillet until browned, crumbly, to minutes; drain. Stir in onion; cook, stir until onion hasoftened. Season with salt, pepper, dill weed. Allow to cool before using. Meanwhile, to make the dough: Dissolve yeast in warm water, place in a warm location until frothy, about to minutes. Warm milk in a medium saucepan over low heat; gently whisk in eggs, oil, sugar, salt. Remove from heat. Place of the flour in a large mixing bowl, gradually stir in the milk mixture. Add yeast solution alternately with remaining flour, stirring after each addition; mix well. Knead until the dough forma ball, doenot stick to the bowl. . Cover the bowl with a clean cloth. Set in a warm location, allow to rise until doubled in volume, about to minutes. Remove dough from bowl, place on a lightly floured surface. Pinch off pieceapproximately the size of golf balls. Roll the pieceinto diskabout to inchein diameter. Fill the center of each disk with a heaping of cooled beef mixture. Fold diskover the mixture, firmly pinch the edgeto seal. Arrange on a flat surface, allow to sit for approximately minutes. Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to degreeF . Lower piroshki carefully into the hot oil in batches. Fry until golden brown on one side, about to minutes; gently turn, fry the other side. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain. Repeat with remaining piroshki. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Brush piroshki with egg wash all over, bake in preheated oven until golden brown, about minutes. We have determined the nutritional value of oil based on a retention value of after cooking. The exact amount may vary depending on cook time, temperature, ingredient density, the specific type of oil used.
ingredients: poundground beef, onion, salt, ground black pepper, dried dill weed
descriptor: These pirozhki have a beef, onion, dill filling, are delicious. You could also add a little cheese to the filling if you like. They can also be baked. I received thirecipe from my Russian language teacher in high school, have been making them ever since. The kidlike them too! They take a little time to roll out — but then doesn't anything authentic take a little time?

instructions: Beat together milk, eggin a large bowl until combined. Beat in sugar, salt. Mix in baking soda, citric acid until incorporated. Blend in flour, a little at a time, until combined. Beat in oil. Pour in boiling water, stirring constantly, until batter ithin, watery. Let rest for about minutes. Melt butter in a small frying pan over medium-high heat. Pick the pan up off the heat. Pour in a ladleful of batter while you rotate your wrist, tilting the pan, so batter forma circle, coatthe bottom. The blini should be very thin. Return the pan to the heat. Cook blini for seconds. Carefully lift up edge of blini to see if it'fully cooked: edgewill be golden, bottom surface should have brown spots. Flip blini over, cook for minute more. Transfer blini to a plate lined with a clean kitchen towel. Continue cooking remaining batter, adding butter to the pan for every blinis. Stack bliniand cover with another kitchen towel to keep warm. Spread desired filling in the center of each blini. Fold timeto make a triangle shape or fold up all sides, like a small burrito. You can fill the bliniwith berries, chocolate sauce, cooked ground meat mashed potatoewith onion.
ingredients: milk, large eggs, white sugar, salt, baking soda, citric acid powder, all-purpose flour, vegetable oil, boiling water, butter, divided
descriptor: Thiblinchiki or blini recipe ia popular Russian dish widely consumed during the Maslenitsa festival. All kindof sweet, savory fillingare possible. Don't worry if the first few don't turn out right; you'll get the hang of it.

instructions: Cook beef shank in a large soup pot over high heat until browned, about minuteper side. Add water, onion, carrots, celery, bay leaf; bring to a simmer, cook until meat itender, falling off the bone, about hours. Strain broth, discard solids. Combine beef broth, beets, cabbage in the same pot; cook, stirring occasionally, until beetare tender, about minutes. Reduce heat to low; add vinegar, salt, black pepper. Serve soup in bowlgarnished with sour cream, dill. The nutrition data for thirecipe includethe full amount of beef broth ingredients, even though only the broth iused.
ingredients: slice bone-in beef shank quartwater onionchopped carrot chopped celery bay leaf diced peeled beet chopped cabbage white vinegar salt, ground black pepper sour cream chopped fresh dill
descriptor: Thibeef borscht started my lifelong love of adding sour cream to things. The way the tangy, rich cream meltinto the hot, beefy broth ia wonder to behold.

instructions: Make dough: Combine egg, oil, salt in a liquid measuring ; add enough warm water to fill to . Pour into a large bowl, knead in flour until smooth, elastic. Cover with a dish towel, let dough rest for minutes. Meanwhile, make filling: Combine ground beef, onion, water, salt, pepper in a medium bowl; mix thoroughly by hand or using a fork. Set aside. Dust a baking sheet lightly with flour; set aside. Roll out a portion of dough very thinly on a lightly floured surface; keep remaining dough covered with a dish towel to avoid drying out. Cut out /-inch roundwith a cookie cutter. Place about filling on one side of each dough circle. Fold dough over, seal the edgeusing your fingers, forming a crescent. Join the endand pinch them together. Place on the prepared baking sheet. Repeat with remaining dough, filling. Freeze pelmeni for minuteto prevent them from sticking together. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a simmer. Working in batches, cook frozen pelmeni in simmering water until meat icooked through, pelmeni float to the top, about minutes. Continue cooking for more minutes. Transfer to serving plateusing a slotted spoon. You can use a mixture of ground pork, ground beef. You can also use ground turkey. You can make the meat filling by processing the filling ingredientthrough a meat grinder. Only use a blender or food processor if you have a special setting for meat. If you're not a fan of raw onion, you can sauté the onion in butter over medium heat for to minutebefore using it in the filling. You can make the dough in a Kitchen Aid; mix until the dough beginto form a ball. In Russia, people often use a pelmeni mold to form dumplings. To use one, roll out a portion of the dough very thinly on a lightly floured surface. You should end up with a circle slightly bigger than the mold. Place onto the mold, floured-side down. Place about filling into each cell. Cover with another thinly rolled dough circle, sprinkle with flour. Roll a rolling pin over the top until pelmeni start popping out from the mold. Gather remaining dough, add a little bit of new dough to it. Roll out again, repeating the proceswith remaining dough, filling. To fry pelmeni: Melt butter or bacon grease in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Sauté frozen pelmeni in hot butter until soft, meat icooked through, just like a pierogi.
ingredients: large egg, vegetable oil, salt, warm water more aneeded, all-purpose flour, all-purpose flour
descriptor: Pelmeni are Russian meat-filled dumplings. Making them ia favorite family pastime during the long winter months. These dumplingare a common convenience food. Large batchecan be frozen, quickly boiled or fried on demand. We usually double thirecipe in our house, fold about pieces. Pelmeni are usually served with sour cream or vinegar.

instructions: Place cabbage in a stockpot; pour over enough water to cover. Add salt; bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Turn cabbage every to minutes; transfer any leavethat separate from cabbage into a strainer to drain, cool. Continue to boil until all the leavehave cooked, about minutes. Reserve of cabbage cooking water. Cut out the tough, thick center ribof any large cabbage leavewith a sharp knife. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Mix ground beef, ground pork, cooked rice, eggs, onion, fresh parsley, garlic powder, salt, pepper in a large bowl until combined. Lay cabbage leaf on a flat surface; place heaping of filling at the base of a cabbage leaf. Overlap with the bottom of the leaf; fold in side edgeand roll up. Repeat with remaining large cabbage leaveand filling. Cut any leftover cabbage leaveinto pieceand place in the bottom of a roasting pan. Layer stuffed cabbage rollon top. Combine tomato sauce, reserved cabbage water, white vinegar, white sugar in a bowl; pour mixture over cabbage rolls. Cover roasting pan with aluminum foil. Bake in the preheated oven until filling icooked through, sauce hathickened, about hours. Baste stuffed cabbage rollevery hour. I use Uncle Ben'Ready Rice, which idone in secondin the microwave, to cut down on prep time. Leftoverfreeze well — if you have any!,To make the cooked rice needed in thirecipe; Bring long grain white rice, water to a boil in a saucepan. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, simmer until rice itender, liquid habeen absorbed, about minutes. Or make a larger batch, use leftoverfor fried rice or rice pudding.
ingredients: head cabbage, cored, water to cover, salt, poundlean ground beef, poundground pork, cooked white rice, large eggs, slightly finely chopped onionfresh parsley, garlic powder, salt, ground black peppercan tomato sauce, white vinegar, white sugar
descriptor: Thistuffed cabbage recipe, known ahalupki on the Ukrainian side of my family, imade with beef, pork, rice encased in cabbage, drizzled with a thin, sweet tomato sauce. My grandma Eugenia taught me how to make this. Every family hatheir own twist on thitraditional dish. Enjoy with mashed potatoejust awe alwaydo in my family!

instructions: Remove any fat, gristle from chuck roast; cut into strip/-inch thick by -inchelong. Season with salt, pepper. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add beef, brown quickly. Push beef to one side of the skillet. Add onions; cook, stir for to minutes, then push to the side with beef. Stir flour into juiceon the empty side of the pan. Pour in beef broth, bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Lower the heat, stir in mustard. Cover, simmer for hour or until the beef itender. Five minutebefore serving, stir in mushrooms, sour cream, white wine. Cook until heated through; season with salt, pepper. Serve over noodles. Thican be served over either rice or noodles.

instructions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add potatoes, bring to a boil, cook for to minutes. Add carrotand whole eggand continue boiling until potatoeare tender, to minutes. Parsley can be substituted for dill if desired.

Continue whisking, cooking until custard reachea thick consistency, to minutes. It iimportant to stir the entire time the custard can easily burn or clump. The custard will continue to thicken ait cools. Spoon into bowlto serve.

instructions: Season chicken thighwith black pepper, adobo seasoning. Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Cook, stir green pepper, red pepper, onion, garlic, tomato paste in the hot oil, until the vegetablehave softened slightly, to minutes. Remove vegetablefrom the pot, set aside. Pan fry chicken in the pot until browned, to minuteon each side. Return cooked vegetableto the pot along with rice, diced tomatoes, chicken broth, bay leaf, red pepper flakes. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low, simmer until rice itender, chicken ino longer pink inside, about minutes. Stir in peaand oliveand cook for another minutes. instructions: Bring water to a boil in a small saucepan over high heat. Add cinnamon sticks, cloves, anise seed. Cover, set aside to steep for minutes. Meanwhile, combine sugar, water in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir occasionally to dissolve sugar completely, but stop stirring once the mixture cometo a boil. Stay near the stove to monitor the colswirling the pan gently to redistribute the sugar athe caramel beginto darken. Cook to about degreeF until the sugar turnlight golden brown, then pour into a 9x-inch loaf pan. Set aside to allow caramel to harden. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Remove crust from day-old bread, tear bread into cubes, place into a large mixing bowl. Strain spice tea through a fine mesh sieve to remove spices. Add to bread along with evaporated milk. Stir to evenly moisten, set aside for minutes. While the bread mixture sits, whisk eggin a large mixing bowl along with remaining sugar, vanilla, salt, butter. Stir in moistened bread mixture until evenly mixed. Pour into the loaf pan over the caramel. Line a roasting pan with a damp kitchen towel. Place the loaf pan on the towel, inside the roasting pan, place roasting pan on oven rack. Fill the roasting pan with boiling water to reach halfway up the sideof the loaf pan. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comeout clean, about hour, minutes. Cool in the pan for about an hour, then refrigerate until cold, hourmore. When ready, invert the budin onto a serving plate. The caramel will have turned to syrup, will cover the budin like a sauce.
ingredients: water, cinnamon sticks, whole cloves, anise seed, white sugar, divided, water, loaf day-old bread, evaporated milk, large eggs, vanilla extract, salt, butter,

Feel free to use your favorite ingredientinstead of what'listed, such amixed vegetablefor the corn. Instead of cubed potatoes, you can fry French frieand add them at the end. If you don't have all the ingredients, don't sweat it! Just use olive oil, onion, garlic, pepperwith whatever other ingredientyou might have.

instructions:
Have the happiest holiday ever with this top-rated coquito recipe. Whether you bottle it and give it as gifts or keep the whole batch to yourself, this boozy drink will make your season extra festive. Coquito is a traditional holiday drink that originated in Puerto Rico. In Spanish, coquito means "little coconut." The beverage is coconut-based and spiked with rum. Rich and creamy coquito, which is often thickened with egg yolks, is similar to eggnog. In fact, sometimes it's referred to as "Puerto Rican eggnog.",These are the ingredients you'll need to make a decadent batch of coquito:,· Evaporated milk: This coquito recipe starts with a can of evaporated milk.
· Eggs: Two beaten egg yolks contribute to the rich, thick, and creamy texture.
· Cream of coconut: Canned cream of coconut lends richness and gives the coquito its signature coconut flavor.
· Sweetened condensed milk: Sweetened condensed milk makes everything more delicious, including this coquito recipe!
· White rum: The best rum for coquito is white Puerto Rican rum, such as Bacardi. In a pinch, any pleasant-tasting white rum will do.
· Water: Water thins the thick and creamy mixture, making it super pourable.
· Vanilla: A teaspoon of vanilla extract takes the flavor up a notch.
· Spices: Cinnamon and cloves add warmth and coziness. You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here's a brief overview of what you can expect when you make this crowd-pleasing coquito:,1. Cook the evaporated milk and egg yolks in a double boiler until thick.
2. Transfer the mixture to a blender and blend with the remaining ingredients.
3. Transfer to glass bottles and chill overnight. Stored in airtight containers in the refrigerator, coquito can last one to two months. Since the eggs may separate and settle, make sure to stir the drink before serving. "I make this every Christmas, bottles and bottles of it," says Deana. "I give it as gifts and make it for my family as well. This recipe is perfect, you won't be disappointed!","My husband and I absolutely love it," raves butterflybutt. "The only thing I did differently was add coconut water instead of plain water and I also added a little nutmeg instead of cloves. Oh, and learn from my mistakes...coconut cream is NOT the same as creamed coconut.","It comes out perfect," according to LEASMOM. "Next year I want to double it because we drink it so fast! This is absolutely the best recipe and I love that everyone tweaks it to fit their tastes.",Editorial contributions by Corey Williams,Gather all ingredients. Combine evaporated milk and egg yolks in the top of a double boiler over simmering water. Cook over the simmering water, stirring constantly, until mixture is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon, and reaches a temperature of 160 degrees F (71 degrees C). Transfer mixture to a blender. Add cream of coconut, sweetened condensed milk, rum, water, vanilla, cinnamon, and cloves; blend until combined, about 30 seconds. Pour into glass bottles and chill 8 hours to overnight before serving.
ingredients: can evaporated milk, large egg yolks, beatencan cream of coconutcan sweetened condensed milk, white rum, water, vanilla extract, ground cinnamon, ground cloves
descriptor: Coquito ia creamy, tropical, Puerto Rican holiday drink with tonof coconut flavor. It'made with both evaporated, condensed milk, cream of coconut, spices, rum, — in thiversion — egg yolks. It ialwayrequested at my holiday gatherings. SometimeI hide it in the fridge to keep for myself! Serve in glasand sprinkle with more cinnamon if desired. Feliz Navidad!

instructions: Combine ajiedulcepeppers, onions, tomatoes, green peppers, red peppers, garlic in a food processor; pulse a few times. Add cilantro stems, recao stems, salt, pepper. Procesuntil a semi-chunky salsa consistency ireached. Store in a resealable plastic freezer bag. Use aneeded or freeze in portions. Recao ia popular Caribbean herb with many aliases: culantro, long coriander, ngo-gai, Mexican coriander. It may be found in Latin grocery stores. You may substitute with cilantro. Aji Dulce ia common ingredient in Puerto Rican recipes. It ia small, sweet red pepper. If you can't find it, use red bell pepper.

In a small bowl, mix together olive oil, garlic, parsley, pepper flakes, paprika, tomato sauce. Pour evenly over casserole. Bake in preheated oven for minutes until potatoeare tender.
