instructions: Slice sausage into /-inch rounds. Heat oil in a pot over medium-high heat. Add sausage, saute until sausage beginto turn brown, rendersome fat, to minutes. Transfer with a slotted spoon to a dish. Reduce heat to medium-low; add onionand pinch of salt salt. Stir, cook until to minutes. Transfer potatoeto pot. Sprinkle in salt. Pour in chicken broth. Increase heat to high, bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to medium-low; simmer until potatoeare tender, to minutes. When potatoeare tender, carefully mash them in the broth with a potato masher until broken up or completely mashed. Add kale, a handful at a time. Transfer browned sausage to soup. Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, simmer until greenare tender, about minutes. I recommend trying to find Portuguese linguica, but pretty much any cured, spicy, smoked sausage will work. Andouille would be a great choice, awould a dried chorizo. Ausual, feel free to adapt thiayou see fit, but I wouldn't change the recommended russet potatoes.
ingredients: linguica sausage olive oil, onion, finely pinch salt, poundrusset potatoes to inch thick, salt, plumore aneeded, quartchicken broth or water, poundkale - trimmed rinsed, pinch cayenne pepper
descriptor: Thisoup iso hearty, comforting, you'll almost forget how good it ifor you. And it'perfect for cold weather with the spicy sausage, kale, potatoes, plenty of chicken broth.

instructions: Add ingredientin order suggested by your manufacturer. Select "sweet bread" setting.
ingredients: milk, egg, margarine, white sugar, salt, bread flour, active dry yeast
descriptor: Thirecipe ifor the bread machine. It isimilar to homemade grandmother'sweet bread.

instructions: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Sauté onion in hot butter until slightly golden, about minutes. Stir in water, garlic, sazon seasoning, lemon juice, salt, pepper; cook for minutes. Stir in beer, hot sauce; bring to a boil. Add shrimp, cook until bright pink on the outside, the meat iopaque, about minutes.
ingredients: butter finely chopped onion water clove garlic, finely choppedpackagesazon seasoning with saffron lemon, juiced salt, ground black pepper bottle beer hot sauce pound uncooked medium shrimp, deveined
descriptor: Thishrimp with Mozambique sauce igreat served over rice. Zesty shrimp in a saffron, garlic-based sauce.

instructions: Boil cabbage in a stockpot until tender, to minutes. Drain well. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook, stir beef in the hot skillet until browned, crumbly, to minutes; drain, discard grease. Mix salt, parsley, onion powder, black pepper into ground beef. Bring water, rice to a boil in a saucepan. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, simmer until rice itender, liquid habeen absorbed, to minutes. Stir tomato soup, crushed tomatoetogether in a bowl. Preheat oven to degreeF . Combine cabbage, seasoned ground beef, rice, tomato mixture together in a bowl; transfer to a 9x-inch baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven until bubbling, about minutes. Thirecipe usea lot of sauce. If you like the traditional golumpki-version, you may want to reduce the amount of sauce. I happen to dislike the old family recipethat are very dry. I put the brand nameof the sauce in there, because it imy personal preference, love the flavor.
ingredients: head green cabbage, cut into bite-size pieces, pound ground beef, salt, dried parsley, onion powder, ground black pepper, water, white rice, can condensed tomato soup container crushed tomatoe
descriptor: Grew up eating golumpki. YeI'm mostly Polish, but alwaywanted more sauce on them, didn't like the 'mushiness' of the burger inside. Thiithe version I came up with, hope you enjoy!

instructions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Place cabbage head into the pot, cover, cook until leaveare softened enough to remove from the head, about minutes. Remove cabbage from the pot, let sit until leaveare cool enough to handle, about minutes. Remove whole leavefrom the cabbage head, cutting out any thick tough center ribs. Set whole leaveaside. Chop the remaining cabbage, spread it in the bottom of a casserole dish. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion, sauté until tender, to minutes. Remove from the heat, let cool, about minutes. Combine beef, pork, cooked rice, garlic, salt, pepper in a large bowl. Add onion, mix until well combined. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Place about beef mixture onto a cabbage leaf. Roll the leaf around beef mixture, tucking in the sideto create an envelope around the meat. Repeat to make remaining cabbage rolls. Place cabbage rollin a layer over chopped cabbage in the casserole dish. Season with salt, pepper. Whisk condensed soup, tomato juice, ketchup together in a bowl; pour over cabbage rolland cover the dish tightly with aluminum foil. Bake in the preheated oven until cabbage itender, meat icooked through, about hour. Uncover for the last to minuteof cooking. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least degreeF .
ingredients: head cabbage, cored, butter, large onion pound ground beef, pound ground pork, cooked rice, finely chopped garlic, salt, pluground black pepper, plucan condensed tomato soup, cantomato juice ketchup
descriptor: Golabki are cabbage leavestuffed with ground beef, rice, then simmered in tomato soup. Thiworkgreat in the oven or a slow cooker. Serve them with the pan juiceand a drizzle of sour cream mix the pan juicewith sour cream, ladle it over the cabbage rolls. They're also good with mashed potatoeand a cucumber, sour cream salad. They freeze well too — either before or after cooking.

instructions: Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion, celery, garlic, saute for to minutes until translucent. Stir in cabbage, reduce heat to low, simmer for minutes. Pour in tomatoeand season with salt, pepper. Cover pan, cook over medium heat for to minutes until cabbage itender.
ingredients: butter, onions stalk celery clove garlic medium head cabbage, cut into squares, can stewed tomatoes, with liquid, salt, pepper
descriptor: Thiia family favorite that my mother-in-law fixed for me while I wavisiting her home last year. Serve over white rice, if desired.

instructions: Combine kielbasa, sauerkraut, beer in a slow cooker. Cook on Low until kielbasa itender, plump, to hours.
ingredients: poundkielbasa sausage, cut into inch piecescan sauerkraut, can or bottle beer
descriptor: Thicrockpot kielbasa ia delicious, minimal-prep recipe perfect for serving aa side dish with dinner or for company. My husband would live on thiif I let him. Our entire family loveit. Thiia slow cooker recipe that'too easy not to try.

instructions: Place cucumberinto a colander, sprinkle generously with salt; let stand until soft, about minutes. Squeeze liquid from cucumberand transfer to a bowl with dill. Mix sour cream, lemon juice, sugar together in a bowl; add to cucumberand tosto coat. Season with pepper. Cover, chill for at least minutebefore serving.
ingredients: pound small cucumbers, salt, bunch dill sour cream, lemon juice, pinch white sugar, ground black pepper
descriptor: Mizeria ia Polish cucumber salad. I serve it on ChristmaEve.

instructions: Fry bacon in a large skillet over medium-high heat until browned, turning once. Remove bacon from pan, reserving drippings, place on paper towels. Stir onions, water, sugar, caraway seeds, garlic, red pepper flakes, seasoned salt into drippings. Add cabbage, gently stir. Cover, cook over medium heat for to minutes. Add kielbasa to the pan. Cook, covered, for an additional to minutes. Crumble bacon over top, serve hot.
ingredients: bacon, onion water, white sugar, caraway seed, garlic, crushed red pepper flakes, seasoning salt, large head cabbage, cut into small wedges, pound Polish kielbasa
descriptor: Thismoked kielbasa, cabbage dish igreat for company but quick enough for a weeknight! It isuper easy, can be prepared well in advance.

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Heat a large pot over medium heat. Add kielbasa, bacon; cook, stir until bacon harendered itfat, sausage ilightly browned. Use a slotted spoon to remove the meat, transfer to a large casserole or Dutch oven. Coat cubeof pork lightly with flour, fry them in the bacon drippingover medium-high heat until golden brown. Use a slotted spoon to transfer pork to the casserole. Add cabbage, carrots, onion, fresh mushrooms, garlic. Add in sauerkraut. Reduce heat to medium; cook, stir until carrotare soft, about minutes. Do not let the vegetablebrown. Deglaze the pan by pouring in red wine, stirring to loosen all of the bitof food, flour that are stuck to the bottom. Season with bay leaf, paprika, basil, marjoram, salt, pepper, caraway seed, cayenne; cook for minute. Mix in beef stock, tomatoes, dried mushrooms, tomato paste, hot pepper sauce, Worcestershire sauce. Heat through just until boiling. Pour vegetableand all of the liquid into the casserole dish with meat. Cover with a lid. Bake in the preheated oven for to hours, until meat ivery tender.
ingredients: pound kielbasa sausage into inch piece thick slicehickory-smoked bacon pound cubed pork stew meat all-purpose flour shredded green cabbage carrots, diced onion, diced sliced fresh mushroom clove garlicjar sauerkraut, well drained dry red wine bay leaf sweet paprika dried basil dried marjoram salt ground black pepper caraway seed, crushed pinch cayenne pepper beef stock canned diced tomatoe dried mushroom canned tomato paste dash bottled hot pepper sauce dash Worcestershire sauce
descriptor: Bigoia traditional Polish stew using pork, kielbasa, sauerkraut — great for a cold winter'day. Thirecipe iwell worth the time it taketo make it!

instructions: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stir onion in melted butter until to minutes. Meanwhile, bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add egg noodleand cook, stirring occasionally, until partially cooked, about minutes. Drain, return to the pot. Pour onion mixture over noodles, then stir in cottage cheese, sour cream, salt, pepper. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until sauce iheated through, noodleare tender, yet firm to the bite, to minutes.
ingredients: butter, small onion, dicedpackage egg noodlescontainer cottage cheese, sour cream, sea salt, ground black pepper
descriptor: Thisimple recipe for pasta with cottage cheese came from the Polish side of my family. We call it "cottage cheese, noodles" or "lazy man pierogies." It'a great comfort food, can be made with any kind of noodle. You can serve it aa side dish, but we alwayenjoy it aa main course.

instructions: Make dough: Combine flour, cold water, beaten egg, salt in a bowl; mix until a smooth dough forms. Cover the bowl, set aside. Make potato filling: Place potatoein a large pot. Add water to cover, bring to a boil, cook until tender, to minutes. Drain, mash in the pot until smooth. Place bacon in a large skillet, cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about minutes. Drain bacon sliceon paper towels. Crumble, stir into mashed potatoes. Stir in cheese; season with salt, pepper. Set aside. Make sauerkraut filling: Place bacon in the skillet, cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about minutes. Drain, crumble, place in a medium bowl. Stir in sauerkraut, then sour cream. Mix well. Roll dough out on a floured surface to /- to /-inch thickness. Cut out -inch circlewith a cookie cutter or an upside-down drinking glass. Place a spoonful of potato or sauerkraut filling in the center of each circle, fold over, pinching edgetogether to seal. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil; drop perogiein boiling water, cook until they float, to minutes. To save time, cook the bacon for the potatoeand the filling at the same time, start the bacon while the potatoeare still cooking.
ingredients: all-purpose flour, cold water, large egg, salt
descriptor: These perogiecan be boiled or fried in butter, which makethem tastier. Serve with sour cream or cottage cheese. I grew up on these deliciouperogies. I like to triple the recipe, freeze some for later by freezing perogiein a single layer on a tray, then storing them in freezer bags.

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Spray a 9x-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Spray one sheet of aluminum foil with cooking spray. Spread bread cubein the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Layer bread cubewith sauerkraut, beef strips, then pour dressing over top. Cover with the aluminum foil, sprayed-side down. Bake in the preheated oven for minutes. Remove, discard foil; sprinkle Swischeese over casserole. Continue baking until cheese imelted, bubbly, about more minutes.
ingredients: slicerye bread, cubedcan sauerkraut, drained, pound deli sliced corned beef, cut into strips, Russian-style salad dressing, cooking spray, shredded Swischeese
descriptor: Thitasty Reuben casserole with layerof sauerkraut, corned beef, Swischeese, rye bread crumbs, Russian-style salad dressing ilike a baked deli sandwich in a dish.

instructions: Whisk together sweetened condensed milk, evaporated milk, vanilla, egg yolkin a saucepan. Place over medium-low heat, gently cook until the mixture thickens, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon, about minutes. Pour into a heatproof serving dish, set aside. Whip egg whitewith confectioners' sugar to stiff peak. Spread meringue on top of milk mixture. Refrigerate until cold, about hours. Sprinkle with cinnamon before serving. Thirecipe containraw egg. We recommend that pregnant women, young children, the elderly, the infirm do not consume raw egg. Learn more about egg safety from our article, How to Make Your EggSafe. To pasteurize your egg whites, you can make a Swismeringue: combine the egg whitewith about granulated sugar in a stainlessteel mixing bowl. Heat over a double boiler, stirring constantly, until sugar imelted, egg whiteare hot to the touch. Remove from heat, whip until fluffy, stiff. Alternately, you can substitute pasteurized liquid egg whiteand save the raw egg whitefor another use. Pasteurized whitetake longer to whip, but will work just fine. Learn more about How to Pasteurize Egg Whitein our article.
ingredients: can sweetened condensed milk, can evaporated milk, vanilla extract, beaten egg yolks, beaten egg white, confectioners' sugar, ground cinnamon
descriptor: Suspiro limeño ia classic Peruvian dessert that ivery popular in Chile, it'irresistible for all ages. It'easy, I've been able to prepare it myself since I walittle. Try it, you won't regret it!

instructions: Combine chicken, green peas, carrot, shallot, roasted red peppers, cilantro, lime juice in a bowl. Season with salt, cayenne. Add mayonnaise, mix until combined. Cover chicken salad with plastic wrap, refrigerate until ready to use. Place potatoeinto a pot, cover with salted water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, simmer until very tender but not falling apart, about minutes. Drain well, transfer potatoeto a mixing bowl. Mash until smooth. Add ají amarillo, olive oil, lime juice to the potatoes. Season with cayenne, salt. Mash together with a potato masher. Switch to a spatula, mix until completely smooth. Line four - ramekinwith plastic wrap. Scoop mashed potatoeevenly into ramekins; presand smooth out the tops. Cover each with a layer of avocado slices. Fill each ramekin to the top with chicken salad, pressing it down, pulling up the plastic wrap to eliminate any air pockets. Cover with a final layer of mashed potatoes, going up to inch or more over the rim. Seal top with a new layer of plastic wrap, fold the sideover to seal. Refrigerate saladuntil completely chilled, at least hour. Mix mayonnaise, sour cream, garlic, ají amarillo together for the sauce, adding a splash of water to adjust the thickness. Remove the top layer of plastic wrap from each salad. Invert each ramekin onto a serving plate; remove ramekins, then plastic wrap. Spoon some sauce around each salad. If you can't find ají amarillo, you can make a paste from some fire-roasted, peeled orange or red bell peppers, with red Fresno chiliefor some heat. While thidoeget you close, you should definitely try to find a jar of the real stuff, since it doehave such a unique flavor. You can also use russet potatoes. You can use fresh peathat have been blanched or frozen peathat have been thawed. Substitute red onion for shallot if desired. Garnish with cherry tomatoeand cilantro if desired.
ingredients: large cooked chicken breast, diced or shredded, green peas, diced cooked carrot, shallot, finely chopped roasted red peppersfresh cilantro, lime juice, mayonnaise
descriptor: There'nothing very unusual about serving a chicken or potato salad at a cookout, which iwhy thilayered Peruvian potato, chicken salad will cause such a stir. Or should I say, "causa" a stir, since in Peru that'what thigorgeoudish icalled. Infused with ají amarillo, lime juice, cilantro, these are perfect for making ahead, packing in your cooler on a hot summer day.

instructions: Mix flour, confectioners' sugar, cornstarch, salt together in a bowl. Beat butter with an electric mixer in a separate bowl until soft, fluffy. Mix in white sugar, vanilla until well combined. Add dry ingredientto wet ingredientin batches, beating until just blended after each addition. Divide dough in half, roll each half into a log, refrigerate until firm, about hours. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Slice dough loginto forty-eight /-inch-thick cookieand place onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake in the preheated oven until just starting to turn golden around the edges, to minutes. Remove from the oven, let cool for minute on the baking sheet. Transfer cookieto wire rackto cool completely, to minutes. Use a knife to generously spread dulce de leche onto of the cooled cookies. Sandwich remaining cookieon top, place onto a serving tray. Lightly dust finished cookiewith remaining confectioners' sugar.
ingredients: sifted all-purpose flour, sifted confectioners' sugar, sifted cornstarch, salt, stickunsalted butter, white sugar, vanilla extract,jar dulce de leche, confectioners' sugar
descriptor: These alfajore are buttery, sweet with a touch of vanilla. They're to die for! Given to me by a chef who sweet-talked the recipe out of a street vendor in Peru.

instructions: Combine Pisco, lime juice, simple syrup, egg white in a cocktail shaker. Cover, shake for to secondto emulsify the egg white. Add ice; cover, shake until chilled. Strain into chilled Champagne coupe. Garnish with dropAngostura Bitterswirled with two straws. Thirecipe containraw egg. We recommend that pregnant women, young children, the elderly, the infirm do not consume raw egg. Learn more about egg safety from our article, How to Make Your EggSafe.
ingredients: fluid pisco fluid lime juice fluid simple syrup egg white ice dropAngostura bitters
descriptor: The Pisco sour originated in Peru, usePisco--a grape brandy produced in Peru, Chile. Combined with lime juice, simple syrup, an egg white, it'a thick, foamy drink that'sure to please.

instructions: Pat turkey dry with paper towels. Loosen skin over each side of breastbone with a spatula inserted beneath skin. Place cumin, soy sauce, vinegar, vegetable oil, garlic, paprika, black pepper, smoked paprika, oregano into a blender. Blend spice rub into a thick paste, about minute. Set aside of rub in a bowl for a later step; pour remaining rub all over turkey, use a spatula to work about of mixture beneath the loosened skin on each side of the breast. Rub the mixture over every nook, cranny of turkey. Let turkey stand for hour at room temperature. Preheat oven to degreeF . Fold a piece of aluminum foil into a rounded piece about the size of the turkey breast; set foil aside. Place turkey onto a rack set in a large roasting pan. Tie legtogether at the bottom with a piece of kitchen twine. Spread of reserved wet rub into cavity of turkey; retain remaining for later. Sprinkle entire top, sideof turkey with kosher salt. Roast turkey in the preheated oven for hours; place foil tent on turkey breast. Return to oven, continue to roast for about hour, more minutes. Combine remaining of spice rub with vegetable oil, water in a small bowl. Brush mixture over turkey'top, legs, sides. Roast until until an instant-read meat thermometer inserted into the thickest part of a thigh, not touching bone, read to degreeF , about more minutes. Transfer turkey to a serving platter, let rest for at least minutes, reserving drippingin roasting pan. Place creme fraiche, chicken broth, lime juice, jalapeno peppers, cilantro into a blender, blend until smooth. Pour excesgrease out of turkey roasting pan, pour in creme fraiche mixture, place the roasting pan over a burner set over medium-high heat. Scrape the browned pan drippinginto the sauce mixture, bring to a boil, cook until gravy ireduced by half, thickened, about minutes. Whisk often to prevent lumps. Season gravy with salt, black pepper, cayenne pepper. Carve, serve turkey with pan gravy. Please note differencein ingredient amountwhen following the magazine version of thirecipe. Roasting time iabout minuteper pound a total of about hourfor a -pound turkey. Mine waabout pounds.
ingredients: whole turkey, neck, gibletremoved
descriptor: Thiione of the juiciest, most flavorful turkeyI've ever made! The rub forma crust that lockin all the juices, even in the driest part of the breast meat. I served some of it plated up with sweet potato chunkand black beanand some of it covered with rich pan gravy.

instructions: Place chicken thighinto a gallon-sized resealable plastic bag. Blend soy sauce, garlic, lime juice, vegetable oil, cumin, paprika, oregano in a blender until smooth. Pour mixture over chicken, seal the bag, refrigerate for hours. Combine jalapeno peppers, cilantro, mayonnaise, lime juice, olive oil, garlic, salt, pepper in a blender; pulse until sauce ismooth. Transfer sauce to a covered bowl, refrigerate until ready to serve. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat, lightly oil the grate. Remove chicken thighfrom the bag, place on the grill. Discard bag with excesmarinade. Grill thighfor minutes; flip, grill additional minutes. Transfer thighto a serving dish, drizzle reserved sauce over the chicken.
ingredients: poundbone-in, skin-on chicken thighs, soy sauce, clove garlic, lime juice, vegetable oil, cumin, paprika, dried oregano
descriptor: For your next cookout, treat your family to a classic Peruvian dish made on the grill instead of in the oven. Thirecipe isimple to prepare, ibursting with flavor. If you like thingspicy, leave the seedin your jalapenofor extra heat.

instructions: Season the chicken with salt, pepper. Heat the olive oil in a large, heavy pot over medium-high heat. Stir in the onion, garlic, serrano chili; cook until the onion ha about minute. Add the chicken, continue to cook for minutes. Stir in the cilantro, peas, corn, red pepper; cook for minute. Pour in the chicken broth, potatoes, rice. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low, simmer until the chicken iopaque, the potatoeare tender, about minutes.
ingredients: skinless, boneless chicken breast halve- cut in half, salt, pepper, olive oil, medium onion garlic, seeded, serrano chilecilantro, green peas, corn, red bell pepper chicken broth, Yukon Gold potatoes, cut in half, uncooked white rice
descriptor: Traditional Peruvian Chicken Soup ia light version of the Peruvian Chicken Chowder .

instructions: Place chicken breasts, onion, carrot, clove garlic in a large saucepan, pour in quartof water, slowly bring to a simmer over medium-high heat. Skim off the foam which formon top, then cover, reduce heat to medium-low, simmer until the chicken itender, about minutes. Remove chicken to a plate, allow to cool. Strain the resulting chicken stock, discarding the vegetables. Pour evaporated milk, chicken stock into the bowl of a blender. Add bread cubeand puree until smooth. Add Parmesan cheese, walnuts; puree until smooth. Shred the cooled chicken, discard the bones. Heat vegetable oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir in garlic, onion; cook until the onion ha turned translucent, about minutes. Stir in shredded chicken, aji amarillo until heated through. Pour in bread puree, cook until hot, stirring frequently. Add more chicken stock if needed to keep from getting too thick. Season with turmeric, simmer for minutemore. Serve garnished with hard-cooked egg sliceand sprinkled with kalamata olives.
ingredients: bone-in chicken breast halves, onion, carrots clove garlic, quartwater, loaf white bread, crustremoved, cubed, can evaporated milk, grated Parmesan cheese, walnut pieces, vegetable oil, clove garlic, onion aji amarillo chile paste, ground turmeric, hard-cooked egg kalamata olives, pitted, quartered
descriptor: Thiia delicious, traditional Peruvian chicken stew in a spicy, nutty cheese sauce. It taketime, but iwell worth it! I serve thiover boiled white rice, baby yellow potatoes.

instructions: Slice beef horizontally into /-inch stripand transfer into a mixing bowl. Add of soy sauce, the sugar. Mix well, place in the refrigerator for at least hour; longer ifine. Preheat an oven to degreeF . Line a sheet pan with a silicone liner . Heat olive oil in a large, nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add French frieand cook until golden, crisp, to minutes. Transfer to the prepared pan, place in the preheated oven to keep warm. Heat olive oil in the same skillet over high heat until the oil beginto smoke. Sear the beef stripin or smaller batches, until browned but still pink in places, for to minuteper batch. You don't want to cook the meat all the way through, ait will finish cooking with the vegetablelater. Aeach batch of beef ibrowned, transfer to a plate or bowl, reserve. Place the skillet back over high heat, add remaining olive oil. Transfer in red onion, bell pepper, habanero, green onion, along with a large pinch of salt. Cook, stirring, until the onionand pepperjust begin to soften, to minutes. Add garlic, ginger to the pan; cook, stir for minute. Add tomato wedgeand cook, stirring, until they begin to soften, start to release their juices, about minutes. Add remaining of soy sauce, white vinegar, the browned beef into the pan, along with any accumulated juices, stir to combine. Stir cilantro, crispy, cooked French frieinto the pan, tossing everything to combine. Taste for salt, adjust if needed. Serve immediately. If you wanted to splurge, you could use a nicer cut of meat, such aa filet, New York strip skirt steak. I like to use frozen, crinkle-cut fries, but any kind will do. You can serve the frieon the side of thidish to keep them from getting soggy, but I've heard that the real playeralwayserve them in it.
ingredients: poundtop sirloin steak, soy sauce, divided, white sugar, olive oil, dividedpackage frozen crinkle-cut French fries red onion, medium orange bell pepper habanero pepper, seeded green onion, kosher salt, clove garlic, fresh ginger root, medium roma tomato, white vinegarfresh cilantro
descriptor: I've never been a big stir-fry guy, but when it cometo lomo saltado, I make an exception. First of all, it'Peruvian--and I love to eat anything Peruvian. But, it'also a stir-fry that featurenot only meat, vegetables, but also French fries. Serve with steamed white rice, garnish with cilantro, if so desired.

instructions: Place chickpeaand kidney beaninto a large container; cover with several incheof cool water. Let stand hourto overnight; drain. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add red onion; cook, stir until onion ha turned translucent, about minutes. Reduce heat to low; continue cooking, stirring until onion itender, golden brown, about minutemore. Stir in dried mint; cook until onionbecome dark brown, crisp, about minutes. Set aside for garnish. Heat remaining olive oil in a stock pot; stir in yellow onions. Cook, stir until onion haturned translucent, about minutes. Add garlic, stir until fragrant, about minute. Stir in chickpeas, kidney beans, turmeric; tosto combine. Stir in vegetable stock; simmer soup for hour. Stir scallions, parsley, cilantro, mint, lentilinto soup; simmer minutemore. Break linguine into sections, stir into soup, cook at a low boil until noodleare soft, to minutes. Stir of the spinach into the soup until wilted, about minute. Stir in remaining spinach, simmer for minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir flour with of the soup liquid together in a small bowl until smooth. Stir flour mixture back into soup. Continue to simmer soup over low heat, stirring frequently, until thickened, about minutes. Serve soup with yogurt, fried red onions. Save time by frying the onionwhile the soup isimmering. It iimportant to stir gently, often toward the end of the cooking process soup will stick to the bottom of the pot. Add more water or stock aneeded to prevent sticking.
ingredients: dry chickpea, dry kidney beans, olive oil, divided, large red onion dried mint, large yellow onions clove garlic, ground turmeric, vegetable stock, bunchescallions, packed chopped fresh parsley, packed chopped fresh cilantro, packed chopped fresh mint, dry lentils, pound linguine pasta, pound fresh spinach all-purpose flour, salt, fresh ground pepper, Greek yogurt
descriptor: Ash reshteh ia wonderful soup that'traditionally made with Persian noodlecalled "reshteh". You can find them in Middle Eastern storeor use linguine pasta aa substitute. Thihearty spiced soup topped with yogurt, fried red onionia Persian New Year tradition.

instructions: Place rice in a medium bowl, cover with tepid water. Gently swish it around with your finger to activate the starches, then tip the bowl to drain water. Repeat thiprocesuntil water runclear, about rinses. Cover rice with cold water, add salt, stir gently, soak for hour. Drain rice without rinsing. Crush saffron threadto a powder in a small mortar, pestle. Transfer to a small bowl with boiling water. Stir, cover, set saffron water aside. Fill a -quart nonstick pot with water, bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Add salt, stir until dissolved. Add rice, stir once gently, watch carefully ait cookso water doenot boil over. Taste water for salt, adjust accordingly. Cook rice until the first piece popup to the surface. Set a timer for minuteand cook, scooping off any foam from the surface, until the timer goeoff. Test rice, continue to cook until tender on the outside but still firm to the bite on the inside, to minutemore. Drain rice in a colander, rinse quickly with lukewarm water, a spray faucet to rinse off extra starch. Taste rice, gently rinse again if too salty. Set aside to drain completely. Wash, dry the pot. Combine chopped fresh parsley, cilantro, dill, chivewith dried dill in a medium bowl. Gently combine herb mixture with rice in the colander, taking care not to break the grainof rice. Place the clean pot over medium heat. Add oil, saffron water, a pinch of salt; swirl the pot until the bottom, lower sideare coated with the oil mixture. Trim or tear lavash bread, cover the bottom of the pot to create the tahdig layer. Gently scatter rice-herb mixture over the tahdig in a pyramid shape, making sure lavash icompletely covered. Place garlic stalkon top at the outer edgeof the rice. Gently poke the handle of a wooden spoon into the rice a few times, being careful not to hit the tahdig; thiwill allow steam to escape while cooking. Cover, cook until you see steam escaping from the sideof the lid, tahdig startto set, to minutes. Meanwhile, combine boiling water with melted butter, remaining saffron water. Lay a kitchen towel out on a heatproof surface. Test the tahdig by quickly tapping the side of the pot with a wooden spoon. When the pot sizzles, remove it from the heat. Remove the lid, place it on the kitchen towel, being careful that none of the condensation dripinto the pot. Wrap the towel around the lid, secure the endat the top by the handle so they will not hang near the heat source. Drizzle the butter mixture over the rice, cover with the towel-wrapped lid. Place a heat diffuser on a burner over low or medium-low heat, return the pot to the stove. Cook until crispy, rotating the pot a few times, about minutes. Remove from the heat, place on a damp kitchen towel; let sit, uncovered, for minuteso tahdig will release easily. Serve the rice on a platter, garnish with garlic stalks, remove the tahdig whole or in pieceand serve on the side. Or, invert carefully but quickly onto a serving platter. Chopping the herbin a food processor savea lot of prep time. Pulse them instead of processing them, so they don't turn mushy. Olive oil can be used instead of grapeseed oil.
ingredients: long-grain basmati rice, kosher salt, divided, saffron threads, boiling water, large bunch finely chopped fresh parsley, large bunch finely chopped fresh cilantro, large bunch finely chopped fresh dill, large bunch finely chopped fresh chives, dried dill, grapeseed oil, sheet lavash bread, fresh spring garlic stalk, boiling water, unsalted butter,
descriptor: Sabzi polo ia classic Nowruz dish brimming with fragrant fresh green herband the scent of spring. A fragrant, long-grain basmati rice ioptimal here. Thiversion iprepared with a crispy, saffron-tinged lavash tahdig that also actaa barrier so the herbdon't burn at the bottom of the pot. Enjoy sabzi polo with mahi sorkh shodeh , a side of smoked fish.

instructions: Heat the chicken stock in a pot to a gentle simmer. Heat the vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat, saute the onion until translucent. Add the pearl barley to the pot, stir for one minute. Stir in the hot chicken stock, turmeric, lime juice, tomato paste, salt, pepper. Bring the mixture to a boil, reduce heat to low, simmer for hour. Mix in the carrotand continue simmering minuteor until the soup hathickened, the carrotand barley are tender. If the soup itoo thick, add hot water, one at a time. Place the sour cream in a small bowl. Slowly pour of hot soup mixture into sour cream, whisking constantly. Gradually add the sour cream mixture into the soup pot, whisking constantly. Stir in the fresh parsley. Serve with fresh lime wedges.
ingredients: quartchicken stock, vegetable oil, medium onion, uncooked pearl barley, turmeric, lime, juiced, tomato paste, salt, ground black pepper, diced carrots, sour creamfresh parsley, lime wedges
descriptor: I've seen a lot of recipefor thisoup; however, my mother-in-law addtomato paste for a bit of a different flavour, she doesn't add any lentilor beans. It'thick, filling, delicious, you could make it vegetarian by using vegetable stock.

instructions: Stir yogurt, cucumbers, garlic, shallot together in a medium bowl; season with dill, salt, pepper. Refrigerate for at least hour to blend flavors.
ingredients: container plain yogurt, Persian cucumber, clove garlic, shallot, dried dill weed, salt, pepper
descriptor: Thicool, healthy dip can be served along side rice, meat simply with bread. No Persian meal icomplete without Maast-o khiar! Thidish ibest if refrigerated for a few hours, but if you are strapped for time feel free to serve after mixing. Don't be afraid to get creative! Try adding spinach, raisins walnuts. Other herbcould be used awell . More cucumbers, lesshallots...it'your call! Enjoy!

instructions: Shave onionwith a grater into a fine mesh strainer. Gently prespulp into the strainer to remove juices. Place pulp into the center of the cheesecloth, gently presuntil no further juice dripout. Place lamb, beef in a pot. Add green onion, onion pulp; mix until thoroughly combined. Mix in baking powder, salt, pepper, sumac, turmeric. Add eggand mix thoroughly. Cover the pot, place in the refrigerator until flavorhave melded, at least minutes. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat, lightly oil the grate. Mold meat mixture onto the skewers. Cook on the preheated grill, rotating every minute, until nicely browned on all sides, meat ino longer pink in the center, about minutes.
ingredients: onions, cheesecloth, pound ground lamb, pound ground beef, green onion, baking powder, salt, ground black pepper, sumac powder, ground turmeric, eggs,metal skewers
descriptor: Kabob koobideh imade with ground lamb or beef or a combination of the two. Thiione of the most delicioukabob recipeI have ever found. The kabobare usually grilled over hot coalor any BBQ.

instructions: Dissolve cornstarch in milk in a small bowl; set aside. Combine remaining milk, ground almonds, cardamom in a medium pot; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium, whisk in cornstarch mixture. Mix in sugar, rosewater. Allow pudding to boil, stirring constantly, for about minutes. Remove cardamom seedand pour pudding into serving dishes. Garnish with slivered almondand serve warm or cold. For best results, use whole cardamom seedinstead of ground. You can find cardamom seedand rosewater at specialty grocers.
ingredients: cornstarch, milk, divided, ground almonds, whole cardamom seeds, white sugar, rosewater, blanched slivered almonds
descriptor: Thidelightful starch-thickened pudding with almondcan be eaten hot or cold during Ramadan, particularly on sohur or iftar. Adjust both the sugar, rosewater.

instructions: Place water, kosher salt in a pot; bring to a boil. Add rice; cook, stir for exactly minutes. Drain. Heat olive oil in a pot over medium-high heat. Cover the bottom of the pot with layer of potato slices. Sprinkle cumin, salt over potatoes. Cook until potatoeare sizzling, to minutes; top potatoewith rice to form an even layer. Reduce heat to low, place butter sliceover rice. Top the pot with a layer of clean paper towels, then place the lid over the towels. Steam until rice ifluffy, about minutes. Grind saffron threadwith a mortar, pestle. Mix crushed saffron with hot water in a large bowl. Add a couple of spoonfulof rice to saffron mixture, stir until rice iyellow. Spoon remaining rice into a serving bowl. Top with saffron rice, line the edgeof the bowl with potatoes. Garnish with parsley. You can use vegetable oil instead of olive oil if desired. Thiideliciouserved with anything, but especially with my Duck Fesenjan recipe.

descriptor: ThiPersian rice takethe grand prize. I believe I've posted a few foolproof methodfor cooking perfect rice, but thirecipe inot even close to second. The beauty of thimethod ithat it doesn't rely on any specific measurementor exact times. Thiwill make some of you very nervoubut just go with it.

instructions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add onion; cook, stir until deep golden brown, to minutes. Stir in turmeric for to minutes. Add chuck cubes; cook until coated in turmeric, browned on all sides, to minutes. Heat remaining oil in a separate pot over medium heat. Add spinach, green onions, parsley, cilantro, chives, fenugreek leaves; cook, stir until deep dark green in colto minutes. Stir spinach mixture into onion, chuck mixture. Pour in enough water to create a slurry consistency. Season with salt, pepper. Stir in lemon juice. Reduce heat, cover, simmer stew until greensoften, about hour. Pierce dried limewith a fork; add to stew. Continue simmering until chuck itender, minuteto hour. Stir in red kidney beans. Cook until flavorcombine, about more minutes. Discard dried limebefore serving. Substitute lamb stew meat for the chuck roast if preferred.
ingredients: canola oil, divided, large yellow onion, ground turmeric, poundboneleschuck roast, finely chopped spinach, finely chopped green onion, finely chopped Italian flat-leaf parsley, finely chopped cilantro, finely chopped chives, finely chopped fenugreek leaves, water more aneeded, salt, ground black pepper, lemon, juiced, dried Persian lime morecan red kidney beans, drained
descriptor: Ghormeh sabzi ideliciously savory, loaded with the flavorof several different green herbs. It'traditionally served atop white rice . You can also serve it with lavash bread.

instructions: Soak brown, red lentilin ample cool water for hour to overnight. Drain, rinse. Place drained lentilinto a large saucepan or Dutch oven. Pour in the water, then add garlic, salt, coriander, cayenne, turmeric. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low, cover, simmer until the lentilare tender, about minutes. While the lentilcook, melt the clarified butter in a skillet over medium heat. Stir in the onions, cook, stirring often, until they turn golden brown. Stir in the cumin, cook until fragrant, about minute. Stir the onionand milk into the lentils; cook for another to minutes. Sprinkle with cilantro to serve.

instructions: Preheat oven to degreeF . Line a roasting pan with aluminum foil. Place the beef into a pan with enough water to cover. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, simmer for minutes. Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a deep pot over medium-high heat. Stir in the ginger, garlic, onions, celery, cook until vegetablesoften, about minutes. Mix in the curry powder, coriander powder, five-spice powder, turmeric, tosto evenly coat the onion mixture. Cook about minutemore, stir in the carrots, parsnips, potatoes, zucchini, apples. Stir in the beef with itcooking liquid, raisins, cashews, tosto evenly blend the spices. Pour the beef, vegetable mixture into the prepared roasting pan. Drizzle water over the mixture. Cover the pan with aluminum foil. Bake in preheated oven until heated through, about hour.

descriptor: The UK haa large Indian/Pakistani population, so curry ia popular meal where I live. I don't like hot curries, but mild oneare a nice change. Thiia mild curried beef recipe with root vegetables. It'very filling, goenicely with brown basmati rice. Chinese Five Spice ia mixture of aniseed, cinnamon, fennel, pepper, cloves.

instructions: Combine yogurt, salt, red pepper flakes, ginger garlic paste, cumin, cloves, turmeric in a medium bowl. Mix in beef until evenly coated. Set aside for minutes. Heat oil in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Fry onion until golden brown. Remove onion, set aside for garnish. Reduce heat to low. Place meat in skillet, cover, cook until tender, about minutes. Check every minutes, add water if necessary. Pour in lemon juice, simmer for minutes. Garnish with cilantro, green chiles, reserved fried onion.

instructions: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Brown lamb chopon all sides, about minutes. Remove, set aside. Stir in green cardamom, black cardamom, bay leaves, cinnamon stick, cumin seeduntil fragrant, about minute. Add onions, garlic, ginger; cook until onion igolden brown, about minutes. Mix in chile powder, turmeric, salt; stir-fry for minute. Add browned lamb, water, tomatoes, chile peppers. Simmer over low heat until lamb itender, all water haevaporated, onionhave disintegrated into a thick gravy, about minutes. Serve garnished with cilantro.

instructions: Heat a small skillet over medium heat. Add the chickpea flour, cook, stirring frequently, until the flour darkenslightly, smellfragrant, about five minutes. Remove the pan from the heat, pour the toasted chickpea flour into a bowl to cool. Heat a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the red bell pepperand curry leaveand cook for minutes, stirring constantly. Mix in the cubed chicken, cook, stirring frequently, until no longer pink, about minutes. Stir in the ginger-garlic paste, fry for seconds. Combine the turmeric, cayenne pepper, chickpea flour. Sprinkle the spice mixture over the chicken mixture, cook, stirring constantly, for minutes. Pour in of water to prevent the spicefrom sticking to the bottom of the pan. Dissolve the coconut powder in of water. Pour it over the chicken mixture, reduce the heat to low. Stir the mixture occasionally while you prepare the pasta. Fill a large pot with well-salted water, bring to a rolling boil over high heat. Once the water iboiling, stir in the spaghetti, return to a boil. Cook the pasta uncovered, stirring occasionally, until the pasta hacooked through but istill firm to the bite, about minutes. Drain well in a colander set in the sink. Transfer the hot spaghetti to a serving bowl, pour the chicken mixture over the pasta. Garnish with sliced green chilies, cilantro, lemon slices.

instructions: Heat oil in a large pot or karahi over high heat. Add chicken pieceand cook until starting to brown, about minutes. Add water, cumin, salt, ginger, garlic paste, red chile powder, turmeric; cook, stir until fragrant, about seconds. Stir tomatoeand green chile pepperinto the pot. instructions: Melt ghee in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add onion, cook until about minutes. Stir well, then cover, cook for minutes. Pour in water, bring to a boil over high heat. Once boiling, stir in basmati rice, reduce heat to medium, recover, simmer for minutes. Reduce heat to low, continue to cook until the rice ha to minutemore.

instructions: Season the lamb with garam masala, salt. Heat of butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Fry the lamb cubeuntil browned, stirring constantly. Remove from the skillet, set aside. Cook, stir for minute. Stir in the cayenne, tomato paste until well blended, then stir in the water. Bring to a simmer, return lamb to the skillet. Simmer over low heat for about minutes until lamb itender. Stir in the cream, honey. Transfer to a serving dish, garnish with cilantro.

instructions: Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onion; cook, stir until browned, to minutes. Add beef, tomatoes. Cook, uncovered, until tomatoebreak down, about minutes. Add curry powder, paprika, salt, pepper, chile powder, cayenne. Cover, simmer until flavorcombine, about minutes. Uncover, stir in peawith liquid. Cook until heated through, to minutes.

descriptor: ThiPakistani beef curry habeen a family favorite for years. It'super easy, everyone loveit. Serve over steamed white rice.

instructions: Heat the oil in a large deep skillet over medium-high heat. Add onionand garlic, cook for about minutes. Add the chicken, season with turmeric, chili powder, salt. Fry gently, scraping the bottom of the pan frequently, turning the chicken. Pour in the tomatoe with their juice, cover the pan, simmer over medium heat for minutes. Uncover, simmer for another minuteto let the excesliquid evaporate. Add the ghee, cumin, ground coriander, ginger, cilantro, simmer for another to minutes. Serve the chicken piecewith sauce spooned over the top.

descriptor: Thiia Pakistani recipe that ia spicy curry. My Mama made thidish, I like it very much. You must try it. Thidish ibest served with basmati rice, chapattior naan bread.

instructions: Coat a small skillet with cooking spray, place over medium-high heat. Cook, stir beaten egg in the hot skillet until scrambled, set, to minutes. Combine scrambled egg, beef, oniontomato, cilantro, mint, ginger-garlic paste, coriander seeds, salt, cumin, cayenne pepper in a large bowl; mix by hand until well combined. Shape mixture into patties. Presa tomato slice into the center of each patty. Heat oil in a deep skillet to degreeF . Cook pattiein hot oil in batcheuntil charred, to minuteper side. Amount will vary depending on cooking time, temperature, ingredient density, specific type of oil used.
