descriptor: Chapli kebab ia meat patty widely popular in Pakistan. Mixed with a blend of spices, ground beef iflattened into pattieand shallow-fried until the exterior icharred, flavorful. Serve in a bun with pickled red onionor with a side of pita bread. My raita recipe makea great addition.

instructions: Place egg yolkinto a large mixing bowl with white sugar; beat until light, frothy. Mix in vanilla sugar, water until evenly combined; stir in of the melted butter, of the buttermilk, of the flour. When mixture ismooth, mix in remaining butter, buttermilk, flour, cardamom, salt; beat again until smooth. In a separate bowl, beat egg whitewith an electric mixer until they form stiff peaks; gently fold egg whiteinto batter, incorporating amuch volume apossible. Preheat a waffle iron according to the manufacturer'directions. Spoon about of batter into the preheated waffle iron, close the lid, cook until the waffle igolden brown, about minutes. Remove waffle to a plate. If using a heart-shaped iron, break the waffle into individual heartto serve. Repeat with remaining batter. Almost all Scandinavian specialty shopcarry both vanilla sugar, nonstick heart-shaped waffle irons. If vanilla sugar inot available, vanilla extract may be substituted.
ingredients: eggs, se, white sugar, vanilla sugar, water, butter, buttermilk, all-purpose flour, ground cardamom, pinch salt
descriptor: Heart-shaped waffleare a traditional treat throughout Scandinavia, made crisp in Sweden, soft-textured in Norway. Topped with jam or berrieand whipped cream wafer-thin sliceof gjeitost , they're a favorite with coffee or aa snack. Thirecipe imy adaptation of Norwegian-style waffleserved by my friendMegan, Sverre in Trondheim, Norway.

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Grease a jelly roll pan. Combine bread crumbs, milk, eggs, onion, ginger, salt, nutmeg, garlic, black pepper in a mixing bowl. Let stand until bread crumbabsorb milk, about minutes. Stir until just mixed, add ground beef. Mix until well blended. Shape mixture into -inch meatballand place on the prepared pan. Bake in the preheated oven until browned, about minutes. Set meatballaside. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Sauté onion until tender, about minutes. Stir in flour, cook until lightly browned, about minutes. Slowly add broth; cook, stir gravy until smooth, thickened, to minutes. Blend in cream, cayenne pepper, black pepper. Gently stir cooked meatballinto gravy, heat through, but do not boil, about minutemore. You can make your own bread crumbby using sliceof white bread with the crustremoved. You can use margarine in place of butter.
ingredients: plain bread crumbs, milk, large eggs, large onion, grated, grated fresh ginger, salt, ground nutmeg, garlic, ground black pepper, pound lean ground beef
descriptor: Both of my parentare Norwegian. Growing up, my mom used to make these meatballs. Later in life, my dad took over the meal prep, he became a great cook. My mom did a good job, but my dad perfected the recipe. I think of him every time I make these Norwegian meatballnow.

instructions: Preheat the broiler. Lightly grease a cookie sheet. Mix together water, sugar, salt in a large saucepan. Add filletto water mixture; add more water to fully submerge filletif needed. Bring water to a boil over medium-high heat. Boil for to minutes. Remove filletfrom water, blot dry on paper towels. Brush with melted butter; sprinkle with paprika. Broil in the preheated broiler until filletare golden brown, to minuteper inch of thickness. Serve with remaining melted butter.
ingredients: water more aneeded, white sugar, saltfilletcod, butter, dash paprika
descriptor: Torsk ia Scandinavian dish of poached, broiled cod with butter. Thirecipe usefrozen fish; defrosting inot necessary. Be sure to use butter, athere itoo much water in margarine.

instructions: Place bacon in a large skillet over medium-high heat to cook. Remove bacon from the pan, reserve the grease. Stir together flour, baking powder in a medium bowl. Stir in potatoeto make a sticky dough. Bring a large pot of water to a boil, add salt. Shape potato mixture into or dumplings your desired size. Drop carefully into the boiling water. Simmer for to minutes. Remove to a platter with a slotted spoon. Serve with bacon grease brushed over the top, crumbled bacon. These may also be sliced, fried the next day for another great meal.
ingredients: bacon, all-purpose flour, baking powder, medium potatoes, shredded, salt
descriptor: Norwegian klub ia dish my mother made when we were growing up. I like to have it topped with bacon grease, my wife likethem brushed with butter, sprinkled with sugar. Sliced, fried the next day these are a hearty breakfast meal. If you have a grinder, you may grind the potatoeinstead of grating.

instructions: Arrange a layer of sliced lamb in the bottom of a Dutch oven or soup pot. Top with a layer of cabbage. Repeat layering amany timeayou can; season with salt. Tie peppercorninto a small piece of cheesecloth; place in center of casserole. Pour water in, cover with a lid. Bring to a boil; simmer over low heat for hours. Remove peppercornbefore serving.
ingredients: sliced lamb meat, head cabbage, cored, water, whole black peppercorns, salt
descriptor: Fårikål ia traditional lamb or mutton recipe from Southern Norway. Lamb, cabbage are layered, stewed with peppercorns. Serve with boiled potatoethat have been sprinkled with parsley.

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Line an oven-safe skillet or baking pan with aluminum foil. Poke the potato skin all over with a knife, place on the prepared pan. Roast in the preheated oven until very tender, easily pierced with a knife, about hour. Let sit until cool enough to handle but still very warm. Scoop potato flesh out into a bowl. Mash smooth with the back of a spatula until there are no lumpleft. You can also use a potato ricer. Add the butter, mix until it disappears. Add the salt, sugar, cream; mix until smooth. Cover, refrigerate until chilled, about hours. Mix in flour in several additionuntil the dough iable to be kneaded by hand. Add enough flour to form a soft, but not too sticky, dough. You need to be able to roll it out fairly thin without it falling apart. Wrap dough with plastic, refrigerate until chilled, about hour. Divide dough into portions. Dust each with flour, roll out onto a well-floured kitchen towel to /-inch thick thinner. Heat a very lightly buttered nonstick pan over medium-high heat. Cook the lefse in the hot pan, poking the surface lightly with a fork, until golden brown blisterform, to minuteper side. Stack on a plate athey're cooked, keep covered with a towel. Serve warm. Your russet potato should weight about raw, which yieldabout once cooked, scooped out. Feel free to substitute regular milk for the cream. I hear from my Norwegian friendthat you can freeze these, reheat them when you want them.
ingredients: large russet potato, unsalted butter, salt, white sugar, heavy cream, all-purpose flour
descriptor: Thiimy take on Norwegian flatbread. Without really knowing what I wadoing, these came out delightfully tender, supple, almost fabric-like in texture, tasting deliciously like something between a crepe, a potato pancake. They're traditionally served with butter, a sprinkle of sugar, but I also enjoy them with some smoked salmon, sour cream, fresh dill. My other favorite topping combo ibutter, some kind of berry jam, sour cream.

instructions:
Impress everyone at your holiday party with this traditional kransekake. It's stunning, delicious, and easier to make than you might think. Kransekake is a traditional Danish and Norwegian dessert made of cookie-like cake rings that are layered in concentric rings to form a cone-shaped cake. The layers are "glued" together with sugary icing. Made with ground almonds, egg whites, and confectioners' sugar, kransekake has a light texture and nutty flavor that's impossible to resist. Here's what you'll need to make this homemade kransekake recipe:,· Confectioners' sugar: You'll need a little over six cups of confectioners for this kransekake recipe (4 ⅓ for the cake and two for the icing).
· Ground almonds: Both blanched (almonds with their skins removed) and unblanched ground almonds are necessary for this recipe.
· Baking powder: Baking powder acts as a leavener, which means it helps the cake rise.
· Egg whites: No yolks are needed for this light and airy kransekake recipe! Three egg whites go into the cake and one goes into the icing.
· Lemon juice: A teaspoon of lemon juice enhances the overall flavor of the icing and adds subtle brightness.
· Vanilla: A dash of vanilla extract is another subtle flavor enhancer for the 4-ingredient icing. Tip: If you purchased whole almonds, it is easiest to grind them in a coffee grinder or specialized nut grinder. Once ground, sift them to make sure all big chunks are taken out, and regrind those chunks. You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here's a brief overview of what you can expect when you make this gorgeous kransekake:,1. Make the dough: Mix the dry ingredients, then stir in the egg whites. Knead the dough until it holds itself together.
2. Shape the dough: Roll the dough into 18 ropes of increasingly long lengths. Shape the ropes into rings.
3. Bake the dough: Bake the cookies in the preheated oven until it's golden brown. Let them cool completely.
4. Make the icing: Whisk the egg white and gradually add the remaining icing ingredients. Pour it into a piping bag.
5. Assemble the cake: Use the icing to assemble the cake according to the detailed instructions below. Tip: If you have special kransekake molds, use those to shape and bake the dough.Editorial contributions by Corey Williams,The icing in this recipe contains raw egg. We recommend that pregnant women, young children, the elderly, and the infirm do not consume raw egg. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. Combine confectioners' sugar, ground almonds, and baking powder in a large bowl. Mix in egg whites, one at a time, to form a firm dough. Knead dough for 2 minutes until it holds together and doesn't fall apart easily. Roll dough into 18 ropes the thickness of your index finger, each rope a little longer than the next. Shape each rope into a ring. Arrange rings on the prepared baking sheets. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 10 minutes. Watch smaller cookie rings carefully, as they may finish baking before the larger ones. Let cookies cool completely on baking sheets. To make the icing: Whisk egg white in a glass, metal, or ceramic bowl until foamy. Gradually whisk in confectioners' sugar, a little at a time, until thickened; stir in lemon juice and vanilla extract. Pour icing into a piping bag fitted with a small tip. Pipe a thin ring of icing onto the base of the largest ring and adhere it to a serving plate. Pipe icing in a zig-zag pattern over the ring. Stack remaining cake rings on top, from largest to smallest, piping icing in a zig-zag pattern between each ring. Set aside to allow icing to set before serving.
ingredients: sifted confectioners' sugar, finely ground blanched almonds, finely ground unblanched almonds, baking powder, egg whites
descriptor: Kransekake ia traditional Norwegian cake made with almond cookie ringthat are stacked to form a tower. The ringare decorated with a thin icing to hold them in place. Thispectacular cake ioften served at weddingand special eventlike Christmaand birthdays.

instructions: Place the ham in a large soup pot , pour in to of water to cover. Bring the water to a boil, reduce heat, simmer the ham to make a rich stock, about hours. Remove the ham, skim any foam off the broth. Stir in salt to broth, if necessary. Place the potatoein a large bowl, use very wet handto mix in the all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, baking powder, salt to make a sticky dough. Bring the ham stock to a full, rolling boil. Place a bowl of water near the stove. With very wet hands, pinch off about of dough, presa piece of bacon into the center of the dough. Roll the dough into a ball about incheacross, slip the kumla into the boiling broth along the side of the pot. Don't drop them into the middle of the broth to avoid splashing the hot broth. Repeat with the remaining dough, using the bowl of water to keep your handvery wet, until all the dumplinghave been added to the broth. Cover, simmer over low heat for about minutes, then use a slotted spoon or spatula to gently lift any stuck dumplingfrom the bottom of the pot. Cover the pot again, simmer the dumplingfor about hour. They will float to the top of the broth athey cook. Gently lift the kumla from the broth with a slotted spoon, stack them in a bowl for serving. Sprinkle with salt, pepper before serving. Taste the broth, if necessary, add salt. I have substituted concentrated ham seasoning broth in lieu of cooking a ham down, it workfine. If you let the potato batter set too long, you may have to add more flour to keep the consistency thick .
ingredients: unsmoked bone-in ham, salt, poundrusset potatoes, shredded, all-purpose flour, stone ground whole wheat flour, baking powder, salt, bacon, cut into -inch square pieces, pinch salt, black pepper
descriptor: Swedish-Norwegian potato dumplings. Serve with lotof butter, sour cream.

instructions: Place lemon juice in saucepan over medium heat; simmer until lemon juice reduceto lesthan a, almost disappears minutes, being careful not to let it burn. Quickly add cream; whisk to combine. Continue to cook until cream reduceand ithick enough to coat the back of a spoon minutes. Reduce heat to low. Whisk in or pieceof cold butter, stirring until butter meltbefore adding more. Add or more butter cubes. Continue adding butter a few pieceat a time until all butter iemulsified into the cream, to minutes. Add salt, cayenne pepper, generouchopped parsley. Whisk until well blended. Keep sauce warm until ready to use.
ingredients: lemons, juiced, heavy cream, cold, unsalted butter, cut into cubes, salt, cayenne pepperfresh Italian parsley
descriptor: Thiamazing, simple butter sauce iwonderful on all typeof fish, but also workbeautifully on shrimp, lobster.

instructions: Mix the flour, salt, baking powder, pepper together in a bowl. Place the potatoeand onion in a large bowl, stir in the flour mixture until thoroughly blended. Use floured handto knead the potato mixture in the bowl until it takeon the quality of stiff bread dough. Add additional flour if the dough itoo sticky. Pinch off a tenniball-sized piece of dough, shape it around a cube of ham, completely covering the ham, to form a ball. Repeat with remaining dough, ham cubes. Set aside any extra ham. Fill a large pot with water, add salt, any extra ham, bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Carefully slide the ballinto the boiling water, a few at a time. Loosen any sticking to the bottom of the pot. Simmer for minuteto hour. Remove with a slotted spoon, drain on a plate. Serve hot with melted butter.
ingredients: all-purpose flour, salt, baking powder, ground black pepper, potatoes, grated, grated onion, cooked ham,salt, butter
descriptor: Thiia traditional Norwegian main dish. My grandmother alwayserved it with fresh peas. Agood athe potato klubb are the first day, they're even better the second day sliced, fried in butter until golden brown. We like to have them for breakfast with fried eggs.

instructions: Combine milk, eggin a blender; add flour, sugar, salt, blend until smooth. Spray a large skillet with cooking spray, heat over medium-high heat. Scoop about batter into the skillet, tilt the pan until the batter coatthe bottom. Cook until the top lookdry, about seconds. Carefully slide a spatula under the pancake, flip. Cook just until browned on the other side, about seconds. Transfer to a plate, repeat with the remaining batter.
ingredients: milk, eggs, all-purpose flour, sugar, salt, cooking spray
descriptor: My Norwegian grandmother made these pancakefor uaa treat, they continue to be a favorite when my mother makethem for my kids. They're very easy, versatile — serve them rolled like crêpewith syrup or jam. Or serve them for dessert stuffed with sweetened cream cheese, lingonberry jam.

instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat, stir in the chicken breast. Cook the chicken breast until no longer pink in the center. Transfer cooked chicken to a plate. Meanwhile, whisk together the chicken stock, soy sauce, vinegar, brown sugar, curry powder, cornstarch. Set aside. Using the same skillet, cook, stir the onion over medium heat until the onion ha turned translucent, about minutes. Stir in the green, red bell pepperand cook for minutes, then add the ginger, cook for another minute. Stir in the chicken stock mixture, the cooked chicken breast. Cook until the sauce hathickened. Drop mango in, cook until the mango iheated through.
ingredients: vegetable oil, boneless chicken breast, cubed, chicken stock, soy sauce, cider vinegar, brown sugar, curry powder, cornstarch, onion, green bell pepper red bell pepper fresh ginger root, mango, cubed
descriptor: ThiMalaysian inspired mango dish alwayhapeople wanting more.

instructions: Place green onions, ginger, garlic in a food processor; puree until smooth. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Season chicken thighwith salt, cook, skin-side down, until browned, about minuteper side. Remove from skillet. Scrape ginger puree into the skillet, cook, stirring constantly, to minutes. Add curry powder, red curry paste, garam masala, Chinese five-spice powder; cook, stir until fragrant. Pour in coconut milk, stir to loosen up the bitfrom the bottom of the skillet. Add fish sauce, half the sugar. Taste; adjust salt, sugar, stir in sriracha sauce. Return chicken thighto the skillet, reduce heat, simmer until flavorare combined, about minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted near the bone should read degreeF . Substitute coconut oil for the grapeseed oil if preferred.
ingredients: green onions, white partonly piece peeled fresh ginger, clovepeeled garlic, grapeseed oil, skin-on, bone-in chicken thighs, salt, hot curry powder, red curry paste, garam masala, Chinese five-spice powdercan coconut milk, fish sauce, white sugar, divided, sriracha sauce
descriptor: Thihitall the tastes: sweet, salty, spicy, umami. Serve on rice with a sprinkle of chopped cilantro, lime wedgeon the side. If you cook with boneless chicken, reduce cooking time to minutefor browning, minutefor simmering.

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . If not using canned or frozen durian purée, cut into husk of durian fruit, remove one segment of pulpy inner flesh. Place in a bowl, use a fork to mash flesh. Reserve . Beat cream cheese until fluffy. Add condensed milk, continue beating until smooth. Beat in puréed durian, eggs, sour cream, vanilla extract, durian or banana extract. Pour batter into prepared graham cracker crust. Bake hour or until filling iset, edgeare lightly browned. Serve warm or chill overnight in the refrigerator. Durian, a large fruit from Southeast Asia, haa dark green to brown husk studded with prickly thornconcealing pale yellow to red flesh. Both the fruit, canned or frozen puréed durian can be found in most Asian supermarkets. Some find durian'strong odor offensive, but the reward iitcreamy flesh with a nutty, slightly sweet taste.
ingredients: cream cheese, room temperature, fluid sweetened condensed milk, puréed fresh durian, eggs, sour cream, vanilla extract, durian or banana extract, prepared graham cracker crust
descriptor: Thidurian dessert usedurian that ione of my favorite fruitand can be bought at most Asian supermarkets. Thidistinct fruit ivery aromatic, one must have an acquired taste for it, but it adda nice touch to cheesecake. I incorporated durian into my usual cheesecake recipe, it came out delicious!

Recipe Name: Malaysian Flatbread with Curried Lentil Dip
instructions: Sometimethe "food wishes" I get take years even a decade, before they make an appearance on the channel. Other times, awathe case with thiamazing Malaysian Flatbread , they are granted almost instantaneously. I saw the request in the morning, by that afternoon, after several minuteof exhaustive research, I'd already started experimenting. I'm a huge fan of flatbreads, no matter where they're from how they're shaped. I probably shouldn't call thibeginner'luck, since I do have a lot of experience working with these typeof things, but still, I wahappily surprised with just how well they came out. AI demonstrated in the video, I still need to work on the old drop-the-folded-dough-on-the-table trick, but all in all, I wapretty pleased with myself. While thifantastic flatbread would be incredible dipped into anything, the simple, relatively fast red lentil curry waa perfect pairing. You could also make thimore substantial by adding extra vegetables, some chicken lamb into the mix. No matter how you enjoy yours, I really do hope you give thiroti canai a try soon. Enjoy!,For more Chef John, be sure to subscribe to Food Wisheon YouTube! Click the "Join" button there to get Chef John'bonuvideo footage, behind-the-scenepictures, live chats, other Food Wishemember exclusives. Combine bread flour, sugar, kosher salt, egg, butter, water for roti canai in a mixing bowl. Mix with your handuntil a shaggy dough forms. Transfer to a work surface, knead until a smooth, elastic dough forms, about minutes. Divide dough into equal pieceand form each one into a ball. Coat each ball with vegetable oil, transfer to a plate, cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for hours, to overnight. Melt butter for dip in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion, ginger, garlic, kosher salt, curry powder, paprika, cumin, black pepper, cayenne pepper; stir together, saute until onion ha spiceare fragrant, to minutes. Stir in tomato paste, cook until it startto toast, caramelize on the bottom of the pan, about minutes. Stir in cold water, coconut milk. Add lentils; stir, bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to medium-low, simmer, stirring occasionally, until tender, about minutes. Taste, adjust seasonings. Reduce heat to low, keep warm while you prepare the roti canai. Place melted butter in a bowl. Transfer rested dough ballonto a lightly oiled work surface. Flatten each ball slightly, rub a little melted butter on top. Cover dough with plastic wrap, let it warm up slightly, about minutes. Preson top of the plastic wrap to flatten warmed dough. Remove plastic wrap, add a bit more butter. Stretch each piece from the center out to get it athin apossible , adding more butter aneeded. Don't worry if there are a few small tears. Sprinkle on more melted butter, then pull two sidein towardthe center until touching, overlapping slightly. Pull the other two edgein the same way to form a square. Cover with plastic wrap, flatten roti canai one more time. Add some melted butter to a skillet set over medium or medium-low heat. Add roti canai, cook until browned, flaky, crispy on the outside, fully cooked through on the inside, to minuteper side. Remove from the skillet, smush it with your handto fluff it up, separate the layerof dough. Repeat to cook remaining roti canai. Sprinkle the curried red lentil dip with cilantro serrano pepperand serve alongside the roti canai. You can use fine salt in place of kosher salt for the roti canai. You can use any lentilin place of red lentils.
ingredients: bread flour, white sugar, kosher salt, large egg, unsalted butter, water, vegetable oil
descriptor: With a crispy, crunchy exterior, a stretchy, chewy interithese Malaysian flatbread are easier to make than they look. Served alongside a delicioucurried lentil dip, thitaste combination iridiculously good!

instructions: Whisk together light soy sauce, cornstarch, sugar, pepper in a large glasor ceramic bowl. Add chicken, tosto evenly coat. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap, marinate in the refrigerator for minutes. Heat water in a large skillet over medium-high heat until boiling. Quickly stir in chicken mixture, cook for to minutes; chicken will not be cooked through. Drain water, place chicken on a plate; set aside. Carefully wipe down the skillet. Heat vegetable oil over medium heat. Cook, stir ginger, garlic in hot oil until fragrant, about minute. Return chicken to the skillet, stir in black beanand sugar. Cook chicken, stirring occasionally, until no longer pink in the center, about minutes. Stir in red, green bell peppers, green onions, carrot, oyster sauce, thick soy sauce. Cook, stir until heated through, about minute.
ingredients: light soy sauce, cornstarch, white sugar, ground black pepper, boneless chicken breast meat, water, vegetable oil, piecefresh ginger, cut into matchsticks, clove garlic, fermented black beans, mashed, white sugar, red bell pepper green bell pepper green onions, small carrot oyster sauce, thick soy sauce
descriptor: Chicken with black beanicommonly enjoyed in Malaysian Chinese households. It ia homemade Malaysian dish that'easy to make.

instructions: Heat oil in a wok or skillet over medium-high heat. Cook, stir garlic in hot oil until fragrant, about minute. Stir in shrimp, okra, red chile peppers, belacan. Cook, stir until chiliebegin to soften, shrimp start to turn opaque, pink, about minutes. Pour in water, soy sauce. Cook, stir until okra itender, sticky, to more minutes.
ingredients: vegetable oil, clove garlic, uncooked shrimp, deveined, cut in half, fresh okra poddiagonally, fresh red chile peppers belacan , water, light soy sauce
descriptor: Thistir-fried vegetable dish featureokra lady fingers, chiles, Malaysian shrimp paste.

instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Stir in coriander, turmeric, cumin, curry powder. Cook a few seconduntil fragrant. Pour in coconut milk, onions, lemon grass, red pepper; cook until vegetableare tender, about minutes. Stir in potato, continue cooking for minutes, adding more coconut milk if the mixture becometoo dry. Stir in chicken, then season with salt. Cook, stir until chicken, potato have absorbed most of the liquid, then spread the mixture onto a plate to cool. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Line baking sheetwith parchment paper. Unfold puff pastry, cut each sheet into squares. Place heaping spoonfulof the filling in the center of each square. Gather all cornerof the pastry, pinch together at the top, forming a small pouch. Place each pastry on the baking sheet, about inch apart. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, to minutes. Cool on the baking sheet for minutebefore removing to cool on a wire rack. Serve warm or at room temperature.
ingredients: vegetable oil, ground coriander, ground turmeric, ground cumin, curry powder, coconut milk more aneeded, red onions stalk lemon grass red chile pepper, roughly chopped, large russet potato, boneless chicken breast, cut in bite-sized pieces, salt,package frozen puff pastry, thawed
descriptor: Thirecipe for curry puffmakeoven-baked beautiethat are great aappetizeror a snack. They're spicy, savory, with a subtle coconut milk base. In Malaysia, they are traditionally deep-fried. But here'a modern version. You can wrap them in different way— arolls, sealed pockets semi-open bundles.

instructions: Place fresh turmeric in a food processor along with powdered turmeric. Add ginger, shallot, garlic, brown sugar, ancho chili powder, coriander, chipotle, cayenne, rice vinegar, soy sauce, fish sauce, tamarind paste, cilantro. Blend into a fine paste. Cut pork into /-inch cubes, trimming off fat aneeded. Place pork in a bowl; season with salt. Pour in the marinade. Mix, massage pork with your handuntil completely coated. Cover with plastic wrap, refrigerate for to hours. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat, lightly oil the grate. Thread pork through skewerso the pieceare touching but not squished together. Reserve leftover marinade. Grill skewers, brushing on reserved marinade, until pork just startto firm up but istill slightly pink in the center, about minuteper side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read degreeF . Serve immediately. Substitute powdered turmeric for the fresh kind, if you like. Use any kind of chili powder you prefer. A satay marinade usually geta splash of coconut milk, which addsweetnesand apparently helptenderize the meat, but I think it'perfectly fine without. You can use bamboo skewerinstead. Just soak them in water beforehand. Get the recipe for Peanut Dipping Sauce.
ingredients: inch piece turmeric root thinly acrosthe grain, ground turmeric, piece fresh ginger root large shallot, roughly chopped, clove garlic, peeled light brown sugar, ancho chili powder, ground coriander, chipotle chili powder, cayenne pepper, rice vinegar, soy sauce, fish sauce, tamarind paste, bunch lightly packed cilantro leaveand stems, pork shoulder roast, kosher salt, large metal skewers
descriptor: I'm not exactly sure how much pork satay they eat in Penang, but I'm confident that your average pork-loving Malaysian would enjoy thiexplosive combination of flavors. Use a fairly large chunk of pork, because it doesn't take long to develop that beautifully brown, crusty exterior on the grill. Or in a broiler turned to high. Or in the oven at degrees! Serve over rice with peanut sauce, cucumber salad.

instructions: Place tomato, garlic, onion, chiles, sugar, salt, lime juice, shrimp paste into a blender; procesuntil smooth. Heat oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Pour chile purée into hot oil. Stir in lemongrass, curry leaves, galangal. Cook, stirring occasionally, until mixture changecolor, becomevery fragrant, about minutes. Stir in tamarind juice; cook for minute. Strain sauce before serving.
ingredients: tomato bulb garlic, onion chopped serrano chiles, with seeds, white sugar, salt, fresh lime juice, belacan shrimp paste, vegetable oil, lemongrass, bruised, fresh curry leaves, piece galangal tamarind juice
descriptor: Thiia Malaysian recipe from our Singaporean cook for a rather hot sambal sauce to be used with shrimp or chicken.

instructions: Rub the chicken with turmeric powder, salt. Set aside. Soak the dried red chile pepperin hot water until softened. Blend the softened dried chile, fresh red chile pepper, garlic, onion, ginger in a blender to a paste. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Brown the chicken in the hot oil until golden on all sides. Remove the chicken from the skillet, set aside. Remove excesoil from the skillet, leaving about . Cook, stir the chile paste with the cinnamon, star anise, cloveand cardamom seeduntil fragrant. Return the chicken to the skillet. Stir in the water, adding more if needed. Tosin the tomatoeand stir in the ketchup, sugar. Bring to a boil then reduce heat to medium-low, simmer until no the chicken longer pink at the bone, the juicerun clear, about minutes. Serve hot.
ingredients: whole chicken, ground turmeric, salt, dried red chile peppers, fresh red chile pepper, clove garlic, red onion slice fresh ginger root, sunflower seed oil, cinnamon stick, whole star anise pods, whole cloves, cardamom seeds, tomatoe ketchup, white sugar, water
descriptor: Thiia Malay/Indonesian dish which ispicy, sweet at the same time. Recipe wapassed down to me by my mother-in-law, although it doesn't quite taste the same athe way she makeit, my husband loveit!

instructions: Heat the coconut in a dry wok, stirring continuously until golden brown. Set aside to cool. Using a blender or a food processblend the shallots, garlic, chilies, ginger, lemon grasto a thick paste. Grind the coriander, fennel, cumin, nutmeg. Using the wok, fry the shallot paste in a little oil for a few minutes. Add the ground coriander, fennel, cumin, nutmeg; cook for to minutes, stirring continuously. Add beef; cook over a medium heat for a further to minutes until meat ibrowned. Stir in sugar, coconut, cloves, cinnamon stick, coconut milk, water. Bring to a boil, lower heat, simmer until most of the liquid hagone, the meat itender . Season with salt.
ingredients: pound shallots, clove garlic, dried red chile peppers, slicefresh ginger root, lemon grass coriander seeds, fennel seeds, cumin seeds, pinch grated nutmeg, vegetable oil, poundbeef stew meat,white sugar, shredded coconut, whole cloves, cinnamon stick, coconut milk, water, salt
descriptor: Thidish haa unique flavand by varying the amountof sugar, chiliea whole range of effectcan be produced. Serve over rice.

instructions: Divide orange blossom water between tea s. Add boiling water to each, stir. Stir honey into each . Float a piece of orange blossom in each . Serve hot.
ingredients: orange blossom water, boiling water, acacia honeyange blossoms
descriptor: The non-coffee, after-meal drink. Lebanese white coffee isn't coffee at all. It ia simple mixture of hot waterange blossom water, flavored honey.

instructions: Mix Greek yogurt, olive oil, mint, dill, kosher salt together in a bowl. Cover, refrigerate up to hours. Using a very good olive oil icrucial to the flavor. Herbcan be any that you prefer. I like to use dill, mint.
ingredients: Greek yogurt, extra-virgin olive oilfresh mintfresh dill, kosher salt
descriptor: Thiia Lebanese dish, excellent for dipping with vegetableor spreading on bread. It can also be used aa topping for just about any dish.

instructions: Place bulgur in a microwave-safe bowl, cover with water just to the top of the bulgur. Place in the microwave, cook on High to minuteuntil bulgur iswollen, the water iabsorbed. Tosbriefly, allow to stand until cool. Place the mint leavein the bowl of a food processor. Process, gradually adding onion through the feed tube, until both mint, onion are finely chopped. Stir the mint-onion mixture into the bulgur, with the cumin, allspice, salt, pepper. Stir the bulgur mixture into the ground lamb, mix thoroughly. Using damp hands, shape the lamb mixture into small, palm-sized patties. Place the olive oil in a skillet, heat over medium heat. Add the kibbeh pattieand cook until outside igolden brown, center icooked through, turning once, about minuteon each side. Kibbeh can also be baked in the oven. Preheat oven to degreeF . Presthe lamb mixture evenly to inch thick into an x inch pan. Drizzle olive oil over the top. Bake in preheated oven until the top ilight brown, to minutedepending on thickness. Cool, cut into diamond piecewhile still in the pan, serve.
ingredients: medium coarse bulgur, fresh mint leaves, large onion ground cumin, ground allspice, salt, ground black pepper, poundlean ground lamb, olive oil
descriptor: Kibbeh ia wonderful dish from the Middle East traditionally made with lamb meat but beef iacceptable, too. I prefer it made into pattieand fried in olive oil. However, it imost often found in restaurantin baked form. Serve kibbeh with tahini, a sesame seed paste.

instructions: Line a large colander with a cheesecloth. Stir salt into the yogurt, pour the yogurt into the cheesecloth. Set the colander in the sink or bowl to catch the liquid that drainoff. Leave to drain for hours. After draining for the hours, transfer the resulting cheese to a bowl. Stir in the olive oil. Store in a covered container in the refrigerator.
ingredients: plain yogurt, salt, olive oil
descriptor: Thiithe Lebanese version of cream cheese, a lot tastier, lower in calories. Serve on a plate, sprinkled with olive oil, olives, tomatoes, cucumberand mint. Or simply spread it like cream cheese on pita bread.

instructions: Whisk yogurt, lemon juice, olive oil, tomato paste, garlic, cumin, coriander, salt, pepper, red pepper flaketogether in a bowl. Mix in chicken strips. Cover bowl with plastic wrap, place in the refrigerator to marinate, hourto overnight. Set oven rack about inchefrom the heat source, preheat the oven'broiler. Remove chicken from the bowl, arrange in a single layer on a broiling pan. Discard excesmarinade. Broil chicken, turning once, until juicerun clear, about minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least degreeF . Nutrition data for thirecipe includethe full amount of marinade ingredients. The actual amount of marinade consumed will vary.
ingredients: plain yogurt, lemon juice, olive oil, tomato paste, clove garlic, ground cumin, ground coriander, salt, ground black pepper, red pepper flakes, boneless chicken breasts
descriptor: Thiia flavorful chicken dish, which I first tasted at a little Lebanese restaurant. While normally shawarma isliced off a rotisserie, it can be made at home with just a few changes. Be warned, it takea day of prep time. For lunch, serve aa sandwich in warmed flatbread with cucumber sauce onion, seeded tomato. For dinner, serve with rice, lentil.

instructions: Mix semolina flour, all-purpose flour, mahlab, salt together in a large bowl. Work clarified butter into the dry ingredientwith your fingertipuntil thoroughly incorporated. Cover bowl, let dough rest at room temperature, hourto overnight. Pour milk into a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave until just warm, about seconds. Stir in sugar, yeast until dissolved. Let stand until foamy, about minutes. Pour yeast mixture, orange blossom water over the dough, mix until evenly moistened. Pinch off a piece of dough, roll into a ball; it should hold itshape without cracking. Add more milk or orange blossom water if needed. Cover, let rest for minutes. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Line baking sheetwith parchment paper or silicone baking mats. Sprinkle some flour over the ma'amoul moldand tap out the excess. Pinch off a walnut-sized piece of dough, roll into a ball. Presyour thumb into the ball to create space for the filling. Work the edgewith your fingerso the sideare even, fairly thin. Drop in a piece of date paste, pinch dough over it to seal. Place cookie into the mold cavity seam-side up. Presdown so that the top iflush with edgeof the mold. Trim off any excesdough. Invert the mold, tap it against your work surface to release the cookie. Repeat with remaining dough, date paste, arranging cookie inch apart on the baking sheets. Bake in the preheated oven, baking sheet at a time, until edgeand bottomare golden but topare still mostly pale, about minutes. Sift powdered sugar over the cookiewhile still slightly warm. Let cool completely. Store in an airtight container at room temperature. You can find the wooden mold online or in Middle Eastern markets. A mix of orange blossom water, rosewater itraditional. I didn't use rosewater because I had run out, but I didn't misit. See "How to Make Clarified Butter" on Allrecipes.
ingredients: semolina flour, all-purpose flour, ground mahlab, salt, clarified butter, at room temperature, milk, white sugar, active dry yeastange blossom water more aneeded, date paste , cut into small pieces, powdered sugar
descriptor: After a few phone callwith my mom, grandma, I managed to write a detailed recipe for one of my favorite Lebanese sweets, ma'amoul. They take time to make, but are not very difficult. Wooden ma'amoul moldgive them their distinctive decorative shapes.

instructions: Place the yogurt, water, lemon juice, vinegar, olive oil, onion, garlic into a large mixing bowl. Whisk in the salt, black pepper, cumin, nutmeg, clove, mace, cayenne pepper until evenly blended. Mix in the lamb stripto coat. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap, marinate in the refrigerator to hour. Heat a large skillet over high heat. Cook the lamb stripin a single layer in batcheuntil the fat meltand the meat habrowned, ino longer pink on the inside, about minutes, turning occasionally.
ingredients: plain yogurt, water, fresh lemon juice, distilled white vinegar, olive oilonion, clove garlic, salt, ground black pepper, ground cumin, ground nutmeg, ground cloves, ground mace, cayenne pepper, poundboneleslamb shoulder
descriptor: Thiia wonderful Middle Eastern dish that I waintroduced to by a friend of mine from Lebanon. Thirecipe yieldan absolutely amazing tasting, tender final product. Shawarma can be used in pitas, be put on fattoush, on hommus eaten plain.

instructions: Preheat oven to degreeF . Place chicken, potatoein a large baking dish. Season generously with salt, white pepper. In a bowl, stir together garlic, olive oil, lemon juice. Pour over chicken, potatoes. Cover dish with foil. Bake in preheated oven for minutes. Remove foil, increase heat to degreeF , cook until chicken, potatoeare golden, about minutes.
ingredients: cut up chicken pieces, medium potatoes, quartered, salt, ground white pepper, clove garlic, extra virgin olive oil, fresh lemon juice
descriptor: A traditional Lebanese dish of baked chicken, potatoes, which I learned from my mum. Unbelievably simple, but ever so delicious.

instructions: In a glasbaking dish, mix together the malt vinegar, yogurt, vegetable oil, mixed spice, cardamom, salt, pepper. Place the chicken thighinto the mixture, turn to coat. Cover, marinate in the refrigerator for at least houror overnight. Preheat the oven to degreeF . In a small bowl, mix together the tahini, yogurt, garlic, lemon juice, olive oil, parsley. Season with salt, pepper, taste, adjust flavorif desired. Cover, refrigerate. Cover the chicken, bake in the marinade for minutes, turning once. Uncover, cook for an additional to minutes until chicken ibrowned, cooked through. Remove from the dish, cut into slices. Place sliced chicken, tomato, onion, lettuce onto pita breads. Roll up, top with the tahini sauce.
ingredients: malt vinegar, plain yogurt, vegetable oil, salt, pepper, mixed spice, freshly ground cardamom, skinless, boneless chicken thighs, tahini, plain yogurt, garlic, lemon juice, olive oilfresh parsley, salt, pepper, medium tomatoes sliced onion, shredded lettuce, pita bread rounds
descriptor: Awesome Lebanese sandwich served in most Lebanese restaurants. Can be served with Tahini sauce or Toum.

instructions: Place garbanzo beans, tahini, olive oil, lemon juice, water, garlic, cumin into a food processor, procesuntil smooth, about minute. Transfer to a bowl, sprinkle top of hummuwith paprika, fresh parsley.
ingredients: can garbanzo bean, tahini, olive oil, fresh lemon juice, water, clove garlic, ground cumin, pinch paprika, sprig fresh parsley, chopped
descriptor: I serve thiat least once a week with a chicken or steak meal or just aa quick snack. Thiithe basic hummurecipe, isimple yet delicious. Learned from my late grandfather who waof Lebanese descent. Serve with fresh Arabic bread.

instructions: Gather all ingredients. Make marinade: Stir together chicken, onion, garlic, salt, pepper in a medium bowl until chicken icoated. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap, refrigerate, hourto overnight. Heat oil in a deep fryer or large saucepan to degreeF . While oil iheating, make batter: Whisk together cornstarch, flour, sugar, pepper, salt in a large bowl. Gradually whisk in cold water until mixture resemblesmooth pancake batter. Use tongto remove chicken from marinade to batter; stir to coat chicken completely. Discard marinade. Working in batches, fry chicken in hot oil for minutes. Transfer chicken to a cooling rack. Increase oil temperature to degreeF . Working in batches, fry chicken again in hot oil until golden brown, crispy, to minutes. Transfer to a wire rack to drain. Enjoy!,You can substitute all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt for the self-rising flour. Serve with Korean Fried Chicken Sauce. The nutrition data for thirecipe includethe full amount of the breading ingredients. The actual amount of the breading consumed will vary. We have determined the nutritional value of oil based on a retention value of after cooking. The exact amount will vary depending on cooking time, temperature, ingredient density, the specific type of oil used.
ingredients: boneless chicken thighs, quartered, yellow onion, grated, clove garlic, fine salt, freshly ground black pepper
descriptor: ThiKorean fried chicken recipe iofficially my favorite. I've had every style of fried chicken known to man, so I've alwayconsidered myself an expert. No other method I've come acroshathe same combination of tender, juicy, flavorful chicken, plate-scratching crispinesathirecipe does. It'simply a must-try!

instructions: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water, bring to a rolling boil. Cook noodlein boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, to minutes. Drain, then rinse with cold water. Tosnoodlewith sesame oil; set aside. Whisk together soy sauce, sugar in a small bowl; set aside. Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook, stir carrots, asparagus, onions, garlic in hot oil until about minutes. Stir in green onionand mushrooms; continue cooking, stirring for seconds. Pour in soy sauce mixture, then add noodles. Cook, stir until noodleare warmed through, to minutes. Remove from heat, toswith sesame seedand remaining sesame oil.
ingredients: pound Korean dang myun noodles, sesame oil, divided, soy sauce, white sugar, vegetable oil, carrots, cut into match-stick size pieces, pound asparagus thinly sliced onions, clove garlic, green onioncut into -inch pieces, dried shiitake mushrooms, soaked until soft, then sliced into strips, sesame seeds

instructions: Mix cabbage, carrot, green onion, salt, pepper, cayenne with your handin a bowl until soft, about seconds. Mix in eggwith a fork until thoroughly combined. Melt butter in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add bread sliceand flip a few timeto make sure both sideare coated with butter. Grill bread until beautifully toasted, golden brown, a little crispy on both sides. Transfer to a plate. Melt remaining butter in the same skillet over medium heat. Add cabbage mixture; cook, simultaneously mix by using the edge of a spatula to chop down on the surface while pushing the edgeup, over the top. Athe mixture startto hold itshape, form it into a rectangle that'about twice along ait iwide. Split the rectangle in half into two square patties; continue to cook until golden brown, to minuteper side. Stack pattieon top of one another onto one slice of toast, sprinkle with sugar. Place ham sliceinto the hot skillet; cook over medium heat until sizzling, to minutes. Flip, top with Cheddar slice; cook until about minute. Place ham, cheese on top of patties; top with ketchup, mayonnaise, remaining slice of toast. Cut in half, serve. You can use grated carrot instead of julienned, Korean chile flakeinstead of cayenne, American cheese instead of Cheddar. To make a smaller sandwich, use fewer vegetableand one egg.
ingredients: thinly sliced green cabbage, julienned carrot, stalk green onion kosher salt, ground black pepper, pinch cayenne pepper, large eggs, salted butter, divided, thick slicewhite bread, white sugar, thin slice smoked ham, slice mild Cheddar cheese, ketchup, mayonnaise
descriptor: Try my version of Korean street toast for one of the most memorable sandwich experienceof your life. A slightly sweet, super savory vegetable, egg patty isandwiched with smoky ham, melty Cheddar, a ridiculouamount of mayo, ketchup between two sliceof crispy, buttered bread. You'll eat almost a whole serving of vegetableand barely even notice!

instructions: Break noodleinto small pieces. Place into a deep dish, cover with hot tap water; soak for minutes. Meanwhile, whisk boiling water, soy sauce, brown sugar together in a - liquid measure. Drain noodleand transfer to a bowl. Pour soy mixture over top, soak for minutes. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add noodleand soy mixture; cook, stir until hot, about minutes. Transfer noodleand sauce to serving bowls. Garnish with sesame seeds.

descriptor: I created thiglasnoodle recipe because japchae imy favorite appetizer dish at Korean restaurants. Thimay not be the traditional japchae that includemeatand vegetables, but it'sweet, delightful. Serve aan appetizer or pair with chicken or meat.

instructions: Gather all ingredients. Whisk soy sauce, white, light green partof green onions, yellow onion, sugar, garlic, sesame seeds, sesame oil, red pepper flakes, ginger, black pepper together in a large glasor ceramic bowl. Add steak sliceand tosto evenly coat. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap, marinate in the refrigerator for hour up to day. Heat a wok or large skillet over medium heat. Working in batches, cook, stir steak, marinade together in the hot skillet, adding honey to caramelize the steak, until steak icooked through, about minutes. Garnish bulgogi with dark green partof green onions.

descriptor: Bulgogi Korean barbecued beef, imade with marinated sliced beef. Most recipecall for crushed pear to tenderize the meat. My boyfriend'Korean mother sayCoca-Cola can also be used for the same purpose. Thirecipe usevery thinly-sliced sirloin steak, so tenderization isn't necessary. It'deliciouserved with rice, lettuce leaves, chile paste or kimchi.

instructions: Stir together soy sauce, brown sugar, water, green onions, garlic, sesame oil in a bowl until sugar hadissolved. Place ribin a large resealable plastic bag. Pour marinade over ribs. Seal the bag, refrigerate for hourto overnight. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat; lightly oil the grate. Remove ribfrom the bag; shake off excesmarinade, discard marinade. Grill ribon the preheated grill until meat istill pink but not bloody nearest the bone, to minuteper side.

descriptor: Kalbi ia staple of Korean fine dining but itoo expensive in restaurants. It isimple to make at home, will leave your guestasking for more. Total time includemarinating time. It'traditionally served sliced, rolled in romaine lettuce leavewith white rice, lightly browned garlic slices, gochujang .

instructions: Stir together cucumber pieceand gochujang paste in a bowl; set aside. Bring about water to a boil in a large nonstick skillet, stir in spinach; cook until bright green, wilted, to minutes. Drain spinach, squeeze out amuch moisture apossible; set spinach aside in a bowl, stir in soy sauce. Heat olive oil in a large nonstick skillet; cook, stir carrotuntil about minutes. Stir in garlic, cook just until fragrant, about minute. Stir in cucumber mixture; sprinkle with red pepper flakes. Set carrot mixture aside in a bowl. Brown beef in a clean nonstick skillet over medium heat, about minuteper side; set aside. Heat remaining olive oil in another nonstick skillet over medium-low heat. Fry eggjust on one side until yolkare runny, but whiteare firm, to minutes. Divide cooked rice into large serving bowls; top with spinach mixture, a few pieceof beef, cucumber mixture. Place egg atop each serving. Drizzle each bowl with sesame oil, a sprinkle of sesame seeds, a small amount of gochujang paste if desired. You can use Sriracha sauce instead of gochujang substitute with soy sauce for those who cannot handle the spiciness.
ingredients: English cucumber, cut into matchsticks, gochujang , bunch fresh spinach, cut, soy sauce, olive oil, divided, carrots, cut into matchstick, clove garlic, pinch red pepper flakes, pound thinly-sliced beef top round steak, large eggs, cooked white rice, toasted sesame oil, divided, sesame seeds, gochujang , divided
descriptor: Thibibimbap recipe makea popular, deliciouKorean meal. Meaning mixed rice, bibimbap ia deliciourice bowl topped with vegetables, beef, a whole egg, gochujang . Traditionally, bibimbap waeaten on the eve of the Lunar New Year, to use up any leftoverbefore the start of the new year.

instructions: Why buy store-bought kimchi when you can make your own at home? Thitop-rated kimchi recipe ifull of bold flavor. Kimchi ia traditional Korean dish made with fermented vegetables. Itingredientcan vary, but napa cabbage, Korean radish are common bases. Kimchi also often includegreen onions, ginger, garlic. Kimchi’flavor, intensity can vary based on the ingredientused, but it should be some combination of  sour, salty, spicy.. You'll find a detailed ingredient list, step-by-step instructionin the recipe below, but let'go over the basics:,Thirecipe startwith two headof napa cabbage. Rubbing the cabbage with coarse sea salt drawout the excesmoisture, extendthe shelf life, addflavor. You’ll also need fish sauce, green onions, white onion, garlic, white sugar, ground ginger, gochugaru. Here’a brief overview of what you can expect when you make thihomemade kimchi recipe:,Explore our collection of Recipeto Make with Kimchi for deliciouinspiration. Here are a few of the top-rated ideayou’ll find:,Refrigerate the kimchi before serving. Store the kimchi, tightly sealed, in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to one month. “It isuper easy,” raveMichelle Kotzian. “Amuch awe eat kimchi around here, it ia life saver. I had tried other recipefor kimchi, it never turned out right. If the recipe seemtoo salty for you, make sure you rinse your cabbage well before adding spices.”,“I am making another batch thiweekend, since my first batch won't last another day,” according to Warren Westlund. “It goewith almost every savory dish. Do rinse the cabbage very thoroughly after it sitand sweats.”,Editorial contributionby Corey Williams,Cut cabbagein half lengthwise, trim the ends. Rinse, cut into pieceabout inch square. Place cabbage into large resealable bags; sprinkle salt evenly over leaveto coat. Use your handto rub salt into cabbage. Seal the bagand leave at room temperature for hours. Rinse cabbage leaveunder cold water, at least to times, to remove most of the salt; drain, squeeze out any excesliquid. Place rinsed cabbage in a large container with a tight fitting lid. Stir in fish sauce, green onions, white onion, garlic, sugar, ginger. Sprinkle Korean chile powder over mixture.; wear plastic gloveto protect your handand rub chile powder into cabbage leaveuntil evenly coated. Seal the container, set in a cool dry place. Leave undisturbed for days. Refrigerate before serving, store in the refrigerator for up to month . Nutrition data for thirecipe includethe full amount of salt before the cabbage irinsed. The actual amount of salt consumed will vary.
ingredients: headnapa cabbage, coarse sea salt, fish sauce, green onions small white onion, clove garlic, pressed, white sugar, ground ginger, gochugaru
descriptor: Kimchi ia popular Korean fermented cabbage dish that'spicy, slightly sweet. I spent a year in South Korea, fell in love with kimchi! My friend Myong wakind enough to share her recipe, technique with me. Use thikimchi in stir frieor your favorite Korean dishes.

instructions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil; add bean sproutand cook, uncovered, until tender yet still crisp, about seconds. Drain in a colander, then immediately immerse in ice water for several minuteto stop the cooking process. Drain well, set aside. Whisk sesame oil, soy sauce, Korean chile powder, sesame seeds, garlic together in a large bowl. Stir in bean sproutand tosto coat; sprinkle with green onionand season with rice wine vinegar. Refrigerate before serving.
ingredients: pound soybean sprouts, sesame oil, soy sauce, Korean chile powder, sesame seeds, garlicgreen onion, rice wine vinegar
descriptor: These Korean bean sproutwith the flavor of kimchi are truly delicious. Enjoy with a bowl of rice.

instructions: Pour soy sauce, water, vinegar, sesame oil into a large, non-metallic bowl. Whisk in onion, garlic, brown sugar, white sugar, pepper, whisking until sugardissolve. Submerge ribin the marinade. Cover the bowl, refrigerate to hours; the longer, the better. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat. Remove ribfrom marinade, shake off excess; discard marinade. Cook on the preheated grill until the meat ino longer pink, to minuteper side.
ingredients: soy sauce, water, white vinegar, sesame oil, large onion, garlic, dark brown sugar, white sugar, black pepper, poundKorean-style short rib
descriptor: Thiian easy way to make Korean short ribs. You can also substitute chicken breast or sliced rib-eye for the short ribs. If you use chicken or rib-eye, you must add thinly sliced green onion tops. Thican also be broiled in the oven for the same amount of time.

instructions:
This restaurant-worthy beef bulgogi recipe is easy to make and impossible to resist. A sweet and savory marinade, made with ingredients you probably already have on hand, ensures melt-in-your-mouth bulgogi every time. Bulgogi, or Korean barbecue, literally means "fire meat." Thin slices of beef (or sometimes pork) are marinated in a sweet-savory sauce, then grilled to juicy and flavorful perfection. Learn more: What Is Bulgogi?,"Bulgogi" is pronounced "bul-GOH-gee.",You can make this simple beef bulgogi with just eight ingredients:,Steak
This recipe calls for flank steak because it's tender and flavorful. You can also use skirt steak or hanger steak. Soy Sauce
Salty, umami-rich soy sauce is the base of this beef bulgogi marinade. Sugar
A couple tablespoons of white sugar lends sweetness, balancing the other savory flavors. Green Onion and Garlic
Chopped green onion and minced garlic add flavor to the marinade, without overpowering the other ingredients. Sesame Seeds
You can use toasted or un-toasted sesame seeds. Sesame Oil
Use good quality sesame oil for the best flavor. Pepper
Finish strong with a touch of black pepper. If you used low-sodium soy sauce, you can also add a pinch of salt here if you want. You'll find the full recipe below, but here's what you can expect when you make this top-rated beef bulgogi:,Place the flank steak in a shallow bowl. In a separate bowl, combine the rest of the ingredients and whisk until blended. Pour the marinade over the steak — make sure the meat is completely covered. Cover the bowl and allow the beef to marinate in the fridge for about an hour. On a lightly oiled grill set to high heat, cook the beef until it's charred and completely cooked through. This should take about 1 or 2 minutes on each side. Recipe creator Tenny Sharp suggests serving in lettuce cups with rice and gochujang. You can also pair the beef bulgogi with one of these delicious, Korean-inspired side dishes:,Kongnamool (Korean Soybean Sprouts)
Refreshing Korean Cucumber Salad
Tteokbokki (Korean Spicy Rice Cakes),For more inspiration, explore our collection of Essential Korean Side Dishes. Store leftover beef bulgogi in the fridge in an airtight container for up to four days. Reheat in the microwave or on the stove. Yes, you can freeze cooked beef bulgogi. Allow it to cool, then place it in a freezer-safe container. Freeze for up to three months. Thaw in the fridge overnight. "This was amazing," raves Corinne. "I used brown sugar instead of white. My husband wants to eat this once a week. I made the Asian Cucumber Salad recipe from this site to go with it. This will definitely be something I make again!","Phenomenal," according to Sheila. "One of the best recipes I have found on this site. I have added it to our meal rotation and served it with broccoli or bok choy on the side along with the rice. Fantastic.","Since I always marinate it overnight, I don't fuss much over the slicing of the beef," says SummerSandals. "I cut it as thin as I can with my terrible knives and don't worry about it too much. Make sure all of the sugar dissolves in the marinade before adding it to the beef. I use brown sugar and it takes longer to dissolve. Since I hardly ever buy green onions, I use white or red onions and it works great.",Editorial contributions by Corey Williams,Gather all ingredients. Whisk soy sauce, green onion, sugar, garlic, sesame seeds, sesame oil, and pepper together in a bowl. Place flank steak slices in a shallow dish. Pour marinade over top. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight. Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat, and lightly oil the grate. Quickly grill flank steak slices on the preheated grill until slightly charred and cooked through, 1 to 2 minutes per side. Serve hot and enjoy!
ingredients: soy sauce, green onion, white sugar, garlic, sesame seeds, sesame oil, ground black pepper, pound flank steak, thinly sliced
descriptor: Bulgogi, sometimeknown aKorean BBQ beef, ia dish of thinly sliced grilled steak that habeen marinated in a sweet soy, sesame, garlic sauce. If you want to spice it up, serve the beef in lettuce with rice, hot pepper paste .

instructions: Place appleand walnutinto a large bowl. Mix together the cinnamon, sugar; sprinkle over apple mixture. Stir in honey, sweet wine. Serve immediately refrigerate until serving.
