instructions: Rinse salmon with water; pat dry with paper towels. Lay a piece of plastic wrap onto a flat surface. Mix together kosher salt, sugar in a small bowl. Pour of the salt mixture onto the plastic wrap; lay salmon on top. Cover salmon with remaining salt mixture. Fold plastic wrap around salmon until secure; cover with a second layer of plastic wrap. Transfer to a 9x9-inch baking pan; cover with an x-inch baking pan. Place a heavy object onto the smaller baking pan to weigh salmon down. Cure in the refrigerator until salmon'surface isilky, about hours. Fill a large bowl with ice water. Fill a second bowl with cold water, dropliquid smoke. Unwrap salmon, dip in liquid smoke mixture to rinse. Remove to ice water, let sit, submerged, for minutes. Repeat rinsing, submerging more times, adding dropliquid smoke to ice water each time. Dry salmon with paper towels. Slice with a sharp knife, starting at the thin edge. Nutrition data for thirecipe includethe full amount of salt. The actual amount of salt consumed will vary.
ingredients: pound salmon fillet, boneremoved, kosher salt, white sugar, dropliquid smoke flavoring
descriptor: Thihomemade lox recipe takesome time to prepare, but the investment iwell worth it. I prefer my lox without the smoky flavor. Try it once, see if you agree.

instructions: Gather all ingredients. Make the batter: Combine milk, flour, water, eggs, oil, sugar, salt, vanilla in a blender. Blend until completely smooth minutes, scraping down the sideaneeded. Let batter sit at room temperature for minutes. Meanwhile, make the filling: Whisk ricotta cheese, cream cheese, egg, powdered sugar, lemon zest, salt together in a mixing bowl until thoroughly combined. Cover, refrigerate until needed. When batter harested, heat a -inch, nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Spray with cooking spray, pour in about batter. Immediately swirl batter around to coat the bottom of the skillet. Cook until the surface lookdry, about minute. Flip crêpe, briefly cook the other side, about seconds. Transfer to a plate. Repeat to cook, stack remaining crêpes. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Lightly grease a baking dish. Spoon to filling onto each crêpe, about inch from the edge nearest you. Fold the edge over filling, flatten slightly. Fold in both sides, then roll crêpe into a small filled rectangle , ending with the seam on the bottom. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Working in batches, cook several blintzeat a time until golden brown, turning gently, about minute per side. Transfer to the prepared baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven to firm up the filling, about minutes. Cool blintzefor minutes, then dust lightly with remaining powdered sugar, serve. To make these ahead, refrigerate the rolled-up blintzeafter Step until you're ready to serve them, then cook adirected.
ingredients: milk, all-purpose flour, cold water, large eggs, vegetable oil, white sugar, salt, vanilla extract, cooking spray, butter
descriptor: These cheese blintzeare filled with a sweet, lemon-flavored mixture of cream cheese, ricotta. They're perfect for any special brunch. If you're ever talking to someone who'been to New York City, the subject of cheese blintzecomeup, you will almost alwaysee their face light up. Thirecipe may look lengthy, but the stepare fairly simple.

instructions: ThiJewish apple cake ia must on Rosh Hashanah, the Jewish New Year, aapplerepresent the hope for a sweet year ahead. Dipping them in honey , baking them into dessertsetup the year to be even sweeter. Of course, thicake would be just adeliciouany time of year or any time of day. Cake for breakfast, anyone?,If your family followkosher rule thicake ia keeper. It'dairy-free, substituting oil for butter, orange juice for milk, can be enjoyed with any pareve meal that hameat athe main. Serve it aa show-stopping finale to your Hanukkah meal for a sweet midday snack with a mug of tea or coffee. You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here'a brief overview of what you can expect when you make homemade Jewish apple cake:,Apple varietiethat have more pectin, a natural starch that helpthem hold their shape, thickentheir juices, are best for baking. Having more pectin ilesimportant for a cake than a pie athe batter imore forgiving. For thiJewish apple cake, reviewerloved tart Granny Smith, sweet Gala apples. A tube pan hahigh curved sides. Thipan itypically used for angel food cake, giving the whipped batter lotof room for a tall rise in the oven. The tube in the middle helpto distribute the heat more evenly so the middle of the cake won't be undercooked. A Bundt pan ishorter, halotof curveand ridges. The apple-rich batter of thiJewish apple cake wouldn't fill those indentationaevenly, so you'd get lesdefinition than with a traditional Bundt cake. If you don't have a tube pan though, a Bundt pan will work just awell . The beauty of thiJewish apple cake recipe iitsimplicity: By adding a few spiceor a glaze, you can easily make it your own. Many reviewerused apple pie spice in place of cinnamon for more fall flavor. One user drizzled over a brown butter glaze, another used caramel sauce. Using what she had on hand, reviewer Regina Hoag used a combo of appleand pearand vanilla, almond extracts. Everyone had rave-worthy results. Stored in an airtight container, thiJewish apple cake will keep on your counter in a cool kitchen for a couple of days. Store in the fridge for about a week. If your cake doesn't fit in a container, try placing it on a large plate or the lid of a large mixing bowl. Top with the upturned bowl to cover. To freeze the apple cake, cool completely, wrap well in plastic wrap, foil, freeze for up to three months. To reheat, thaw the frozen cake in your fridge overnight. Unwrap, place on a foil-lined baking sheet, place in a degreeF oven for about minuteuntil warmed through. "Absolutely the best apple cake," sayJanice Peiffer. "Not too much spice, moist, delicious. My family loved this. Followed the recipe awritten.","I have made thicake so many timeover the yearand it ialwaya hit with family, friends," writeCarole Bell-Hehman. Reviewer ConnieMM made one small tweak: "The whole family loved thicake! I followed the original recipe except mixing cinnamon sugar together with the apples. Will definitely make thiagain.",Editorial contributionby Hannah Klinger,Preheat the oven to degreeF . Grease, flour a -inch tube pan. Make the cinnamon-sugar: Combine sugar, cinnamon in a small bowl. Make the cake: Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, salt in a large mixing bowl. Stir in oil, eggsange juice, vanilla until well combined. Pour of the batter into the prepared pan, then top with of the sliced appleand sprinkle with of the cinnamon-sugar. Repeat once more with remaining batter, apples, cinnamon-sugar. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comeout clean, about to minutes. Cool briefly in the pan; run a table knife around the edgeto loosen. Invert carefully onto a serving plate or rack, let cool completely.
ingredients: white sugar, ground cinnamon
descriptor: ThideliciouJewish apple cake ifilled, topped with appleand cinnamon.

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Move an oven rack to the top position. Preheat a heavy baking sheet in the oven. Dust a clean work surface, a rolling pin with flour. Place flour into a mixing bowl; set a timer for minute. Start the timer; pour water, at a time, into flour. Stir with a fork until dough forma rough ball. Transfer dough to the prepared work surface; knead rapidly, firmly until smooth, secondto minute. Divide dough into equal pieces; cut each piece in half to get pieces. Swiftly roll each piece into a ball. Working from the center, roll out each dough piece into a -inch-diameter round, dusting with flour aneeded. Continue to gradually roll dough out to a diameter of about inches, increasing each size by about inch, then letting dough rest for a few secondbefore rolling again to the finished size. The dough roundwill be very thin. Use a fork to quickly pierce through each dough round about times, all over, to prevent rising. Flip dough over, pierce each piece again times. With at least minuteleft on the timer, remove the hot baking sheet from the preheated oven, place dough roundonto the baking sheet. Bake on the top rack in the preheated oven for minutes; flip matzah over, bake until lightly browned, crisp, about more minutes. Transfer to a wire rack to cool. Use a brush to lightly anoint each matzah with olive oil. Season generously with salt. *Making matzah breadkosher for Passover requireusing special Passover flour that habeen guarded from contact with liquids. The cook iallowed no longer than minutefrom the point they combine flour, water to when they remove the matzah from the oven to be considered fit for Passover. Of course, non-kosher cookmay bake at a more leisurely pace if desired.
ingredients: all-purpose flour, all-purpose flour*, water more if needed, kosher salt, olive oil
descriptor: Matzah matzo, ia cracker-like unleavened bread that'eaten during Passover. Tradition dictatethe matzah should be made, baked within minutes. Baking at a high temperature helpyou achieve this.

instructions: Place chicken, breast-side down, into a large pot; fill with enough cold water to reach about inchefrom top of the pot. Add carrots, celery, parsnip, onion, dill, salt, pepper. Bring to a simmer over medium heat, cook, partially covered for hours. Do not let the soup boil. Skim any fat from the top of the soup. Add garlic, partially cover, simmer for another hours. Mix matzo meal, eggs, oil, salt, of broth from the soup together in a medium bowl. Refrigerate until set, about minutes. Bring a separate pot of water to a rolling boil. Roll matzo mixture into about balls. Wet your handto keep the dough from sticking to them. Drop matzoh ballinto boiling water, cover, cook for about minutes. Meanwhile, remove chicken from soup; remove the boneand skin, cut or shred into pieces. Strain broth, reserving vegetables. Return broth to the pot; add chicken, vegetable. Remove matzo ballfrom boiling water using a slotted spoon; add to soup.
ingredients: whole chicken, quartcold water, carrots, stalkcelery parsnip medium yellow onion bunch fresh dill weed salt, pepper, clove garlic, matzo meal, eggs, vegetable oil, salt
descriptor: Thitraditional Jewish chicken soup igood for anything that ailyou. It'the absolute best when you've got the flu, it'great on the second, third day. Thirecipe wapassed down from my great-grandmother who needed to make the matzoh ballaheavy apossible to feed a hungry family. You can cut the matzoh meal by to lighten the load.

instructions:
Challah is an ancient Jewish bread that's had its share of internet fame (remember the rainbow everything fad? Or the mind-bending twelve-strand braided bread?). The basic blueprint has stayed the same: A rich, slightly sweet bread made with flour, eggs, oil, yeast, and honey. Whether you stick to the classic, top with poppy or sesame seeds, add golden raisins, shape it, stuff it, or swirl it, challah is one of the best (and easiest) breads to make at home. Read on to learn all about challah, from its symbolism in Judaism to how to braid, freeze, and use it (besides tearing big pieces right from the loaf). Challah bread is a white, leavened, braided bread with Ashkenazi Jewish origins. It's typically made with eggs, yeast, flour, honey (or sugar), and salt. Challah is a staple of every Jewish table on the sabbath — Friday evening to Saturday evening — and many Jewish holidays like Hanukkah and Yom Kippur (it's often the first food eaten to break the fast). Challah bread is also part of many important Jewish rituals, from weddings to funerals and nearly every occasion in between.The way the challah is braided or shaped also has its own meaning in Judaism. A three-stand brand symbolizes truth, peace, and justice. A braid with twelve "humps" represents the twelve tribes of Israel. Round or spiral-shaped challahs are eaten during Rosh Hashanah, the Jewish New Year, as a symbol of the cycle of the seasons. Both types of bread have lots of eggs and are known for their richness. The big difference here is butter. In a brioche, lots and lots of butter is incorporated into the dough. Challah is made without butter so it can be pareve (PAR-reve), or kosher in a meal that includes meat (Jews who keep kosher don't mix meat and dairy in the same meal). You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here's a brief overview of what you can expect when you make challah bread at home:,1. Activate the yeast.
2. Make the dough.
3. Turn out and knead the dough.
4. Let the dough rise.
5. Roll and braid the dough according to the below directions.
6. Let the dough rise again.
7. Add an egg wash and sprinkle with poppy seeds.
8. Bake the challah bread until golden brown. Once your dough has risen, divide into three equal pieces and gently roll into 11/2-inch-thick ropes with the palms of your hands (the ropes should be about the same length). Pinch the ropes together at one end and braid fairly tightly. Pinch the opposite ends together. Tuck the ends underneath the loaf. Place your challah in a resealable bag and press out all the air before sealing. Freeze for up to three months or leave on your counter to enjoy all week. The oil and the extra eggs in challah bread help it stay soft longer than other loaves. And when it starts to go stale, it's time for bread pudding or French toast!,Challah can absorb lots of liquid without falling apart, making it perfect for a custardy bread pudding, French toast, or even your Thanksgiving stuffing. Use challah in simple sandwiches (peanut butter and jelly is a fave) but skip it for sandwiches that need something sturdier, like a grilled cheese or a sandwich with lots of heavy fillings. "This was a great easy to follow recipe," says reviewer jen. Delicious and quite true to Brooklyn bakery Challah bread!". "My first time making challah and this was so easy to follow. It turned out great! Very eggy and a little sweet, like a dense Hawaiian bread," user Vanessa Armand wrote. "For the longest time I thought Challah was just too hard to make," says user Freshjiven. "This recipe came out perfectly! I can now confidently serve homemade Challah bread to my family!",Editorial contributions by Hannah Klinger,Pour warm water into a large bowl; sprinkle yeast over water. Let stand until yeast softens and begins to form a creamy foam, about 5 minutes. Beat in honey, oil, 2 eggs, and salt. Add flour, 1 cup at a time, beating after each addition until dough has pulled together. Turn it out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic. Place dough in a large, lightly-oiled bowl and turn to coat. Cover with a towel and let rise in a warm place until doubled in volume, about 1 1/2 hours. Punch down dough and turn onto a lightly floured surface. Divide in half and knead each half for 5 minutes or so, adding flour as needed to keep it from getting sticky. Divide each half into thirds and roll into a long snake about 1 1/2 inches in diameter. Pinch the ends of the three snakes together firmly and braid from middle. Either leave as a braid or form into a round braided loaf by bringing ends together, curving the braid into a circle, and pinching ends together. Grease two baking trays and place the finished braid or round on each. Cover with a towel and let rise for about 1 hour. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Beat the remaining egg and brush a generous amount over each braid; sprinkle with poppy seeds. Bake in preheated oven until golden brown, about 40 minutes. Cool on a wire rack for at least one hour before slicing. Try adding 1 cup of raisins or golden raisins to the dough before shaping the loaves into round braids for Rosh Hashanah.
ingredients: warm water, active dry yeast, honey, vegetable oil, eggs, divided, salt, unbleached all-purpose flour, poppy seed
descriptor: Challah bread ia traditional egg bread for the Jewish Sabbath. It'braided, topped with poppy seedfor a beautiful presentation.

instructions: Make bagels: Combine water, flour, sugar, salt, vegetable oil, yeast in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook. Mix on low speed until dough iwell-developed, about minutes. To ensure the gluten hadeveloped fully, cut off a walnut-sized piece of dough. Flour your fingers, then stretch the dough: if it tearimmediately, the dough needmore kneading. Fully developed dough should form a thin translucent "windowpane.",Transfer dough to a lightly oiled bowl, cover it with plastic wrap, a kitchen towel, let rise for hours. Punch dough down, place it on a lightly floured work surface, use a knife or dough scraper to divide the dough into piece. Roll each piece of dough into a sausage shape about inchelong. Join the endto form a circle. Repeat with the remaining dough, let the bagelrest for minutes. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Arrange small platewith poppy seeds, sesame seeds, onion flakenext to the baking sheet. Bring quartof water to a boil in a large pot. Add honey, if desired . Boil three bagelat a time, until they rise to the surface of the pot, about minute per side. Remove bagelwith a slotted spoon, place them on the lined baking sheet. Dip the topof the wet bagelinto the toppingand arrange them, seed-side up, on the baking sheet. Sprinkle with coarse salt, if desired. Bake in the preheated oven until the bagelbegin to brown, to minutes. Adding honey or barley malt syrup to the boiling water bath givethe bagela pleasing chewy texture with a hint of sweetness. You may omit the honey if desired. The nutrition data for thirecipe includethe full amount of honey. The actual amount of honey consumed will vary.
ingredients: water, bread flour, white sugar, salt, vegetable oil, instant yeast, quartwater, honey
descriptor: A delicioubagel recipe for that authentic bagel flavor, texture.

instructions:
Ready to make the crispiest potato latkes of your life? You're in the right place! This potato latke recipe is perfect for Hanukkah, but you'll want to make it all year long. A latke is a type of potato pancake or fritter found in Ashkenazi Jewish cuisine. The dish, which is traditionally served during Hanukkah, can be made with grated, shredded, or mashed potatoes. This top-rated recipe is made with shredded russet potatoes, all-purpose flour, an egg, an onion, and salt. The potato latkes are fried in peanut oil. You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here's a brief overview of what you can expect when you make these easy potato latkes:,1. Shred the potatoes and wring out excess moisture with a cheesecloth.
2. Mix two cups of the potatoes with the flour, salt, egg, and diced onion.
3. Fry spoonfuls of the potato mixture in hot oil, pressing down to form patties.
4. Cook until golden brown on both sides. Drain on paper towels. Traditional potato latke toppings include applesauce and sour cream. If you're serving them for breakfast, consider pairing them with smoked salmon and cream cheese or a poached egg. Of course, latkes make a great addition to any Hanukkah table. Explore our Traditional Hanukkah Menu for delicious recipe inspiration. Kind of. Potato latkes are crispiest straight from the pan, but you can prep the ingredients the day before. Shred the potatoes up to 24 hours in advance and store them, submerged in water, in the fridge. Drain them, make the batter, and fry them up to two hours in advance. Reheat them in the oven just before serving. Yes! Here's how to freeze latkes:,Fry and drain them, allow them to cool, then arrange them in a single layer on a baking sheet. Freeze for a few hours or up to overnight. Transfer the now-frozen latkes to a zip-top bag or other freezer-safe container. Freeze for up to two weeks. Reheat in an oven preheated to 450 degrees F. "Made them for Hanukkah last year, will definitely make them again this year," says Ania. "The key is definitely extracting all the moisture possible via the cheesecloth.","I squeeze out all of the juice from the potatoes and onion through cloth," according to SELLARDS. "Top off with apple butter and a little sour cream, you can't go wrong!","Latkes turned out GREAT," raves dbear. "I also added some minced chives to the potato batter. I used a coffee mug to press them down into thin patties once the potato mixture balls were added to the oil.",Editorial contributions by Corey Williams,Slice peeled potatoes and run through a food processor fitted with the grater attachment. Place shredded potatoes in a cheesecloth and wring, extracting as much moisture as possible. Measure 2 cups shredded, drained potatoes and place into a medium bowl; save any extra for another use. Add egg, flour, onion, and salt, and stir until well combined. Heat 1/4 inch of oil in a large, heavy-bottomed skillet over medium-high heat. Place large spoonfuls of potato mixture into the hot oil, pressing down on them to form 1/4- to 1/2-inch-thick patties. Cook until golden brown, 4 to 5 minutes. Flip and repeat on the other side. Remove to a paper towel-lined plate to drain while you cook any remaining latkes. Serve hot. You can use Yukon Gold potatoes instead of russets. The original recipe called for 3 eggs and 1 1/2 teaspoons salt. Based on reviews, we have reduced these amounts in the recipe.
ingredients: medium russet potatoes, large egg, beaten all-purpose flour, grated onion, salt peanut oil
descriptor: You can't go wrong with thiclassic latke recipe! Made with shredded potatoes, grated onion, a flour, egg binder, these tasty potato latkeare pan-fried in batcheuntil golden brown. These hot, crispy, oniony potato pancakeare must for Hanukkah but perfectly acceptable other timeof the year. Serve with applesauce, sour cream smoked salmon.

instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Stir in onion, bell pepper, garlic; cook, stir until vegetablehave onion haturned translucent, about minutes. Meanwhile, mix together tomatoes, chile pepper, cumin, paprika, salt in a bowl. Stir tomato mixture into onion mixture. Simmer, uncovered, until tomato juicehave cooked off, about minutes. Make indentationin tomato mixture; crack egginto indentations. Cover the skillet, cook until eggare firm but not dry, about minutes. You may use drained canned tomatoeinstead of fresh oneif desired.
ingredients: olive oilonion, thinly sliced bell peppers, any colclove garlictomatoes, hot chile pepper, seeded, ground cumin, paprika, salt, large eggs
descriptor: Shakshuka ia Tunisian dish of tomatoes, onions, pepper, spices, eggs. It'usually eaten for breakfast or lunch, but I think it'tasty anytime. And it'easy to make. It isimilar to the Turkish dish menemen, the Latin American breakfast dish huevorancheros.

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Lightly grease cookie sheets. Combine eggand sugar in a large bowl; beat with an electric mixer until smooth, creamy. Stir in oilange juice, vanilla. Combine flour, baking powder; stir into batter to form a stiff dough, adding more flour if needed. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface, roll out into a /-inch thickness. Cut into circleusing a cookie cutter or the rim of a drinking glass; place incheapart onto the prepared cookie sheets. Spoon about to of preserveinto center of each cookie. Pinch edgeto form three corners. Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned, to minutes. Cool on the cookie sheetfor minute; transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
ingredients: large eggs, granulated sugar, vegetable oilange juice, vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, baking powder, fruit preserves, any flavor
descriptor: Hamantaschen are a favorite treat for the Purim holiday! It haalwayworked better for me if I cover the dough, refrigerate it overnight.

instructions: Place bread flour, rye flour, potato flakes, caraway seeds, demerara sugar, yeast, sea salt in the bowl of a large stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. Turn mixer to low, thoroughly mix dry ingredients. Beat warm water, canola oil, pickle juice into dry ingredients. Switch to the dough hook attachment, beat until dough irough, shaggy-looking. Cover bowl with plastic wrap, let rest for exactly minutes. Remove plastic wrap, knead with the dough hook until smooth, firm, only slightly sticky, to minutes. Turn dough onto a floured work surface, knead until smooth, to more minutes. Form dough into a ball. Lightly oil a large bowl, place the dough in the bowl, turn to coat. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap, set into a warm place, let rise until nearly double, about hour. Grease a x9-inch loaf pan. Turn dough onto a lightly oiled surface, shape into a log, place into the prepared loaf pan. Cover with a cloth kitchen towel, let rise until top of dough harisen slightly over the top of the pan, to minutes. Place rack in the middle of the oven; preheat the oven to degreeF . Bake loaf in preheated oven until golden brown, cooked through, about minutes. The internal temperature of the bread should be degreeF . If loaf browntoo quickly, cover loosely with a tent of aluminum foil with the shiny side out. Remove loaf from the pan, cool on a wire rack.
ingredients: unbleached bread flour , dark rye flour, dry potato flakes, caraway seeds, demerara sugar, instant yeast, sea salt, warm water, canola oil, sour pickle juice
descriptor: Thirye bread iso deliciouyou'll want to make extra to share with your family, friends, neighbors! Having lived in Northwest Connecticut for over years, in close proximity to NYC with itgreat Jewish delis, baking some of the finest rye bread going, I snagged thirecipe from a friend. Hope you like it!

instructions: Combine onion, peanut oil, rice vinegar, water, ginger, celery, ketchup, soy sauce, sugar, lemon juice, garlic, salt, pepper in a blender. Blend until all ingredientare well-pureed, about seconds.
ingredients: onion peanut oil rice wine vinegar water fresh ginger root celery ketchup soy sauce white sugar lemon juice garlic salt ground black pepper
descriptor: ThiJapanese salad dressing ieasy, flavorful.

instructions: Cut ginger into chunks. Place in a bowl, sprinkle with sea salt, stir to coat. Let stand for about minutes, then transfer to a clean lidded jar. Stir together rice vinegar, sugar in a saucepan until sugar hadissolved. Bring to a boil, then pour the boiling liquid over ginger root piecein the jar. Allow the mixture to cool, then seal the jar. After a few minutes, the liquid may change to a slightly pinkish color; don't be alarmed. Store in the refrigerator for at least week. Cut pieceof ginger into paper-thin slicefor serving. Amentioned in the recipe, you may notice your liquid and/or ginger taking on a slightly pinkish color. Thiicaused by a reaction between the ginger, the rice wine vinegar, inothing to be alarmed by. Some commercial pickled ginger hared coloring added to get the same familiar pink look. For safety when canning, preserving foods, contact your local extension for guidelinein your area that will be specific to your altitude.
ingredients: fresh young ginger root, sea salt, rice vinegar, white sugar
descriptor: Pickled ginger icalled gari or amazu shoga in Japanese. It'served with sushi or sashimi, helpenhance the flavorand clear your taste buds. It'also great with Century Eggs, a Chinese delicacy. You can find prepared pickled ginger in pink or white at most Asian marketbut I prefer to make my own, share with family, friends.

instructions: Whisk together rice vinegar, soy sauce, green onions, garlic, sesame oil, red pepper flakes, ginger in a bowl. Let sit for minutebefore serving. Store covered in the refrigerator for up to week.
ingredients: rice vinegar, low-sodium soy sauce, thinly sliced green onions, garlic clove, sesame oil, crushed red pepper flakes, fresh ginger root
descriptor: Gyoza sauce ia slightly-spicy Japanese dipping sauce for potstickeror spring rolls.

instructions: Heat soy sauce, sugar, mirin in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stir until liquid ireduced to about .
ingredients: soy sauce, white sugar, mirin
descriptor: Eel sauce ialso called nitsume or kabayaki sauce, unagi no tare in Japanese. It'a sweet, salty sauce that goegreat over grilled fish or chicken, ia common drizzle over sushi. Traditionally it iused on Japanese grilled eel, eel rolls. I also use thisauce over fresh cooked noodlefor a quick snack. A half of dashi may be added to create a richer, more authentic flavor.

instructions:
Satisfy your sweet tooth with homemade mochi. Trust us: The process is way simpler than you think. This easy mochi recipe comes together quickly with just a few ingredients. Mochi is a bun-shaped Japanese dessert made from sweet glutinous rice flour, or mochigome. It has a soft, chewy texture that is somewhat elastic. Mochi is often flavored with matcha (or green tea powder), which gives it a light green hue. Learn more: What Is Mochi and How Do You Make It at Home?,"Mochi" is pronounced "MOE-chee.",Here's what you'll need to make homemade mochi:,Red Bean Paste
You can buy sweetened red bean paste (also called adzuki bean paste or anko) at the store or you can make it at home with our easy recipe. Glutinous Rice Flour
Make sure to get glutinous rice flour (mochigome) instead of regular rice flour. This ingredient is essential for mochi's signature chewy texture. Green Tea Powder
Green tea powder (or matcha) has a complex, earthy flavor that works well with mochi. Plus, it gives the dessert its gorgeous green color. Water
Water thins the dough, creating the perfect consistency (and making it easier to work with). Sugar
Plain granulated white sugar will add just the right amount of sweetness. Cornstarch
Cornstarch prevents sticking when you're rolling out the dough. You'll find the full recipe below, but here's what you can expect when you make this top-rated mochi recipe:,Wrap red bean paste in foil and freeze until solid. Once the paste is frozen, divide and roll into eight equal balls. Set aside or return to the freezer. Mix sweet rice flour and green tea powder in a microwave-safe bowl. Stir in water, then stir in the sugar. Mix until smooth. Cover bowl with plastic wrap and cook in the microwave for about 3 minutes and 30 seconds. Stir the mixture, then heat in the microwave for an additional 15-30 seconds. Dust your work surface with cornstarch. Roll the (still hot) dough into balls. Flatten each ball and place one frozen red bean paste ball in the center. Pinch the mochi over the paste until covered. Sprinkle with more cornstarch and place the mochi (seam side down) in a paper muffin liner. Repeat the steps until all the dough and frozen paste is used. Try to eat mochi immediately, as it is best enjoyed fresh. Since mochi is extremely sticky, cut it into small, bite-sized pieces and make sure to chew thoroughly before swallowing. Fresh mochi should be stored in the freezer. Avoid storing it in the fridge, as it will quickly dry out and harden. Store mochi in an airtight container in the freezer for up to two weeks. To prevent sticking, either flash freeze the mochi before transferring it to the storage container or individually wrap each mochi ball. "This recipe was a home run," says Susan Sliger. "It was extremely easy to make. I made it today for 10 tour guides from Japan. They gave it a 10 and could not believe this was the first time I had made it. I doubled the recipe with no issues and made the red bean paste with red kidney beans.","It was super quick and easy to make the mochi," raves larissa Levon. "Nothing beats fresh mochi!","Very easy to make," according to sushihorsey. "Side note: The mochi dough is SUPER sticky, so be sure to prepare your surface and hands with starch before making the balls. Otherwise, it's very yummy and easy and fun!",Editorial contributions by Corey Williams,Gather all ingredients. Wrap red bean paste in aluminum foil and place in the freezer until solid, at least 1 hour. Mix glutinous rice flour and green tea powder thoroughly in a microwave-safe bowl. Stir in water, then sugar; mix until smooth. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and microwave for 3 minutes 30 seconds. Meanwhile, remove red bean paste from the freezer and divide into 8 equal balls. Set aside. Remove rice flour mixture from the microwave. Stir and heat, covered, for another 15 to 30 seconds. Dust a work surface with cornstarch. Roll about 2 tablespoons of hot rice flour mixture into a ball. Flatten the ball and place one ball of frozen red bean paste in the center. Pinch and press the dough around the bean paste until completely covered. Sprinkle with additional cornstarch and place mochi, seam-side down, in a paper muffin liner to prevent sticking. Repeat Step 6 to make remaining mochi. Enjoy!
ingredients: sweetened red bean paste, glutinourice flour, green tea powder , water, white sugar, cornstarch
descriptor: Mochi are small, sweet Japanese cakemade with glutinourice flour . They have a soft, chewy outer layer, a deliciously sticky filling made of sweetened red bean paste. Freezing the red bean paste before you use it ioptional but it doemake the proceseasier.

instructions:
Make restaurant-worthy chicken katsu at home with this top-rated recipe. You won't believe how quickly it comes together with simple ingredients!,Katsu is a Japanese dish of crispy fried cutlets coated with Panko bread crumbs. Popular varieties are chicken katsu (like this recipe) and tonkatsu (which is made with pork). You'll find a detailed ingredient list and step-by-step instructions in the recipe below, but let's go over the basics:,These are the ingredients you'll need to make this chicken katsu recipe at home:,· Chicken: You'll need four skinless, boneless chicken breast halves.
· Seasonings: This chicken katsu recipe is simply seasoned with salt and pepper.
· Flour: All-purpose flour helps seal in the moisture, adds flavor, and promotes browning.
· Egg: An egg adds moisture and gives the Panko something to stick to.
· Panko: Panko bread crumbs are responsible for katsu's signature crunch.
· Oil: Opt for a neutral oil with a high smoke point, such as canola or vegetable oil. Here's a brief overview of what you can expect when you make homemade chicken katsu:,1. Season the chicken, then dredge in flour.
2. Coat each breast in egg, then press into the Panko.
3. Fry the chicken katsu until golden brown. In need of some serving inspiration? Try pairing your chicken katsu with tonkatsu sauce and one of these irresistible side dishes:,· Kombu Seaweed Salad
· Japanese-Style Cabbage Salad
· Miso Soup,Allow the chicken katsu to cool completely, then store your leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to three days. Reheat in the oven or in the microwave. "This was so easy and so yummy," raves Sarah. "The whole family loved every bite. I served it with white rice and sweet and sour sauce.","Made exactly as instructed with one exception — I didn't have Panko, so I pulsed some herb-seasoned breadcrumbs in the food processor," says Melnal. "Delicious, inexpensive, and easy to make," according to EmptyRecipe. "It will make you think twice why you would ever order this at a restaurant.",Editorial contributions by Corey Williams,Season chicken breasts on both sides with salt and pepper. Place flour, beaten egg, and panko crumbs into separate shallow dishes. Coat chicken breasts in flour, shaking off any excess; dip into egg, and then press into panko crumbs until well coated on both sides. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Place chicken in the hot oil, and fry until golden brown, 3 or 4 minutes per side. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain. Try serving this with Japanese salad dressing for dipping. Nutrition data for this recipe includes the full amount of breading ingredients. The actual amount of breading consumed will vary. We have determined the nutritional value of oil for frying based on a retention value of 10% after cooking. The exact amount will vary depending on cooking time and temperature, ingredient density, and specific type of oil used.
ingredients: skinless, boneless chicken breast halve- pounded to inch thickness, salt, pepper, all-purpose flour, egg, panko bread crumbs, oil
descriptor: Chicken katsu iJapanese-style fried chicken. Thiimy family recipe, can also be used to make tonkatsu by using pork cutletinstead of chicken. Serve with white rice, tonkatsu sauce.

instructions:
Did you know you can make restaurant-worthy miso soup in the comfort of your own home? Well, you can! You just need a good recipe — and that's where we come in. This miso soup recipe is bold, flavorful, and easy to make with just five ingredients. Miso soup is a traditional Japanese soup that starts with a dashi stock and is flavored with miso paste. Dashi is an umami-rich stock made from dried seaweed and dried fish. Miso paste, meanwhile, is a paste made from soybeans, salt, and koji rice. The brothy soup usually contains tofu and green onions. It can also feature seaweed, mushrooms, daikon, and more. Miso soup is traditionally served with rice. You'll find a detailed ingredient list and step-by-step instructions in the recipe below, but let's go over the basics:,These are the basic, easy-to-find ingredients you'll need to make this top-rated miso soup recipe:,· Water: This easy miso soup recipe starts with four cups of water.
· Dashi granules and miso paste: Dashi granules and miso paste give the soup a bold, savory flavor base.
· Tofu: The protein in this miso soup is a package of diced silken tofu.
· Green onions: Diced green onions add a burst of color and flavor. Miso paste comes in red, white, and yellow varieties. The type you use for soup is up to you and your preferences, but restaurants usually use red miso because it has the deepest flavor. Here's a brief overview of what you can expect when you make classic miso soup at home:,1. Bring the water and dashi granules to a boil.
2. Reduce the heat and whisk in miso paste.
3. Stir in the tofu and green onions.
4. Simmer and serve. Allow the miso soup to cool to room temperature, then transfer it to an airtight container. Store in the refrigerator for up to three days. Reheat in the microwave or on the stove. Yes! Miso soup freezes well. Transfer the cooled soup to zip-top bags or ice trays, then freeze for up to two months. If you use freezer bags, make sure you leave about an inch of room at the top to allow for expansion. We recommend adding the tofu and green onions after you thaw the soup. "Easy to make and tasty," according to Brownie5. "Made it for my husband when he wasn't feeling well. Wanted to give him something else instead of the chicken noodle soup he's been drinking. The tofu is a good source of protein to fill his stomach.","I was looking to replicate the taste of restaurant miso soup at home," says Earnest Cavalli. "This does the job perfectly. That said, I prefer firm tofu to silky, but that's a personal taste thing. Either works great in this recipe.","I've made this several times now and always make a huge batch to freeze," according to lnos. "Made it exactly with the addition of seaweed. Love this!!",Editorial contributions by Corey Williams,Combine water and dashi granules in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium and whisk in miso paste. Stir in tofu. Separate the layers of green onions, and add them to the soup. Simmer gently for 2 to 3 minutes before serving. Dashi is a basic stock used in Japanese cooking which is made by boiling dried kelp (seaweed) and dried bonito (fish). Instant dashi granules are sold in conveniently-sized jars or packets and vary in strength. Learn how to cook rice to serve alongside miso soup!
ingredients: water, dashi granules, miso paste, package silken tofu, green onion
descriptor: Thimiso soup ifull of savory flavors. Add more dashi to your soup if you want a stronger stock. You can use yellow, white red miso paste for thisoup — yellow miso isweet, creamy, red miso istronger, saltier.

instructions: The first step to perfect homemade sushi? Perfect homemade sushi rice. Thitop-rated sushi rice recipe cometogether quickly on the stove with just a few basic ingredientyou probably already have on hand. Sushi rice ilesof a type of rice than it ia preparation method. It'cooked short-grain white rice combined with rice vinegar, other ingredients, cooled completely, then used to make sushi rolls. The best rice for sushi ishort-grain Japanese rice — thiiwhat'in the baglabeled "sushi rice" at the store. Thiglutinourice haa higher starch content than other varieties, which giveit the sticky texture you're after when you make sushi. Classic sushi rice iseasoned with just rice vinegar, white sugar, salt. Thirecipe callfor vegetable oil instead of a bolder oil, so the simple seasoninghave a chance to really shine. You can make sushi rice on the stove, in a rice cooker even in an Instant Pot. Our stovetop method iaeasy ait gets. You'll find the full recipe below, but here'a brief overview of what you can expect:,Add the rinsed rice to a saucepan with water . Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat, cook, covered, until the rice itender, all the water habeen absorbed. Combine the rice vinegar, oil, sugar, salt in a separate saucepan. Cook over medium heat until the sugar hadissolved. Allow the vinegar mixture to cool, then stir it into the cooked rice. Stir until the rice inice, sticky — it'll look wet at first, but it'll dry ait cools. "I really loved thirecipe," ravePhillippa Molnar. "When I added the sugar, everything to the rice I panicked thinking it tasted too sweet, but then the rice absorbed it, the flavour became more subtle like it wameant to be. I've actually made it a few timebecause I think it'such a refreshing meal, it'so fun to make with family, friendaa relaxed fun evening.","Thisushi rice really iperfect," sayMandy. "I alwayfollow thiwhen I'm making sushi rollfor my family. The only thing I do differently ireduce the salt down to tsp. I do thiprimarily because we dip our sushi in soy sauce, that giveuplenty of salt.","Thirecipe iexcellent," according to SamX. "I've used it half a dozen timewith just a pot on the stove, it workgreat every time. I did make one change which for me, waa game changer. Instead of using vegetable oil in the flavor mix, I use of TOASTED sesame oil. All I can say iWOW! If you do try it just be mindful of nut allergies. But I'm telling you it'worth even making a separate batch!",Editorial contributionby Corey Williams,Gather all ingredients. Rinse the rice in a strainer or colander under cold running water until the water runclear. Combine rice, water in a saucepan over medium-high heat, bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, cook until rice itender, all water habeen absorbed, about minutes. Remove from stove, set aside until cool enough to handle. Meanwhile, combine rice vinegar, oil, sugar, salt in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook until the sugar hadissolved. Allow to cool, then stir into the cooked rice. While mixture will appear very wet at first, keep stirring, rice will dry ait cools.
ingredients: uncooked glutinouwhite rice , water, rice vinegar, vegetable oil, white sugar, salt
descriptor: Here imy recipe for the perfect sushi rice. You can eat thialone or roll into your favorite sushi roll with ingredientof choice. I use stripof carrots, cucumberand sliceof avocado. You can adjust the amount of vinegar in thirecipe to suit your taste.

instructions: Miso Soup – In, Out,I don't like to start a meal with soup. I much prefer to begin with something light, slightly acidic, subtly bitter to get the taste budgoing, to further stimulate my appetite. Soupare usually filling, there'nothing worse, culinarily speaking, than being satiated before the final courseare served. The one huge exception to thiwould be miso soup. Whenever I go to a Japanese restaurant, before the sashimi, the sushi, the katsu, the tempura appear, I have to have a nice, steaming bowl of miso soup. It'rich, satisfying, but doesn't leave me feeling full. In fact, it somehow stimulatemy appetite unlike any other soup I know. It'one of my favorite partof any Japanese meal, I alwaylook forward to itwarm, comforting embrace. So then, why don't I make it more often at home? I wish I had a good answer for that. It'fast, easy, cheap, if you live anywhere near a city the ingredientare not hard to find. Maybe enjoying it in the restaurant setting, before all that other wonderful food arriveipart of the magic, but after doing thivideo, I'm promising myself I'll make thiat home a lot more often, I hope you do the same. Enjoy!,Gather all ingredients. Pour cold water into a saucepan. Add kombu, soak for minutes. Set pan on the stove over medium heat, wait until water just startto simmer. Turn off heat, remove kombu with a strainer. Squeeze out any liquid back into the pan, discard kombu. Turn heat back on to med-high, bring to a simmer. Stir bonito flakeinto the simmering liquid, turn off the heat. Let sit for minutes, before staining, reserving the liquid, also known athe "dashi.",Pour dashi into a saucepan over medium heat. Add pre-soaked, shredded seaweed, soy sauce, green onions. Bring to a simmer, reduce heat to low. Place a small strainer over the pan, add miso pastes. Submerge strainer halfway down into the hot dashi, stir slowly until all the miso hadissolved, passed through into the soup. Stir in tofu, continue cooking on low until tofu iheated through, about minutes. Taste, season with more soy sauce if needed. Serve immediately with sliced green onionon top.
ingredients: cold water, dried kombu , lightly packed dried bonito flakes
descriptor: Thimiso soup imade entirely from scratch, haa simple yet complex flavor. You can now enjoy miso soup at home, not just in a Japanese restaurant.

instructions: Prepare the pastry by combining the flour, salt in a bowl. Rub in the butter, shortening until incorporated, the mixture takeon a sandy appearance. Combine the egg, water, stir into the flour mixture until a dough forms, then knead for a few turnto bring the dough together. Wrap well, chill for hourin the refrigerator. While dough ichilling, peel plantainand cut into thirds. Place into a small saucepan with a little water. Bring to a simmer, steam until tender, to minutedepending on how ripe your plantainare. Once soft, pour out the water, mash plantainwith sugar, vanilla, nutmeg, red food coloring. Set aside to cool. Preheat oven to degreeF . Roll dough out on a lightly floured surface to /-inch thick. Cut into circleusing a or -inch round cookie cutter. Spoon a little of the plantain filling into the center of each circle, then fold in half, to form a half-moon shape. Place the tarton a baking sheet, brush with beaten egg white, sprinkle with sugar. Bake in preheated oven for to minuteuntil golden brown. Allow tartto cool to room temperature before serving.
ingredients: all-purpose flour, salt, cold butter, cut into inch pieces, shortening, chilled, egg, ice-cold water

instructions: In a small bowl, stir together the dried onion, thyme, allspice, ground black pepper, cinnamon, cayenne pepper, salt. Coat meat lightly with oil, then rub seasoning onto meat.

instructions: Place chicken in a medium bowl. Cover with water, lime juice. Set aside. Pour most of the blended marinade mixture into the bowl with chicken, reserving a small amount to use aa basting sauce while cooking. Stir chicken until well coated. Cover the bowl, marinate in the refrigerator for at least hours. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat, lightly oil the grate. Cook chicken slowly on the preheated grill, turning frequently, basting often with reserved marinade mixture, until no longer pink in the center, the juicerun clear. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of chicken should read at least degreeF .

descriptor: Thijerk chicken recipe ia succulent, tropical treat. You'll love the heat, flavor of thifiery marinade.

instructions: Make the chicken: Rub chicken with jerk paste, place into a shallow dish. Cover, refrigerate for at least hour. Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat, lightly oil the grate. Cook chicken on the preheated grill until no longer pink in the center, the juicerun clear, to minuteper side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least degreeF . Remove to a plate, keep warm. While the chicken icooking, make the pasta: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. instructions: Peel tough outer leavefrom cabbage. Core the head, shred cabbage; set aside. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat; add onion, bell pepper, green onion. instructions: Place yellow onion, habanero peppers, green onions, lime juice, soy sauce, garlic, fresh thyme, brown sugar, oil, salt, black pepper, allspice, dried thyme, cinnamon, cumin, nutmeg into a blender. I'm usually pretty casual about you changing my recipes, but I insist you not change any of the key ingredients, which are every one of them.

instructions: Pat fish dry; cut small sliton each side of fish. Season all over with salt, pepper. Heat -quart of oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until smoking. instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Grease, flour two 9-inch round cake pans. Place butter, sugar into a large bowl; beat with an electric mixer until light, fluffy. instructions: Soak cod in cold water to rehydrate it, remove excessalt, hourto overnight. Remove boneand skin from fish. Flake, shred fish into small pieces; set aside. instructions: Heat olive oil in a large, heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium-low heat. Add leek, garlic; cook, stir until soft, about minutes. Add rice, cook for minutestirring frequently. Recipe Name: Mediterranean Turkey Meatball Sheet Pan Dinner
instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Line a sheet pan with foil or parchment paper. In a large bowl, combine parsley, rosemaryegano, dill, mint, salt, pepper. Stir to combine. instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Grease a -inch cake pan. Beat egg whiteand cream of tartar until soft peakform. Add sugar gradually, beating until very stiff. instructions: Heat olive oil in a pot over medium heat; cook, stir onion, garlic until onion ha to minutes. Add ginger, stir until fragrant, minute. Add brown rice, stir to coat rice with oil. instructions: Preheat oven to degreeF . Line a baking sheet with waxed paper. Mix flour, sugar, baking powder together in a large bowl; add butter, tahini, mix until dough icrumbly. instructions: In a large, resealable plastic bag or plastic container with a lid, mix applewith the juice of lemon. Freeze for several houror overnight. instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Grease a baking sheet. Beat egg in a medium bowl, mix in cheese. Season with parsley, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, pepper. Set aside. Make an interesting tuna salad, cut up some veggies, you have a full meal.

instructions: Rinse the garbanzo beanand, place in a pot. Fill with enough water to cover by at least inch. Add baking soda, if using. Add the tahini, blend in along with the lemon juice. Blend in the garlic, cumin, salt. Spread the hummuinto a flat serving dish, garnish with the reserved beanand a drizzle of olive oil. Remove bananafrom oil, drain them on paper towels. Serve hot. We have determined the nutritional value of oil based on a retention value of after cooking. instructions: Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Coat with nonstick cooking spray. Pour egginto the hot skillet, cook until the edgebegin to set. Transfer omelet to a cutting board, slice into /-inch strips. Set aside. Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large frying pan over high heat. Stir in onion, leek, chile peppers, garlic. Cook, stir until onion isoft, to minutes. Stir in chicken, shrimp, coriander, cumin; mix well. Cook, stir for about minutes. Mix in cooked rice, sweet soy sauce, omelet strips; cook until rice iheated through, chicken ino longer pink in the center, to minutes. To cook rice: Bring of water, white rice to a boil in a saucepan over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, simmer until rice itender, liquid iabsorbed, to minutes. Spread onto a baking sheet, then refrigerate until cold, about hours.

instructions: Cut beef chuck into -inch pieces. Combine shallots, garlic, ginger, galangal, serrano, Fresno chiles, salt, red pepper flakes, coriander, turmeric, cardamom, nutmeg in the bowl of a food processor. Pulse until paste ivery finely ground, stopping occasionally to scrape down the sidewith a spatula. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the curry paste. Cook, stir until it startto dry out, then stir in the beef. Add coconut milk, tamarind paste, brown sugar. Stir to combine. Fill up the empty can of coconut milk with water, pour it into the pan. Increase heat to medium-high; bring to a simmer. In the meantime, bruise lemongraswith the back of your knife. Cut into - to -inch pieceand add to the curry. Reduce heat to medium. Cook, uncovered, stirring occasionally, until beef ifork-tender, sauce ifully reduced, about hours. Stir more frequently awater reduces; add more water or lower the heat if sauce ireducing faster than beef isoftening. Remove lemongrasto serve. For best results, let cool, serve the next day. Feel free to use a fattier cut like beef shank or short rib in this. Substitute red onion for the shallotand ginger for the galangal if desired. If you don't have tamarind paste, use zest from a lime, lemon, plujuice from lime. If you do want some sauce to serve with it, simply add more water during the cooking cover for part of the time. If you cook thithe day before, arecommended, you'll want to add a big splash of water when you reheat it. Cover until heated through, then uncover, crank the heat, cook until it'adry ayou like.

descriptor: The sauce in thiamazing Indonesian curry might be invisible, but you'll know it'there. Ait reduces, the water evaporates, leaving behind the fat, flavor that make thidish so unique, addictive. Originally, cooking meat thiway helped preserve it in hot, humid Indonesia. Turnout, people continued making it long after refrigeration came around. Serve with steamed rice, garnished with cilantro, lime if desired.

instructions: In a bowl, mix soy sauce, tomato sauce, peanut oil, garlic, black pepper, cumin. Place chicken into the mixture, stir to coat. instructions: There'no need to buy store-bought garam masala when you have all the ingredientyou need to make the spice blend at home! Thieasy garam masala recipe will quickly become a go-to in your kitchen. Garam masala ian Indian spice blend. Garam mean"hot" while masala mean"spices," but it'not necessarily hot, spicy — the name referto the warm flavorof itingredients, such acinnamon, cumin. Learn more: What IGaram Masala?,These are the ground spiceyou'll need to make thigaram masala recipe at home:,It couldn't be easier to make garam masala at home: Simply mix all the ingredienttogether, stir until well-combined. That'it!,Garam masala iusually added toward the end of cooking so that it seasonthe dish, additaroma. In need of some recipe inspiration? Explore our collection of Recipeto Make with Garam Masala. Here'a preview of what you'll find:,Store the garam masala in an airtight container in a cool, dry, dark place for up to six months. "I loved thistuff," raveGitana. "I used whole spicethough, roasted them together on dry pan until you could smell the aroma, then ground them all up. Waperfect on chicken tandoori, pulav.","I alwayhave some garam masala blend in my spice rack to kick up a spice rub for pork or chicken or to use in Indian dishes," sayRobin Ann Donnelly. "Versatile, yummy!","Tastegreat on roasts, chicken, lamb, just about anything," according to Mary L. "I do occasionally sprinkle in a bit of cayenne for a bit of heat. Everyone loveit when I make a roast with thiseasoning.",Editorial contributionby Corey Williams,Mix cumin, coriander, cardamom, pepper, cinnamon, cloves, nutmeg in a bowl. Place mix in an airtight container, store in a cool, dry place.

instructions: Heat ghee in a large saucepan over medium heat, add carrots. Cook, stir briefly, about minutes. Pour in milk, increase heat; bring to a boil, cook, stirring constantly, for minutes. Reduce heat to low, simmer gently, uncovered, stirring occasionally until moisture evaporates, about hour. Bring carrot mixture back to a boil; add sugar, raisins, cardamom, saffron. Cook, stir until mixture hathickened, about minutes. Ladle carrot halwa into individual serving dishes. Top each serving with pistachios. Serve warm or chill before serving. instructions: Enjoy the lavishly delicioutaste of chicken curry at home with thieasy-to-follow recipe. Bold spicelike ginger, cumin, curry powder add rich layerof flavor to succulent chicken coated in a creamy tomato-based sauce. Fill your kitchen with the delightful fragrance of a creamy, spicy, filling curry that the whole family will love. Murgh Kari makeuse of a potent spice blend that includegaram masala, coriander, turmeric, cayenne pepper. Tomato, yogurt, onion are also essential ingredientin thiclassic Indian main dish. Fresh garlic, ginger lend a pleasant sharpness. Our top-rated recipe useskinless, boneless chicken breastfor a tender, evenly cooked result, but other cutlike tenderloin, thigh make suitable substitutions. Start by partially cooking your seasoned chicken breastin a large pan, removing them after they're browned. After setting the chicken breastaside, cook garlic, onions, ginger in the same pan to create the flavor base. Once the onionare translucent, add in spices, tomatoes, yogurt, chicken to cook thoroughly. Cover, simmer for about minutefor a wow-worthy chicken curry. Finish with fresh herband a squeeze of lemon. Leftover chicken curry can be refrigerated in a sealed container, enjoyed for two to four days. Freezing extendthe time to two month— simply thaw, gently reheat in the microwave or on the stovetop. "Thiinow our favorite go-to curry," sharehome cook xxlaracrofttrxx. "Quick, easy with a great flavor. I used hot curry powder, chose to cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces.","Excellent flavor!" raveVUCN. "My husband, our 9-year-old loved it. The only change I made wato halve the amount of cayenne. I will definitely make thiagain.","The only tweakI made were using homemade stewed crushed tomatoeinstead of canned, Moroccan seasoning for the garam masala , fresh cilantro for coriander, a heaping of honey," explainreviewer Chris. Paired with fresh naan, it walike a hug in a bowl!",Editorial contributionby Rai Mincey,Gather all ingredients. Sprinkle the chicken breastwith salt. Heat oil in a large skillet over high heat; partially cook the chicken in the hot oil in batcheuntil completely browned on all sides. Transfer browned chicken breastto a plate, set aside. Reduce the heat to medium, add onion, garlic, ginger to the oil remaining in the skillet. Cook, stir until onion turnsoft, translucent, to minutes. Stir curry powder, cumin, turmeric, coriander, cayenne, of water into the onion mixture; allow to heat together for about minute while stirring. Add tomatoes, yogurtcilantro, salt to the mixture; stir to combine. Return chicken breast to the skillet along with any juiceon the plate. Pour in water, bring to a boil, turning the chicken to coat with the sauce. Sprinkle garam masala, cilantro over the chicken. Cover the skillet, simmer until chicken breastare no longer pink in the center, the juicerun clear, about minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least degreeF . Drizzle with lemon juice to serve.

instructions: Mix flour, salt together in a bowl. Stir in water to form a soft dough. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured work surface, knead several times. instructions: Make a spice mix by combining garam masala, tandoori masala, curry powder, cumin, cardamom, cayenne, salt, black pepper in a small bowl; set aside. Remove from heat. Melt remaining butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion; cook, stir until soft, translucent, about minutes. Stir in remainder of the spice mixture, garlic, lemon juice, ginger; cook, stir until combined, about minute. Stir tomato puree into onion mixture, cook, stirring frequently, about minutes. Pour in half-and-half, yogurt. Reduce heat to low, simmer sauce, stirring frequently, about minutes. Remove from heat. Blend cashewin a blender until finely ground. Add sauce to the blender; puree until smooth. Pour blended sauce over chicken in the skillet. Simmer until thickened, to minutes. Garnish with cilantro. instructions: Heat butter, vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in chicken, onion, garlic. Cook, stir until onion ha turned translucent, about minutes. instructions: Gather all ingredients. Remove, discard skin from chicken pieces. Cut slitinto meat, place into a shallow dish. Season chicken on both sidewith lemon juice, salt. Let sit for minutes. instructions: Lay eggplant sliceon paper towels; sprinkle lightly with salt. Let sit for minuteto draw out moisture, then pat dry with paper towels. Warm olive oil in a skillet over high heat. Fry eggplant until browned, to minuteper side. Drain on paper towels; set aside. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in ground beef, onions, garlic; season with salt, black pepper. Cook, stir until beef ibrowned, to minutes. Add parsley, fineherbs, cinnamon, nutmeg. Pour in tomato sauce, wine; mix well. Simmer for minutes. Allow to cool, then stir in beaten egg. Scald milk in a saucepan over medium heat. At the same time, melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Whisk flour into butter until smooth. Lower heat; gradually pour in scalded milk, whisking constantly until it thickens. Season béchamel sauce with salt, white pepper. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Grease a 9x-inch baking dish. Arrange a single layer of eggplant in the prepared baking dish. Cover eggplant with meat sauce, then sprinkle Parmesan cheese on top. Cover with remaining eggplant, sprinkle another cheese on top. Pour béchamel sauce on top, sprinkle with remaining nutmeg. Cover with remaining cheese. Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly, browned, about hour. Serve hot, enjoy!

instructions: Cut tomatoeinto wedgeover a large serving bowl so that any extra juiceland in the bowl with tomato wedges. Add onion sliceand oregano, then season liberally with salt; mix to combine. Top with feta cheese, drizzle with olive oil. Don't skip the salting, resting step! The tomatoes' acidic juicecombine with the olive oil to make the perfect dressing, with no need to add vinegar or lemon juice at the end. instructions: Pulse onion in a food processor until finely chopped. Scoop oniononto the center of a towel, gather up the towel ends, squeeze to remove liquid. Combine onions, lamb, beef, garlicegano, cumin, marjoram, rosemary, thyme, pepper, salt in a large bowl. Mix with your handuntil well combined. Cover, refrigerate to hourto allow the flavorto blend. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Place the meat mixture into a food processor, pulse until the texture feeltacky, about minute. Transfer to a x-inch loaf pan, pack down to make sure there are no air pockets. Line a large roasting pan with a damp kitchen towel. Place the loaf pan in the center of the towel-lined roasting pan, transfer it into the preheated oven. Carefully pour boiling water into the roasting pan until it comehalfway up the sideof the loaf pan. Bake in the preheated oven until gyro meat ino longer pink in the center, about minuteto hour. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least degreeF . Pour off any accumulated fat, allow to cool slightly before slicing thinly, serving. If you prefer, substitute pork or chicken for the ground lamb, beef.

instructions: Place red potatoeinto a large pot, cover with salted water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, simmer until tender, about minutes.
