instructions: If you've never tried rich, cheesy, utterly decadent spanakopita, you need to remedy that ASAP —, we've got just the recipe for you! With thitop-rated Greek spanakopita recipe, you'll have the most deliciousavory pie of your life on the table in just over an hour. Spanakopita ia savory Greek pie that consistof a spinach-ricotta filling baked in a buttery phyllo crust. "Spanakopita" iprond "spah-nah-KO-pee-tuh.",You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here'a brief overview of what you can expect when you make thitop-rated spanakopita:,Saute onion, green onions, garlic in olive oil until they're soft, lightly browned. Add spinach, parsley, then continue to saute until spinach ilimp. Remove from heat, let cool. In a medium bowl, mix together eggs, ricotta, feta. Stir into spinach mixture. Lay one sheet of phyllo dough in a lightly oiled 9xinch baking pan. Brush lightly with olive oil. Lay another sheet of phyllo dough on top, brush with olive oil, repeat thiproceswith two more sheetof phyllo. The sheetwill overlap the pan. Spread the spinach, cheese mixture into the pan, fold overhanging dough over filling. Brush with oil, then layer with the remaining sheetof phyllo dough, brushing each with oil. Seal the filling with the overhanging dough. Bake for to minutes, until golden brown. Cut into squareand serve while it'still hot. Store leftover spanakopita in an airtight container in the fridge for up to three days. Reheat in the oven until heated through. The best way to freeze spanakopita? Freeze it before baking. It won't lose nearly amuch flavor or texture thiway, athe dish won't be cooked twice. Just assemble the spanakopita, wrap it in one layer or storage wrap, one layer of aluminum foil, then freeze for up to two months. Thaw in the fridge, cook according to the recipe. You can also freeze spanakopita after baking: Simply let the dish cool, transfer it to a freezer-safe container. Freeze for up to two months. Thaw in the fridge, reheat in the oven until heated through. "My apologieto the puristout there, but I also added fresh basilasparagus, mushrooms, artichoke hearts," sayS'more. "I have made it with none of the additions, all of the additions, a combination of the depending on what I had on hand, it alwayturnout phenomenal!","Thiiawesome," raveSylvia C. "We ate the whole thing in minutes. I will probably need to double thinext time. I used a 9-oz. bag of pre-washed spinach, it turned out great. Thiwould be great with a Greek salad with olives.","I used frozen spinach to save time," according to JoAnne Gauthier. "Thiwahalf-thawed and, when added to the hot mixture, it wajust the right consistency, temp to keep moving, finish this. Great pie.",Editorial contributionby Corey Williams,Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Lightly oil a 9-inch square baking pan. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute chopped onion, green onions, garlic in the hot oil until soft, lightly browned, about minutes. Stir in spinach, parsley, continue to saute until spinach ilimp, about minutes. Remove from the heat, set aside to cool. Mix feta cheese, ricotta cheese, eggin a medium bowl until well combined. Stir in spinach mixture. Lay one sheet of phyllo dough in the prepared baking pan, brush lightly with olive oil. Lay another sheet of phyllo dough on top, brush with olive oil. Repeat the proceswith two more sheetof phyllo dough; the sheetwill overlap the pan. Spread spinach, cheese mixture into the pan. Fold any overhanging dough over the filling. Brush with oil. Layer the remaining sheetof phyllo dough, brushing each with oil. Tuck overhanging dough into the pan to seal the filling. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, to minutes. Cut into squareand serve while hot.
ingredients: olive oil, large onion bunch green onions clove garlic, poundspinach, choppedfresh parsley, crumbled feta cheese, ricotta cheese, large eggs, lightly sheetphyllo dough, olive oil
descriptor: Thiian authentic Greek spanakopita pie recipe featuring layerof crispy, flaky phyllo dough, a rich spinach, feta cheese filling. Serve warm for an impressive but easy to make vegetarian main dish.

instructions:
Believe it or not, you can make Greek restaurant-worthy baklava in the comfort of your own kitchen — and it's actually not that hard! This top-rated baklava recipe, which is surprisingly approachable for beginner bakers, has racked up almost 2,000 rave reviews from the Allrecipes community. Baklava is a traditional pastry known for its sweet, rich flavor and flaky texture. It consists of phyllo (or filo) dough, nuts, spices, and a sugary syrup. Pronounce "baklava" like "bah-klah-vah." The stress is placed on the first syllable. Though baklava is often associated with Greek restaurants now, its exact origins are unclear. Food historians think modern baklava may have been invented in Turkey during the Ottoman Empire, then modified in Greece. However, the technique of layering unleavened bread with nuts and honey can be traced back as far as the 8th century B.C.E. during the Assyrian Empire. Here's what you need to make the best baklava of your life:,Phyllo Dough
Make your own phyllo pastry dough or buy frozen phyllo dough at the store. Nuts
Chopped walnuts, pistachios, or a mixture of both are traditionally used. Hazelnuts and/or pecans would also work. Butter
Not only does butter add richness and flavor, it keeps the phyllo sheets moist and soft. It also helps the sheets stay together. Cinnamon
Cinnamon is responsible for baklava's signature warmth. Water, Sugar, Vanilla, and Honey
A sweet syrup — made from water, sugar, vanilla extract, and honey — is poured over the baked baklava layers, bringing the delicious dessert together. Even though making baklava can be a bit time-consuming, it's probably not as hard as you think. You'll find the full recipe below, but here's a brief overview of what you can expect. Stack eight sheets of phyllo dough, brushing with butter between each layer, to create a sturdy base. Sprinkle it with a mixture of chopped nuts and cinnamon. Top with two sheets of phyllo dough and follow with the nut mixture. Repeat this process a few more times, until the nut mixture is gone. Top with about eight more layers of phyllo, buttering each layer. Cut the baklava into diamond or square shapes. Be sure to cut all the way to the bottom of the pan. Bake until golden and crisp. Boil water and sugar until sugar is melted. Add vanilla and honey. Remove the baklava from the oven and immediately pour syrup over it. Let cool before serving. Baklava is super sugary, so it has a relatively long shelf-life. It will last for about two weeks stored in an airtight container. Keep it in the pantry if you like your baklava crispy. If you like it chewy, opt for the fridge. Yes, you can definitely freeze baklava. Just let it cool completely, wrap it in a layer of storage wrap, and then a layer of aluminum foil. Follow with another layer of aluminum foil for added protection. Freeze for up to three months. Thaw in the fridge overnight. When culinary producer Nicole McLaughlin (a.k.a. Nicole McMom) tried this top-rated baklava recipe, she declared it the "perfect make-ahead dessert." Here are a few of the best tips and tricks she learned along the way:,· Chop the nuts in a food processor to save time.
· Ensure the phyllo sheets stay moist during the layering process by keeping the stack covered with a damp paper towel or cloth.
· Worried about tearing the dough when you brush it with butter? Don't be! If you're concerned, Nicole suggests spraying melted butter onto the phyllo dough between layers instead of brushing it.
· If the phyllo dough sticks to your hands while you work with it, place a bowl of water next to your prep station. Keeping your fingertips moist will prevent sticking.
· When it's time to eat, consider serving (and storing) the baklava pieces in cupcake liners to nip sticky fingers in the bud. "Definitely use a spritzer bottle for the melted butter, it cuts down on the time," says Dionne Sharp Ukleja. " It made the assembly easy and effortless!","My husband and I have tried making homemade baklava a couple of times, and this is by FAR the BEST recipe we have used," raves jlgarnet. "We followed the recipe exactly, and it turned out perfectly!","This is an amazing recipe," raves cookingmom. "I added more cinnamon, but other than that I don't think any changes need to be made! The result has the perfect crispness and flavor! Excellent recipe!",Editorial contributions by Corey Williams,Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F(175 degrees C). Butter the bottoms and sides of a 9x13-inch pan. Chop nuts and toss with cinnamon. Set aside. Unroll phyllo dough. Cut whole stack in half to fit pan. Cover phyllo with a dampened cloth to keep from drying out as you work. Place two sheets of dough in pan, butter thoroughly. Repeat until you have 8 sheets layered. Sprinkle 2 to 3 tablespoons of nut mixture on top. Top with two sheets of dough, butter, nuts, layering as you go. The top layer should be about 6 to 8 sheets deep. Using a sharp knife cut into diamond or square shapes all the way to the bottom of the pan. You may cut into 4 long rows then make diagonal cuts. Bake for about 50 minutes until baklava is golden and crisp. Make sauce while baklava is baking. Boil sugar and water until sugar is melted. Add vanilla and honey. Simmer for about 20 minutes. Remove baklava from the oven and immediately spoon sauce over it. Let cool. Serve in cupcake papers. This freezes well. Leave it uncovered as it gets soggy if it is wrapped up. Enjoy!,Please note the addition of lemon zest when following the magazine version of this recipe.
ingredients: package phyllo dough, pound chopped nuts, butter, ground cinnamon, water, white sugar, vanilla extract, honey
descriptor: Baklava ia deliciouGreek dessert made up of layerof crispy phyllo dough, honey, nutthat'sooo easy to make. A Greek friend showed me how to make thifabulourecipe.

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Grease cookie sheets. Beat butter, sugar, egg together in a medium bowl with an electric mixer until smooth. Stir in vanilla, almond extracts. Blend in flour, then use your handto form a soft dough. Take about a of dough at a time, roll into balls, logs "S" shapes. Place cookie to incheapart on the prepared cookie sheets. Bake in the preheated oven until edgeare golden, about minutes. Allow cookieto cool completely before dusting with confectioners' sugar.
ingredients: butter, white sugar, egg, vanilla extract, almond extract, all-purpose flour, confectioners' sugar
descriptor: These Greek cookieare a Christmaclassic! Greek familiegive tinof these buttery cookie treatto neighboraround Christmas.

instructions: Place onion in a food processor, finely chop. Transfer onion to a piece of cheesecloth, squeeze out the liquid. Place onion in a large bowl. Mix lamb, beef, garlicegano, cumin, marjoram, thyme, rosemary, black pepper, salt with the onion using your handuntil well mixed. Cover bowl with plastic wrap, refrigerate until flavorblend, about hours. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Place meat mixture in a food processor, pulse until tacky, about minute. Pack meat mixture into a x-inch loaf pan, ensuring there are no air pockets. Place the loaf pan into a roasting pan, pour enough boiling water around the loaf pan to reach halfway up the sidefor a water bath. Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the center, to minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least degreeF . Pour off any accumulated fat, cool slightly. Thinly slice the cooked gyro meat loaf. Spread hummuonto each pita bread. Then top each with some of the gyro meat slices, shredded lettuce, tomato slices, red onion slices, feta cheese crumbles, tzatziki sauce to complete each sandwich.
ingredients: small onion, cut into chunks, pound ground lamb, pound ground beef, garlic, dried oregano, ground cumin, dried marjoram, dried thyme, dried rosemary, freshly ground black pepper, sea salt, hummus, pita bread rounds, small head lettuce, shredded, large tomato large red onion crumbled feta cheese, tzatziki sauce
descriptor: Make a Greek gyro sandwich at home with thirecipe that I absolutely love!

instructions: Thihomemade souvlaki recipe iflavorful, tender, easy to make on your outdoor grill. Souvlaki ia Greek fast food that consistof meat grilled on a skewer. It can be served alone or inside of a rolled pita. It’traditionally made with pork, but it’also commonly made with chicken, beef lamb. Here’what you’ll need to make thieasy souvlaki recipe:,You’ll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here’a brief overview of what you can expect when you make homemade souvlaki:,On a grill preheated to medium-high heat, the souvlaki should be perfectly grilled in - minutes. You’ll know it’done when the pork ino longer pink in the middle, an instant read thermometer inserted into the middle of the meat readat least degreeF . Thisouvlaki recipe pairperfectly with pita bread, tzatziki sauce, rice. Explore our collection of Greek Side Dishefor deliciouserving inspiration. Here are a few of the top-rated recipeyou’ll find:,Store your leftover souvlaki in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to four days. Reheat in the microwave or oven until the pork iwarmed through. “It wadeliciouwith lotof leftovers,” sayeponymous. “We made thiwith grilled potato salad, grilled zucchini. We will definitely make thiagain apork iinexpensive.”,“Amazing flavor,” raveAmber. “Strong enough to season bell pepperand onions, but gentle enough to know you were eating pork.”,“Thirecipe turned out amazingly,” according to Siobhan. “I made it with chicken, pork. I let the meatmarinate for hourin the fridge. Will be making thiagain for sure.”,Editorial contributionby Corey Williams,Gather all ingredients. Mix oil, soy sauce, lemon juice, garlic, oregano together in a large glasbowl. Add pork, onions, bell peppers, stir until coated. Cover, refrigerate for to hours. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat, lightly oil the grate. Remove pork, vegetablefrom marinade, shake off excess; thread onto skewers. Discard remaining marinade. Cook on the preheated grill, turning frequently, until pork ino longer pink in the middle, to minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least degreeF . Nutrition data for thirecipe includethe full amount of marinade ingredients. The actual amount consumed will vary.
ingredients: olive oil, soy sauce, medium lemon, juiced, clove garlic, dried oregano, poundpork tenderloin,medium yellow onions, cut into inch pieces, medium green bell peppers, cut into inch pieces, skewers
descriptor: Souvlaki ia Greek specialty made with tender cutof meat. In thirecipe, pork tenderloin imarinated in a lemony mixture of olive oil, oregano. Serve with rice pilaf, a Greek salad.

instructions: Whisk olive oil, lemon juiceegano, garlic, rosemary, tarragon together in a measuring . Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat, lightly oil the grate. Place chicken on a rimmed baking sheet. Pour of the oil mixture over the chicken, reserve the remaining /. Using your hands, massage the oil mixture into the chicken skin. Season with salt, pepper. Grill chicken skin-side up over indirect heat for minutes. Move chicken over direct heat, grill minutes. Carefully flip chicken over skin-side down, grill until skin ibrown, crispy, about more minutes. Transfer chicken to a serving platter, let rest for minutes. Drizzle reserved oil mixture over the chicken. Carve, serve. To spatchcock a chicken, use sharp kitchen shearand cut along both sideof the backbone, remove. Using your hands, presdown on both sideof the chicken to flatten.
ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, lemon juicefresh oregano, clove garlic, fresh rosemary, dried tarragon, whole chicken, spatchcocked, salt, ground black pepper
descriptor: Thigrilled spatchcocked chicken isimple to do, only requirea sharp pair of kitchen shearand minuteof your time. Grilling over indirect heat keepthe chicken moist.

instructions: Soak kaiser roll in a medium bowl of water for minutes. Drain, squeeze out exceswater; crumble into a large bowl. Add ground meats, onion, parsley, egg, paprika, salt, black pepper to crumbled roll; mix until well blended. Shape mixture into large flattened meatballs. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Fry meatballin the hot skillet until browned, no longer pink in the center, about minuteper side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of a patty should read at least degreeF .
ingredients: kaiser roll, pound ground beef, pound ground pork, onionfresh parsley, large egg, Hungarian hot paprika, salt, ground black pepper
descriptor: Frikadellen, the original hamburger, are served like a flattened meatball with string beanand salad. I also like to use thirecipe to make Swedish meatball. My aunt in Hamburg, Germany, taught me thirecipe, I've been making it ever since. Serve with steamed string beanand tossed salad. Or serve on a kaiser roll with lettuce, tomato, pickled cucumbers, finely sliced deep-fried onions, curry ketchup.

instructions: Place sliceof beef on a work surface, Season both sidewith kosher salt, pepper. Spread one side with mustard. Place bacon stripon the mustard, sprinkle with paprika. Arrange onion slicecross-wise on the beef. Then evenly space pickle sliceacroseach slice of beef. Keep about an inch of the narrowest end of the beef slice free of toppingto facilitate rolling it up. Roll each slice of meat, beginning from the wider of the two short ends, working to keep all ingredientinside the roll. Rollshould be nice, tight. Secure the roll with loopof butcher'twine, one in the middle, one at each end. Trim excesstring. Heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat in a large saucepan. Cook beef, turning, browning well on all sides, about minutes. Remove meat from pan. Reduce heat to medium-low. Melt butter in the pan; whisk in the flour, cooking for about minute. Pour in cold beef broth, whisk vigorously to combine. Raise heat to medium-high, simmer until sauce beginto thicken, about minute. Transfer beef rollto pan along with accumulated juices. Reduce heat to very low. Simmer gently, covered, turning rollevery minuteor so, until beef itender, about hours. When the tip of a sharp knife can easily be inserted into the beef roll, the meat idone. Transfer meat to dish to allow it to rest. Raise heat to high, bring cooking liquid to a simmer to thicken slightly to make a gravy, about minute. Serve rouladen with gravy.
ingredients: sliceof beef round, kosher salt, freshly ground black pepper, Dijon mustard, stripbacon, paprika, onion into half-ringand se, dill pickle spears, vegetable oil
descriptor: For something that lookand tasteaimpressive athibeef rouladen, it'actually one of the simplest stuffed meat recipeI know. You can pretty much use any cheap cut of beef; I used round steak, but rump, chuck, flap meat, other similar cutwill work work.

instructions: Place beaten egg in a shallow dish. Mix together bread crumband flour in a second shallow dish; season with salt, pepper. Dip pork steakin beaten egg, then presinto bread crumb mixture to coat. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Fry coated steakin hot oil until browned, cooked through, about minuteper side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of steakshould read at least degreeF . Remove steakto a platter, keep warm. Add onion, mushroomto drippingin the skillet; cook, stir until lightly browned. Pour in water, stir in bouillon cube until dissolved. Simmer for about minutes. Combine sour cream, cornstarch in a small bowl; stir into the skillet. Cook over low heat until sauce ithickened, but do not boil. Spoon sauce over steakto serve.
ingredients: large egg, beaten bread crumb all-purpose flour salt, pepper pork steakor cutlets, pounded thin vegetable oil medium onion, diced can sliced mushroom water cube beef bouillon sour cream cornstarch
descriptor: Thijägerschnitzel ia delicioudish I ordered again, again when I wastationed in Germany with the Army. It ibest served with French frieto clean up the remaining gravy, a nice garden salad.

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Melt together sugar, shortening, honey in a saucepan over low heat. Let cool. Mix together eggs, vanilla, baking soda, ginger. Gradually add to cooled honey mixture. Slowly add flour to mixture. Stir until well blended. Drop by fulonto cookie sheetabout incheapart. Bake in the preheated oven until golden, to minutes.
ingredients: white sugar, shortening, honey, large eggs, vanilla extract, baking soda, ground ginger, all-purpose flour
descriptor: I got thirecipe for honey cookiefrom my grandmother who got it from her grandmother. She had to translate it, then figure out the measurements. The original recipe called for "enough flour to make a dough." Thankfully grandma knew what kind of dough.

instructions: Place veal cutletbetween sheetof heavy plastic on a solid, level surface. Firmly pound cutletwith the smooth side of a meat mallet to a /-inch thickness. Dip cutletin flour to coat; shake off excess. Beat together eggs, Parmesan cheese, milk, parsley, salt, pepper, nutmeg in a shallow bowl until combined. Place bread crumbon a plate. Dip each cutlet into the egg mixture, then presin bread crumbto coat. Place coated cutleton a plate, refrigerate for hour to overnight. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook breaded cutletin butter until browned, about minuteper side. Transfer cutletto a serving platter, pour pan juiceover them. Garnish with lemon slices. Nutrition data for thirecipe includethe full amount of breading ingredients. The actual amount of breading consumed will vary.
ingredients: poundveal cutlets, all-purpose flour, large eggs, grated Parmesan cheese, milk, parsley, salt, pepper, pinch ground nutmeg, dry bread crumbs, butter, slice lemon
descriptor: Thiwiener schnitzel ian easy German recipe, one of our favorites. Bonelespork chopcan also be substituted for veal, taste excellent!

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Combine kosher salt, caraway, sage, fennel, coriander, rosemary in a spice grinder or mortar. Grind to a coarse powder. Transfer spice mixture to a bowl; stir in paprika, garlic powder, flour, onion powder. Mix in vegetable oil to make a smooth paste. Pat chicken halvedry with paper toweland tuck wing tipbehind the back. Brush spice paste onto chicken halves, coating all sideand seasoning under wingand legs. Place chicken halves, skin-sideup, in a baking dish or roasting pan, leaving space around chickenso halvearen't touching. Roast in the preheated oven until no longer pink at the bone, the juicerun clear, about hour. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the thigh, near the bone, should read degreeF . Remove from the oven, let rest for minutebefore slicing.
ingredients: kosher salt, caraway seeds, dried sage, fennel seeds, coriander seeds, dried rosemary, paprika, garlic powder, all-purpose flour, onion powder, vegetable oil, broiler-fryer chicken, cut in half lengthwise
descriptor: Thiroasted half chicken iinspired by Brathähnchen, commonly served in Bavarian biergartens, small shops, food carts. You can serve thioven-roasted chicken with many side dishes, but favoriteinclude fried potatoeor spaetzle, a nice garden salad. Weisbeer doesn't hurt at all!

instructions:
These sweet, spicy, and totally delicious pfeffernusse cookies are packed with complex flavor. Trust us: You truly can't go wrong with this top-rated pfeffernusse recipe. Pfeffernusse are German spice cookies. "Pfeffernusse" translates to "peppernuts," which makes sense — these cookies are flavored with a cozy blend of warm spices, including black pepper. They also traditionally contain anise. These are the ingredients you'll need to this traditional pfeffernusse cookie recipe at home:,· Molasses and honey: These super sweet pfeffernusse cookies start with a blend of molasses and honey.
· Shortening and margarine: This recipe calls for shortening and margarine instead of butter, as butter tends to spread (we want these cookies to rise as high as possible).
· Eggs: Two large eggs lend moisture and help bind the cookie dough together.
· Flour: All-purpose flour gives the cookies structure.
· Sugars: You'll need a blend of white and brown sugars for this cozy pfeffernusse cookie recipe.
· Anise extract: Two teaspoons of anise extract give the cookies an even more complex flavor.
· Spices: These pfeffernusse cookies are spiced with cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, nutmeg, ginger, and black pepper.
· Baking soda: Baking soda acts as a leavener, which means it helps the cookie dough rise.
· Salt: A pinch of salt enhances the flavor of the cookies without making them taste salty. You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here's a brief overview of what you can expect when you make pfeffernusse:,1. Cook the first four ingredients on the stove. Cool, then beat in the eggs.
2. Combine the dry ingredients in another bowl, then add the wet mixture. Chill.
3. Roll the dough into balls.
4. Bake in the preheated oven until firm. Dust with confectioners' sugar. Allow the cookies to cool completely. Store them in an airtight container at room temperature for up to four days. Yes, you can freeze pfeffernusse! But it's best to freeze the cookie dough balls before baking. When you're ready to eat, just bake them according to the recipe and dust with powdered sugar before serving. "Made this exactly as the recipe calls for and these cookies were amazing," raves Pingpong. "Everyone who had them loved them and no wonder — the blend of spices blooms in your mouth very nicely.","These cookies are delicious and, as others have noted, better the next day," according to sharon-lynn. "Just a note: Do not boil the honey/molasses/sugar for too long. I did and it cooled to a hard ball...had to toss and start over!","I am happy with the results of this recipe," says Ruth Meadows. "I have never heard of it, but was intrigued by the ingredients. When I combined the wet and dry ingredients, it did not look like it was going to work and then *poof* everything came together.",Editorial contributions by Corey Williams,Place molasses, honey, shortening, and margarine in a saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir until creamy. Remove from heat and allow to cool to room temperature. Beat in eggs. Combine flour, white sugar, brown sugar, anise, cinnamon, cardamom, baking soda, cloves, nutmeg, ginger, black pepper, and salt in a large bowl. Add molasses mixture; stir until thoroughly combined. Refrigerate dough until well chilled, about 2 hours. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Roll dough into acorn-sized balls and place 1 inch apart on baking sheets. Bake in the preheated oven until firm to the touch with slight cracking, 10 to 15 minutes. Cool on the baking sheets briefly before removing them to a wire rack to cool completely. Dust cooled cookies with confectioners' sugar. Store in an airtight container.
ingredients: molasses, honey, shortening, margarine, large eggs, all-purpose flour, white sugar, brown sugar, anise extract, ground cinnamon, ground cardamom, baking soda, ground cloves, ground nutmeg, ground ginger, ground black pepper, salt, confectioners' sugar
descriptor: Pfeffernüsse are German Christmacookiespiced with black pepper, cinnamon, cardamom, other spices. I have searched far, wide for a recipe that mimicmy favorite, store-bought version of these cookies. After dayof thrown-out cookies, I think I have come aclose aI can get.

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Grease a -inch springform pan. Combine sugar, butter in a large bowl, beat with an electric mixer until light, fluffy. Add eggs, at a time, beat well after each addition. Combine flour, baking powder, salt in a separate bowl, sift on top of the butter mixture; mix to combine. Transfer batter into the prepared springform pan, smooth out. Set pluminside batter, cut-side up, sprinkle evenly with cinnamon-sugar. Bake in the preheated oven on the lowest rack until a toothpick inserted into the center comeout clean, to minutes. Serve warm or cool to room temperature.
ingredients: white sugar, unsalted butter, at room temperature, large eggs, all-purpose flour, baking powder, pinch salt, medium Italian plums, cinnamon sugar
descriptor: A super delicioucake, which ia great way of using plumwhen in-season. A buttery sponge cake itopped with plums, cinnamon, sugar, before being baked to perfection. Serve with cream or whipped cream.

instructions: Spread mustard over one side of each piece of steak; sprinkle onion, paprika, salt, pepper evenly over the steaks. Lay one slice of bacon on each piece; roll up steakjelly roll-style, secure with toothpicks. Heat canola oil in a skillet over medium heat; cook beef rouladen on all sideuntil browned. Add broth, water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low; cover, simmer until tender, about minutes. Remove beef rouladen; strain broth mixture, return liquid to the skillet. Whisk cornstarch, of water together until smooth; slowly pour cornstarch mixture into the skillet, stirring continually until the sauce hathickened, to minutes. Stir in sour cream; return rollto the sauce, serve immediately.
ingredients: Dijon mustard, round steak, pounded inch thick, onion, paprika, salt, freshly ground black pepper, bacon, canola oilcan beef broth, water, cornstarch, warm water, sour cream
descriptor: Thibeef rouladen recipe ianother great German dish that remindme of my mom'wonderful cooking. Enjoy thiunique, delicioudish!

instructions: Place sauerkraut, caraway seeds, brown sugar, apple into a large saucepan over medium-low heat, bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to low, cook for hours, stirring occasionally. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Grease a 9x-inch baking dish. Place bacon, onion into a skillet over medium heat, cook until bacon ialmost crisp, onion ibeginning to brown, about minutes. Stir the bacon mixture into the sauerkraut. Brown kielbasa sausage in remaining bacon grease in the same skillet until sausage beginto brown, to minutes; stir into the sauerkraut mixture. Spoon the sauerkraut, sausage mixture into the prepared baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven until bubbling, about hour.
ingredients: sauerkraut, caraway seed, brown sugar, apple, cooking spray, pound bacon, large onion poundkielbasa sausage, cut into -inch thick slices
descriptor: Thisauerkraut, sausage recipe ifrom a sweet old German lady I used to attend church with. Allow for plenty of time to prepare, cook thidish. It idefinitely worth the time, effort! Serve with hot German potato salad, red cabbage.

instructions:
Don't feel like going out tonight? You can easily make a gourmet restaurant-worthy meal in the comfort of your own kitchen with this top-rated chicken cordon bleu recipe. It's impressive, delicious, and way simpler than you think. A cordon bleu is a dish that traditionally consists of meat wrapped around cheese, then breaded and pan-fried or deep-fried. Many modern versions of the classic French recipe, such as this one, are baked. Classic chicken cordon bleu is made with the following ingredients: chicken cutlets, cooked ham, Swiss cheese, bread crumbs, and simple spices. It's usually topped with a rich cream sauce spiked with a hint of Dijon mustard. "Cordon bleu" translates to "blue ribbon." According to Larousse Gastronomique, a French food encyclopedia, the phrase dates back to medieval times when the most prestigious order a knight could earn was called the Cross of the Holy Spirit. The honor was signified by a medal that hung from a blue ribbon known as Le Cordon Bleu. Over time, the blue ribbon became a symbol of excellence. The term, meanwhile, became associated with food that meets the highest of standards or that is prepared by the most prestigious chefs. There are many ways to make chicken cordon bleu, from the traditional French method to the simple oven-baked one detailed here. You'll find the full recipe below, but here's a brief overview of what you can expect:,Cover the chicken cutlets with plastic wrap and pound them with a mallet to create thin, even pieces. Thoroughly season the chicken with salt and pepper. Top each piece of chicken with one slice of Swiss cheese and one slice of ham. Roll the chicken vertically so that the ham and cheese are contained. Secure each roll with a toothpick. Arrange the chicken rolls in a prepared baking dish. Sprinkle liberally and evenly with breadcrumbs. Bake until the chicken is no longer pink, top each roll with half a slice of Swiss, and continue baking until the cheese is melted. This recipe should be fully cooked after 30-35 minutes in an oven preheated to 350 degrees F. However, every oven is different — the chicken should no longer be pink and an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Chicken cordon bleu is traditionally topped with a decadent cream sauce made with Parmesan cheese and Dijon mustard — you can improvise your own recipe or try spiking our top-rated Alfredo Sauce with a hint of Dijon. Looking for some side dish inspiration? We've got you covered. Try one of these delicious ideas:,Mascarpone Mashed Potatoes
Easy Garden Green Beans
Gourmet Mushroom Risotto
Steamed Broccoli
Pommes Anna with Gruyere
Classic Restaurant Caesar Salad,Store your chicken cordon bleu leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for three to four days. Reheat in the oven instead of the microwave to avoid sogginess. About 10 minutes at 350 degrees F should do the trick. To freeze chicken cordon bleu, simply arrange the completely-cooled rolls on a lined baking sheet, cover, and freeze for about two hours. Transfer the now-frozen rolls to an airtight freezer bag labeled with the date. Freeze for up to four months. To thaw frozen chicken cordon bleu, transfer the container to the fridge the night before you plan to serve it. Bake the thawed rolls for about 10 minutes at 350 degrees F. "What a wonderful recipe," raves Pj kearns. "Simple and delicious! I did use a little olive oil to roll the chicken in after it was constructed and then lightly breaded them. Works out perfectly!","This recipe was the first I have cooked for my family, and they just would not stop complimenting me on it," says one Allrecipes community member. "Not yet being an experienced cook, I didn't add any gimmicks or tricks of my own, and I found that I didn't need to. A great, easy recipe!","Love this recipe," says LILYFIRE41. "My husband declared that this was one of his favorite things I've ever made, and he stressed what a big deal that was! Great recipe to use up leftover ham. I made it with the sauce that other members recommended (cream of chicken, lemon juice & sour cream).",Editorial contributions be Corey Williams,Gather all ingredients. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Coat a 7x11-inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. Pound chicken breasts to 1/4 inch thickness. Sprinkle each piece of chicken on both sides with salt and pepper. Place 1 Swiss cheese slice and 1 ham slice on top of each breast. Roll up each breast and secure with toothpicks. Place in the prepared baking dish and sprinkle chicken evenly with bread crumbs. Bake in the preheated oven until chicken is no longer pink, 30 to 35 minutes. Remove from the oven, and place 1/2 Swiss cheese slice on top of each breast. Return to the oven until cheese has melted, 3 to 5 minutes. Remove toothpicks and serve immediately.
ingredients: nonstick cooking spray, skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, salt, ground black pepper, sliceSwischeese, slicecooked ham, seasoned bread crumbs
descriptor: Thientree ieasy, delicious! It'one of my husband'favorites! Try to use the largest chicken breastyou can find so you'll be able to roll them easier.

instructions: There'nothing cozier than a warm bowl of freshly made French onion soup. With thitop-rated recipe, you can make restaurant-worthy French onion soup in the comfort of your own kitchen. Plus, get our best ingredient tipand storage secrets. French onion soup soupe à l'oignon gratinée, ia classic French dish made with caramelized onionand beef stock or broth. The soup itopped with bread, cheese, then gratinéed to rich, gooey perfection. It'traditionally served in a ramekin or a ceramic crock with a handle. French onion soup itraditionally topped with Gruyère, but other cheesecan be used. Most French onion soupare topped with three cheesefor maximum decadence. Thirecipe callfor Parmesan, provolone, Swiss. Other popular choiceinclude Fontina, mozzarella. No matter which cheeseyou choose, make sure not to skimp! French onion soup should be rich, indulgent. French onion soup itraditionally made with thinly sliced yellow onions. You can also make deliciousoup with red or white onion– it just dependon your flavor preferenceand what you have on hand. Transfer the cooled soup to an airtight container, but leave out the crouton. Store it in the fridge for up to three or four days. To reheat French onion soup, bring it to a boil on the stove. You can add more broiled bread, cheese if you want to go the extra mile, but you can use store-bought croutonfor quick, easy results. You can easily freeze French onion soup without the croutons: Just transfer the cooled soup to an airtight, freezer-safe container, freeze up to three months. To make thingeasier on your future self, you can freeze it in serving-size portion– that way, you don't have to thaw, refreeze the whole batch. To thaw frozen French onion soup, simply transfer it to the fridge, allow it to defrost overnight. In a rush? You can thaw it more quickly by submerging the sealed container in cool water. "Thiwaso easy...perfect for after work," according to one Allrecipecommunity member. "I used Gruyere, Leerdhammer cheeseand they were a great complement.","Thisoup waawesome," raveCANADIANCHICK. "I served it at my dinner party. Everyone loved it, asked for the recipe. I added of Worcestershire sauce, toasted the bread. It waexcellent!","Thisoup waexcellent! I did use different kindof onions, my husband, I couldn't get enough," sayIRED. "I can't wait to make it again.",Editorial contributionby Corey Williams,Gather all ingredients. Melt butter with olive oil in an -quart stock pot over medium heat. Add onionto butter, continually stir until tender, translucent. Do not brown the onions. Add beef broth, sherry, thyme. Season with salt, pepper. Let simmer for minutes. Meanwhile, preheat the oven'broiler. Ladle soup into oven-safe serving bowland place one slice of bread on top of each . Layer each slice of bread with a slice of provolone, slice diced Swisand Parmesan cheese. Place bowlon a cookie sheet, broil in the preheated oven until cheese bubbleand brownslightly, to minutes. Serve hot, enjoy!
ingredients: unsalted butter, olive oil onions, beef broth, dry sherry, dried thyme, pinch salt, pepper, sliceFrench bread, sliceprovolone cheese, sliced Swiss Cheese, Grated Parmesan cheese
descriptor: We have been trying French onion soup in restaurantfor years, my family, friendagree — none can compare to my recipe for taste, simplicity of preparation.

instructions:
Are you intimidated by the thought of making crêpes at home? Don't be! This crêpe recipe yields perfectly delicate, tender results every time. Crêpes are very thin pancakes. They can be served with a wide variety of sweet and savory fillings and toppings. The breakfast staple dates back to at least 13th-century France. Making homemade crêpes is easier than you think. You'll find a detailed ingredient list and step-by-step instructions in the recipe below, but let's go over the basics:,Crêpes are easy to make with basic ingredients you likely already have on hand:,· Flour: These basic French crêpes start with a cup of all-purpose flour.
· Eggs: Eggs act as a binder, which means they help hold the batter together.
· Milk: Milk adds moisture and keeps the crêpes tender.
· Water: Water helps thin the batter.
· Salt: A pinch of salt enhances the overall flavor.
· Butter: Butter lends richness and moisture to the crêpes. Here's a very brief overview of what you can expect when you make homemade crêpes:,1. Whisk the flour and eggs.
2. Gradually add the milk and water.
3. Scoop the batter onto a hot griddle.
4. Cook until lightly browned on the bottom.
5. Flip and continue cooking until done on both sides. You can fill and top your crêpes with whatever you like! Popular choices include whipped cream, fresh fruit, fruit sauce, cream cheese, and chocolate-hazelnut spread (such as Nutella). You can also make savory crepes with cheese, meats, and veggies. A fun way to serve crêpes: Set up a crêpe bar where everyone can assemble their own creations with whatever toppings and fillings they want!,Stack the crepes with wax paper in between each layer. Place them in an airtight container or zip-top bag, then store in the refrigerator for up to two days. You can freeze the crêpes for up to two months. "This by far is the best crêpes recipe I tried," raves one Allrecipes community member. "I love crêpes, I am used to the real deal and this is it. I strongly recommend not to make them thick, just remember that you are making crêpes not pancakes.","Such an easy recipe that you can doctor up any way you want," according to Sarah "Wilson" Arnold. "I followed the recipe, only added a bit of sugar and vanilla and they are perfect!","Love these and so easy," says Kimberly Kays. "I served them with Greek yogurt, honey, and blueberries.",Editorial contributions by Corey Williams,Whisk flour and eggs together in a large mixing bowl; gradually add in milk and water, stirring to combine. Add salt and melted butter; beat until smooth. Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium-high heat. Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each crêpe. Tilt the pan with a circular motion so that the batter coats the surface evenly. Cook until the top of the crêpe is no longer wet and the bottom has turned light brown, 1 to 2 minutes. Run a spatula around the edge of the skillet to loosen the crêpe; flip and cook until the other side has turned light brown, about 1 minute more. Serve hot. Read our picks for the best non-stick cookware to make cooking your favorite recipes that much easier. Once you've mastered this basic recipe, try your hand at a crêpe cake!
ingredients: all-purpose flour, large eggs, milk, water, salt, butter,
descriptor: Thisimple but delicioucrêpe recipe can be made in minutefrom ingredientthat everyone haon hand.

instructions: Dice tomatoes, place in a colander for about minuteto drain. Transfer drained tomatoeto a bowl, gently fold in shallots, garlic, parsley, tarragon, Kalamata olives, basil. Pour olive oil, lemon juice over the vegetables, stir until combined. Allow mixture to sit for about minutefor the flavorto meld.
ingredients: small tomatoe, shallots, clove garlicfresh parsleyfresh tarragon,Kalamata olives, large basil leaves extra-virgin olive oil, freshly squeezed lemon juice, salt, ground black pepper
descriptor: Thisauce iFrench inspired, traditionally served over delicate white fish or seafood, but it'equally good over pork tenderloin, chicken, even steamed veggies. Ittaste ifresh, light, pure, it'so very simple to make.

instructions:
This hearty meat pie recipe is quick, easy, and full of satisfying and crowd-pleasing ingredients. You'll find a detailed ingredient list and step-by-step instructions in the recipe below, but let's go over the basics:,These are the ingredients you'll need to make this homemade meat pie recipe:,· Meat: The "meat" in this meat pie is a combination of ground beef and ground pork.
· Vegetables: You'll need a potato and an onion.
· Spices and seasonings: This hearty meat pie is flavored with garlic, mustard powder, dried thyme, dried sage, ground cloves, salt, and pepper.
· Water: Add ¼ cup of water to the ground meat mixture as it cooks.
· Pie crust: Use a store-bought or homemade double pastry crust. Here's a very brief overview of what you can expect when you make a classic meat pie at home:,1. Boil and mash the potatoes.
2. Cook the meat with the water, onion, garlic, and seasonings.
3. Mix in the potatoes, then fill the pie crust. Cover with the top crust.
4. Bake until the crust is browned. Meat pie is traditionally served alone or with Beef Gravy. It would also pair well with roasted vegetables (such as these Roasted Parsnips and Carrots) or classic side dishes, like Cream Peas or Mashed Potatoes. Store your leftover meat pie in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to four days. Reheat thoroughly in the oven or in the microwave. "Excellent pie," raves one Allrecipes community member. "Just the right amount of seasoning. I used instant potato flakes to thicken it and doubled the recipe to make two pies. This will be my meat pie recipe from now on.","This wonderful meat pie epitomizes the term 'comfort food,'" according to jshell43. "So easy to put together, it's almost a complete meal in itself. Just add a nice garden salad and voila…dinner is served!","We replaced half the ground pork with ground beef," says pdm. "This recipe was easy, the result was yummy and reminded us of the French Canadian meat pie we have had many times over the years.",Editorial contributions by Corey Williams,Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Place potato in a saucepan with enough water to cover. Bring to a boil, and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Drain, mash, and set aside. Meanwhile, crumble ground beef and pork into a large saucepan. Add onion, garlic, mustard powder, thyme, sage, cloves, salt, and black pepper. Stir in water. Cook over medium heat, stirring, until meat is evenly browned. Remove from the heat and mix in mashed potato. Ease one pie crust into a 9-inch pie plate. Fill with meat mixture, then top with the remaining pie crust. Trim any excess dough, then crimp the edges with the tines of a fork to seal. Prick top crust a few times with a knife to vent steam. Cover the edges of the crust with aluminum foil. Bake in the preheated oven until crust is browned, about 25 minutes.
ingredients: medium potato, cubed, pound ground beef, pound ground porkonion, clove garlic mustard powder, dried thyme, dried sage, ground cloves, salt, ground black pepper, waterpackage refrigerated pie crusts
descriptor: Thimeat pie idelicious! I got it from my husband'mother. She iFrench so I believe thiia French meat pie recipe. Beef, pork, potato are all nicely spiced, baked together. It'yummy, pretty easy to make too! It'best served fresh, but you can also make it ahead, freeze or refrigerate it. Serve the pie by itself or with a beef gravy.

instructions: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion; cook, stir until translucent, about minutes. Add mushroomand garlic; cook, stir until mushroomare soft, about minutes. Season with salt, black pepper. Transfer onion, mushroom mixture to a small bowl. Heat remaining oil in the same skillet. Add remaining garlic; cook, stir until fragrant, about seconds. Add spinach; cook, stir until wilted, to minutes. Season with salt, black pepper. Transfer to another bowl. Preheat oven to degreeF . Line a glasbaking dish with parchment paper. Dust work surface with flour. Lay puff pastry sheet out on work surface; spread onion, mushroom mixture evenly acrospastry, leaving a /-inch border. Center salmon on top; sprinkle paprika over salmon, top with wilted spinach. Cover with second puff pastry sheet. Fold over, crimp edgeto seal. Brush top with beaten egg. Transfer to prepared baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven until pastry igolden, to minutes. Let cool briefly, then slice into portions. To make the sauce: Whisk mayonnaise, lemon juice, Dijon mustard, dill together in a small bowl. Spoon sauce onto plateand place a piece of salmon en croûte on each. You can substitute spinach with asparaguspears, use heaping fresh dill instead of dried if preferred. Use espelette pepper instead of the smoked paprika if you can find it. If using a convection oven, bake for to minutes.
ingredients: olive oil, divided, onion chopped fresh mushrooms, garlic, divided, salt, ground black pepper, baby spinach, all-purpose flour, sheetfrozen puff pastry, boned, skinned salmon fillet, smoked paprika egg, beaten
descriptor: Salmon en croûte ia deliciously tender salmon fillet wrapped in crispy puff pastry with a spinach, mushroom filling. I like to serve it with a thin lemon-mustard sauce, a side of rice or asparagufor an impressive French-inspired meal.

instructions: Pour water into a bread machine pan; add flour. Sprinkle milk powder over flour. Place sugar, salt, of softened butter into the cornerof the pan. Make a small indent in the top of the dry ingredientand place yeast in the indent. Run the bread machine on the basic dough setting. Meanwhile, lay out a sheet of waxed or parchment paper. Shape the remaining of butter into a x-inch rectangle on the waxed paper; wrap, chill until ready to use. Remove butter from the refrigerator, allow to soften while you roll out dough. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface; roll into a x-inch rectangle. Place butter on half of the dough, leaving a /-inch border of dough on sides. Fold the other half of dough over butter, presthe edgefirmly to seal. Roll the dough out to a x-inch rectangle. Fold the dough in thirdfrom the long ends, ayou would fold a businesletter. Cover dough loosely with plastic wrap, refrigerate for minutes. Remove the dough from the refrigerator. Place it onto a lightly floured surface so that the folded edge faceyou. Roll the dough out again into a x-inch rectangle, fold into thirds. Cover with plastic, chill for minutes. Repeat step, then chill the dough for minutes. In a small bowl, beat together the egg yolk, milk; set aside. Grease two baking sheets. Roll dough out into a x-inch rectangle. Cut dough into thirdin both directions, to make rectangles. Divide chocolate among the rectangles. Lightly brush egg yolk mixture around the edgeof each piece. Starting at a short end, roll each piece of dough around the chocolate; presthe edgetogether to seal. Place the croissantonto the prepared baking sheets; cover with greased plastic wrap, allow to rise in a warm place until they have doubled in size, about minutes. Preheat oven to degreeF . Brush the top of the pastriewith the remaining egg yolk mixture. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about minutes. Cool for minuteon the baking sheets, then transfer croissantto wire racks. Serve warm or at room temperature. To reduce the 'day of' preparation time, make the dough, refrigerate the unbaked rollovernight. Pull them out hour before baking in the morning to come to room temperature.
ingredients: warm water, bread flour, instant nonfat dry milk, white sugar, salt, butter, instant yeast, butter, egg yolk, milk, semisweet chocolate chunks
descriptor: Thipain au chocolat recipe makelight, flaky French croissantfilled with deliciouchocolate. They do require a little effort but a bread machine makethe procesa lot easier. Your entire family will love these!

instructions: Thichoux pastry recipe iperfect for beginner bakerand seasoned proalike. Choux pastry ia French pastry dough that imade without leavening agents. Instead, it relieon a high moisture content to create steam, puff the pastry during baking. The delicate dough iassociated with cream puffs, eclairs, beignets, so many more decadent desserts. You’ll need just six simple ingredientto make thitraditional choux pastry recipe:,You’ll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here’a brief overview of what you can expect when you make homemade choux pastry:,Thirecipe wadeveloped in our test kitchen. Check out some tipand trickfrom culinary expertthat might make the cooking proceseasier:,Ready to put your homemade choux pastry to good use? Try one of these sweet ideastraight from our test kitchen:,Editorial contributionby Corey Williams,Gather all ingredients. Combine water, butter, sugar, salt in a medium saucepan over medium heat; cook until butter hamelted, mixture cometo a boil. Add flour all at once; stir vigorously with a wooden spoon over medium-low heat until mixture forma ball, the saucepan icoated in a light film of flour, about to minutes. Remove the pan from heat, let cool for minutes. Beat in eggs, one at a time, with the wooden spoon until the mixture forma sticky dough with a pipeable consistency.
ingredients: water, butter, cut into small cubes, white sugar, pinch salt, all-purpose flour, large eggs, lightly beaten
descriptor: Choux pastry pâte à choux, isurprisingly easy to make with butter, hot water, flour, eggs. The dough cometogether in lesthan minutes, then steamand puffup in the oven, making it perfect for eclairs, profiteroles, choux pastry rings, savory gougères, more!

instructions: Preheat oven to degreeF , line a 9x inch baking pan with parchment paper. Beat sugar with the butter until the mixture ismooth, creamy, beat in the egg. Add the baking powder, stir in the flour, at a time, alternating with a few of the milk, until all the flour, milk have been incorporated. The dough will be sticky, like sugar cookie dough. Spread the dough into the prepared baking dish, creating a raised edge of dough around the dish. Place the blueberriein a bowl with of sugar, mash the berriewith a potato masher. Spread the blueberry mixture on top of the crust in an even layer. Bake in the preheated oven until the crust habrowned slightly, the filling ithickened, bubbling, to minutes. I learned thirecipe from a wonderful Finnish woman while living in Finland aa missionary. Because the measurementwere in metric, I've converted them to English measurements.
ingredients: white sugar, butter, egg, baking powder, all-purpose flour, milk, pintfresh blueberries, white sugar more
descriptor: Thipie, with itsugar cookie-like crust, isimple to make, storewell in the fridge or on the counter during cool weather up to days. It can be served hot, cold, plain with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream on the side.

instructions: Heat water to boiling in a medium pot; add potatoes. Reduce heat, simmer until potatoeare tender, approximately to minutes. Add salt, pepper, butter, onions, carrotand green beans; simmer until tender then add peas. In a small bowl, stir together half-and-half, flour until smooth; stir into the simmering vegetables. Cook, stirring constantly until the soup islightly thickened. Serve immediately.
ingredients: water small potatoes, peeled salt ground black pepper butter green onions, cut into inch length baby carrot poundfresh green beans, cut into -inch length fresh shelled green pea half-and-half all-purpose flour
descriptor: Thisoup should be made with fresh vegetables. Serve with a bread, cheese platter athey do in Finland. If you can't get fresh shelled green peas, use frozen tiny green peas.

instructions: Preheat oven to degreeF . Place butter in a 9x-inch baking dish, place in the preheating oven until about minutes. Beat milk, flour, eggs, sugar, salt together in a bowl until batter ismooth. Pour melted butter from baking dish into batter, beat until smooth. Pour batter into the baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven until cooked through, to minutes.
ingredients: butter, milk, all-purpose flour, eggs, white sugar, salt
descriptor: A quick, easy Finnish egg pancake that igreat plain, with salt, pepper, maple syrup with your favorite pancake topping.

instructions: Preheat an oven to degreeF . Grease a quart casserole dish. Place the carrot, turnip cubeinto a large pot, cover with salted water. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low, cover, simmer until tender, about minutes. Drain, allow to steam dry for a minute or two. Return the carrotand turnipto the pot, mash well with the butter, salt, flour, of sugar. Whisk together the eggand milk in a bowl, then stir into the mashed carrot mixture until blended. Scrape into the prepared casserole dish. Stir together of sugar with the cinnamon in a small bowl, sprinkle over the top of the carrot mash. Bake in the preheated oven until the carrot mash haslightly firmed, the top habegun to turn golden brown, about minutes.
ingredients: large carrots, cubed, large turnip, cubed, softened butter, salt, all-purpose flour, white sugar, eggs, milk, white sugar, ground cinnamon
descriptor: Carrotand sugar sweeten the turnip in thiside dish. A must for my family'Thanksgiving, Christmadinners. The recipe ioften requested.

instructions: Mix ground beef, bread crumbs, onion, egg, cream, salt, allspice in a bowl with your handuntil evenly mixed. Roll mixture into golf ball-sized spheres. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook about half the meatballin melted butter until evenly browned on all sides, to minutes; remove to a plate, repeat with remaining meatballs, keeping liquid in the skillet when finished. Sift flour into the skillet drippings; cook flour in the skillet drippinguntil brown, to minutes. Slowly stream milk into the skillet while whisking vigorously; pour cream into mixture, stir until smooth. If you aren't good at making gravy, end up with some lumpyou can pour gravy through a strainer. Return all meatballto the skillet; stir to coat with gravy. Bring the mixture to a simmer, cook until the meatballare cooked through, to minutes.
ingredients: pound lean ground beef, plain bread crumbs, yellow onion, egg, whipping cream, salt, ground allspice, butter, all-purpose flour, milk, whipping cream
descriptor: These Finnish meatballs lihapyorykoita, are my family'favorite meal. They're made with punajuuret beets, perunasose, which are mashed potatoes. Serve it with cranberry sauce. Personally, I also like it with a quarter of a pickle on the side.

instructions: Melt butter in a large pot over medium-high heat. Cook beef in hot butter until browned on all sides. Pour in water, bring to a boil. Add onion, salt, pepper. Reduce heat to low, simmer for hour. Add potatoes, carrots, celery; simmer for more hours. Whisk together remaining water, flour in a small bowl to form a thin paste; stir into soup, simmer until thickened, about minutes.
ingredients: stickbutter, poundbonelesbeef roast, water, divided, onion salt, ground black pepper, potatoes, cubed, carrots stalkcelery all-purpose flour
descriptor: Thimojakka soup ia staple in any Finnish household. Serve with flatbread .

instructions: Combine rice, water in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover, simmer for minutes until water iabsorbed. Stir in milk, cover, cook until milk iabsorbed by the rice, about minutes. Season with salt. Preheat the oven to degreeF . In a medium bowl, stir together salt, rye flour. Stir in water. Mix in all-purpose flour at a time until dough ijust past the sticky stage. Divide the dough into equal portions. On a lightly floured surface, roll each piece of dough out into a thin circle, inchein diameter. The dough should be athin apossible. Place about of the rice mixture in the center of each circle. Spread the mixture out to within inch of the edges. Fold the edgeof the dough upward, crimp the edgeso ato allow the pastrieto hold their shape. Pinch the sideat each end to form a little boat. Place pastrieabout incheapart on an ungreased baking sheet, brush the topwith butter. Bake for to minutein the preheated oven, until the dough ifirm, the rice porridge islightly browned on the top. Serve warm.
ingredients: water, uncooked white rice, milk, salt, water, salt, rye flour, all-purpose flour, butter,
descriptor: These savory Karelian pie were my favorite thing to eat in Finland. Rice porridge surrounded by a rye flour crust, baked until slightly browned. In Finland, these pastrieare often eaten at breakfast or lunch. Delicioutopped with ham, cheese just butter.

instructions: Preheat oven to degreeF ,In a medium bowl stir together sugar, flour, salt. Add eggand milk. Beat with an electric mixer until blended. Batter will be very thin. Melt butter in the baking pan. Turn the pan to be sure all of the sideare coated then stir the remaining butter into the batter. Pour batter into the baking pan, bake for minutes. It will puff up when baking, flatten when cool.Cut into squareand serve.
ingredients: eggs, white sugar, salt, milk, all-purpose flour, butter
descriptor: Thidelicioubar ia treat that can be served for breakfast or with tea. Serve with syrup, jelly or honey.

instructions: Heat the milk in a small saucepan until it bubbles, then remove from heat. Stir in the margarine, sugar, salt until melted. Let cool until lukewarm. In a small bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water. Let stand until creamy, about minutes. Pour milk mixture into a large bowl. Beat in eggs, flour, cardamom, yeast mixture. Cover, let stand for to minutes until bubbly. Stir in the remaining flour, at a time, beating well after each addition. When the dough hapulled together, turn it out onto a lightly floured surface, knead until smooth, supple, about minutes. Lightly oil a large bowl, place the dough in the bowl, turn to coat with oil. Cover with a damp cloth, let rise in a warm place until doubled in volume, about hour. Deflate the dough, turn it out onto a lightly floured surface. Divide the dough into three equal pieceand then divide each piece into thirds. Roll out with your handuntil the pieceare long enough to braid. Braid three piecetogether to form a loaf; repeat twice to make three loaves. Place on lightly greased baking sheetand let rise for minutes, until nearly doubled. Meanwhile, preheat oven to degreeF . Bake in preheated oven for minutes, until golden brown. Move to a wire rack to cool completely. In a small bowl, mix together butter, confectioners' sugar. Stir in vanilla, milk to make a spreadable frosting. Spread the frosting over the cooled bread.
ingredients: milk, margarine, white sugar, salt,packageactive dry yeast, warm water, eggs, ground cardamom, bread flour, butter, confectioners' sugar, vanilla extract, milk
descriptor: Nissua ia tender Finnish sweet bread made with cardamom. Thibread iformed into braided loaveor wreaths, topped with a simple frosting.

instructions: Whisk together flour, salt in a large bowl. Cut shortening. Make a well in the center of the mixture, quickly stir in ice cold water. Form dough into a ball. Set aside. Dissolve the bouillon cube in the hot water. Combine uncooked vegetables, uncooked meats, salt, pepper, monosodium glutamate, bouillon. Roll out pastry dough into x inch rectangles. Place about of filling in the center of each rectangle. Bring inch sidetogether, seal. Cut a slit in the top of each pasty. Place on dull, not black, baking pans. Bake at degreeF for minutes.
ingredients: all-purpose flour, shortening, ice water, salt, thinly sliced potatoes, carrots, shredded, onions, diced rutabaga, poundlean ground beef, pound lean ground pork, salt, ground black pepper, monosodium glutamate , cube beef bouillon, hot water
descriptor: I make these pastieabout once a month for my family, extended family. I weigh my ingredientfor accuracy, flavor.

instructions: Preheat oven to degreeF . Melt the butter in a 9x inch pan. In a medium bowl, stir together the sugar, flour, baking powder, salt. Add the beaten eggand milk; mix well. Tilt the baking pan to coat all of the sidewith butter, then pour the excesbutter into the batter, mix until combined. Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for to minutein the preheated oven. Serve hot.
ingredients: butter, white sugar, all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, eggs, milk
descriptor: A family favorite, thirecipe ihanded down to each generation. Thirich, airy treat ibest when served hot with jam or jelly.

instructions: Stir together salt, paprika, black pepper, onion powderegano, cumin, garlic powder, chili powder in a bowl. Store in a sealed jar in a cool, dry place.
ingredients: salt paprika ground black pepper onion powder dried oregano ground cumin garlic powder chili powder
descriptor: Thiadobo seasoning ioften used in Mexican, Filipino dishes. I've recently started mixing my own seasonings.

instructions: Tosgrated papaya with salt together in a large bowl; allow to sit for hour. Drain liquid from papaya, rinse thoroughly. Place papaya in the middle of a large piece of cheesecloth, squeeze to drain amuch liquid from the papaya apossible. Combine papaya, carrot, bell pepper, chile peppers, ginger, raisintogether in a clean large bowl; mix. Transfer the mixture to clean, dry jarwith lids. Stir vinegar, water, sugar, salt together in a small saucepan; bring to a boil for minutes. Pour the vinegar mixture into the jars, making sure the vegetableare completely submerged in liquid. Allow vegetableto marinate in the liquid at least day before using. Store in the refrigerator between uses.
ingredients: grated fresh green papaya, salt, carrot, red bell pepper into long strips, green chile pepperinto thin rings, piece fresh ginger root,box raisins, white vinegar, water, white sugar, salt
descriptor: Thiatsara recipe ia Filipino relish made normally with very fresh green papayas. Sauerkraut can also be used.

instructions: Place sliced beef in a large bowl. Whisk together lemon juice, soy sauce, sugar, salt, pepper in a small bowl; pour over beef, tosto coat. Stir in cornstarch. Cover, refrigerate for hour to overnight. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Remove beef slicefrom marinade, shaking to remove any excesliquid. Discard marinade. Working in batches, fry beef slicein hot oil until they start to firm, are reddish-pink, juicy in the center, to minuteper side. Transfer beef sliceto a serving platter. Heat olive oil in a small skillet over medium heat. Cook, stir onion, garlic in hot oil until onion igolden brown, to minutes; spoon over beef slices.
ingredients: poundNew York strip steak thin, lemon, juiced, soy sauce, white sugar, salt, pepper, cornstarch, vegetable oil, olive oil, onion clove garlic, chopped
descriptor: Thibeef steak ia very easy recipe to make. A tender cut of beef isliced thin, then marinated with lemon juice, soy sauce for at least an hour.

instructions: Remove casing from sausage, cook in a skillet over medium heat until slightly browned, to minutes. Add green onions, carrots, water chestnuts, onion. Cook, stir until onionare soft, translucent, to minutes. Add garlic, cook for to minutes. Season with soy sauce, salt, ginger. Stir until filling iwell combined; remove from heat. Lay a spring roll wrapper at an angle. Place a scant filling in the center of the wrapper. Fold bottom corner over filling, tuck in the sideto form a roll. Use your finger to lightly moisten edgewith water. Repeat with remaining wrapperand filling. Mist each roll with avocado oil cooking spray. Preheat an air fryer to degreeF . Place lumpia rollin the air fryer basket, making sure they are not touching; cook in batcheif necessary. Fry for minutes; flip, cook until skinare crispy, about minutemore. I used a mini food processor to chop the carrotand water chestnuts.
ingredients: pound Italian hot sausage links, finely sliced green onions, finely chopped carrots, finely chopped water chestnuts, diced onions, clove garlic, soy sauce, salt, ground ginger, spring roll wrappers, avocado oil cooking spray
descriptor: Thirecipe for lumpia in the air fryer resultin the same crispineswithout having to deep-fry. Your taste budwill never know the difference, but your waistline will!

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Stir yuca, coconut milk, condensed milk, evaporated milk, eggtogether in a bowl until thoroughly combined; pour into a -quart baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven until set, about hour. Turn the broiler on, bake until top of cake ibrowned, to minutes. Cool completely in the refrigerator before serving, about hour.
ingredients: grated, peeled yuca can coconut milk can sweetened condensed milk can evaporated milk large eggs, beaten
descriptor: Thicassava cake ia Pinoy dessert best served cold. It ieasy to make if you are looking for a Filipino dessert.

instructions: Combine ground pork, ground beef, onion, carrot in a large bowl; mix well with hands. Gradually blend in soy sauce, salt, garlic powder, pepper until incorporated. Working one at a time, lay a wrapper on a flat surface with a corner pointing at you. Place about filling in a line, no thicker than your thumb, acrosthe center of the wrapper. Moisten the edgeof wrapper with water. Fold the bottom edge of wrapper snugly over filling. Fold in the left, right sideof wrapper towardthe center. Roll up tightly to seal in filling. Heat oil in a deep fryer or heavy skillet to degreeF . Working in batches, fry lumpia in hot oil, turning once, until golden brown, to minutes. Drain on a paper towel-lined plate. Cut lumpia in half serve as-iwith dipping sauce. We have determined the nutritional value of oil based on a retention value of after cooking. The exact amount may vary depending on cook time, temperature, ingredient density, the specific type of oil used.
ingredients: pound ground pork, pound ground beef, medium onion, carrot, grated, soy sauce, salt, garlic powder, black pepperpackage spring roll wrappers, water, quartoil
descriptor: Lumpia Shanghai ia smaller, meatier type of egg roll that we Filipinoare very proud of! You could use pork, beef both. It'a very easy, yummy recipe that'great afinger food. We serve these spring rollwith sweet, sour sauce, soy sauce with lemon banana ketchup.

instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion; cook, stir until translucent, about minutes. Season with salt. Stir in ginger, tomatoes, pork chops. Cover, reduce heat to medium-low. Turn the pork occasionally, until browned. Pour in water, tamarind soup base. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat, simmer until the pork itender, cooked through, about minutes. Stir in green beanand cook until tender.
ingredients: vegetable oil, small onion salt, piece fresh ginger plum tomatoes, pound bone-in pork chops, water, more if needed,package tamarind soup base , pound fresh green beans, trimmed
descriptor: Sinigang ia Filipino soup cooked with pork. Serve with rice, for additional sauce, use soy or fish sauce. If you want to, you can add what Filipinocall gabi gabi, which ia small taro root. When peeled they look like potatoes. You can add five to six of them when you add the water, make sure they are cooked through. Take them out when they are cooked because they can get too soft.

instructions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat; stir in onion, garlic, cook until tender, about minutes. Add pork; cook, stir until browned, to minutes. Add prawns; cook, stir until they turn pink, about minutes. Stir in tomato; season with salt, pepper, cover, simmer for minutes. Stir in zucchini, okra, green beans, eggplant, bitter melon; cover, cook until the vegetableare tender, about minutes.

descriptor: Pinakbet ia vegetable-based dish from the Philippinethat can be served aan everyday dish or when you have company. Since it also containpork, prawns, you can eat it aa one-pot meal.

instructions: Toscabbage with vinegar, sugar, coriander, pepper, salt in a large bowl. Massage spiceinto cabbage using your hands. Adjust seasoning adesired with additional sugar or salt. Stir in Thai chile. Cover, chill until sugar, salt dissolve, at least minutes.

instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chicken pieceuntil golden brown, to minuteper side. Transfer chicken to a plate, set aside. Add onion, garlic to the skillet; cook until brown, about minutes. Pour in soy sauce, vinegar, season with garlic powder, black pepper, bay leaf. instructions: Get ready for a fragrant chicken soup loaded with fresh vegetableand bold seasonings. Thitop-rated recipe boastan intensely savory flavor that makeit stand out from the pack. Try your hand at thiterrific chicken tinola, make tonight'dinner one to remember. Tinola ia traditional Filipino comfort food that usually consistof broth, chicken, leafy greens, papaya, ginger. Fish sauce ia key ingredient that lenda deliciously pungent taste. Chicken tinola ioften served with rice to make a hearty meal. Thiversion featurechayote squash, bok choy for a fresh, vibrant spin on traditional chicken soup. Make thiwarming Filipino chicken soup a part of your regular rotation. You'll find the full recipe below with step-by-step instructions, but here'what you can expect when you make thitop-rated recipe:,Begin gently cooking the onion, garlic in a large pot over medium heat until fragrant. Add the ginger, fish sauce, chicken, cook for about five minutes. Stir in the broth, squash, seasoningbefore simmering until the chicken iwhite in the center. Add bok choy, spinach, cooking the mixture just until the greenare wilted. Serve the soup hot by itself or paired with rice. Refrigerate the leftover chicken tinola in an airtight container for up to three days. If you'd like to freeze chicken tinola, use a heavy-duty bag or large, tight-lidded container for best results. Reheat on the stovetop. "Thisoup isoo good!" raveYum Yum Betty. "I substituted zucchini, yellow squash for the chayote squash, added an extra can of chicken broth, mushrooms, hot chili oil. I will definitely make thiagain.","I waactually very afraid making thibecause it'out of my comfort zone but my husband iFilipino & I really wanted to make thifor him," sharekaylaem. "It came out perfectly – thank you so much for sharing the recipe!","Deliciouand great for a rainy day," sayRaivyn. "Tasted like my mom's, wavery easy to make.",Editorial contributionby Rai Mincey,Gather all ingredients. Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion, garlic; cook, stir until fragrant, about minutes. Add ginger, fish sauce; cook, stir for to minutes. Stir in chicken, cook for minutes. Pour in chicken broth, cook for minutes. Add squash, simmer until chicken ino longer pink in the center, about minutes. Season with salt, pepper. Add bok choy, spinach; cook until spinach ijust wilted, to minutes. Serve hot. You can use a green papaya instead of chayote squash if preferred.
ingredients: cooking oil, medium onion clove garlic, piece fresh ginger, fish sauce, poundchicken legand thighs, patted drycanchicken broth, chayote squash, cut into bite-sized pieces, salt, ground black pepper, head bok choy package fresh spinach, chopped
descriptor: Tinola ian easy, one-pot soup from the Philippines. Chicken, chayote squash , bok choy, spinach are simmered with fresh ginger in a savory broth that'often served with white rice.

instructions: Thipancit recipe ia flavor sensation —, it cometogether in just half an hour!,Pancit ia Filipino dish. There are many different typeof pancit, but it alwayfeaturerice noodleand vegetable. You’ll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here’a brief overview of what you can expect when you make homemade pancit:,Pancit itraditionally made with vermicelli rice noodles. The great thing about rice noodles? You don’t have to boil them! Just soften them in water, you’re good to go. If you don’t have rice noodleon hand, you can use udon or chow mein noodles. If you’re in need of some serving inspiration, we’ve got you covered. Explore our entire collection of Filipino Recipes check out one of these mouthwatering recipe collections:,Store your leftover pancit in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to four dayor freeze for up to three months. Thaw in the refrigerator overnight. “Awesome starter recipe,” according to LittleMsBozzi. “I added in some fish sauce, Maggi seasoning, shrimp, soft-boiled eggand it waincredible.”,“Thiimy second time making it, it'so good,” raveSweetCatalyst. “The mixture of soy sauce, garlic, onion, lemon juice are what make the dish. It only needed a sprinkle of salt to make the taste pop.”,“I make thiall the time now,” saySara Vogt. “Leftoverwarm up great, it'quick, easy, cheap! Everyone I make thifor begfor more!”,Editorial contributionby Corey Williams,Place rice noodlein a large bowl; cover with warm water, let soften for to minutes. Drain, set aside. Meanwhile, heat oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-low heat. Add onion, garlic; cook, stir until onion itender, about to minutes. Stir in chicken, cabbage, carrots, soy sauce. Cook until cabbage beginto soften. Tosin noodleand cook, stirring constantly, until heated through. Transfer pancit to a serving dish, garnish with lemon wedges.

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Grease cookie sheets. In a medium bowl, cream butter to soften. Combine the flour, sugar, baking soda, stir into the softened butter. Drop by rounded spoonfulonto the prepared cookie sheet. Presdown sightly with a cold fork. Bake for to minutein the preheated oven. Allow cookieto cool on baking sheet for minutebefore removing to a wire rack to cool completely.
ingredients: butter, all-purpose flour, white sugar, baking soda
descriptor: These cookieare delightful all year round. Buttery, light they will melt in your mouth.

instructions: Preheat oven to F . Cream together the butter, shortening, sugar, vanilla. Sift together the flour, baking soda, salt. Add to sugar mixture, mix well, being careful not to over mix. Drop heaping fulof dough on ungreased cookie sheet, flatten each with the tineof a fork . Do thionce or twice, depending on the size of cookie, fork. Bake for to minutes. After each pan iremoved from oven, carefully place or chocolate chipon top of each cookie while they are still hot. When chocolate iglossy, soft, spread with knife.
