instructions: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Combine the garlic, onion, basil, parsley, mint, paprika, cumin, coriander, diced bell peppers, lemon juice, olive oil in a food processor. Pulse the vegetableuntil finely chopped. Add the halved tomatoeand procesuntil the mixture ia thick puree. Place the lamb in the preheated skillet, reduce the heat to medium. Add the puree, the tomato paste, mix well. Cook, stir until the lamb icooked through, to minutes. Stir in cayenne pepper, salt. Transfer the mixture to a shallow baking dish to cool to room temperature. Cover with plastic wrap, refrigerate overnight. Dissolve the yeast, sugar in warm water. Combine the flour, salt in a mixing bowl, stir well. Add the vegetable oil, water to the yeast mixture, pour it over the flour. Use your handto mix the dough. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface, knead until smooth, elastic, about minutes. Shape the dough into a ball, transfer to an oiled bowl. Cover with a wet towel, let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk, about hour. Remove the lamb sauce from the refrigerator, allow it to come up to room temperature. Prepare the garlic sauce: combine the yogurt, parsley, crushed garlic, salt, pepper. Stir well, set aside. Punch the dough down, transfer it to a floured work surface, cut the dough into portions. Shape each portion into a round. Flatten each round with your hand; use a rolling pin to roll each piece into a -inch circle. The dough should be thin, like a crepe. Place the roundon parchment paper. Preheat an oven to degreeF . Stir the lamb sauce, then spoon it onto a dough round. Spread it thinly to the edgeand presdown lightly so it stickto the dough. Bake pizzaon parchment paper-lined baking sheeton the lowest oven rack until the edgeare a light tan colto minutes. Place on a wire rack to cool. The pizzacan be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for three dayor in the freezer for three months. To reheat, place the pizzain a degree F oven for minutes. To assemble the lahmacun, drizzle with garlic sauce, top with shredded cabbage, roll up to eat. See the Cook'Notefor other garnish ideas. Additional condimentinclude chili sauce, harissa Tabasco. In place of the cabbage, you can combine lettuce, thinly sliced tomatoes, cucumbers, red onion. To assemble, arrange cabbage, lettuce, cucumbers, tomatoes onion down one side of the pizza. Drizzle with garlic sauce, hot sauce, roll up. Eat, enjoy--but watch out for the drip. You won't want to misa bite!,If you can't find ground lamb in your area, you may substitute ground beef.
ingredients: chopped garlic, yellow onion chopped fresh basilfresh parsleyfresh mint, paprika, ground cumin, ground coriander seed, green bell pepper, red bell pepper, lemon, juiced, olive oil, roma tomatoes, pound lean ground lamb, double concentrated tomato paste, cayenne pepper, salt
descriptor: ThiTurkish-style pizza ia Turkish flat bread layered with a fresh sauce composed of tomatoes, sweet bell peppers, lamb cooked with a flavorful selection of Mediterranean spices. It inormally garnished with fresh salad, a creamy garlic sauce, or a tangy zesty hot red pepper sauce. It ia really light meal, but filling, flavorful. I find it worth the time to make if I can't get it from my favorite Turkish bakery in my old neighborhood in Amsterdam. For the best flavmake the topping the night before you make the pizza.

instructions: Beat egg whiteuntil foamy in a large glasor metal mixing bowl. Gradually add the white sugar, continuing to beat until stiff peakform. Lift your beater or whisk straight up: the egg whiteshould form a sharp peak that holditshape. Fold in the almond meal, cinnamon, lemon zest, vanilla. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Transfer the meringue to a piping bag with a large plain tip . Pipe the meringue into ladyfingerabout inchelong. Set the pan aside, let the meringuedry at room temperature for hours. Preheat an oven to degreeF . Bake the cookieon the middle oven rack until dried but not yet brown, to minutes. Allow them to cool completely. Make the filling by creaming the butter, confectioners' sugar until smooth. Stir in the vanilla. Meanwhile, melt the chocolate in the top of a double boiler over just-barely simmering water, stirring frequently, scraping down the sidewith a rubber spatula to avoid scorching. To assemble the cookies, spread buttercream on the back of a cookie, sandwich it together with another cookie, dip both endin the melted chocolate. Let the dipped cookiedry on waxed paper or parchment. Almond meal can be found in specialty storeand some supermarkets. One pound of almond meal yieldabout s. To make it yourself, grind raw almondwith of the white sugar in the recipe . Proceed adirected.

instructions: Heat oil in a pot over medium-high heat, cook beef stew meat until browned on all sides, to minutes. Season with salt, pepper. Pour in water, bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover, simmer over low heat for minutes. Heat oil in a skillet, cook half of the onionover medium-low heat until they are very soft, are starting to caramelize, about minutes. Add sauteed onionand uncooked onionto the pot with the meat. Add cloveand bay leaveand simmer for more minutes. Season with beef bouillon. When meat icooked through, season with vinegar, sugar, curry powder. Remove of liquid, stir together with potato starch in a small bowl to make a slurry. Add slurry back to the stew to thicken. Cook for to more minutes. Recipe habeen updated based from original publication.
ingredients: oil, divided, package beef stew meat, pinch salt, pepper, water, poundonions whole cloves, large bay leaves, cube beef bouillon granules, vinegar white sugar, curry powder, potato starch

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Set out two rimmed baking sheets. Beat butter, sugar with an electric mixer in a mixing bowl until light, fluffy. Mix in egg yolk until thoroughly combined, creamy. Add flour, cinnamon, mix until dough iwell combined. Spread of the dough over one baking sheet; spread remaining dough over half of the second baking sheet. Presdown on dough with your fingers, then score with a fork. instructions: Place ground veal in a skillet over medium heat. Cook, stirring to crumble, until evenly browned. Set aside. Melt butter in a saucepan over low heat. Stir in flour until smooth, cook for about minutes. Gradually stir in milk, then chicken broth to make a smooth thick sauce. When the meat mixture icooled, slightly firm, shape into cylinder to inchelong, inchewide. If you wish, presa strip of the spiced Gouda cheese into the center, making sure it icompletely surrounded. If you have a deep-fryer, they can be deep-fried instead. Remove to paper towelto drain, serve hot.

instructions: In a large bowl, cut cold butter or margarine into flour until the mixture haa crumb-like texture. Make a well in the center, add cold water. Mix together until the mixture forma ball. instructions: Stir the flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, clovetogether in a large bowl; mix in the egg, milk, butter, vanilla until just combined. instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Grease three round cake pans. Beat together brown sugar, butter in a large bowl until creamy, smooth. instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . In a large bowl, mix together butter, sugar until smooth. Beat in eggone at a time, stirring until light, fluffy. instructions: Pour the warm milk into a mixing bowl, mash in the fresh cake yeast. Mix in of soft butter, eggs, cardamom, sugar, salt, of the flour. Use a wooden spoon to mix the dough. If it'very sticky, mix in the remaining of flour. Cover the bowl, let the dough rise for minutes. Cream together the butter, sugar. Stir in the cinnamon. Transfer the dough to a floured surface, knead it until it'firm, about minutes. Divide the dough in half; roll each half into a rectangle no more than inch thick. Spread each rectangle with half the filling. Stack one layer of dough, filling on top of the other rectangle of dough, filling-side up. Roll the dough up, starting with the edge closest to you, to form a long log. Cut the log into inch-thick slices. Preheat an oven to degreeF . Line a baking sheet with parchment paper grease a baking dish or two cake pans. Place the rollon the prepared baking sheet, spacing them about incheapart. If you like pull-apart rolls, arrange them in a greased baking dish or cake pans, spacing the rollabout inch apart. Place the uneven end pieceon the baking sheet cut-side up for the best presentation. Let the rollrest minutebefore baking. Bake the snailin the preheated oven until golden brown, about minutes. Pull-apart rollwill take longer to bake: after minutes, reduce the oven temperature to degreeF , bake the rolluntil the sideare fully set, about minutelonger. Cover the baking dish with foil if the rollbegin to get too brown.
ingredients: warm milk,cakecake yeast, butter, room temperature, eggs, ground cardamom, white sugar, salt, all-purpose flour
descriptor: Americanwould call these cinnamon rolls--but thiversion ithe original Danish version, it'absolutely wonderful. They are traditionally served with coffee or tea at Christmatime, they are to die for!

instructions: Preheat oven to degreeF ,In a large bowl, combine flour, salt. Cut in shortening until mixture resemblecoarse crumbs. Beat egg yolk in measuring, add enough milk to make total liquid. Stir into flour mixture until all flour idamp. Divide the dough in half. On floured surface, roll half the dough into a rectangle, fit into a 9x inch pan. instructions: Place of flour in a medium bowl. Mix in butter using a fork or a pastry blender. Sprinkle of water over, stir with a fork until dough cometogether. Divide into two balls. Drizzle over the Danish, decorate with candy sprinkleif desired.

descriptor: My mom used to make thiAlmond Puff every year for Christmas. It ivery elegant, pretty--and surprisingly easy to make. I almost alwayhave every ingredient already in my board. I made it myself for the first time, my husband loved it. I'm planning to make it for himom when she cometo visit. Thiia fun one to share.

instructions: Cut flank steak in half acrosthe grain. Mix salt, black pepper, cayenne. Season both sidegenerously with the salt mixture. Heat olive oil in a pot over high heat. Add steakand cook until outsideare well browned, to minuteper side. Remove steakto a plate. Reduce heat to medium. Add red onion, garlic, more of the salt seasoning. Cook, stir until starting to soften, to minutes. Stir in cumin, paprikaegano, cayenne pepper, cloves, allspice. Cook, stir for minute. Pour in white wine, scraping up the browned bitfrom the bottom of the pot. Stir in tomato sauce, chicken broth. Return beef, accumulated juiceto the pot. Season with salt, add bay leaves. Reduce heat to low, cover, simmer until beef ialmost fork-tender, not falling apart, about hours. Remove pot from heat, let stew cool to room temperature, at least minutes. Refrigerate, hourto overnight, for best results. Remove beef to a plate, set stew over medium heat. Tear beef along the grain into /- to /-inch-wide shreds; place back in the stew. Add bell peppers, poblanos, smoked paprika, capers, olives, sugar. Stir together, reduce heat to medium. Simmer until pepperare soft, meat itender, to minutes. Turn off heat, remove bay leaves, stir in cilantro. You can also use skirt steak big pieceof chuck, but flank imy favorite. Chuck icheaper but shredtoo small. Use finely crushed tomatoeinstead of tomato sauce, if desired.
ingredients: flank steak, kosher salt freshly ground black pepper, pinch cayenne pepper, olive oil, large red onion clove garlic ground cumin, paprika, dried oregano, cayenne pepper, ground cloves, ground allspice, white wine, tomato sauce, chicken broth, bay leaves, bell pepper poblano pepper smoked paprika, capers, pimento-stuffed green olive white sugarfresh cilantro
descriptor: ThiCuban braised beef dish literally translateto 'old clothes,' because apparently some people thought the fall-apart meat, colorful stripof onionand peppers, tangled together, looked like old, tattered clothing. You'll love thidish if you're into big, bold flavors, since there'nothing subtle about the seasoning here. Deliciouserved with beans, rice, plantain chips. Garnish with more cilantro.

instructions: Split the sandwich rollin half, spread mustard, mayonnaise liberally onto the cut sides. On each sandwich, place, equal amount of Swischeese, ham, pork in exactly that order. Place a few pickleonto each one, put the top of the roll onto the sandwich. Brush the topwith melted butter. Preseach sandwich in a sandwich presheated to medium-high heat. If a sandwich presinot available, use a large skillet over medium-high heat, presthe sandwichedown using a sturdy plate or skillet. Some indoor grillmay be good for thialso. Cook for to minutes, keeping sandwichepressed. If using a skillet, you may want to flip them once for even browning. Slice diagonally, serve hot.
ingredients: sweet bread roll, mayonnaise, prepared mustard, pound thinly sliced cooked ham, pound thinly sliced fully cooked pork, pound sliced Swischeese, dill pickle slices, butter,
descriptor: Thiione of the more famousandwichestraight out of the island of Cuba. Thirecipe came from my uncle who used to work at a restaurant in Pinar del Rio, Cuba, now workat a Cuban cafeteria here in Miami. Thisandwich ibest served with fried plantain chipand a cold mamey milkshake!

instructions: Whisk vino seco, olive oil, salt together in a large bowl. Add oxtailand mix well to coat. Cover with plastic wrap, marinate in the refrigerator for hours. Drain oxtails, discarding all but of the marinade. Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat, sear oxtailuntil browned on all sides, about minuteper side. Transfer to a large plate. Heat remaining olive oil in the same pot. Saute potatoes, onion, carrotuntil onionare translucent, about minutes. Mash garlic, salt into a coarse paste in a mortar, pestle. Add garlic paste to the pot; stir until fragrant, about seconds. Stir in green olives, bay leaves, sazon completa, sazon seasoning, allspice. Pour in reserved marinade, tomato sauce, chicken broth. Return oxtailto the pot. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, simmer, covered, until oxtailare fork tender, falling off the bone, about hours. instructions: Grind garlic, salt, pepper, cuminegano, coriander into a paste using a mortar, pestle. Transfer of the paste to a bowl. Add lime juiceange juice, olive oil, vinegar, whisk until smooth. Cut several deep, -inch-long slitinto the fatty side of the pork roast. Rub the remaining paste into the slits. Put roast into a -gallon resealable plastic bag. Pour citrumixture into the bag to coat roast, then squeeze amuch air from the bag apossible, seal. Refrigerate, turning occasionally, hourto overnight. Remove pork roast from refrigerattransfer to a roasting pan, let stand at room temperature for minutes. Meanwhile, preheat the oven to degreeF . Roast pork in the preheated oven for minutes. Reduce the heat to degreeF , continue cooking until no longer pink in the center, about hourmore. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least degreeF .

instructions: Place sugar each into two - glasses. Squeeze juice from a lime wedge into each glasand drop in the wedge. Place mint spriginto each glass. Use a spoon or muddler to mash lime mixture together in the bottom of the glasses. Fill each glasabout half full with crushed ice. Pour rum into each glass. Fill the glassewith club soda, stir, garnish with remaining lime wedges. You can garnish with mint spriginstead of lime wedges.

descriptor: ThiCuban mojito ivery similar to the drinkI enjoyed in Varadero, Cuba. The muddling, the order of the ingredienthelpensure that all the flavorare well blended. Serve with a straw, a decorative stir stick to keep the different flavorwell mixed together.

instructions: Combine warm water, flour, yeast, in a bowl or measuring . Whisk the starter until well blended. Cover with plastic wrap, refrigerate hourto overnight. Place package yeast, sugar in a mixing bowl. Pour in warm water. Let rest minuteto ensure yeast ialive, bubbling on the surface. Add lard, salt to bowl, then add of the flour. Mix until incorporated, dough forma sticky ball. Add the starter. Add all but of the remaining flour, mix to incorporate. Knead dough on a lightly floured work surface until it cometogether in a firm ball, adding up to of the remaining flour aneeded. Dough should be soft, supple with just a bit of tackineson the surface. Place dough in a bowl, coat the surface with vegetable oil. Cover the bowl with a damp kitchen towel, place in a warm spot to rise. Let rise until at least doubled in size, about hours. Line two rimmed baking sheetwith parchment paper, sprinkle with cornmeal. Transfer dough to a lightly floured surface. Lightly presdough into a rectangle with lightly floured hands. Divide dough in half, shape each half into a rectangle about inchelong, inch thick. Starting at the long ends, tightly roll dough to form two skinny loaves. Slightly flatten the tops. Transfer loaveto a prepared baking sheet, dust with flour. Cover with a light, dry towel, let rise until doubled in size, to hours. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Cut a /-inch deep slit down the top of loavewith a sharp knife or razor. Lightly mist loavewith water. Bake in the preheated oven, one pan on the lower rack, one on the higher rack, for minutes. Switch pan positionand continue to bake until loaveare golden brown, to minutelonger. Transfer loaveto cooling rack, let cool to room temperature before slicing. I used all-purpose flour, bread flour. Each loaf yieldabout sliceof bread Cuban sandwiches. Check out Chef John'Cuban Sandwich recipe.
ingredients: warm water, flour, active dry yeast
descriptor: ThiCuban bread recipe uselard, a double hit of yeast plua fermented starter. All of thiaddextra flavor, lift. I didn't think I liked Cuban sandwicheuntil I had one on real Cuban bread — what a difference! If you want to keep your starter going, reserve of it before adding the rest to the dough.

instructions: Place yuca into a pan, fill with enough water to cover. Stir in salt. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, cover, cook until tender, about minutes. instructions: Melt the butter in a large pot over medium heat. Stir in the onion, garlic, curry powder, red pepper flakes. Cook until the onion haturned translucent, to minutes. instructions: Mix corn meal, salt, sugar together in a bowl. Add hot water, mix with your handuntil a dough forms. Roll into a ball, let rest, to minutes. Fill a pot with about incheof oil, heat to degreeF . Divide dough into equal-sized balls. Set aside a small amount of dough for repairing holeafter cooking. Place a dough ball onto a sheet of plastic wrap, place a second sheet of plastic wrap on top. Use a pan or plate to flatten the dough into a /-inch thick round. Smooth edgeof area with your fingers. Repeat with remaining dough. Place the arepacarefully into the hot oil, fry until puffed, about minuteper side. Remove arepafrom the oil, drain on paper toweluntil cool until safe to handle. Cut a -inch hole near the edge of an arepa. Crack an egg into a small glasand carefully pour it into the hole in the arepa. Repair the hole quickly using reserved dough. Return the arepa to the oil, fry until egg ino longer runny, minuteper side. Drain on paper towels. Repeat with remaining arepas. Let cool briefly. When cutting the hole, make sure the knife stayinside the arepa so the egg doesn't leak out. If the arepa hasn't puffed up completely, you can use the knife to open it up a bit more. You want enough space to pour the egg into. If it appearlike you won't have enough time to repair the hole after adding the egg, you can place the arepa into the oil on edge to let the egg set a bit before letting it completely submerge. We have determined the nutritional value of oil based on a retention value of after cooking. Amount will vary depending on cooking time, temperature, ingredient density, specific type of oil used.

During a visit to Barranquilla, Colombia, I got the chance to taste an arepa de huevo. My friend got the recipe for me and now it's a special treat.
The fried dough coupled with the egg is beyond words. Such a tasty dish!

instructions: Place a plate, upside-down, onto a work surface. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Fry plantain slicein the hot oil until slightly browned, to minuteper side. Smash the plantain sliceby gently pressing the top plate into the bottom plate. Place the smashed plantainin the hot oil, fry until browned, to minuteper side. instructions: Combine tomato, cilantro, onion, jalapeno pepper, garlic in a food processor. Add olive oil, lime juice, sugar, apple cider vinegar, salt; pulse until a coarse paste forms. However, because the spicinesof jalapenoivery unpredictable, I highly recommend leaving it out, transferring the salsa to a bowl, then adding the finely chopped jalapeno gradually. I even throw mine in a small Magic Bullet-style blender with a little olive oil, turn it into a paste so I can add it very carefully. Thialso allowyou to separate the salsa into mild, spicy batches.

instructions: Thiirresistibly deliciouChinese barbecue pork recipe haa rich, salty-sweet flavor that gethigh markfrom our community of home cooks. Dive into the tangy blend of honey, rice wine, brown sugar that coatevery bite of succulent pork tenderloin. Learn how to make thiflavorful favorite right here — plus, get tipon the best way to serve, store, freeze char siu. The wonderfully sweet, savory flavor of thiChinese dish comefrom a unique blend of pantry ingredients. Soy sauce, honey, ketchup, brown sugar create the base of the luscioumarinade, while hoisin sauce, red bean curd add depth. Juicy pork tenderloin ithe main event of thi-star recipe. Choose two lb. tenderloinfor best results, substituting pork loin or pork chopif necessary. You'll find the full recipe below with step-by-step instructions, but here'what you can expect when you make thitop-rated recipe;,Begin by gently heating all of the marinade ingredientin a saucepan. Next, slice pork into stripand place them in a large plastic bag. Pour marinade into the bag, refrigerate the contentfor at least two hours. After marinating, barbecue the pork tenderloin over a charcoal grate for a rich, robust flavor. Baste athe meat cooks, use a thermometer to mark degreeF for doneness. You'll love the tender meat paired with a tantalizingly fragrant glaze. Char siu can be eaten ais, over rice paired with bright green vegetablefor a great contrast. Use thizesty pork to stuff steamed buns, in pork fried rice aa topping in,wasabi-spiked nachos. Refrigerate leftover char siu in an airtight container for up to three days. When you're ready to reheat, simply place the pork on foil, bake in a degreeF oven until thoroughly warmed. Yes, char siu can be frozen for up to one month if stored correctly. Place leftover stripin a freezer bag, squeeze out any air, thaw in the refrigerator when you're ready for a repeat. "The marinade idelicious!" ravehome cook PG. "I've made the marinade twice now. Used part of the second batch in BBQ pork fried rice. Next time I'll use pork shoulder. The tenderloin ia bit too lean for our taste.","I loved everything about thimarinade," sharereviewer Saveur. "Only addition — a slug of rice wine vinegar. With all of the sweet going on I felt it needed a little acid balance. Hubgrilled to perfection. A keeper!","I followed the recipe to the letter, it came out perfect just like my local Chinese restaurant, shareTanya. "I used my copper crisper basket over a pot of water in the oven at for minutes, it came out beautiful with a char, all.",Editorial contributionby Rai Mincey,Gather all ingredients. Stir soy sauce, honey, ketchup, brown sugar, rice wine, hoisin sauce, red bean curd, five-spice powder together in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Cook, stir until just combined, slightly warm, to minutes. Meanwhile, slice each pork tenderloin lengthwise into /- to -inch-thick strips. Place pork stripin a large, resealable plastic bag. Pour marinade into the bag with the pork. Squeeze air from the bag, seal, turn the bag a few timeuntil pork iwell coated. Marinate in the refrigerathourto overnight. When ready to cook, preheat a charcoal grill for medium-high heat, lightly oil the grate. Remove pork from marinade, shake to remove excesliquid. Set aside the remaining marinade for basting. Rake the hot coalinto two equal pileon opposite sideof the charcoal grate. Add a small container of water to the grate. Place pork stripin the center of the grate for indirect cooking. Cook pork over indirect heat, turning regularly, basting adesired, until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center readat least degreeF , minuteor longer. Serve hot, enjoy!,If you can't find red bean curd, use red food coloring instead, if desired. To cook over indirect heat on a gagrill, simply turn off the center burner. Place food over that burner, it will cook by the heat on either side. The nutrition data for thirecipe includethe full amount of marinade ingredients. The actual amount of the marinade consumed will vary.
ingredients: soy sauce, honey, ketchup, brown sugar, Chinese rice wine, hoisin sauce, red bean curd, Chinese five-spice powder
descriptor: Char siu iChinese restaurant-style pork with a deep red, sweet, sticky coating. Char siu literally mean"fork roast", referto the traditional method of cooking thidish by which stripof seasoned pork were skewered with long forkand roasted in a covered oven or over a fire. Thiversion usepork tenderloin, ieasy to make at home on your charcoal grill. Enjoy the sweet, salty taste on itown or serve it over rice or noodles.

instructions: Prepare dipping sauce: Combine soy sauce, rice vinegar, chives, sesame seeds, chile sauce in a small bowl. Set aside. Prepare dumplings: Mix pork, garlic, egg, chives, soy sauce, sesame oil, ginger in a large bowl until thoroughly combined. Place a dumpling wrapper on a lightly floured work surface, spoon about of the filling in the middle. Wet the edge with a little water, crimp together forming small pleatto seal the dumpling. Repeat to form remaining dumplings. Heat to vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Place to dumplingin the pan, cook until browned, about minuteper side. Pour in of water; cover, cook until the dumplingare tender, pork icooked through, about minutes. Repeat to cook remaining dumplings, adding more oil, water for each batch. Serve dumplingwith dipping sauce. Please note the differencein the recipe name, ingredient amounts, filling optionwhen using the magazine version of thirecipe. Shrimp Filling: Stir together finely chopped fresh shrimpwater chestnuts, egg yolk, finely chopped Chinese chiveor chives, less-sodium soy sauce, fresh ginger, toasted sesame oil in a bowl. Mushroom-Tofu Filling: Cook chopped shiitake or button mushroomin a large skillet over medium heat until all liquid haevaporated, mushroomare tender; cool. Transfer to a bowl, mix with pressedextra-firm tofu, egg yolk, Chinese chiveor chives, less-sodium soy sauce, fresh ginger, toasted sesame oil, Chinese -spice.

instructions:
Make restaurant-worthy Kung Pao chicken at home with this top-rated recipe. Kung Pao chicken (a.k.a. Gong Bao or Kung Po) is a stir-fried Chinese dish that consists of cubed chicken in a sweet, spicy, and savory sauce. It originated in southwestern China in the early 1800s. This Kung Pao chicken recipe consists of cubed chicken breasts soaked in a marinade (made with cornstarch, water, white wine, soy sauce, and sesame oil) and tossed in a sweet-savory sauce (made with hot chili paste, brown sugar, white vinegar, water chestnuts, peanuts, onions, and garlic). Tips:,· Use Shaoxing wine if you have it on hand.
· You can substitute cashews for peanuts and bamboo shoots for the water chestnuts.
· If you want, you can add cubed red and green bell peppers for color and flavor. You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here's a brief overview of what you can expect when you make this top-rated Kung Pao chicken:,1. Make the marinade, then marinate chicken in the fridge.
2. Make the chili paste-brown sugar sauce. Add the remaining ingredients and cook.
3. Cook the marinated chicken in a skillet until it's cooked through.
4. Add the chicken to the chili paste-brown sugar sauce.
5. Continue cooking until the sauce thickens. This Kung Pao chicken pairs perfectly with plain rice, but you can kick things up a notch with one of these top-rated Chinese-inspired side dishes:,· Egg Drop Soup
· Easy Fried Rice
· Chinese Broccoli,"Easy to make and amazing flavors," according to one Allrecipes community member. "Preparation is everything as there is a lot of chopping. I added celery and a touch of ginger. Nice touch.","I made this by adding red bell pepper and chopped onion (didn't have green onions) because that's what our favorite Chinese restaurant does," says Lucy. "I also had to substitute garlic chili sauce for the chili paste.","I added broccoli, scallions, green pepper, and lightly salted dry roasted peanuts and it was amazing," raves Shirley R. Ritter. Editorial contributions by Corey Williams,Combine water and cornstarch in a cup; set aside. Combine 1 tablespoon wine, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 1 tablespoon sesame oil, and 1 tablespoon cornstarch/water mixture in a large glass bowl. Add chicken pieces and toss to coat. Cover the dish and refrigerate for about 30 minutes. Combine remaining 1 tablespoon wine, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 1 tablespoon sesame oil, and remaining cornstarch/water mixture in a medium bowl. Whisk in chili paste, brown sugar, and vinegar. Add water chestnuts, peanuts, green onions, and garlic and toss to coat. Transfer water chestnut mixture to a medium skillet. Heat slowly over medium heat until aromatic. Meanwhile, transfer chicken from marinade into a large skillet; cook over medium-high heat, stirring, until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear. Combine water chestnut mixture and sautéed chicken together in one skillet. Adjust heat and simmer together until sauce thickens. The nutrition data for this recipe includes information for the full amount of the marinade ingredients. Depending on marinating time, ingredients, cooking method, etc.  the actual amount of the marinade consumed will vary.
ingredients: cornstarch, dissolved in water, white wine, divided, soy sauce, divided, sesame oil, divided, boneless chicken breast halve- cut into chunks, hot chili paste, brown sugar, distilled white vinegarcan water chestnutspeanuts, green onions chopped garlic
descriptor: Thitasty kung pao chicken isimilar to what iserved in Chinese restaurants. It'easy to make, you can be acreative with the measurementayou want. You can't go wrong! The sauce reduceuntil nice, thick.

instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over medium heat. Stir in garlic, cook until it beginto brown, to seconds. instructions: If you're looking for the best steamed pork dumplingrecipe on the internet, you've come to the right place. These pork dumplingare aeasy to assemble, steam athey are to eat. Ready to make the best steamed pork dumplingof your life? You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here'a quick overview of what you can expect:,Mix the pork, ginger, garlic, green onion, soy sauce, sesame oil, egg, cabbage in a large bowl. Place a of filling onto each wonton skin, then moisten the edgewith water, fold diagonally to create a triangle. Roll the edgeto seal in the filling. Transfer the dumplingto a lightly floured surface until you're ready to cook. Arrange the pork dumplingin a steamer so that they're not touching. Steam until the pork icooked through. Steamed pork dumplingare traditionally served aan appetizer with a dipping sauce, such ahoisin. You can purchase bottled hoisin sauce at the store you could try our simple recipe for Homemade Hoisin Sauce. Other great sauce optioninclude Chinese-Style Hot Mustard or our Easy Asian-Inspired Dipping Sauce. These steamed pork dumplingwould also work well aa main dish. Try an Asian-inspired side dish such Chinese Green Bean Stir-Fry or Easy Fried Rice. Store your leftover pork dumplingin an airtight container in the fridge for up to two days. Reheat in the microwave, sprinkled with a few dropof water. Yes, you can freeze steamed pork dumplings. Simply allow them to cool, then flash freeze them on a baking sheet until frozen solid. Transfer them to a freezer-safe container or zip-top freezer bag, label with the date, freeze for up to three months. When it'time to eat, simply reheat from frozen in the microwave or in the oven until heated through. "Thirecipe iAMAZING," raveLindsay. My fiance, I spent an afternoon making these, we even doubled the recipe. We made half with ground pork, half with ground turkey, they both taste equally agood!","Great recipe," according to MelissaGG. "Only thing I did differently wato make my own wrapperand I dipped them in boiling water first before steaming. The filling iexcellent.","So good," sayfennellylisa. "I didn't change anything. I made a dipping sauce with soy, ginger, scallions. My husband raved.",Editorial contributionby Corey Williams,In a large bowl, combine the pork, ginger, garlic, green onion, soy sauce, sesame oil, egg, cabbage. Stir until well mixed. Place heaping of pork filling onto each wonton skin. Moisten edgewith water, fold edgeover to form a triangle shape. Roll edgeslightly to seal in filling. Set dumplingaside on a lightly floured surface until ready to cook. Arrange dumplingin a covered bamboo or metal steamer so they don't touch to prevent them from sticking together; steam for minutes until pork icooked through. Serve hot, enjoy!
ingredients: wonton wrappers, poundground pork, fresh ginger root, clove garlic, thinly sliced green onion, soy sauce, sesame oil, egg, finely shredded Chinese cabbage
descriptor: These tasty steamed pork dumplingmake a perfect appetizer for a party or you can serve them aa main dish.  Serve with hoisin sauce, hot Chinese-style mustard, toasted sesame seeds.

instructions: Whether served aan appetizer or full-blown main dish, pot stickerare alwaya winning choice. Packed with savory flavors, Chef John'pot stickerare a little different because they're fried, steamed, fried again for a delightfully crispy bottom with a tender, juicy filling. Be sure to bookmark thiirresistible recipe because you'll be making these homemade pot stickeragain, again. Pot stickerare a type of dumpling that are believed to have originated in China. Pot stickerare typically filled with ground pork, cabbage, but they can be stuffed with other ingredienttoo. They're usually pan-fried, steamed to give a soft, tender texture to the filling, a crunchy texture to the dumpling dough. You'll find the fully involved recipe below — but here'a brief overview of what you can expect:,Combine ground pork, green onions, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, sesame oil, cayenne, cabbage in a bowl. Mix until combined, refrigerate until chilled, ready to use. Slowly pour hot water over flour, kosher salt. Stir until a dough forms. Knead the dough until smooth, elastic. Wrap the dough ball in plastic wrap, let rest for minutes. Divide the dough ball into four equal piece. Roll the dough into a log, divide into six equal pieces. Roll each piece into a pot sticker wrapper. Repeat until all dough iused. Place a small amount of pork filling into the center of each wrapper. Wet the edgeof the wrapper, fold the two sidetogether. Pinch the edgetogether. Tap the pot sticker on the work surface to flatten it, then add a slight curve so it can stand on itown. Combine rice vinegar, soy sauce in a bowl. Set aside until ready to serve. Pan-fry the pot stickeruntil golden brown. Add water, steam for three minutes. Uncover, continue to pan-fry until water haevaporated, the pot stickerare crunchy. We love Chef John'method for cooking pot stickers. For crunchy, yet tender pot stickers, first pan-fry them in oil until the bottomare golden brown. Add water to the skillet, cover — steam the pot stickerfor three minutes. Uncover, allow to pan-fry again until the water haevaporated, the bottom of the pot stickerare crunchy. Chef John'dipping sauce for pot stickerisuper simple, delicious. Just combine soy sauce, rice vinegar in a bowl. To dresup the sauce, you can also add hot sauce, garlic, green onions ginger. Store leftover pot stickerin an airtight container in the fridge for up to four days. Reheat in the microwave until warmed through. If you want the crispy bottom, reheat in the microwave until warmed through, then pan-fry in oil until crispy. Uncooked pot stickerare freezer-friendly. Simply follow the recipe until the pot stickerare assembled, but don't cook them yet. Transfer the pot stickerto a baking sheet, flash freeze them for a few hour. Transfer the now-frozen pot stickerto a zip-top freezer bag, freeze for up to three months. When you're ready to eat, there'no need to thaw the pot stickers. Simply follow thirecipe to cook them from frozen. However, you may need to add a few minuteof cook time to account for the frozen temperature. "My yr old daughter said: 'It wabetter than restaurant quality,' sayDenise Perchall. "I did use wonton wrapperfrom the grocery, instead of making my own dough. Even using the pre-made wrappers, it did take me a little longer to prepare....but so worth it with the final product.","Chef John nailit with thione, the video igreat, very useful, helpful," according to Scott Jennings. "The prep took a while, but I will definitely be making thiagain, I know I will get faster. It took me about minutefrom start to finish, they lasted me, my family all of secondto devour.. so good, even the sauce waspot on!!","Absolutely delicious. Tasted like it wafrom a restaurant," raveGreta K. "I recommend thirecipe, especially for a dinner party appetizer. Assembly can be a bit time consuming, but it ifun, that'expected when making thingfrom scratch. stars!",Editorial contributionby Bailey Fink,Place ground pork, green onions, garlic, ginger, plu soy sauce, sesame oil, cayenne in a mixing bowl. Top with chopped green cabbage. Mix with fork until thoroughly combined. Tamp down lightly; cover with plastic. Refrigerate until chilled, about an hour. Place of flour, kosher salt in a mixing bowl. Slowly pour in hot water. Stir with a wooden spoon until mixture forma shaggy dough. Flour your handand transfer dough to a work surface. Knead dough until it becomesmooth, elastic, about to minutes. If dough seemtoo sticky, sprinkle with a bit more flour, up to an additional, continue to knead. Wrap dough ball in plastic, let it rest about minutes. When dough harested, divide into equal pieces. Cover piecewith a dish cloth while you work the first piece. Roll into a small log about the thicknesof a thumb, about inch. Divide each log into equal pieces. Roll each piece into a thin /-inch circle on a lightly floured surface to form the pot sticker wrappers. Repeat with the remaining dough pieces. Lightly moisten the edgeof a wrapper with your wet finger. Place a small scoop of the ground pork mixture onto the center of a wrapper. Fold up the sideand pinch together in the center. Pinch together the remaining edges, forming "pleats" along one side. Tap the pot sticker on the work surface to slightly flatten the bottom; form a slight curve in it so it standupright in the pan. Transfer to a well-floured plate. Repeat with remaining dough, filling. Mix together seasoned rice vinegar, soy sauce in a small mixing bowl for the dipping sauce. Heat oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Place about or pot stickerin the hot oil, flat side down. Cook until bottomare golden brown, about minutes. Drizzle in water, quickly cover the pan; steam for minutes. Uncover; reduce heat to medium. Continue cooking until water evaporateand bottomare browned, crunchy minutes. Transfer to a warm serving dish. Repeat with remaining pot stickers. Serve with dipping sauce. Serve hot, enjoy!,Optional: You can spike dipping sauce with thinglike hot sauce, garlic, green onions, ginger, etc.
ingredients: pound ground pork, clovegarlic, finely chopped green onions, very finely fresh ginger, soy sauce, soy sauce, sesame oil, pinch cayenne pepper, finely chopped green cabbage
descriptor: These pot stickermade with homemade dough, filled with ground pork, ginger, garlic, cabbage are so versatile — you can fill them with anything you want, afull ayou want. The dumplingare fried, steamed, then fried again until golden, perfectly crispy on the bottom for a truly unique dumpling.

instructions: You don't have to go out to enjoy delicious, Asian-inspired cuisine! Make your own orange chicken at home with thitop-rated recipe. Over, Allrecipecommunity memberhave rated thirecipe stars, so you already know it'going to be great!,Have some rice on deck because you won't be able to resist the temptation of immediately biting into thisweet, sticky chicken. Orange chicken ia popular item at Chinese restaurants. It consistof small cubeof chicken that are breaded, pan-fried, coated in an orange sauce. The orange sauce isweet with a little tang, a hint of spice. It'mainly known for itorange flavor . It'typically made with orange juice, orange zest to achieve the citruflavor. Even though you see orange chicken at Chinese restaurantin America, it'not a typical Chinese dish. Instead, it wapopularized by American Chinese restaurant— alongside General Tso'chicken, which ialso not traditional Chinese food. You'll find the full step-by-step recipe below, but here'what you can expect when making orange chicken:,Combine all sauce ingredientin a saucepan. Bring to a boil, then let cool. Once cool, transfer to a zip-top bag with chicken, place in the refrigerator to marinate for at least hours. After the chicken imarinated, coat it in flour, salt, pepper. Cook it in a skillet until it'brown on both sides. Add the sauce to an empty skillet, bring it to a boil. Add cornstarch, water , then the chicken pieces. Let it simmer until everything icombined. Store orange chicken in an airtight container in the fridge for three to five days. Reheat the chicken in a skillet — you may need to add water to fix the sauce'consistency. Freeze orange chicken in an airtight container or zip-top freezer bag for up to three months. Let thaw in the refrigerator overnight. "I made thifor my family, got raves. I didn't have any green onionso I left onion out, I cut back a little bit on the red pepper flakes. It waso good. I served it with brown rice, it waperfect. I didn't have any leftovereven though I used chicken breasts. I will definitely be making thiagain," according to Carol. "LOVED thirecipe. Time intensive, but worth the effort. I used fresh orangeand lemonfor juice. I made brown rice, stir fried snow peas, broccoli flowers, grated carrots, diced red peppers. Rice went on the plate first, followed by the veggies, then the chicken, last the sauce. Delish," ravejenvan. "My family, even my year old grandson, loved it. The only change wathe marinating for hours. It waa last minute dinner idea, I didn't have hourso I put it in the freezer for minuteand it worked out fine. Next time though I will cook the chicken in small batcheait didn't all get acrispy aI would have liked," sayFirebird9. Editorial contributionby Bailey Fink,Gather all ingredients. Combine water, rice vinegar, lemon juice, soy sauce, orange juice for sauce into a saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir in brown sugar, green onionange zest, ginger, garlic, pepper flakes; bring to a boil. Remove from heat, cool for to minutes. Place chicken in a resealable plastic bag. Pour in cooled sauce. Seal the bag, refrigerate for at least hours. Reserve the remaining sauce. Mix flour, salt, pepper in another resealable plastic bag. Remove chicken from the marinade, place into the bag of seasoned flour. Seal the bag, shake to coat. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook chicken in the hot skillet until browned on both sides. Remove to a paper towel-lined plate, cover with aluminum foil. Wipe out the skillet. Pour reserved sauce into the skillet, bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Mix together cornstarch, water until completely smooth. Stir into the boiling sauce. Reduce heat to medium-low, add the chicken, simmer, stirring occasionally, until cooked through, about minutes. Serve over rice, enjoy!
ingredients: water, rice vinegar, lemon juice, soy sauceange juice, packed brown sugargreen onion, grated orange zest, fresh ginger root, garlic, red pepper flakes, cornstarch, water
descriptor: Thiorange chicken recipe isticky, sweet, delicious. It tastesimilar to the orange chicken from a popular Chinese restaurant in the mall! It'easier to make than you think for delicioutakeout at home.

instructions: Need to use up some of your leftover vegetableand other pantry staple ingredients? Look no further than a classic beef stir-fry. Thibeef, broccoli stir-fry cometogether in just minuteand only requireingredientthat you probably already have. And if you don't? You can just skip them!,Thidish ipacked with veggies, beef, saucy flavorfor a weeknight dinner warrior that checkall the boxes. Served with rice or lo mein noodles, thiwill be the best beef stir-fry you've ever made. The most time-consuming part of making stir-fry iall the chopping. Slicing your meat, veggieinto smaller bite-sized piececan take a little bit of time, effort, but it'worth it for the end result. After you've chopped all your ingredients, you'll cook the beef on one side of the wok another large frying pan, the veggieon the other side of the wok. Once they're all cooked, you can mix the two sidetogether, add the soy sauce, sesame seeds. Some stir-fry recipeuse a specific stir-fry sauce, which can be abasic abroth, soy sauce, sugar, rice wine vinegar. Thiquick stir-fry callfor only soy sauce. But you can feel free to add a stir-fry sauce or marinate your beef in one if you prefer. Learn more: How to Make the Easiest Stir-Fry Ever,Flank steakare the most popular choice for making a stir-fry. However, you can also use sirloin steak, skirt steak, Denver steak even beef chuck. Beef chuck steak ithe most economical choice, but it doerequire some extra trimming. You'll want to remove the tough tissue from the steakbefore frying. If possible, you should use a wok to make beef stir-fry. Wokare large, have sloping sidethat let you cook the entire stir-fry in one pan, so you can easily stir, flip the food without fear of it flying out. They also are designed to cook foodquicker than skilletand with lesoil. If you can't use a wok then any skillet will work. You may just need to cook the meat, veggiein separate batches. When cooking, make sure you heat the pan, oil up first before adding your ingredient— they should sizzle asoon athey hit the heat. And alwayuse an oil with a high smoke point, like canola or peanut oil, for the best stir-fry results. "I added thirecipe to my favoritelist not even a month ago, I have made this, using different variationevery time, at least times. My family lovethirecipe, I've paired it with rice or noodleand it alwaypleases. I usually use beef stew meat, switch up the vegetables. I would definitely recommend thirecipe for anybody that'pressed for time, wantto make a quick easy meal that the whole family will enjoy," sayTiana Marie Ginorio. "Hubby, I both liked this. It'very easy to make, iready in no time. I used flank steak instead of sirloin, I didn't have any green onions, but otherwise I followed the recipe awritten. We both though it needed a bit of something, so after the first few bitewe added some crushed chilifor a bit of heat," addAllrecipeAllstar France C. "Made it true to the recipe except that I only used half of a red bell pepper because it wawhat I had. The dish didn't suffer at all for it, the spicineswajust right for me. Served over rice, wathe best quick meal that I made thiweek," raveShoebox. Editorial contributionby Bailey Fink,Gather all ingredients. Heat vegetable oil in a large wok or skillet over medium-high heat; cook, stir beef until browned, to minutes. Move beef to the side of the wok, add broccoli, bell pepper, carrots, green onion, garlic to the center of the wok. Cook, stir vegetablefor minutes. Stir beef into vegetableand season with soy sauce, sesame seeds. Continue to cook, stir until vegetableare tender, about more minutes. Serve hot, enjoy!
ingredients: vegetable oil, pound beef sirloin, cut into -inch strips, fresh broccoli florets, red bell pepper, cut into matchsticks, carrots green onion garlic, soy sauce, sesame seeds, toasted
descriptor: Quick, easy beef stir-fry. I make thion my busiest weeknights.

instructions: Combine water, tea leaves, soy sauce, black soy sauce, zest, cinnamon stick, star anise, salt in a large saucepan; bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, simmer for hours. Meanwhile, place eggand remaining salt into a medium pot; cover with cold water. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, simmer for minutes. Remove from heat, drain, cool. Tap cooled eggwith the back of a spoon to crack shells; do not remove shells. Remove the saucepan from heat. Add eggand let steep for at least hours. You can steep the eggfor up to dayfor a richer flavor. Store eggunpeeled, tightly sealed in the refrigerator for to days.
ingredients: water, black tea leaves, soy sauce, black soy sauce, tangerine zest, piece cinnamon stick, podstar anise, salt, divided, large eggs
descriptor: Tea eggare one of my favorite disheand traditional lucky food to make for the Lunar New Year. These hard-boiled eggare subtly flavored with anise, have a deep brown hue from black tea, soy. The marbled patternfrom the cracked shellmake these quite attractive. I eat them chilled in quarteraa side dish, appetizer snack. Recipe courtesy of Mom.

instructions: Cut the piece of beef into large chunk. Place the beef into a large saucepan; pour in the beef broth, water. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium, cover, simmer until nearly tender, to hours. Stir the polenta into the stew along with the potatoeand onion. Cover, simmer for minutes. Cut the pumpkin into, serving-sized pieces, add to the stew along with the corn, carrot, bell pepper, celery, leek; simmer until the vegetableare tender, adding more water if needed to barely cover. Stir in the oregano, paprika during the last minutes. Season with salt, pepper. Ladle into serving bowls, sprinkle with chopped cilantro.
ingredients: poundbeef roastcarton beef broth, water, polenta , red potatoes, cut in half, onion, quartered, poundslice of pumpkin , earcorn, cut into thirds, carrot, small red bell pepper, seeded, cut into inch pieces, stalk celery, cut into chunks, leek, split in half, then cut into /-inch pieces, fresh oregano, mild paprika, salt, pepper, coarsely chopped cilantro leave
descriptor: Thihearty Chilean stew of beef, corn, pumpkin ia one dish meal. The main ingredientare stewed in serving-sized pieces, so that each person receivea large piece surrounded by a broth with the other vegetables.

instructions: Gently simmer the cloveand cinnamon stickin water until reduced by half, about minutes. Add of milk, heat to a simmer, then stir in, dissolve the coffee, sugar. Strain the coffee mixture into the remaining cold milk, discard the cloveand cinnamon sticks. Stir in the vanilla extract, pisco. Store in the refrigerator.
ingredients: whole cloves, cinnamon sticks, water, gallon cold milk, instant coffee granules, white sugar, vanilla extract, pisco, white rum, brandy other lightly-flavored liquor
descriptor: Thiia traditional Chilean Christmastime drink of milk flavored with coffee, spices, passed down to me by our Chilean nanny Isa. It idelicious, a must-try if you don't care for egg-nog. The recipe can be varied to suit your taste- be creative with the proportionof coffee, cinnamon, cloves, vanilla, awell awith your choice of liqueurs.

instructions: Heat the olive oil in a stock pot over medium heat; add the onion, cover. Cook the onionuntil soft, translucent, about minutes. Stir the squash, great Northern beans, lima beaninto the pot; pour the chicken stock over the mixture. Cover, cook until the squash itender, beginning to break apart, to minutes. Stir the corn, basil into the stew; cook until the stew reachethe consistency of pancake batter, about minutemore. Sprinkle the chopped banana pepper over individual portionto serve.
ingredients: olive oil, yellow onion cubed butternut squashcan great Northern beans, frozen lima beans, chicken stock, frozen cornfresh basil, banana pepper, chopped
descriptor: Thihearty harvest recipe iperfect for the coldest nightbut standup just awell to the summer heat. Using frozen vegetables, you can put together thidish in minuteand have it on the table in an hour.

instructions: Preheat oven to degreeF . Grease a baking sheet. Stir together the flour, salt, baking powder, milk, of melted butter. When the dough beginto pull together, turn it out onto a lightly floured surface; knead until smooth, elastic. Roll out the dough to inch thicknesand cut into -inch circles. Brush the circlewith the remaining melted butter. Fold each circle in half, then in half again, into triangles; presfirmly to seal the layers. Place the rollon the prepared baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about minutes. Serve warm.
ingredients: all-purpose flour, salt, baking powder, milk, butter, butter,
descriptor: Thiia great recipe for a Chilean bread. They are so easy, ready in a few minutes, taste heavenly. They are best when they are warm, right from the oven or toasted the next day, with some butter, jelly even some guacamole.

instructions: Bring milk, sugar, vanilla extract to a boil in a saucepan over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, continue cooking, continuously stirring until milk hathickened, turned a caramel colabout hour or more. Stir in baking soda. Continue cooking until caramelized milk hareached a pudding consistency. Pour manjar into a bowl, cool completely in the refrigerator.
ingredients: quart whole milk, white sugar, vanilla extract, baking soda
descriptor: Thiione hundred percent Chilean. It ia sort of caramel that can be found everywhere in Chile. Actually, most pastry making in my country hamanjar in it. The truth ithat one can eat manjar anytime during the day, in many different ways: with bread, cheese, cookies, my favorite, with meringue. Some of my foreign friendlove it, some otherhate it, so I guesyou must give it a try, judge.

instructions: Make the filling: Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion, garlicegano, cumin, salt, pepper; cook, stir until onion igolden brown, to minutes. Add pork, cook until completely browned, crumbly, to minutemore. Drain fat from the skillet. Stir in raisins, olives, hard-cooked eggs. Whisk water, cornstarch together in a small bowl; pour into the skillet, stir until liquid thickens. Remove from the heat, set aside. Make the dough: Whisk milk, shortening together in a bowl until evenly blended. Stir flour, salt together in a separate large bowl. Pour milk mixture into flour mixture; whisk until well combined, a dough forms. Let rest for minutes. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Roll dough on a lightly floured surface to a thicknesof inch. Cut into circlewith a round cookie cutter or glass. Spoon filling into the center of each circle. Fold each circle in half, presthe edgewith a fork to seal. Brush the topwith beaten egg. Place empanadaonto the prepared baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about minutes.
ingredients: butter, large onion garlic, dried oregano, cumin, salt, ground black pepper, pound ground pork, raisinsblack olives, large hard-cooked eggs water, cornstarch
descriptor: My mother ifrom Chile, empanadahave been a staple in our household for years. I have searched, searched, never seem to find the right one, so here iour family-favorite recipe for Chilean empanadas. My mom liketo sprinkle sugar on hers, while I prefer to dip mine in a little mustard — we all have our own cravings! Thirecipe makeabout a dozen large empanadas, depending on the size.

instructions: Peel, seed, cut zapallo into chunks. Place in a saucepan, cover with water, bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook until zapallo isoft, easily pierced with a fork, to minutes. Drain, allow to cool slightly. Mix flour, baking soda, salt together in a mixing bowl, set aside. Stir together squash, butter. Stir the flour mixture into the butter mixture until blended. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface, knead until soft, satiny, adding a little more flour if necessary. Cover dough with a towel, allow to rest minutes. Roll out the dough to /-inch thick, cut into -inch diameter circles. Poke each circle a few timewith a fork to make holeand prevent rising. Pour oil into a large, deep skillet, heat over medium-high heat until hot, degreeF . Place several of the dough circleinto hot oil; cook until lightly browned, to minutes. Drain on paper towels. Cook remainder of dough circlein batches. Zapallo, sometimecalled Jamaican pumpkin, ia type of winter squash from South America. If it'not available, sugar pumpkin makea good substitute. We have determined the nutritional value of oil based on a retention value of after cooking. Amount will vary depending on cooking time, temperature, ingredient density, specific type of oil used.
ingredients: zapallo squash, all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, butter, canola oil for pan-frying
descriptor: Thiia traditional Chilean snack maybe an appetizer. The truth ithat it'a snack eaten during wintertime, especially when it rains. It itypical to arrive home after walking through the rainy streetof Santiago, sit down to have a of tea, eat a couple of sopaipillas. You can also eat onesold by street vendors, but they usually don't taste agood ahomemade ones. If you can't find zapallo, pumpkin ia good substitute.

instructions: Make crust: Place flour, frozen butter, salt into the bowl of a food processor. Pulse on, off until butter breakdown to pea size, about seconds. Stir together cold water, vinegar; drizzle over flour mixture. Pulse on, off until mixture icrumbly, holdtogether when pinched, about seconds. Drizzle in more cold water if mixture itoo dry. Transfer mixture to a work surface. Prestogether until it forma ball. Flatten to a disc, wrap in plastic wrap, refrigerate until chilled, about hour. Make spice blend: Mix together salt, black pepper, thyme, sage, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, allspice, mustard, clove, cayenne in a small bowl; set aside. Make filling: Place potatoeand kosher salt in a saucepan; cover with cold water. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, simmer until tender, to minutes. Use a slotted spoon to transfer potatoeto a bowl, reserving potato cooking water in the saucepan. Mash potatoewith a potato masher until smooth; set aside. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add chopped onion, a pinch of salt. Cook, stir until onionturn golden, to minutes. Stir celery, garlic, spice blend into the skillet with onions. Stir until onion mixture ievenly coated with spices, about seconds. Add ground pork, ground beef, about potato cooking water to the skillet. Cook, stirring occasionally, until meat ibrown, tender, most of the liquid haevaporated, about minutes. Stir in mashed potatoes, turn off heat, let cool to room temperature. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Divide chilled dough into pieces, one just slightly larger than the other. Roll the larger piece out on a lightly floured work surface into a -inch circle. Place in a 9-inch deep-dish pie plate. Roll top crust out into an -inch circle; set aside. Fill bottom crust with meat mixture; smooth out the surface. Make egg wash: Whisk together egg, water in a small bowl. Brush egg wash over the edgeof the bottom crust. Cover with top crust; preslightly around the edgeto seal. Trim excesdough, crimp the edges. Cut small slitin the top crust to allow steam to escape. Brush entire surface of pie with egg wash. Bake in the preheated oven until crust iwell browned, about hour. Let cool to almost room temperature before serving. You can easily tailor thirecipe to your tastes; besidethe ground meat, mashed potatoes, pretty much anything goes. I may try thinext time with beef gravy, aa few of my Canadian friendhave suggested. Another suggested pairing waketchup, which I tried on a cold slice, it wadelicious.
ingredients: all-purpose flour, stickunsalted butter frozen, kosher salt, ice-cold water, distilled white vinegar
descriptor: Tourtière ia hearty, satisfying French Canadian meat pie that'easy to make, so it'a great choice for a holiday main course. Visually impressive, relatively affordable, best served at room temperature, tourtière doesn't require any precise timing.

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Make loaf: Mix together saltegano, flour, black pepper, Italian seasoning, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne pepper in a or small bowl. Place ground beef in a large steel mixing bowl on a sturdy surface; use your handto blend in spice mixture. Pick up meat, throw it down with force about times, kneading it after each throw. Thiwill help meat hold together better when sliced. Form meat into a loaf; place on a broiler pan or baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven for hour, minutes, rotating loaf halfway through to ensure even baking. Serve warm with sauce or allow meat to chill before slicing, reheating. Make sauce: Mix together evaporated milk, sugar, garlic powder in a medium bowl. Gradually whisk in white vinegar, at a time, until thickened to your desired consistency. The loaf cutbetter if you chill it overnight before slicing.
ingredients: salt, ground oregano, all-purpose flour, ground black pepper, Italian seasoning, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne pepper, pound ground beef
descriptor: Thidonair recipe itried, tested for the true donair fan. If you enjoy Halifax donairs, then you'll love thirecipe. Use only the finest spiceavailable; they make a huge difference. If you want the smooth texture of meat that you see in an authentic donair shop, you must knead the meat in a steel mixing bowl on a sturdy surface.

instructions: Attach a candy thermometer to a large, heavy-bottomed saucepan. Bring maple syrup to a boil in the saucepan over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until syrup reache degreeF . Remove from heat, cool to degreeF without stirring, about minutes. Stir mixture rapidly with a wooden spoon until thick, creamy, lighter in colabout minutes. Stir in chopped nuts. Pour into molds; allow to cool at room temperature until set. Unmold candy. Store in an airtight container for up to month.
ingredients: pure maple syrupwalnut
descriptor: Thimaple sugar candy imade with only maple syrup, ipure, creamy. It'a melt-in-your-mouth treat, almost like fudge! Add anything you want, like chopped nuts. Use small maple leaf moldor other pretty shapes.

instructions: Combine pork, beef, onion, garlic, water, salt, thyme, sage, black pepper, clovein a saucepan. Cook, stirring occasionally, over medium heat until mixture boils. Reduce heat to low, simmer until meat icooked, about minutes. Allow to cool to room temperature. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Spoon meat mixture into pie crust. Cover with top crust, pinch edgeto seal. Cut slitin top crust so steam can escape. Cover edgeof pie with stripof aluminum foil. Bake in the preheated oven for minutes; remove foil, return to the oven. Bake until golden brown, to minutes. Let cool minutebefore slicing.
ingredients: pound lean ground pork, pound lean ground beef, onion, clove garlic, water, salt, dried thyme, ground sage, ground black pepper, ground cloves,package double-crust pie pastry, thawed
descriptor: Traditional French Canadian tourtière , served on Revéillon .

instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion, tomato, habanero pepper, garlic, curry powder, thyme, cook, stirring, until onion igolden, about minutes. Stir in chicken, cook until chicken ilightly browned, about minutes. Pour water into the skillet. Reduce heat to low, cover, simmer until chicken ino longer pink at the center, about minutes. Season with salt.

It'rich, hearty, with flavor that'great when you can't get the real thing in the islands. Try a variety of hot pepperto change the flavor — even sweet bell peppergive it a different taste. Use fresh thyme to really bring out the fresh taste.

instructions: Combine green bell pepper, whole jalapeño pepperin a food processor or blender, working in batcheif necessary; procesuntil finely chopped. Transfer pepperto a large saucepan. Return liquid to the saucepan; stir in salt, sugar until dissolved. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. When the mixture cometo a rolling boil , boil for one minute, then stir in liquid pectin. Stir in remaining finely chopped jalapeño pepperand ladle into sterile jarleaving /-inch headspace. Seal jarin a hot water bath. Refrigerate jelly after the seal ibroken.

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Combine oats, pastry flour, brown sugar, baking soda, salt in a large bowl. Mix in butter until crumbly. Stir in lemon juice, remove from heat. Spread the filling over the base, spread the remaining crumb mixture on top. Bake in the preheated oven until the top ilightly toasted, to minutes. instructions: Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to degreeF . Combine flour, salt, black pepper, cayenne pepper, paprika, garlic powder in a large bowl. Whisk together egg, milk in a small bowl. Dip each piece of chicken in egg mixture, then roll in flour mixture. Repeat so that each piece of chicken idouble-coated. Refrigerate breaded chicken for minutes. Fry chicken in hot oil in batches. Cook until golden brown, juicerun clear, to minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least degreeF . Combine hot sauce, butter in a microwave-safe bowl. Heat sauce in the microwave until to seconds. Pour sauce over fried chicken; mix to coat.
ingredients: oil for deep frying, unbleached all-purpose flour, salt, ground black pepper, cayenne pepper, paprika, garlic powder, egg, milk, skinless, boneless chicken breasts, hot pepper sauce, butter

instructions:
These Nanaimo bars feature three decadent layers of rich, chocolatey, nutty goodness. The Nanaimo bar is a no-bake dessert named after Nanaimo, a Canadian city in British Columbia. It consists of three layers: a coconut crumb base, a custard filling, and a chocolate ganache topping. You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here's a brief overview of what you can expect when you make homemade Nanaimo bars:,1. Make the bottom layer: Melt a stick of butter, cocoa powder, and sugar in a double boiler. Beat in the egg. Remove from the heat and mix in the crumbs, coconut, and nuts. Press the mixture into the pan.
2. Make the middle layer: Beat a stick of butter, cream, and custard powder. Mix in the confectioners' sugar and spread the mixture over the bottom layer. Chill to set.
3. Make the top layer and cut: Melt the chocolate and butter together and spread over the chilled bars. Let the chocolate set, then cut into squares. Tip: You can use instant vanilla pudding powder instead of custard powder. Store the Nanaimo bars in the refrigerator for up to four days. Since they are served chilled, these bars make a great make-ahead dessert. Yes! Nanaimo bars freeze quite well. Wrap them individually in storage wrap, then in a layer of aluminum foil. Freeze for up to three months. Thaw in the refrigerator overnight. "These were delicious," raves Rhonda. "Here's a tip for beginners: Don't add the egg to the saucepan...if it's too warm the egg will CURDLE. My mom told me to slowly beat about half of the chocolate mixture into the egg, a little at a time, so that it won't curdle from the heat.","This was surprisingly easy to make," says nikki. "I followed the recipe using some suggestions found in the comments. One thing I tried differently was to replace the graham crackers with more nuts. I love the extra crunch it gives!","These are simply outstanding," according to Jamie Anderson. "Seriously, it's my new favorite dessert. Great recipe and I will definitely make these again. I didn't have custard powder so I substituted it with instant vanilla pudding mix and it went well.",Editorial contributions by Corey Williams,In the top of a double boiler, combine 1/2 cup softened butter, cocoa powder, and sugar. Stir occasionally until melted and smooth. Beat in egg and stir until thick, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from the heat and mix in graham cracker crumbs, coconut, and almonds. Press into the bottom of an ungreased 8x8-inch pan. For the middle layer, beat remaining 1/2 cup softened butter, heavy cream, and custard powder until light and fluffy. Mix in confectioners' sugar until smooth. Spread over the bottom layer in the pan. Chill to set. While the second layer is chilling, melt semisweet chocolate and 2 teaspoons butter together in the microwave or over low heat. Spread melted chocolate mixture over chilled bars. Let the chocolate set before cutting into squares. The magazine version of this recipe uses instant vanilla pudding powder instead of custard powder.
ingredients: butter, divided, unsweetened cocoa powder, white sugar, egg, graham cracker crumbs, flaked coconut, finely chopped almond, heavy cream, custard powder, confectioners' sugarsquaresemisweet baking chocolate, butter
descriptor: These Nanaimo barare three layerbut worth the effort. My son ifamoufor making, taking these to work. I've heard other names, but everyone knowthem aNanaimo barhere in the Northwest. They are sold on British Columbia Ferrieand at coffee stands. If you can't find custard powder, I've used instant pudding mix with good results.

instructions:
This restaurant-worthy shrimp étouffée recipe tastes like it came straight from New Orleans, but it's easy enough to make at home. Étouffée is a dish consisting of shellfish cooked in a rich sauce served over rice. The secret to authentic étouffée is a cooking technique called "smothering," a Cajun and Creole cooking technique that is similar to braising. In French, "étouffée" means "smothered.",These are the ingredients you'll need for this top-rated shrimp étouffée recipe:,· Spices and seasonings: This étouffée starts with a spice blend made with paprika, thyme, oregano, cayenne, garlic and onions powders, and white and black peppers. You'll also need salt.
· Shrimp: If your shrimp isn't already peeled and deveined, you can do it yourself with our handy guide.
· Oil: Cook the shrimp in a neutral oil with a high smoke point, such as vegetable oil.
· Stock: Use store-bought or homemade chicken stock.
· Butter: Cook the vegetables in three tablespoons of butter.
· Vegetables: You'll need an onion, green bell pepper, celery, green onions, and diced tomatoes.
· Flour: All-purpose flour thickens the buttery vegetable mixture.
· Sauces: Worcestershire sauce and hot sauce add tons of flavor.
· Rice: Shrimp étouffée is served over cooked white rice. You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here's a brief overview of what you can expect when you make shrimp étouffée at home:,1. Make the spice blend.
2. Season and cook the shrimp. Strain the shrimp juices into the stock.
3. Sauté the onion, bell pepper, and celery in butter. Season and sprinkle with flour.
4. Add the tomatoes and the stock. Cook until thickened and season with sauces.
5. Stir the shrimp into the sauce and continue cooking until they're translucent.
6. Garnish and serve the étouffée over rice. Looking for serving inspiration? We've got you covered. Check out our collection of Best Cajun Side Dishes that will pair perfectly with shrimp étouffée. There are a few of the delicious ideas you'll find:,· Cajun Corn and Bacon Maque Choux 
· Fried Okra
· Mom's Cajun Hush Puppies,Allow your leftover shrimp étouffée to cool, then transfer them to an airtight container. Store in the refrigerator for up to three days. "This is an excellent recipe and very forgiving," according to Clemetee Whaley. "I added extra seasoning. It was even better the next day. Later, I served it over mashed potatoes instead of rice for a different variation.","The recipe is excellent," raves Miriam Schurman. "It's my go-to shrimp recipe. The only addition for me is 2 cloves of garlic. I've made it many times and everyone loves it. I sometimes replace the rice with noodles.","Excellent recipe," says jpossehl. "I tripled the cayenne pepper just cause I like it hot and subbed some bacon fat in for butter. Came out awesome!",Editorial contributions by Corey Williams,For the spice blend: Whisk paprika, thyme, oregano, cayenne, garlic powder, onion powder, white pepper, and black pepper together in a small bowl. For the étouffée: Drain shrimp in a colander for at least 15 minutes. Transfer to a bowl lined with paper towels and dry shrimp for about 3 minutes. Remove paper towels from the bowl. Season shrimp with salt and 1 teaspoon spice blend; toss to coat. Heat oil in a large heavy skillet over high heat until oil is smoking. Cook shrimp in hot oil without stirring for 1 minute; stir, and cook 1 minute more. Transfer shrimp to a large bowl. Let stand until juice collects in the bowl. Strain shrimp juices into chicken stock to total 2 cups, adding more chicken stock if necessary. Set aside. Melt butter in the same skillet over medium heat until butter begins to turn tan at the edges. Sauté onion, bell pepper, and celery in hot butter until softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in remaining spice blend. Sprinkle flour into vegetable mixture and sauté until combined, 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in tomatoes; cook until tomato juices begin to brown on the bottom of the pan, about 3 minutes. Whisk in chicken stock mixture, stirring until smooth. Bring to a simmer and cook until slightly thickened and reduced to a gravy consistency, 3 to 5 minutes. Stir in Worcestershire and hot sauce. Season with salt to taste. Stir shrimp into étouffée sauce; let simmer until shrimp are cooked all the way through and no longer translucent, about 1 minute. Garnish with green onions and a dusting of cayenne pepper. Pour over rice in large, shallow bowls.
ingredients: paprika, ground thyme, dried oregano, cayenne pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, white pepper, ground black pepper
descriptor: Étouffée ia spicy, deliciouNew Orleanclassic. In thirecipe, we're going to demonstrate that it ipossible to get good resultfrom using waterlogged frozen shrimp, which unfortunately isometimethe only option. To make them work we've got to use a few tricks. I prefer thiwith little chunkof browned chicken or pork, actually.

Brush salmon filleton both sidewith butter, sprinkle evenly with the spice mixture. Heat melted butter in a large, heavy skillet over high heat. Add salmon, cook until blackened, to minutes. Lift fillets, add remaining melted butter to the skillet, flip filletinto the butter. Cook until the other side iblackened, fish flakeeasily with a fork, to minutes.

instructions: Blackened fish prepared according to thitop-rated recipe ijuicy, flaky, full of spicy, smoky flavor. You'll find a detailed ingredient list, step-by-step instructionin the recipe below, but let'go over the basics:,Thirecipe callfor trout because it’firm, flaky. Other great optioninclude haddock, cod, mahi-mahi, tilapia, halibut. Thispicy, smoky blackened fish seasoning blend includethe following ingredients:,If you make, enjoy thirecipe, we recommend making a large batch of the blend to keep on hand for quick dinner prep. Store it in an airtight container in a cool, dark place. Here’a brief overview of what you can expect when you make thiblackened fish recipe:,“If a restaurant askme how I’d like my fish, I almost alwaychoose blackened,” sayculinary developer, test kitchen expert Nicole McLaughlin. “I love the spicy, crispy coating it givefish.” Here are a few of her best tipfor making blackened fish at home:,“Great recipe for introducing the kidto blackened fish,” sayone Allrecipecommunity member. “I used red snapper. Served with white rice, broccoli.”,“The seasoning mixture ijust delicious,” raveStirFryGuy. “So much depth of flavor without obscuring the flavor of the fish. And considering the amount of cayenne, cumin, it'not ahot aone might expect, so it would be easy to ramp up the heat by adding a little more of either . Thiia keeper.”,“Really good recipe, easy to put together, but definitely vent your kitchen well or cook outside,” adviseCraig Henke. “Grilled mine, it turned out great.”,Editorial contributionby Corey Williams,Mix together paprika, dry mustard, cayenne pepper, cumin, black pepper, white pepper, thyme, salt in a small bowl. Heat a heavy cast iron pan on high heat until extremely hot, about minutes. While the pan iheating, pour melted butter into a shallow dish. Dip each fillet into butter, turning once to coat both sides. Sprinkle both sideof filletwith spice mixture; gently pat mixture onto fish. Working in batches, place filletinto the hot pan without crowding. Carefully pour about melted butter over each fillet. Cook until fish haa charred bottom, about minutes. Turn filletand spoon about melted butter over each. Continue cooking until bottomare charred, to minutes. Repeat with remaining fish.
ingredients: paprika, dry mustard, cayenne pepper, ground cumin, black pepper, white pepper, dried thyme, salt, unsalted butter, dividedfillettrout

If you see black speckin the mixture, it'best to start over. Add sausage, celery, bell pepper, onion into the roux; cook, stir minutes. Add garlic; continue to cook, stir another minutes.
