instructions:
Cajun spice mix is a Louisiana seasoning that packs a punch when it comes to flavors. The delicious (and mildly spicy) seasoning lends itself to so many wonderful dishes — like pastas, shrimp, chicken, fish, and much, much more. If you've never made your own Cajun spice mix at home, just know that not only are you missing out on great flavors — you're also missing out on savings. That's right, homemade Cajun seasoning tastes better and it's cheaper than store-bought! Do you need any more reasons to try this recipe?,Cajun seasoning hails from Louisiana, which is home to Cajun cuisine. The cuisine is a wonderful blend of Native American, West African, Caribbean, and French cooking styles. Cajun seasoning is a blend of spices that create a spicy, earthy, and sometimes smoky flavor. Typical Cajun seasonings (including store-bought like Slap Ya Mama and Tony Chachere's) are made with black pepper, white pepper, cayenne pepper, onion powder, garlic powder, and paprika. For different flavors, some Cajun spice mixes include salt, mustard powder, chile peppers, or cumin. This spice mix also includes oregano and thyme, which you don't normally see in Cajun spice mixes — those are typically found in Creole spice mixes. Creole cuisine, which also originated in Louisiana, is a mixture of African, Italian, French, Portuguese, and Spanish cooking styles. So, Creole seasoning typically has more herbs than Cajun seasoning. Creole seasoning is made with black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne, thyme, basil, and oregano. Sometimes, you might find bay leaves, rosemary, or parsley in it too. So, Creole seasoning has a light spicy kick, but it has more aromatics to balance it out than Cajun seasoning does. Learn more: What's the Difference Between Cajun and Creole?,Blackened seasoning can be described as a mixture between Cajun seasoning and Creole seasoning. It's quite spicy (from the cayenne or chili powder), but it also contains aromatic herbs (like oregano, thyme, and basil). Blackened seasoning is also different from Cajun seasoning in the way it's used. The term "blackened" doesn't really have anything to do with the seasoning itself, but in the way the food is prepared. The protein, like fish, shrimp, or chicken, is drenched in butter, then heavily coated in blackened seasoning and seared. The blackened seasoning will create a blackened crust on the outside of the food after a few minutes of cooking. Making homemade spice mixes is so easy, there's really no excuse not to do it! Simply stir all the ingredients together in a bowl until well combined, then store in an airtight container or jar. Cajun seasoning is great on protein, like chicken, fish, shrimp, and steak, but it's also delicious in pasta dishes, rice, and stuffed peppers. If you don't know where to start, try one of these mouthwatering Cajun recipes. Cajun Style Stuffed Peppers
Cajun Pastalaya
Cajun Home Fries
Cajun Air Fryer Salmon,Need more inspiration? Check out our entire collection of Cajun recipes. Store homemade Cajun seasoning in an airtight container or jar in a cool, dry place (like a spice cabinet or pantry). The spice mix will stay fresh for up to one year. "Needed Cajun seasoning for a recipe. My grocery store had none. I happened to have all the spices for this recipe in my pantry. Whoo hoo! A real cost saver too," says Beverly McNulty. "Perfect substitute! I just made a recipe of Cajun Sausage Pasta tonight which called for Cajun Seasoning (which I don't have) and I used this recipe and the dish was delicious!!! I didn't add the red pepper flakes because my kids probably wouldn't eat it and I did slightly less cayenne for the same reason and it had JUST enough bite for us," according to papayasoup. "This is great for anything you want to be Cajun. I love to have my own homemade Cajun seasoning so I can leave out the salt. This one comes out perfect," raves joy. Editorial contributions by Bailey Fink,Gather all ingredients. Stir together paprika, salt, garlic powder, oregano, thyme, black pepper, onion powder, cayenne pepper, and red pepper flakes in a bowl until evenly blended. Store spice mix in an airtight container.
ingredients: paprika, salt, garlic powder, dried oregano, dried thyme, ground black pepper, onion powder, cayenne pepper, red pepper flake
descriptor: Thiia mildly hot Cajun spice mix you make yourself with common spicefrom your pantry. For those who like it hotter, add the optional crushed red pepper. Use thispice mix to make great oven Cajun hashbrowns!

instructions: Stir together the lime juice, cumin, paprika, garlic, salt, pepper in a bowl. Add the tilapia, tosto coat. Cover, refrigerate at least minutes, up to hours. Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Quickly fry the onionin the oil to minutes. Reduce heat to medium. Add the bell peppers, tilapia, diced tomatoeto the pot in succeeding layers. Pour the coconut milk over the mixture. Cover the pot, simmer minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in the cilantro, continue cooking until the tilapia icompletely cooked through, another to minutes.
ingredients: lime juice, ground cumin, paprika, garlic, salt, ground black pepper, poundtilapia fillets, cut into chunks, olive oil, onions large bell pepper can diced tomatoes, drainedcan coconut milk, bunch fresh cilantro
descriptor: Thisuper easy but hearty dish ifull of flavor, absolutely delicious! It'a simplified version of a common Brazilian dish that I remember from my childhood, it'become a favorite even among my kidand I, even though we don't like fish! Thican be made easily on the stovetop or in the slow cooker for a no-fail convenience meal. Use salmon in place of tilapia for a stronger fish flavor. Serve with hot rice or warm tortillas.

instructions: Preheat an oven to degreeF . Melt the sugar in a heavy saucepan over low heat, stirring constantly. Once the sugar becomea golden brown syrup after about minutes, pour it immediately into a round baking dish, swirling so that the syrup coatall sideof the dish. Set aside to cool. Place the egg yolkinto a blender, blend on medium for minutes, then add condensed milk, plu milk, egg whites. Continue to blend until all ingredientare combined. Pour egg mixture into the baking dish, cover with aluminum foil. Line a roasting pan with a damp kitchen towel. Place baking dish on towel, inside roasting pan, place roasting pan on oven rack. Fill roasting pan with boiling water to reach halfway up the sideof the baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven until a knife inserted inch from the edge comeout clean, to minutes. The center of the flan will still be soft. Allow flan to cool before unmolding onto a plate. Refrigerate before serving.
ingredients: white sugar, eggs, secan sweetened condensed milk, milk, plus, milk
descriptor: I learned to make thiwhen we lived in Brazil. It haa wonderful, creamy texture without being too heavy. Melted syrup will run down sides, forming a caramel sauce. Serve cool with a dollop of whipped cream on the side. Top it with toasted coconut, serve with a garnish of tropical fruitsuch amango or pineapple. Uma delicia!

instructions: Bring milk, butter to a simmer in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Continue to cook, stirring often, until the milk hareduced to half, thickened, about minutes. Remove from heat, stir in the coconut, allow to cool a bit before pouring into a buttered bowl. Chill in the refrigerator until cold, about hours. With buttered or oiled hands, form milk mixture into -sized balls, roll in coconut flakes. Stick a clove into each beijinho adecoration.
ingredients: can sweetened condensed milk, butter, plumore for pan, sweetened flaked coconut, sweetened flaked coconut for decorating, whole clovefor decorating
descriptor: Condensed milk cooked with butter, coconut flakes, formed into little candy ballmakethia favorite Brazilian recipe especially at birthday parties. Kid love it!

instructions: Mix tomatoes, cucumber, red bell pepper, onion, parsley, lime juice, olive oil, green onions, cilantro, vinegar, salt, pepper in a large bowl. Let stand at room temperature until flavorcombine, about hours.
ingredients: tomatoes, English cucumber, quartered, red bell pepper, seeded, diced onion, finely chopped fresh parsley, lime juice, olive oil, diced green onions, finely chopped fresh cilantro, cider vinegar, salt, ground black pepper
descriptor: A refreshing side dish to pair with chicken, pork beef.

instructions: Cut each banana half into or pieces. Mix sugar, cinnamon together in a shallow bowl. Melt butter in a skillet over medium-low heat; add banana sliceand cook until golden brown, to minutes. Transfer banana sliceto a paper towel-lined plate. Coat banana slices, at a time, with cinnamon-sugar. Nutrition data for thirecipe includethe full amount of cinnamon-sugar. The actual amount of cinnamon-sugar consumed will vary.
ingredients: firm bananas lengthwise, white sugar, ground cinnamon, butter
descriptor: A very traditional breakfast or dessert in northeast Brazil, bananaor plantainare fried in butter, coated with cinnamon-sugar. Deliciouwith vanilla ice cream too.

instructions: Place the rice in a colander, rinse thoroughly with cold water; set aside. Heat the oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook the onion in the oil for one minute. Stir in the garlic, cook until the garlic igolden brown. Add the rice, salt, cook, stir until the rice beginto brown. Pour hot water over rice mixture, stir. Reduce heat to low, cover the saucepan, allow to simmer until the water habeen absorbed, to minutes.
ingredients: long-grain white rice, onion, clove garlic, vegetable oil, salt, hot water
descriptor: White rice ithe main side dish made in Brazil. Thiithe way my mom would make it, taught my sister, I. What makethiso different ithat we fry it in oil with onion, garlic before adding water. You can also use part water, part chicken broth. The secret ito not let it overcook because it should come out loose, not sticky.

instructions: Mix together cumin, cayenne pepper, turmeric, coriander in a large bowl. Add chicken, season with salt, pepper; rub spiceinto chicken. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook chicken in hot oil until no longer pink in the center, the juicerun clear, to minuteper side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least degreeF .  Remove chicken to a serving dish, set aside. Heat remaining olive oil in the same skillet. Cook, stir onion, jalapeño peppers, ginger, garlic in hot oil until onion itender, about minutes. Mix in tomatoeand cook until tomatoeare to minutes. Stir in coconut milk, cook until sauce iwarmed through. Spoon sauce over chicken, garnish with parsley.
ingredients: ground cumin ground cayenne pepper ground turmeric ground coriander skinless, boneless chicken breast halve salt, pepper olive oil, divided onion, jalapeño peppers, seededfresh ginger clove garlic, tomatoes, seededcan light coconut milk bunch chopped fresh parsley
descriptor: Thichicken in coconut milk sauce isimple, vibrant. It will fill your kitchen with the enticing aromaof South American cooking, igreat served over pasta or rice.

instructions: Preheat oven to degreeF . Grease a 9x-inch cake pan. Beat sugar, butter, egg yolktogether in a bowl using an electric mixer until smooth, creamy; add shredded coconut. Whisk flour, baking powder, salt together in a bowl. Stir creamed butter mixture, alternating with coconut milk, into flour mixture until batter ijust mixed. Beat egg whitein a glasor metal bowl until until soft peakform. Lift your beater or whisk straight up: the egg whitewill form soft moundrather than a sharp peak. Fold egg whiteinto batter. Pour batter into the prepared cake pan. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comeout clean, about minutes.
ingredients: white sugar, butter, eggs, se, unsweetened shredded coconut, all-purpose flour, baking powder, saltcan coconut milk
descriptor: Thiia super moist, tasty coconut cake. Growing up in Brazil, thiwaa favorite amongst our circle of friends. It iespecially good with a of coffee on the side. I've converted a few of my anti-coconut family, friendinto loverof thicake. Enjoy it plain dresit up with your favorite glaze or frosting, toasted coconut.

instructions: Heat oil in a large pot or Dutch oven. Add chopped onion, green onions, garlic; cook, stir until about minutes. Pour in soaked beanand fill with enough water to cover beanby inches. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low, simmer uncovered for hours until tender. While beanare cooking, place ham hockin a smaller pot with chopped onion. Cover with water, simmer until meat pulloff of the bone easily, about hour. Drain, add to beans. Meanwhile, preheat the oven to degreeF . Place ham, bacon, remaining onion in a baking dish. Bake until mixture icrispy, minutes. Drain bacon, ham mixture, add to beans. Season with bay leaves, coriander, salt, pepper. Simmer, uncovered, minutemore. Stir in chopped cilantro, parsley just before serving.
ingredients: olive oilonion, divided, green onions clove garlic package dry black beans, soaked overnight, smoked ham hocks, diced ham, pound thickly sliced bacon, bay leaves, ground coriander, salt, pepperfresh cilantrofresh parsley
descriptor: Thifeijoada recipe imy version of a traditional Brazilian black bean stew that maintainthe rich smoky, flavorfamouin Brazil. Additional meats, including sausage, may be added if desired. Thiiexcellent served over brown rice.

instructions: Place spareribinto a large pot, fill with just enough water to cover. Add soy sauce, of the parsley, garlic, lime juice, rosemaryegano, bay leaves. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat, simmer uncovered until water hacompletely evaporated, about minutes. Remove bay leaveand continue cooking until spareribare browned, turning occasionally. Use a spatula to scrape up browned bitand softened garlic from the bottom of the pot, tosthem with spareribs; the garlic will dissolve onto meat. Remove spareribto a paper towel-lined plate to drain. Season spareribwith black pepper. Garnish with lime wedgeand remaining parsley to serve. If you wish to use fresh herbinstead of dry, double the amounts. You can use cilantro instead of parsley.
ingredients: pork spareribs, soy sauce, sprigfresh parsley, divided, clove garlic, lime, juiced, dried rosemary, dried oregano, bay leaves, ground black pepper, limes
descriptor: Thipork ribrecipe ihow my Brazilian mom preparethem. Boiling the ribwith the seasoningensurethat the meat remainmoist, juicy, that the flavorfully penetrate the meat. I hope you like these amuch aI alwayhave! Serve with lime wedges, rice, a fresh green salad.

instructions: Squeeze, drop lime wedgeinto a large rockglass. Add sugar, muddle until juicerelease. Pour in cachaça, ice. Stir well.
ingredients: lime, quartered white sugar fluid cachaça ice cubes
descriptor: Caipirinha iBrazil'national cocktail. It'so refreshing, delicious! Ask your liquor store to order cachaça for you if they don't stock it — there'no substitute.

instructions: Gather all ingredients. Combine condensed milk, cocoa, butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stir until thickened, about minutes. Remove from heat, let rest until mixture icool enough to handle. Use your handto shape into small balland place on a serving plate. Can be eaten at once or chilled until serving.
ingredients: can sweetened condensed milk unsweetened cocoa butter
descriptor: Brigadeiro ia great Brazilian dessert similar to bonbonthat'extremely scrumptiouand delicious. Thisweet iloved here in Brazil. Try it! You can also make it in the microwave; just remember to stir every minute.

instructions: Heat the oil in a large Dutch oven over medium -high heat, quickly brown the chicken pieces. Remove, set aside. In the same pot, saute the leeks, onion, celery, salt until the vegetableare tender crisp. Return the chicken to the pot, add the water, bouillon, nutmeg. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low; cover, simmer for to minutes, until the chicken itender. In a small bowl or, combine the flour, lemon juice; pour into the pot, stir. Beat the cream, the egg yolkwith of the hot liquid; stir into pot. Heat through, but do not allow to boil athe cream will curdle. Sprinkle in the parsley before serving.
ingredients: vegetable oil, poundfryer or boiler chicken, leek large onion, stalkcelery salt, water, chicken bouillon granules, nutmeg, all-purpose flour, lemon juice, heavy cream, egg yolks, dried parsley
descriptor: I learned thiwhile stationed in the Flemish part of Belgium, in a village called Sint-Hubrechtslille. So tasty good, my daughter still askme to make it for her yearlater!

instructions: Beat egg in a large bowl with a hand mixer until fluffy. Add flour, milk, chocolate chips, oil, sugar, baking powder, vanilla extract, salt; mix just until smooth. Spray a Belgian waffle iron with cooking spray, preheat according to manufacturer'instructions. Pour about batter onto the hot waffle iron, cook until golden brown. Repeat with remaining batter. Serve hot.
ingredients: large egg, all-purpose flour, fluid milk, chocolate chips, vegetable oil, white sugar, baking powder, vanilla extract, salt, nonstick cooking spray
descriptor: The fluffiest Belgian wafflewith melty chocolate chipon the inside.

instructions: Combine the chiles, garlic, ginger, salt, turmeric, vegetable oil in a food processor or mortar, pestle, procesinto a fine paste. Set aside. Place the potatoein a saucepan with the water, bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pan, cook the potatoeuntil they're soft, easily pierced with a fork, about minutes. Reserve the cooking water. Mash the potatoewhile they're still warm, using some of the cooking water to get a smooth consistency. Mix in green chile paste, chickpea flour, salt, turmeric, mustard oil. Add enough reserved potato-cooking water aneeded to make a soft dough. Taste the dough for heat level, seasoning . Add more salt, chile paste if desired. Heat the cooking oil in a deep pan over medium-high heat. Use a potato ricer to presnoodleinto the oil. Fry until golden brown, crisp, about two minutes. Use a skimmer or slotted spoon to transfer the noodleto a paper towel-lined bowl. Repeat until all noodleare fried. Store in an airtight container for up to two weeks. Be careful handling chiles: use rubber gloveto avoid getting the oilon your skin. For step-by-step tipon how to fry, see our Deep Frying Advice article.
ingredients: chopped fresh green chile peppers, coarsely chopped garlic, fresh ginger, salt, ground turmeric, vegetable oil
descriptor: I've been obsessed with thicrispy fried snack ever since my friend brought the recipe back from South Africa in 9. Thiiadapted from a recipe she learned in a cooking clastaught by a renowned Indian food authority in Cape Town, Ramola Parbhoo.

instructions: Rub the crabwith of the turmeric, salt; let them marinate for hour. Combine the mustard seed, hot water in a small bowl, let stand for minutes. Use a mortar, pestle to grind the seedinto a coarse paste. Heat the oil in a wok or kadhai over medium heat. Add the craband stir fry until they change colabout minutes. Remove the crabfrom the oil, set aside. Add the sliced onionto the wok, cook, stir over medium heat until the onionare translucent, about minutes. Raise the heat to high, add the potatoes, cook, stirring constantly, for about minutes. Add the cloves, cinnamon stick, cardamom pods, peppercorns, stir for thirty seconds. Stir in the tomatoes, ginger paste, garlic paste. Halve three of the chileand add them to the wok. Cook, stir for an additional minute or two over high heat. Reduce the heat to medium; add the remaining turmeric, the cayenne pepper, the mustard paste, stir to combine. Add the crabto the wok, pour in just enough water to cover the vegetables. Bring the water to a boil, stir in the sugar, salt. Cover the wok, reduce the heat, simmer until the potatoeare tender, the water ireduced by half, about minutes. Remove the lid, stir, simmer until the gravy ithickened, about minutemore. Squeeze the lemon wedge over the finished dish. Garnish with chopped cilantro green chile, serve hot, with rice. Mustard oil, green cardamom podare available in Indian grocerieand specialty food stores. Black or white mustard seedcan be used to make the mustard paste.
ingredients: fresh Dungenescrabs, cleaned, with their shellcracked, ground turmeric, salt, mustard seed, hot water, mustard oil red onion, boiling potatoes, cut crosswise into /-inch slices, whole cloves, piece cinnamon stick, podgreen cardamom pod, whole black peppercorns, large tomatoes, Thai green chiles, garlic paste, ginger paste, cayenne pepper, salt, white sugar
descriptor: A spicy crab curry cooked with hot Indian spicered onion potatoe It'best eaten with hot rice.

instructions: To prepare fresh garam masala, in a coffee grinder, grind cardamom seeds, whole cloves, cinnamon stickto a fine powder. Set aside. Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add whole cloves, cardamom pods, stickof cinnamon, fry for a few second. Stir in grated onion, reduce the heat to medium-low. Cook, stir until liquid drieand onion no longer smellraw, about minutes. Add ginger paste, garlic paste, cook for minutes, stirring constantly. Stir in turmeric, cayenne pepper. Add chopped tomatoeand cook until tomatoeare soft, about minutes. Pour in water, cover the pan, cook for an additional minutes. Pour in coconut milk, stir well. When mixture ijust below boiling, stir in prawns. Sprinkle mixture with almost all of the fresh garam masala powder, reserving a pinch to use aa garnish. Gently stir to combine. Do not cover the pan at thistage, acoconut milk will curdle. Asoon aprawnare pink, cooked through, to minutes, add ghee. Remove the pan from the heat. Sprinkle reserved garam masala over the dish, serve.
ingredients: cardamom seed whole clove , cinnamon stick ,vegetable oil, whole clove green. cardamom pod, stick of cinnamon onion, grated ginger paste garlic paste ground turmeric cayenne pepper finely chopped tomato water coconut milk pound tiger prawns, deveined ghee
descriptor: Thidelicious, malai curry iso easy to make. The word malai meancream, but thicurry getitcreaminesfrom coconut milk. Thiia recipe from Bengal, which ifamoufor itseafood. Serve it with steamed basmati rice.

instructions: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Stir in onions; cook, stir until onion pieceare soft, translucent, about minutes. Reduce heat to medium-low; continue cooking, stirring occasionally, until onionare golden, about minutemore. Remove pan from heat, set it aside. Transfer cooked onionto the bowl of a food processor; grind onions, tomatoes, green chileinto a smooth paste. Heat remaining oil in the same skillet over medium heat. Add onion mixture carefully, ait may spatter. Cook, stir for to minutes. Stir in garlic paste, ginger paste, coriander, cumin, garam masala, turmeric, cayenne pepper, salt. Cook, stir until the oil beginto separate from the mixture, about minutes. Pour water into skillet, bring sauce to a boil. Add cubed potatoes. Gently stir in the eggs. Reduce heat to low, simmer until sauce hathickened slightly, about minutes. Remove from heat. Garnish with cilantro before serving. If you don't have boiled eggand a cooked potato, add minuteto the prep time. You can cook the potato in the microwave boil it on the stovetop while you cook the eggs.
ingredients: vegetable oil, divided, onions, quartered, tomatoes, quartered, small green chile peppers, garlic paste, ginger paste, ground coriander, ground cumin, garam masala, ground turmeric, cayenne pepper, salt, water, large potato - cooked, cut into -inch cubes, hard-cooked eggs, quarteredfresh cilantro
descriptor: North Indian in origin, I wavery grateful to have found thirecipe. It ivery similar to what waserved to uby our Bengali neighboryearago! Serve hot with a side of thickly sliced bread.

instructions: Wash lentilin a strainer. Combine lentiland water in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add of the sliced onionand garlic, reserving the rest for later. Stir in turmeric, bay leaf, tomatoes, salt. Add chiles, leaving them whole to add flavor or cut in half to add heat. When mixture beginto boil, reduce heat to a simmer; cook until lentilbreak apart, thicken slightly, about minutes. Meanwhile, in a skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat until oil shimmers. Add reserved sliced onions; cook, stir until onion ha translucent, about minutes. Reduce heat to medium-low; continue cooking, stirring until onion ivery tender, dark brown, to minutemore. Stir in reserved garlic, cook, stirring constantly, until garlic ifragrant, tender, about minutes. Add onion-garlic mixture into cooked lentiland stir. Garnish with chopped cilantro.
ingredients: red lentils, water, onion divided, clove garlic, divided, ground turmeric, bay leaf, cherry tomatoes, salt, whole serrano chile pepper, vegetable oilcilantro
descriptor: Here imy recipe for dhal based on my many experiencecooking with my friendover the years. We love thiserved over freshly made basmati rice. Don't skimp on the caramelized onionand garlic — it totally makethirecipe amazing!

instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion; cook, stir until the onion ha turned translucent, about minutes. Reduce heat to medium-low, continue cooking, stirring until the onion ivery tender, dark brown, to minutemore. Stir in the garlic, green chiles, ginger paste, cardamom seeds, cloves, cinnamon sticks. Cook, stir until the garlic beginto brown, to more minutes. Mix cumin, coriander, turmeric, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, water into the onion mixture. Simmer until most of the water haevaporated, the mixture hathickened. Stir in beef chuck pieceuntil coated with spice mixture; simmer over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, until the beef icooked through, tender, about to hours. Use to small green chile peppers, such aThai chiles; if they're unavailable, substitute to serrano chileor. Use rubber glovewhen chopping chile peppers. Follow step, . Place the onions, spice mixture, water in the slow cooker; reserve the remaining water. Add the beef, cook on Low for to houror on High for to hour. Add reserved water if you like a thinner consistency of curry. Cook the onionand spicein the pressure cooker instead of the skillet; add the beef in Step, seal the lid. Bring to high pressure, cook until beef itender, about minutes. Allow pressure to release naturally after cooking.
ingredients: olive oil, onion clove garlic, green chile peppers, finely sliced, ginger paste, whole cardamom seeds, whole cloves, cinnamon sticks, ground cumin, ground coriander, ground turmeric, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, water, poundbonelesbeef chuck, cut into -/-inch pieces
descriptor: Thispicy beef curry ibest served with plain basmati rice or eaten with naan or pita bread.

instructions: In a medium bowl, cream together the butter, sugar. Add the vanilla, egg yolk; mix until fluffy. Stir in the flour, refrigerate dough for hours. Preheat oven to degreeF . Grease cookie sheets. Measure out the dough by fuls, roll into balls. Dip the ballinto chopped almondand set on the prepared cookie sheet inch apart. With a finger, make an indention in each cookie, fill the indention up with jam using a or a pastry bag. Bake in the preheated oven for to minutes, cookieshould be golden brown. Remove from pan after baking to cool on a wire rack.
ingredients: butter, white sugar, vanilla extract, egg yolk, all-purpose flour, almonds, raspberry jam
descriptor: Thirecipe belonged to my mother. It ione the many cookiefrom her Christmacookie collection.

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Grease a loaf pan. Cream margarine, sugar in a bowl with an electric mixer until well combined. Add eggone at a time, beating well after each addition. Mix flour, cornstarch, hazelnuts, cocoa powder in a separate bowl, quickly mix into the margarine mixture. Pour batter into the prepared loaf pan. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comeout clean, about hour. Cool on a wire rack for minutes. Run a table knife around the edgeto loosen. Invert carefully onto a serving plate or cooling rack. Let cool completely before dusting with confectioners' sugar.
ingredients: margarine, white sugar, eggs, all-purpose flour, cornstarch, ground hazelnuts, unsweetened cocoa powder, confectioners' sugar
descriptor: Hazelnutor walnutare traditionally used for thichocolaty nut cake a mixture. You don't need any baking powder. It'a cake associated with lotof tradition in our family.

instructions: Grease a fluted tube pan generously with butter, sprinkle with bread crumbs. Turn pan so bread crumbare evenly distributed. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Beat butter using an electric mixer on high speed for a few minuteuntil foamy. Add eggs, at a time, beating well after each addition. Add sugar, vanilla sugar in batches. Beat batter for a few minuteuntil mixture ilight, foamy. Mix in white wine. Combine flour, cinnamon, baking powder, salt in a bowl. Mix flour mixture into egg mixture quickly on low speed. Fold in hazelnutand chocolate chips. Pour batter into the prepared baking pan, level with the back of a spoon. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comeout clean, about hour.
ingredients: unsalted butter, room temperature, plumore for baking dish, dry bread crumbs, eggs, white sugar, vanilla sugar, dry white wine, all-purpose flour, ground cinnamon, baking powder, pinch salt, ground hazelnuts, chocolate chips
descriptor: You can bake thideliciounut cake from Tyrol in a fluted tube pan or loaf pan. It imoist, will last a few day. Hazelnutare my favorite, but you can use walnutawell.

instructions: In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, salt. Cut in the butter until the size of small peaand mix in with your hands. Mix confectioners' sugar, the egg, of vanilla sugar, ground almondinto the flour mixture. Place the dough in the refrigerator for minutes. Preheat oven to degreeF . Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Divide the dough into several parts. Roll each section of dough into logapproximately inch thick. Cut the loginto -inch pieces, bend the pieceinto a crescent shape . Place the kipferl on the baking sheet, chill them for minutes. Bake in the preheated oven until the edgeare golden brown, to minutes. Let cool slightly. Combine confectioners' sugar, vanilla sugar, tosto mix. While still warm, carefully remove kipferl from the baking sheet, dip them in sugar to coat. To Make Your Own Vanilla Sugar: Place to of sugar, place in pint jar. Put a clean vanilla bean in the jar, cover, shake well. Let stand for a few days, shaking the jar occasionally, before using the sugar. Ayou use the vanilla sugar, replace what you remove with fresh sugar.
ingredients: all-purpose flour, pinch salt, unsalted butter, confectioners' sugar, egg, vanilla sugar, ground almonds, confectioners' sugar, vanilla sugar
descriptor: The vanille kipferl originated in Austria, they are also very popular in Switzerland, Germany. The kipferl become even yummier after to days...but only for those who can resist long enough. If desired, the two endof the kipferl can be dipped in warm chocolate, then left to cool.

instructions: Scrub potatoes, place them into a large pot with enough water to cover. bring to a boil, cook until tender, about minutes. Drain, cool. When potatoeare cool enough to handle, peel, presthrough a ricer into a large bowl. Set aside to cool. Thipart of the procescan be done amuch aone day in advance. In a large bowl, mix together the prepared potatoes, salt, egg, of butter until well blended. Gradually stir in the farina, then the flour. If dough istill wet, more flour can be mixed in. Turn dough out onto a floured surface, knead until smooth, about to minutes. Split open each plum where it cracks, remove the pit. Replace each pit with a sugar cube, close. On a floured surface, roll out the dough to inch thickness. Cut into twelve inch squares. Place one plum into each square, bring the corneraround to the top. Pinch together all of the seamto seal. Bring a large pot of water to a slow boil. Place about dumplinginto the water at a time. Once they float to the surface, continue to cook them for about more minutes. Transfer cooked dumplingto a covered bowl, keep warm. Melt the remaining of butter in a small skillet over medium heat. Stir in bread crumbs, of sugar. Continue to cook, stir until browned. Remove the bread crumbto a plate, roll warm dumplingin the mixture until entirely coated. To serve, place a dumpling or two on a plate, sprinkle with a little sugar, a little extra melted butter, if desired.
ingredients: large russet potatoes, salt, butter, eggs, farina, all-purpose flour, Italian prune plums, cube white sugar, butter, white sugar, dry bread crumbs, additional melted butter, sugar for garnish
descriptor: Sweet dark plumare wrapped in a potato dough, boiled before rolling in sweetened toasted bread crumbs. My Austrian grandmother made these delicioudessert dumplingfor uevery fall. These take some time to make, but to me, they're well worth the effort.

instructions: Preheat oven to degreeF . In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, butter, nuts, confectioners' sugar, salt, vanilla. Hand mix until thoroughly blended. Shape dough into a ball. Cover, refrigerate for hour. Meanwhile, place sugar in a bowl or small container. With sharp chef'knife, split vanilla bean lengthwise. Scrape out seeds, mix them into the sugar. Cut pod into inch pieceand mix into sugar. Remove dough from refrigerator, form into inch balls. Roll each ball into a small roll, inchelong. Place roll incheapart on ungreased cookie sheet, bend each one to make a crescent shape. Bake to minutein the preheated oven until set but not brown. Let stand minute, then remove from cookie sheets. Place hot cookieon a large sheet of aluminum foil. Sprinkle with prepared sugar mixture. Turn gently to coat on both sides. Cool completely, store in an airtight container at room temperature. Just before serving, coat with more vanilla flavored sugar.
ingredients: all-purpose flour, butter, hazelnuts, ground, sifted confectioners' sugar, salt, vanilla extract, sifted confectioners' sugar, vanilla bean
descriptor: These cookiehave been a Christmafamily favorite for years. Flaky, buttery, they are worth the effort. Almondcan be substituted for hazelnuts.

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Lightly grease a 9-inch springform pan. Line the bottom with a circle of parchment paper; grease the paper. Make the cake: Melt chocolate in the top of a double boiler over simmering water. Stir frequently, scraping down the sidewith a rubber spatula to avoid scorching, until chocolate imelted, to minutes. Remove from the heat, let cool slightly, to minutes. Beat butter, plu confectioners' sugar in a large bowl with an electric mixer until creamy. Mix in melted chocolate, then beat in egg yolks, one at a time. Beat egg whitein a glasbowl until foamy. Gradually add plu white sugar, continue to beat until stiff, glossy peakform. Fold egg whiteinto chocolate mixture, then fold in cake flour until incorporated. Pour batter into the prepared pan, smooth the top. Bake in the preheated oven until the edgebegin to pull away from the sideof the pan, a toothpick inserted into the center comeout dry, about minutes. Cool pan on a wire rack for minutes, then run a small knife around the edge, remove the sideof the pan. Allow cake to cool completely on the pan base, to more minutes. While the cake icooling, make the filling: Bring water, sugar to a boil in a small saucepan. Cook, stir until sugar hadissolved, syrup iclear, to minutes. Remove from the heat, stir in rum. Purée apricot preservewith of water in a blender until smooth. Transfer to a saucepan, bring to a simmer over medium heat; cook until thickened, about minutes. Stir in remaining rum. Remove the pan base, parchment paper from cooled cake. Carefully slice cake in half horizontally into two layers. Place one layer onto a wire rack; brush of the syrup over top, spread with of the apricot purée, then top with remaining cake layer. Brush the cake top, sidewith remaining syrup, then spread remaining purée over the top, sides. Refrigerate cake on the wire rack until icing iready. Make the icing: Melt chocolate in the top of a double boiler over simmering water. Stir frequently, scraping down the sidewith a rubber spatula to avoid scorching, until chocolate imelted, to minutes. Remove from the heat, let cool slightly. While the chocolate imelting, bring the cream to a simmer in a small saucepan. Stir cream into melted chocolate until combined. Let cool slightly, stirring often, until icing reachea spreadable consistency, to minutes. Remove the cake from the refrigerator; set the wire rack over waxed paper to catch any drips. Pour icing over cake, spread over the top, sides, allow excesicing to drip through the rack. Let sit until icing iat room temperature. Carefully transfer cake to a serving platter. Serve at room temperature.
ingredients: semisweet chocolate unsalted butter, confectioners' sugar, confectioners' sugar, large eggs, se, divided, white sugar, white sugar, cake flour
descriptor: ThiSacher torte ipretty close to the original dessert produced by the Sacher Hotel in Vienna, Austria. It'a dense apricot, chocolate concoction that'not too sweet. It'a lot of work but well worth the effort! Refrigerate any leftovers, but alwayserve it at room temperature.

instructions: Sift together all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt in a large bowl. Mix eggs, vegetable oil, sugar in a small bowl. Quickly stir into the flour mixture. Mix in approximately of the water. Knead into a soft, pliable dough, using more water anecessary. Cover dough with a tea towel, allow to sit at least hour while desired filling iprepared. To use, divide into two parts. Cover half the dough with plastic wrap while you roll out the other. Carefully stretch the dough into paper thinneson a lightly floured surface , lightly brush with remaining vegetable oil. Fill, bake adesired. Top strudel dough with poppyseed or apple filling, leaving a -inch border. Roll into a log. Brush the edge of the dough with water or milk, then pinch to seal. To bake, preheat the oven to degreeF . Place strudel, seam-side down, on a greased baking sheet or parchment. Bake until golden brown, minuteto hour.
ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, large eggs, well vegetable oil, divided, white sugar, water
descriptor: A basic strudel dough — use any filling, bake to perfection.

instructions: Cut the veal into steaks, about athick ayour finger. Dredge in flour. In a shallow dish, beat the eggwith oil, salt, pepper. Coat the veal with egg mixture, then with bread crumbs. Heat oil in a heavy skillet over medium heat. Fry veal until golden brown, about minuteon each side. We have determined the nutritional value of oil based on a retention value of after cooking. The exact amount may vary depending on cook time, temperature, ingredient density, the specific type of oil used.
ingredients: poundveal, all-purpose flour, eggs, vegetable oil, salt, pepper, bread crumbs, oil
descriptor: Translation of the name: 'Wiener' thiword comefrom the word 'Wien', which ithe Austrian city called Vienna. 'Schnitzel' meanbasically meat in a crust. I'm German, hope you can understand my English description. Serve the schnitzelwith salad, ketchup, French fries.

instructions: Combine raisinand rum in a small bowl; let soak for minutes, then drain. Beat eggs, milk, white sugar, vanilla, salt together in a medium bowl; gradually whisk in flour to make a smooth batter. Stir in drained raisins. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat; pour batter into the skillet, cook to minutes until the pancake haset, the bottom igolden brown. Flip pancake, cook until thiside ialso golden brown, about minutes. Tear pancake into bite-sized pieceusing a spatula or two forks; drizzle in melted butter, sprinkle with confectioners' sugar. Increase heat to medium-high, gently tosthe pancake pieceuntil sugar hacaramelized, about minutes. Sprinkle with additional confectioners' sugar, serve with apple sauce or plum preserves.
ingredients: raisins, rum, eggs, whole milk, white sugar, vanilla extract, pinch of salt, all-purpose flour, butter, butter, confectioners' sugar, pluapple sauce or plum preservefor serving
descriptor: Kaiserschmarrn ian Austrian pancake dessert with rum-soaked raisins. The pancake ishredded into piecewhile frying, sprinkled with powdered sugar, served hot with apple sauce or plum preserveon the side.

instructions: Heat deep-fryer to degreeF . Place meat on a solid, level surface, pound with a mallet until it ito inch thick. Place the flour, bread crumbin separate dishes. Soup plateare useful. Lightly beat the eggand add the milk. Lightly season with salt, pepper, put thiinto another soup plate. Coat the meat in flour, patting lightly by hand. Using a fork to hold the meat, dip into the egg mixture, drain slightly. Next, coat with the breadcrumbby lightly pressing the crumbinto the meat. When each piece of meat habeen prepared, deep fry in cooking oil until golden brown. We have determined the nutritional value of oil based on a retention value of after cooking. The exact amount may vary depending on cook time, temperature, ingredient density, the specific type of oil used.
ingredients: quart oil for deep fryingfilletpork sirloin, cake flour, dry bread crumbs, eggs, milk, salt, pepper
descriptor: Both my mother, father were Viennese, grew up there. Thiwamy mother'recipe. Veal can also be used in place of pork.

instructions: Dissolve yeast in warm water in a large bowl. Let stand until yeast softenand beginto form a creamy foam, about minutes. Stir in egg yolks, whole eggs, oil, sugar, salt. Mix in of flour to make a sticky dough. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead with remaining flour until smooth, elastic, about minutes. Transfer dough to a well-oiled bowl, turn until entire surface icoated with oil. Cover with a damp cloth, let rise in a warm place until doubled in volume, about hours. Punch down the dough, divide into thirds. Roll each piece into a -inch long rope. Braid the three strandtogether, seal the ends. Transfer the bread to a greased cookie sheet. Whisk remaining egg with a pinch of salt; brush on top, sideof bread. Set eggwash aside. Let bread rise until doubled in volume, about minutes. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Brush bread again with eggwash. Bake in the preheated oven until golden, about minutes. Cool on a wire rack.
ingredients: packageactive dry yeast, warm water, large egg yolks, large eggs, at room temperature, divided, vegetable oil, white sugar, salt, all-purpose flour, divided, pinch salt
descriptor: Thiegg bread recipe comefrom two older ladiein Hawaii, it makeall other egg bread look weak. It'amazing when used for bread pudding, French toast, try cutting it into chunkfor fondue — wow!

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Grease, flour an x-inch pan. Make the cake: Sift flour, baking powder, salt together into a bowl. Beat sugar, butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light, fluffy, noticeably lighter in color. Mix in one egg until fully incorporated; mix in remaining egg, vanilla. Add flour mixture in two batches, alternating with milk, beating until just incorporated after each addition. Pour into the prepared pan. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comeout clean, to minutes. Remove from the oven, let stand in the pan for minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack, let cool completely, about minutes. Wrap cooled cake with plastic wrap. Place onto your counter at room temperature to let firm up, hourto overnight. When ready to finish the lamingtons, make the icing: Place confectioners' sugar, cocoa into a mixing bowl. Mix in warm milk, butter until icing ifluid but not too runny. Unwrap the cake, cut into squares. Cover a work surface with parchment or waxed paper, then set a wire rack over top. Pour coconut into a shallow bowl. Using a fork, dip each cake square into icing, turn until all sideare coated, then roll in coconut. Place onto the rack to dry. Desiccated coconut islightly dried, ground coconut. It'not the same asweetened, shredded coconut.
ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, white sugar, unsalted butter, at room temperature, large eggs, room temperature, vanilla extract, milk
descriptor: Lamingtonare little sponge cakecoated in chocolate, grated coconut. Most people love these traditional Australian treats. Any firm type of plain cake can be used: butter cake, pound cake, Madeira cake génoise sponge.

instructions: Whisk flour, sugar, baking powder together in a bowl until thoroughly mixed. Stir in water, bananas, vanilla until combined; dough will be smooth, sticky. Heat incheoil in a deep fryer to degreeF . Working in batcheof four to five at a time, scoop a scant batter with a large spoon, then use another spoon to gently push it off into the deep fryer. Fry until panikeke float to the top, turn golden brown, about minuteper side. Drain on paper towels.
ingredients: all-purpose flour, white sugar, baking powder, water, medium very ripe bananas, mashed, vanilla extract, vegetable oil
descriptor: My brotherand I used to eat Samoan pancakewhen we were younger. I recently started making them for my family, I enjoy them amuch today aI did back then! They're a lot like doughnuts, but you can top them with butter, jam, chocolate syrup, powdered sugar, even ice cream.

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Grease a baking sheet. Stir flour, salt together in a large bowl. Rub in butter until mixture resemblecoarse crumbs. Make a well in the center; pour in milk, water, then stir until dough cometogether. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface, form into an -inch-diameter round loaf. Place loaf onto the prepared pan; cut a crosin the top using a sharp knife. Bake in the preheated oven for minutes; lower the temperature to degreeF , continue to bake for an additional to minutes. The loaf should be golden brown, the bottom should sound hollow when tapped.
ingredients: self-rising flour, salt, butter, milk, water
descriptor: Damper bread waa staple of the early Australian settlers' diet. Traditionally, the dough wacooked directly on the coalof an open fire. If you use thimethod, have a beer handy in case some of the asheon the damper are still glowing when you eat it!

instructions: Looking for an impressive dessert for your next dinner party? Try thidelicate pavlova! With a crispy crust, fluffy filling, thikiwi-topped pavlova isure to be a showstopper. Pavlova ia meringue-based dessert that originated in either Australia or New Zealand. The elegant dish inamed after Anna Pavlova, a Russian ballerina. It haa crisp meringue crust, a soft whipped cream interiand a fruit topping. These are the ingredientyou’ll need to make thipavlova recipe:,Tipfrom recipe creator Rosina:,You’ll find the full, step-by-step recipe below – but here’a brief overview of what you can expect when you make homemade pavlova:,You can make the meringue for the pavlova up to three dayin advance. Fill, assemble the pavlova just before serving. “Pavlova takepatience, but it’so worth it,” according to Noel. “Such a unique, impressive dessert.”,“Thiwaeasy, elegant,” raveCynthia B. “I used blueberries, raspberrieand kiwi for the fruit athat wawhat I had on hand. My only mistake wain stirring the fruit together before adding it on to the cream. The blueberriecolored the kiwi. Live, learn!”,“Thiia great recipe,” sayAimee George. “I usually have some left over to make a couple of individual pavlovas. Delicious.”,Editorial contributionby Corey Williams,Preheat the oven to degreeF . Line a baking sheet with parchment paper; draw a 9-inch circle on the parchment paper. Beat egg whitein a large bowl until stiff but not dry. Gradually add sugar, about at a time, beating well after each addition. Continue beating until thick, glossy. Gently fold in cornstarch, vanilla extract, lemon juice. Spoon mixture inside the circle drawn on the parchment paper. Working from the center, spread mixture toward the outside edge, build the edge slightly. Thishould leave a slight depression in the center. Bake in the preheated oven until meringue idry, soundhollow when tapped, about hour. Cool on a wire rack. Beat heavy cream in a medium bowl until stiff peakform; set aside. Remove meringue from the parchment paper, place on a flat serving plate. Fill center of meringue with whipped cream, top with kiwi slices. Top with fruit, enjoy!,You can substitute kiwi with other fruit, like sliced strawberries, pineapple, mango. If you prefer sweetened whipped cream, add of sugar while whipping the cream. Please note the different recipe name, differencein ingredient amountand yield, awell athe addition of papaya, blood orange when using the magazine version of thirecipe.
ingredients: large egg whites, white sugar, cornstarch, vanilla extract, lemon juice, pint heavy cream, kiwi
descriptor: Pavlova ian elegant dessert made with a crisp white meringue layer filled with whipped cream, fresh fruit. To prevent your meringue from being flat, grainy, beat the egg whiteuntil stiff but not dry. Overbeaten egg whitelose volume, deflate when folded into other ingredients. Also, when mixing in sugar, add about at a time, beating well after each addition. Then beat until meringue ithick, white, glossy. Make sure that no trace of grease or egg yolk getinto the whites.

instructions: Preheat oven to degreeF . Grease baking sheet. Combine plu margarine, golden syrup in a microwave-safe bowl. Heat in the microwave until margarine imelted, secondto minute. Mix boiling water, baking soda in a small bowl until baking soda idissolved. Stir into margarine mixture. Mix oats, all-purpose flour, sugar, coconut, apricottogether in a large bowl. Add water, margarine mixture; mix until dough icombined. Form dough into small balland place on prepared baking sheet; flatten slightly. Bake in the preheated oven until golden, about minutes.
ingredients: margarine, margarine, golden syrup, boiling water, baking soda, rolled oats, all-purpose flour, raw sugar, dried shredded coconut, diced dried apricots
descriptor: Makearound to biscuitdepending on size the ballare rolled.

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . You will be turning the temperature down to degreeF when you put thiin to bake. Line a or inch round glasdish with parchment paper. Combine the egg whiteand salt in a large bowl. Beat with an electric mixer stand mixer using a whisk attachment until able to form soft peaks. Sprinkle in the sugar at a time while continuing to whip to stiff peaks. Stir in the vanilla, vinegar, fold in coconut if using. Spread evenly into the prepared glasdish, making sure to spread out to all of the edges. Place the Pavlova into the oven, immediately reduce the temperature to degreeF . Bake for to minutes until the top icrisp, a pale straw color. Leave in the oven, turn off the heat. Let it stay in the oven until the oven hacooled completely. Once the Pavlova icooled, top generously with sweetened whipped cream. Arrange the strawberries, kiwis, peacheand blueberriein beautiful concentric circleon top.
ingredients: egg whites, pinch salt, vinegar, castor sugar or superfine sugar, vanilla extract, unsweetened flaked coconut, sweetened whipped cream, fresh strawberrie kiwifruit, fresh peach, pitted, fresh blueberries
descriptor: Australianand New Zealanderboth claim Pavlova, thirecipe iso easy it feellike cheating! I first had it when a friend brought it to our final dresrehearsal, begged her for the recipe! It iespecially striking when the fruitand berrieare in season. Personally, I like to add coconut for the crunch, but it'NOT sweetened coconut – it'unsweetened, in big flakes, I get it from the fruit, nut guy at our commissary. It'a real crowd pleaser, the best thing about it iyou can make it a day ahead. Just allow the meringue to fully cool, cover lightly with plastic wrap. Top with whipped cream, fruit just prior to serving.

instructions: Preheat oven to degreeF . Grease interior of inch springform pan, dust lightly with cornstarch. Beat egg whites, preferably in a glasor ceramic bowl, until stiff, glossy. Make sure egg whitehave absolutely no contact with grease even a speck of yolk. Combine cream of tartar, white sugar, cornstarch; gradually beat in to the egg whites. Sprinkle vinegar over egg white mixture, then fold it in very gently. Pile meringue into prepared pan. Spread to the sideleaving a slight depression in the center. Place in preheated oven. Close the oven doand immediately turn oven down to degreeF . Bake for to minutes. Open oven dobut leave meringue in the oven for more minutes. Remove meringue to a draft free spot. Very carefully remove rim of springform pan, allow meringue to cool completely. There may be a slight sinking in the center. Carefully remove meringue from pan base, place on serving platter. Whip cream, vanilla extract, confectioners' sugar until thick, firm. Gently spread over the meringue. Remove the pulp from the passion fruit, spoon over cream. If using kiwi, peel, slice the fruit; arrange slightly overlapping slicein a pleasing design. Chill until serving time.
ingredients: egg whites, cream of tartar, white sugar, cornstarch, distilled white vinegar, heavy cream, chilled, vanilla extract, confectioners' sugar, passion fruits
descriptor: A pavlova ia fresh fruit dessert with a meringue crust, cream filling. The 'deluxe' in thirecipe referto the passion fruit, which can be pricey. Passion fruit ia round, purple fruit resembling a kiwi, but larger. When ripe it appearshriveled. You can also use kiwi, about, instead of passion fruit.

instructions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook potatoein boiling water until tender yet firm, about minutes. Drain, place in a large serving bowl. Place eggin a saucepan, cover with cold water. Bring to a boil, then immediately remove from heat. Cover the pan, let eggstand in hot water for to minutes. Remove from hot water, allow to cool. Peel, chop eggs. Add to potatoein the serving bowl. Stir in mixed vegetableuntil combined. Make dressing: Combine mayonnaise, olives, lemon juice, pepper, mustard, dill, salt in a separate bowl; stir until blended. Pour dressing over potato mixture. Season with salt, pepper; tosto coat. Cover, refrigerate until chilled, at least hour to overnight.
ingredients: russet potatoes, cubed, large eggs, can mixed vegetables, drained
descriptor: ThiArgentine salad icalled "ensalada rusa", ia popular South American dish that makea wonderful appetizer. It can be served asoon ait ichilled but ieven better the next day.

instructions: Combine red wine, salt, rosemary in a small bowl. Let stand at room temperature for to hours. Heat a large cast iron skillet or griddle over high heat. Place steakon the hot skillet, cook to desired degree of doneness, about minuteper side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the centerof steakshould read about degreeF for medium-rare. Pour red wine mixture into the skillet with steaks; let boil for minute. Serve steakwith sauce on a deep platter.
ingredients: red wine, salt, sprig fresh rosemary, New York strip steaks, cut -inch thick
descriptor: Thiia wonderful rosemary steak dish that waprepared for me when I lived in Argentina. Thimeat dish iquite popular in variourestaurantaround BuenoAires.

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Oil a baking sheet with cooking spray, set aside. Stir together egg, milk, cheese, butter in a large bowl. Sprinkle in tapioca starch, flour; stir in to form a dough. Knead dough for minuteon a lightly floured surface, then roll into golf ball-sized pieceand place onto the prepared baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, to minutes.
ingredients: cooking spray, large egg, milk, shredded Italian cheese blend, butter, tapioca starch, self-rising flour
descriptor: Thideliciourecipe for chipas Argentinean breads, are small ballof cheese bread made from tapioca starch. They are quick, very easy to make. You could even make the dough ahead of time, keep it in the freezer. If you cannot find Argentinean cheeses, Italian cheese will do just fine.

instructions: Combine water, salt in a small saucepan over medium heat, warm through, stirring until salt idissolved. Remove from heat, let cool for to minutes. Combine sifted flour, margarine in the bowl of a food processor; pulse until crumbly. Add salt water gradually to the food processor, pulse until a soft dough ball formthat easily separatefrom the edge of the bowl. Add more water, at a time, only if needed. Presdough into a ball, wrap tightly with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for at least minutes. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Cover a baking sheet with aluminum foil, grease with vegetable oil. Set aside. Bring a saucepan of water to a boil. Add cubed potatoeand cook until soft, to minutes. Meanwhile, melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Cook, stir onionand green onionuntil soft, translucent, about minutes. Add red pepperand cook for more minutes. Add ground beef, stir with a wooden spoon until fully browned, about minutes. Season with salt, cayenne pepper, cumin, paprika. Remove from heat. Drain potatoeand add to filling. Tosin chopped eggand let filling cool down for a few minutes. Remove pastry from the fridge, knead gently on a floured surface. Divide dough in half, roll out each piece to /-inch thickness. Cut out -inch circlewith a pastry cutter or sharp knife, wet the edgelightly with water. Add large of filling in the center of each disc. Fold pastry over, presedgetogether, seal with a fork. Transfer empanadato the prepared baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, to minutes. Remove from the oven, allow to cool just a little before serving.
ingredients: water, salt, all-purpose flour, sifted, margarine, vegetable oil
descriptor: Thitruly traditional beef empanadareceta ifrom Salta, one of the Northern Provincein Argentina. Made with ground beef, potatoes, hard-boiled eggs, a fluffy homemade empanada pastry, these are just to die for!

instructions: Spread ground beef into a large sieve. Slowly pour boiling water over top for partial cooking. Let drain, cool. Meanwhile, melt shortening in a skillet over medium heat. Add onions; cook, stir until just before they begin to turn golden, to minutes. Remove from the heat, stir in sweet paprika, hot paprika, red pepper flakes; season with salt. Transfer cooled beef to a bowl. Mix in vinegar, cumin, season with salt. Mix in onionuntil well combined. Transfer to a large plate to cool, harden, about minutes. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Cut puff pastry dough into circles. Place a spoonful meat mixture onto each round, making sure at least inch of the outer pastry edge stayclean, dry. Add olives, raisins, hard-cooked eggto each round. Slightly wet the edgeof pastry rounds, fold in half into half-moons, presthe edgetogether. Seal empanadaby twisting, curling dough together between your thumb, index finger, adding pressure before releasing each pinch, moving on to the next one. Place empanadaonto the prepared baking sheet. Prick each empanada with a fork near the curled edge to allow steam to escape during baking. Brush empanadawith beaten egg. Bake in the preheated oven until golden, to minutes. Other methodof sealing the empanadas, like pinching without curling or using a fork to seal the edges, do not create a strong enough seal to prevent the juice from leaking during baking. The empanadamust be juicy, so a good seal iimportant.
ingredients: pound lean ground beef, shortening, medium onions Hungarian sweet paprika, hot paprika, crushed red pepper flakes, salt, ground cumin, distilled white vinegar, raisins, large hard-cooked eggs pitted green olivespackage frozen puff pastry sheets, large egg, beaten
descriptor: My original version of the Argentinean recipe for empanadas. Rich, delicious. Any meat can be used for thirecipe, just be sure to cut it up into tiny pieces.

instructions: Heat oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add onions, scallions, bell pepper. Cover, cook, stirring occasionally, until onionare translucent, to minutes. Add ground beefegano, salt, cayenne pepper, cumin to the pot. Cook, stir beef until no longer pink, to minutes. Remove from the heat, allow to cool slightly, then cover, place in the refrigerator until meat icompletely cooled, about hour. Remove filling from the refrigerator, transfer to a colander to drain. Return filling to the Dutch oven. Preheat the oven to degreeF . Liberally grease a baking sheet with butter. Place about filling into the center of empanada disk. Fold empanada in half into a crescent shape, presthe edgeof dough together with a fork or your fingerto seal, place onto the prepared baking sheet. Repeat with remaining empanadaand filling. Brush topwith egg white. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about minutes.
ingredients: extra-virgin olive oil, pound yellow onions scallions green bell pepper poundground beef, dried oregano, salt, cayenne pepper, ground cumin, butter, empanada pastry discs, egg white, beaten
descriptor: Thiempanada recipe wagiven to me by a visiting Argentine professor while I wastudying Spanish in college. They have become a staple food in my household; they are simple to make, delicious.

instructions: Combine sifted flour, butter in the bowl of a food processor; pulse until crumbly. Add egg, pulse until just combined. Dissolve salt in warm water. Add gradually to the food processor, pulse until a soft dough ball forms. Place dough ball into a bowl, wrap tightly with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for at least minutes. Dust a work surface with flour, knead dough for minute. Roll out thinly, cut into rounds; use right away for your favorite sweet or savory empanadas freeze for later.
ingredients: all-purpose flour, sifted, unsalted butter, chilled, cubed, egg, warm water, salt
descriptor: Try thieasy, authentic dough for making empanada pastry rounds! It'quick to make since all ingredientare mixed in a food processthen kneaded just very quickly, it'done. You can make it in advance: cut dough into roundand freeze them for later.

instructions: Preheat oven to degreeF . Line baking sheetwith parchment paper. Whisk together the flour, cornstarch, baking soda, baking powder; set aside. Beat the butter, sugar with an electric mixer in a large bowl until light, fluffy. Add the egg yolkone at a time, allowing each yolk to blend into the butter mixture before adding the next. Beat in the vanilla rum, vanilla extract, lemon extract, lemon zest with the last egg. Gently fold in the flour mixture with a spoon, making a crumbly dough. When the dough becomecohesive enough, presit together into a ball with your hands. Wrap with plastic wrap, chill for minuteto hour. Roll out the dough, using alittle flour apossible, about inch thick. The dough will have an unusual consistency. Cut with a small round cookie cutter. Continue pressing the dough together, rolling it out, cutting until you have used it all. Place cookieinch apart on the prepared cookie sheets. Bake in the preheated oven until set but not browned, to minutes. Remove the cookieimmediately to cool on a wire rack. Spread the underside of a cooled cookie with a of dulce de leche, then sandwich together with another cookie until the caramel oozeout the sides. Roll the sidein the shredded coconut.
ingredients: unbleached all-purpose flour, cornstarch, baking soda, baking powder, unsalted butter, white sugar, egg yolks, vanilla rum, vanilla extract, lemon extract, lemon zest,jar dulce de leche, unsweetened shredded coconut
descriptor: Thiia traditional cookie that imuch loved in most Latin cultures. Even my mother in law saythey're the BEST, that isaying a lot considering she ifrom Mendoza, Argentina!

instructions: Combine parsley, oil, vinegaregano, cumin, garlic, hot sauce, salt in a blender or food processor. Mix on medium speed until ingredientare evenly blended, about seconds.
ingredients: fresh parsley extra virgin olive oil red wine vinegar dried oregano ground cumin garlic pepper sauce, salt
descriptor: ThifamouArgentinian chimichurri sauce iperfect for any grilled chicken, meat fish. My catering customerlove it on garlic crostini with grilled flank steak slices.

instructions: Combine parsley, cilantro, red wine vinegar, onion, garlic, saltegano, hot pepper flakes, pepper in the bowl of a food processor; pulse a few times. Pour olive oil in slowly, while pulsing a few more times, until chimichurri ichopped, but not mushy. Refrigerate until flavorhave blended, about hours.
ingredients: tightly packed chopped parsley leaves, tightly packed chopped cilantro leaves, red wine vinegar, onion, clove garlic, coarse salt, dried oregano, hot pepper flakes, freshly ground black pepper, extra-virgin olive oil
descriptor: I took elementof several chimichurri recipeI found to come up with thicombination, which habecome a favorite. Can be stored for up to weekin the refrigerator.

instructions: Preheat oven to degreeF . Grease cookie sheets. In a large bowl, cream together the shortening, sugar until smooth. Stir in the eggs, one at a time, then the vanilla. Combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, cream of tartar, salt; stir into the creamed mixture alternately with the buttermilk until well blended. Place big heaping fulonto prepared cookie sheetabout incheapart. Sprinkle each cookie with some of the remaining sugar. Bake for to minutein the preheated oven, until edgebegin to turn golden. Remove from baking sheetto cool on wire racks. When cool, store in an airtight container.
ingredients: butter flavored shortening, white sugar, eggs, vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, cream of tartar, pinch salt, buttermilk, white sugar
descriptor: Big, soft, Amish sugar cookies, called sugar 'cakes'.

instructions: Preheat oven to degreeF . Grease loaf pans. In a large bowl, combine the Amish bread starter with oil, eggs, flour, sugar, ground cinnamon, salt, baking soda, baking powder, vanilla. Mix well. Pour into prepared loaf pans. Bake in preheated oven for to minutes. Get the recipe for Amish Friendship Bread Starter
ingredients: Amish Friendship Bread Starter, vegetable oil, eggs, all-purpose flour, white sugar, ground cinnamon, salt, baking soda, baking powder, vanilla extract
descriptor: A sweet cinnamon bread that requirea batch of Amish Friendship Bread Starter. For variations, add your favorite fruitand/or nuts!

instructions: Place the potatoeinto a large pot, fill with enough water to cover. Bring to a boil, cook for about minutes until easily pierced with a fork. Drain, set aside to cool. While the potatoeare cooking, whisk together eggs, sugar, cornstarch, salt in a saucepan. Stir in the vinegar, milk, mustard. Cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, until thickened, about minutes. Remove from heat, stir in the butter. Refrigerate until cool, then stir in the mayonnaise. Peel the potatoeif desired, cut into medium dice. Place in a large bowl, toswith the onion, celery, carrots, celery seed, hard-cooked eggs. Gently fold in the dressing. Refrigerate until serving. I personally like thito sit for at least a day before serving to let the flavorblend, but you may serve it asoon ait ichilled.
ingredients: medium white potatoe small onioncelerycarrots, celery seed, hard-cooked eggs, chopped, eggs, white sugar, cornstarch, salt, apple cider vinegar, milk, prepared yellow mustard, butter, mayonnaise or salad dressing
descriptor: Thiilike the potato salad I grew up with in Pennsylvania Dutch country. Thihaa sweet, sour dressing, idistinctively yellow.

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . In a medium bowl, mix together ground beef, crushed crackers, onion, eggs, ketchup, brown sugar until well blended. Presinto a 9x inch loaf pan. Lay the two sliceof bacon over the top. Bake for hour in the preheated oven until cooked through. While the loaf bakes, mix together the remaining ketchup, vinegar, salt, mustard, brown sugar. Spread over the top of the meat loaf for the last minuteof baking.
ingredients: poundground beef, crushed butter-flavored cracker, small onion eggs, ketchup, brown sugar, bacon, ketchup, vinegar, salt, prepared yellow mustard, brown sugar
descriptor: A recipe for Amish meatloaf topped with bacon stripand a ketchup glaze that I had while in Amish country in HolmeCounty, Ohio.

instructions: In a bowl, mix corn syrup, peanut butter, marshmallow creme until thoroughly combined. Store in an air-tight container.
ingredients: light corn syrup, peanut butter, smooth, marshmallow creme
descriptor: Thiia tasty peanut butter spread, sometimeknown a'church spread' that icommon among the Amish, Mennonite communities. Great on bread, bananas, ice cream, etc.

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Stir together potato, whole kernel corn, cream-style corn, hard-cooked eggs, milk, salt, pepper in a large saucepan over medium heat. Simmer for about minutes. Meanwhile, presone of the pie crustinto the bottom, up the sideof a 9-inch pie plate. I like to use a glaspie plate to check the bottom crust for doneness. Pour hot potato-corn mixture into crust. Dot with pieceof butter. Cover with top crust; flute the edgeto seal. Cut a few slitin top crust to vent steam. Place on the prepared baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven for minutes, then reduce the temperature to degreeF . Continue baking until crust ibrowned, about minutemore. Serve hot. You can double the filling, spoon the extra over sliceof pie to serve.
ingredients: large potato, choppedcan whole kernel corn, drainedcan cream-style corn, large hard-cooked eggs milk, salt, pepper, butter, double-crust pie pastry, thawed
descriptor: Thicorn pie imy mom'recipe. We grew up eating thiand loving it in the heart of Amish country. It ia very hearty dish, easy to make. Give thione a try before you decide you won't like it. Corn takeon a whole different flavor made thiway. Some people add cooked chicken to the pie awell.

instructions: Preheat the oven to degreeF . Grease two rimmed baking sheets. Place of the popped popcorn, of the peanutonto each prepared baking sheet. Bring brown sugar, margarine, corn syrup, salt to a boil in a saucepan over medium heat, stirring occasionally to blend. Once boiling, boil for minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from the heat, stir in vanilla, baking soda; mixture will be light, foamy. Immediately pour hot liquid over popcorn, nuts. Stir until pretty well coated. Bake in the preheated oven for hour, removing the panand giving them each a good stir every minutes. Line your countertop with waxed paper. Remove popcorn, nutfrom the oven; dump onto waxed paper, separate any large clumps. Allow to cool completely. You can use roasting pans, jelly roll pans disposable roasting paninstead of rimmed baking sheets.
ingredients: quartplain popped popcorn, dry roasted peanut, brown sugar, margarine, light corn syrup, salt, vanilla extract, baking soda
descriptor: Thicaramel corn recipe ithe best! It comefrom an Amish family who packagethitreat, giveit to friendand neighborevery Christmas. It itruly the tastiest, easiest, most foolproof caramel corn recipe you'll ever find! Store in airtight containeror resealable bags.

instructions: Dissolve yeast in warm water in a small bowl; let stand until foamy, about minutes. Combine flour, sugar in a -quart container ; mix thoroughly. Stir in milk, yeast mixture. Cover the container loosely, leave at room temperature until bubbly. Thiiday of the -day process. Day through : Stir starter with a spoon. Day : Stir in flour, sugar, milk. Day through 9: Stir starter with a spoon. Day : Stir in remaining flour, sugar, milk. Remove starter to make your first bread. Give starter to friend along with thirecipe, your favorite Amish bread recipe. Store remaining starter in a container in the refrigerator or begin the -day procesover again . Once you have made the starter, you will consider it day, so you can ignore step in thirecipe, proceed with step . You can also freeze the starter in measurefor later use. Frozen starter will take at least hourat room temperature to thaw before using.
ingredients: package active dry yeast, warm water, all-purpose flour, divided, white sugar, divided, milk, divided
descriptor: Make Amish friendship bread starter, share some with a friend! Thidelicioustarter can make a variety of breads. Do not use metal containeror utensils.

instructions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook elbow macaroni in boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about minutes. Drain, set aside to cool. Combine eggs, onion, celery, bell pepper, relish in a large bowl. Stir together salad dressing, sugar, mustard, vinegar, celery seed, salt in a small bowl. Pour over eggand vegetables. Top with cooled macaroni; stir until well combined. Cover, chill in the refrigerator for at least hour before serving.
ingredients: uncooked elbow macaroni, large hard-cooked eggs small onion stalkcelery small red bell pepper, seeded, chopped, dill pickle relish, creamy salad dressing, white sugar, prepared yellow mustard, white vinegar, celery seed, salt
descriptor: ThiAmish macaroni salad ia colorful, flavorful dish made with hard-cooked eggs, bell pepper, celery in a creamy dressing. Best macaroni salad I have ever had. I alwayget many requestfor the recipe. Enjoy!

instructions: Place eggin a saucepan, cover with water. Bring to a boil, remove from heat, let eggstand in hot water for minutes. Remove eggfrom hot water, cool under cold running water, peel. Place eggs, beets, onion in a non-reactive glasor plastic container. Set aside. Combine sugar, reserved beet juice, vinegar, cloves, bay leaves, salt, pepper in a medium-size, non-reactive saucepan. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, simmer for minutes. Pour hot liquid over eggs, beets, onion. Cover, refrigerate hourbefore using.
ingredients: large eggs, can whole pickled beets, small onion white sugar, cider vinegar, whole cloves, bay leaves, salt, pinch ground black pepper
descriptor: ThiAmish pickled beetrecipe ia gift from the Amish.

instructions: Toscabbage, onion together in a large bowl; set aside. Combine sugar, vinegar, oil, celery seed, salt, mustard, pepper in a small saucepan; bring to a boil, simmer, stirring frequently, until sugar idissolved, about minutes. Let mixture cool slightly, about minutes, then pour over cabbage mixture; toswell to coat. Cover, refrigerate at least hours.
ingredients: large head cabbage, cored, finely shredded, medium onion white sugar, vinegar, vegetable oil, celery seed, salt, prepared mustard, black pepper
descriptor: Thitangy vinegar coleslaw iperfect for those who like slaw with no mayonnaise. I got thiwonderful recipe from one of the ladiein my Amish community.
